name: Ark of the Ancients
description: Not to be confused with Wrath of the Ancients, a Hardmode spell tome. The Ark of the Ancients is a craftable Hardmode broadsword that auto-swings. It fires either a large or a small sword beam projectile along with two stars that fall from the sky at the cursor's position. The Eon Beam pierces two enemies, disappearing on the third enemy, and inflicts the Elemental Mix debuff for 2 seconds. The small projectile is identical to the Enchanted Sword projectile. The stars deal 50% of the weapon's da

name: Jungle Dragon, Yharon
description: "The loyal guardian of the Jungle Tyrant" Jungle Dragon, Yharon is a major post-Moon Lord boss fought in the Jungle. The player should be well equipped and prepared before summoning him as the boss is incredibly challenging. Defeating Yharon will provide the player with Yharon Soul Fragments and generate Auric Ore in the world, granting the player access to one of the highest tiers of equipment. Yharon does not spawn on his own, and requires the player to summon him with a Jungle Dragon Egg in t

name: Bookcases
description: Bookcases are pieces of furniture that function as crafting stations. The Calamity Mod currently adds fourteen types of Bookcases to the game, each corresponding to specific sets of furniture. The Ashen Bookcase's eye will ocassionally blink.

name: Essence of Sunlight
description: Essence of Sunlight is a Hardmode crafting material that drops from certain enemies related to the sky, storms, or the Sun. 5-10 Essences of Sunlight can additionally be obtained from Sunbeam Fish, and 2-4 Essences of Sunlight can be obtained from Sky Crates at a 20% chance in Hardmode. Its name was previously "Essence of Cinder", and it could also be dropped by some Desert enemies.

name: Essence of Eleum
description: Essence of Eleum is a Hardmode crafting material that drops from certain ice-related enemies. 5-10 Essences of Eleum can additionally be obtained from Fish of Eleum. The name of this item is a reference to a location in the Dark Souls series, the Frozen Eleum Loyce.

name: Essence of Chaos
description: Essence of Chaos is a Hardmode crafting material that drops from certain enemies related to fire or evil, such as those present in the Brimstone Crag biome. 5-10 Essences of Chaos can additionally be obtained from Chaotic Fish, and 5-15 can be obtained from Brimstone Crates at a 50% drop chance.

name: Core of Chaos
description: Cores of Chaos are Hardmode crafting materials crafted with Ectoplasm and an Essence of Chaos. They can additionally be obtained from Fleshy and Necromantic Geodes dropped by the Ravager.

name: Core of Sunlight
description: Cores of Sunlight are Hardmode crafting materials crafted with Ectoplasm and an Essence of Sunlight. They can additionally be obtained from Fleshy and Necromantic Geodes dropped by the Ravager. Its name was previously "Core of Cinder".

name: Core of Eleum
description: Cores of Eleum are Hardmode crafting materials crafted with Ectoplasm and an Essence of Eleum. They can additionally be obtained from Fleshy and Necromantic Geodes dropped by the Ravager.

name: Core of Calamity
description: Cores of Calamity are Hardmode crafting materials. They can also be obtained from Necromantic Geodes, a type of grab bag dropped by the Ravager. Crafting all items (excluding any items crafted from Miracle Matter and itself included) requires 52 Cores of Calamity (requiring 156 Cores of Chaos, Sunlight, Eleum and 52 Ashes of Calamity). For a full crafting tree, see here.

name: Shadowspec Bar
description: Shadowspec Bars are post-Moon Lord bars used to craft various developer items. They can be considered a direct upgrade to Auric Bars, crafted using Ashes of Annihilation and Exo Prisms.

name: Life Alloy
description: Life Alloys are Hardmode crafting materials crafted with Cryonic, Perennial, and Scoria Bars, additionally being dropped from Necromantic Geodes at a 50% chance. They are primarily used in the crafting of many powerful upgrades. Additionally, they are used in the crafting of multiple Elemental items, and one of the components of Miracle Matter. For a full crafting tree, see here. Life Alloys were previously named Bars of Life.

name: Cryonic Bar
description: Not to be confused with Frigid Bar, a now-removed crafting material that was dropped by Cryogen. Cryonic Bars are Hardmode bars that are made with 5 Cryonic Ore at a Hardmode Forge and are additionally dropped from the Fleshy and Necromantic Geode. They are mainly used in the crafting of crystal-themed items, as well as being used to craft Life Alloys. Cryonic Bars were previously known as Verstaltite Bars and are still referred to as such in the files.

name: Perennial Bar
description: Perennial Bars are Hardmode bars made with 5 Perennial Ore at a Hardmode Forge and are additionally dropped from the Fleshy and Necromantic Geode. They are used to craft various items themed around savage plant-life, and are also used to craft Life Alloy. 1-3 Perennial Bars can additionally be obtained from Jungle Crates at a 10% drop chance after Plantera has been defeated. Perennial Bars were previously known as Draedon Bars and are still referred to as such in the files.

name: Scoria Bar
description: Scoria Bars are Hardmode bars that are made with 5 Scoria Ore at a Hardmode Forge and are additionally dropped from the Fleshy and Necromantic Geode. They are used to craft various volcanic-themed items, as well as being used to craft Life Alloys. Scoria Bars may also be obtained from Abyssal Crates after Golem has been defeated. Scoria Bars were previously known as Chaotic Bars. Before that, they were known as Cruptix Bars, and are still referred to as such in the files.

name: Meld Construct
description: Meld Constructs are Hardmode crafting materials that are crafted with Stardust and Meld Blobs. They are primarily used to craft powerful Hardmode and post-Moon Lord gear which function as alternatives to the gear provided by the Celestial Pillars; additionally, they are used in the crafting of Empyrean armor, a post-Moon Lord armor that functions as the rogue counterpart to the Celestial armors. Selling Meld Constructs yields a profit of 2  13 per construct, compared to selling their components.

name: Aerialite Bar
description: Aerialite Bars are Pre-Hardmode bars made with 4 Aerialite Ore at a Furnace. They are used to craft various sky-themed items. 1-3 Aerialite Bars can additionally be obtained from Sky Crates at a 10% drop chance after either The Hive Mind or The Perforators have been defeated.

name: Living Shard
description: Living Shards are Hardmode crafting materials that drop from Plantera, used in the crafting of permanent consumables, "Terra" weapons, and various broadswords.

name: Desert Scourge
description: If you were looking for something other than the Desert Scourge, see Scourge (disambiguation). "...A dried up and gluttonous husk on a constant and voracious search for its next meal." The Desert Scourge is a Pre-Hardmode boss. It is intended to be one of the first bosses fought by the player and is considered to be the weakest of all of the bosses added by the Calamity Mod. It is intended to be fought before the Eye of Cthulhu and after the King Slime, but can still pose a considerable challeng

name: Uelibloom Bar
description: Uelibloom Bars are post-Moon Lord bars made with 5 Uelibloom Ore at a Hardmode Forge. They are used to craft various plant-themed items. 1-3 Uelibloom Bars can additionally be obtained from Jungle Crates at a 10% drop chance after Providence, the Profaned Goddess has been defeated. Uelibloom Bars were previously known as Ueliace Bars and are still referred to as such in the files. The word "Uelibloom" contains the word "bloom", as in blooming plants. The word "Ueliace", and therefore the "Ueli-"

name: The Devourer of Gods
description: This article is about the post-Moon Lord boss. For the fishing rod with a similar name, see The Devourer of Cods. "You are no god... but I shall feast upon your essence regardless!" The Devourer of Gods is a post-Moon Lord boss that is intended to be fought after all of the Sentinels of the Devourer have been defeated. The fight against this boss is lengthy and difficult, with several phases and numerous varying attacks and behaviors. Defeating it will provide the player with Cosmilite Bars, a n

name: Galactica Singularity
description: Galactica Singularities are craftable Hardmode crafting materials made from Solar Fragments, Vortex Fragments, Nebula Fragments, and Stardust Fragments. They are used in multiple post-Moon Lord recipes. They will float in midair if dropped, similar to Souls. 1-3 Galactica Singularities can be obtained from Sky Crates at a 10% chance after the Moon Lord has been defeated.

name: Trophies
description: Trophies are rare drops (10%) from most bosses and are essentially the boss version of banners. Unlike banners, trophies do not provide any special effects. They are purely decorative background objects that can be placed on background walls. In total, there are 34 trophies. Just like the trophies in the vanilla game, each trophy resembles a part of the boss it is dropped from:

name: Victide Bar
description: Victide Bars are Pre-Hardmode bars made with a Victory Shard, Coral, a Starfish and a Seashell. They are used to craft various ocean-themed items. Victide is a portmanteau of "victory" and "tide", being a reference to its recipe.

name: Stardust
description: Not to be confused with Stardust Fragment, a vanilla crafting material. Stardust is a Hardmode crafting material dropped by monsters in the Astral Infection biome as well as Astrum Deus and the Astrum Aureus. The following table displays the chances and quantities that each Astral Infection enemy will drop Stardust. Stardust can also be obtained through Astral Crates.

name: Meld Blob
description: Meld Blobs are a Hardmode crafting material dropped by enemies spawned during the Lunar Events. Their sole purpose is to be used for crafting Meld Constructs. Meld Blobs may also be obtained from Astral Crates once Astrum Deus has been defeated.

name: Frigid Bar
description: Not to be confused with Cryonic Bar, a post-Cryogen bar crafted using Cryonic Ores. Frigid Bars were Hardmode bars dropped by Cryogen. They were used to make various ice-themed items.

name: Victory Shard
description: Victory Shards are a Pre-Hardmode crafting material that are dropped by the Desert Scourge. They are used to craft Victide Bars and other early-game items. They can also combine with boss trophies to create Lore items. Victory Shards are a reference to Victory Pieces from the Exxo Avalon mod.

name: The Slime God
description: "It is a travesty, one of the most threatening biological terrors ever born." The Slime God is a Pre-Hardmode boss that can be fought anywhere. The boss is comprised of three main parts, the Ebonian Slime God, the Crimulan Slime God, and the Core itself. All three will spawn upon the use of the Overloaded Sludge, regardless of whether the world generated contains Corruption or Crimson. The Slime God does not spawn on its own and requires the player to summon it with the Overloaded Sludge. The Sl

name: Boss Masks
description: Boss Masks are vanity items dropped by most bosses added in the Calamity Mod. They are worn in the social head slot, like vanilla masks. Each boss has a 14.29% (1 in 7) chance to drop its own mask. In total, there are 31 boss masks. The only boss currently without a mask is Supreme Calamitas. Instead, she drops a full vanity set in the form of the Calamitous set and Ashen Horns.

name: Yharon Soul Fragment
description: Yharon Soul Fragments are a post-Moon Lord crafting material dropped by Jungle Dragon, Yharon after defeating his second phase. They are used to make highly powerful endgame equipment, including Auric Bars. Crafting all items (excluding any items that solely require Auric Bars in later tier recipes) requires 29 Yharon Soul Fragments (requiring Yharon to be defeated 2 times on all difficulties). In Expert Mode and higher, Yharon Soul Fragments will drop directly from Yharon instead of from his Tr

name: Terratomere
description: Not to be confused with Teratoma, the summoning item for The Hive Mind. The Terratomere is a craftable post-Moon Lord broadsword that autoswings. It fires a barrage of 4 homing beams when swung, which deal half damage, and can pass through blocks. The sword and projectiles will inflict Glacial State onto enemies. In addition to this, striking enemies with true melee hits will heal the player for 2 to 4 HP. Its best modifier is Legendary. For a full crafting tree, see here.

name: The Hive Mind
description: "A hive of clustered microbial-infected flesh." The Hive Mind is a Pre-Hardmode boss fought in The Corruption, with an immobile first phase and a floating, teleporting second phase. It is the Corruption counterpart to The Perforators. The Hive Mind does not spawn on its own, and requires the player to summon it using a Teratoma or by killing a Hive Cyst in The Corruption. The Hive Mind is stationary in all of Phase 1, summoning Corruption-themed enemies at intervals based on its life. In Phase 2

name: Greatbay Pickaxe
description: The Greatbay Pickaxe is a craftable Pre-Hardmode pickaxe. It can mine blocks up to Demonite Ore / Crimtane Ore. Its best modifier is Legendary. While Light may seem to provide a better speed boost by percentages, rounding reveals that Legendary and Light mine at equal speeds for this tool.

name: The Perforators
description: "An abomination of comingled flesh ... infested primarily by blood-slurping worms." The Perforators are a group of Pre-Hardmode bosses fought in The Crimson. They consist of 3 worms with varying appearances, sizes, and behaviors, and a crimson, fleshy hive. They are the Crimson counterpart to The Hive Mind. The Perforators do not spawn on their own. The player can summon them manually with Bloody Worm Food or by killing a Perforator Cyst while in The Crimson. When spawning, the Perforator Hive w

name: Reefclaw Hamaxe
description: The Reefclaw Hamaxe is a craftable Pre-Hardmode Hamaxe. Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes. The item used to be an axe known as "Reefclaw Axe", and was the first item in the mod to be renamed.

name: True Ark of the Ancients
description: The True Ark of the Ancients is a craftable Hardmode broadsword that autoswings. It is a direct upgrade to the Ark of the Ancients. It fires a beam forward and rains either one or two sets of holy star and homing terra star at the cursor. The beam can either be pink or blue colored, deals 75% of the weapon's base damage, and pierces up to one enemy. The hallow star and terra star each deal 33.33% of the weapon's base damage. Its best modifier is Legendary.

name: Ark of the Elements
description: The Ark of the Elements is a craftable post-Moon Lord broadsword that autoswings. It is the penultimate upgrade to the Ark of the Ancients. It fires an Eon Beam of random colors when swung, including pink, green, blue, and orange. These beams can pierce twice and ignore tiles. Each beam color also has varying immunity frames on hit, with pink at a highest value of 6 and decreasing in the mentioned order to orange's value of 3. A column of four elemental dust orbs are also fired inaccurately towa

name: Redtide Sword
description: The Redtide Sword is a craftable Pre-Hardmode broadsword. When swung, it fires a small glowing cyclone that grows in size, pierces once, deals half the broadsword's damage and travels a short distance before popping, emitting glowing water projectiles in a large radius. Despite the projectile growing in size, its hitbox does not change. The projectile can also go through walls if close enough to it. Its best modifier is Legendary. Red tide is the term given to the occurrence of algal blooms, whi

name: Rotten Matter
description: Rotten Matter is a Pre-Hardmode crafting material dropped by The Hive Mind. It is used in crafting the items dropped by The Hive Mind, as well as a few magic weapons and the Teratoma. It is the Corruption counterpart to the Blood Sample. This item was previously named "True Shadow Scale".

name: Blood Sample
description: Blood Samples are Pre-Hardmode crafting materials dropped by The Perforators. It is used in crafting the items dropped by The Perforators, and also used in crafting the Carnage Ray and the Bloody Worm Food. It is the Crimson counterpart to the Rotten Matter.

name: Leviathan and Anahita
description: "...Two genetic misfits outcast from their homes..." If you were looking for something other than Anahita or the Leviathan, see Anahita (disambiguation) and Leviathan (disambiguation). The Leviathan and Anahita are a duo of bosses that can be fought at any point in the game, but is intended to be fought during Hardmode. It is recommended that the player acquire post-Plantera equipment before engaging the bosses, as they are very challenging and require the management of two boss-tier enemies wit

name: The Plaguebringer Goliath
description: "A horrific amalgam of steel, flesh, and infection." Not to be confused with Plaguebringer, a related mini boss. The Plaguebringer Goliath is a Hardmode boss and the central force of the plague afflicted onto the Jungle after the Golem's defeat. The Plaguebringer Goliath can be summoned manually with the Abombination. She must be summoned in the Jungle or Underground Jungle. The Plaguebringer Goliath behaves similarly to Queen Bee, charging at the player and using a variety of dangerous attacks.

name: Work Benches
description: Work Benches are pieces of furniture that function as early game crafting stations. The Calamity Mod currently adds fourteen types of Work Benches to the game, each corresponding to specific sets of furniture.

name: Ashes of Calamity
description: Ashes of Calamity are Hardmode crafting materials that drop solely from Calamitas. They are used in the crafting of Calamitas' Brew, Sigil of Calamitas, Brimflame armor, and several weapons. They can also be used to summon the Supreme Calamitas boss when interacting (right-click) with the Altar of the Accursed.

name: Wings
description: Wings are accessories that allow the player to fly temporarily by pressing and holding the ↷ Jump key. They also provide immunity from fall damage (except when the player is affected by the Stoned debuff), rendering the Lucky Horseshoe, Obsidian Horseshoe, Umbrella, and Featherfall Potions unnecessary. By continuing to hold the ↷ Jump key after the wings' flight time has been exhausted, the player is able to glide. Gliding fall speed can be accelerated by holding the ▼ Down key. Equipping Wings

name: Earth Elemental
description: The Earth Elemental is a rare Hardmode mini boss found in the Underground and Cavern layers. Its method of attack is to fly toward the player and charge every 10 / 5 seconds, while firing blasts of small rocks, which burst upon impact with blocks. Occasionally, a larger rock is fired which bounces off blocks twice before exploding. Due to its intimidating size, ability to phase through blocks, and immunity to all forms of knockback, it can be a dangerous encounter for unaware players. The player

name: Starfleet
description: The Starfleet is a craftable post-Moon Lord ranged weapon and is an upgrade to the Star Cannon EX and Electrosphere Launcher. It fires a shotgun burst of plasma blasts that explode into blue particles that deal damage to enemies. Plasma blasts cannot pierce enemies or pass through tiles. It uses Fallen Stars as ammo. Its best modifier is Unreal. Grinding the Astrum Deus is an efficient way of obtaining Fallen Stars. The Starfleet's name is a reference to the Norfleet from Borderlands 2. The name

name: Purified Gel
description: Not to be confused with Purified Jam, a buff potion dropped by The Slime God. Purified Gel is a Pre-Hardmode crafting material that drops from The Slime God. It is used to make several items, including the Statigel Armor.

name: Harpy Ring
description: The Harpy Ring is a craftable Pre-Hardmode accessory that increases the player's movement speed by 10% and flight time by 25%. It is later used in the crafting of the Angel Treads. The Harpy Ring will not give any bonus flight time if the Angel Treads are already equipped.

name: Feller of Evergreens
description: The Feller of Evergreens is a craftable Pre-Hardmode axe. Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes. Due to its relatively cheap price and being available from the beginning, it can be made very early. Additionally, it has autoswing and has more damage than most of swords made with ores, so one can use it as a decent weapon until obtaining something better.

name: Firestorm Cannon
description: Not to be confused with Flurrystorm Cannon, a snow-themed ranged weapon. The Firestorm Cannon is a craftable Pre-Hardmode ranged weapon that is a weaponized version of the Flare Gun. Like the Flare Gun, it uses Flares as ammunition. The Firestorm Cannon has two firing modes, both of which have auto-use: Left click will fire a constant but inaccurate stream of piercing flares; sometimes firing two flares at once. These flares disappear very quickly after sticking to a tile. Right click fires an i

name: Ion Blaster
description: The Ion Blaster is a craftable Hardmode magic gun. It fires continuously accelerating ion blasts that have increased damage the more mana the player has in reserve. Its projectiles inflict the Brimstone Flames debuff upon hitting an enemy. The projectile damage is multiplied by 0.2 added to 1.4 times of the player's mana ratio, dealing 20% damage at 0 mana and 160% damage at full mana. Additionally, the projectile size is multiplied by 0.75 added to 0.75 times of the player's mana ratio, being 7

name: Mana Rose
description: Not to be confused with Mana Flower, an accessory. The Mana Rose is a craftable Pre-Hardmode wand. It shoots a blue flower that decelerates into a complete stop. After three seconds have passed or upon contact with any enemy or blocks, it will explode into an even spread of six damaging small blue petals. Three petals move forwards with homing properties and a blue dust trail, and the remaining three with green dust trail move in the opposite direction. Both petal variants deal 50% of the main d

name: Megalodon
description: The Megalodon is a craftable Hardmode gun and an upgrade to the Megashark. It rapidly fires bullets with a chance to not consume ammo. Its best modifier is Unreal. The weapon is named after a prehistoric shark, the Megalodon, which was the largest shark that ever lived.

name: Voidragon
description: The Voidragon is a craftable post-Moon Lord developer gun which is the upgraded version of Seadragon and the final upgrade to the Minishark. It rapidly fires a stream of bullets interspersed with void blasts, which explode upon contact with enemies or tiles. Its best modifier is Unreal. This item used to be known as "Megafleet", and consumed Fallen Stars to fire explosive blue blasts similar to the weapon's current void blasts. It is still referred to such in the mod's source code. It also used

name: Dragon Rage
description: The Dragon Rage is a post-Moon Lord melee weapon auto-swings. It is dropped by Jungle Dragon, Yharon. When used, a baton is held at the player's position, rotating and spawning an explosion which deals 25% damage on every hit. Every 10 hits from the baton summons a ring of 10-15 homing fireballs outwards which deal 12.5% of the weapon's damage and creates a damaging explosion on death. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. The Dragon Rage may be considered an indi

name: The Burning Sky
description: The Burning Sky is a unique post-Moon Lord melee weapon dropped by Jungle Dragon, Yharon. When used, the player holds the weapon out similarly to a wand, and a stream of burning meteors rain down from the sky in the direction of the cursor. The meteors inflict melee damage, and can travel through tiles but do not pierce enemies. The meteors inflict the Daybroken debuff for 10 seconds on contact. The weapon itself does not deal damage. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affe

name: Excelsus
description: The Excelsus is a post-Moon Lord broadsword that is dropped by The Devourer of Gods. When swung, three spinning energy swords are thrown from the blade at slightly varying speeds and velocities. They can be blue, pink, or both blue and pink, however they all function identically. They can pierce two enemies before dissipating on the third and slow down when hitting tiles. Striking an enemy directly with the sword will cause a fountain of five fast gravity-affected lasers to spray into the air fr

name: Hellkite
description: The Hellkite is a craftable Hardmode broadsword that auto-swings and is the direct upgrade to the Fiery Greatsword. It is larger than most other swords of its tier, and upon hitting an enemy it inflicts the On Fire! debuff and summons a damaging geyser of flame on top of each target struck, dealing additional damage. Its best modifier is Legendary. The explosion generated by sword hits deals exactly 100% of the weapon's base damage, can not critically strike, does not damage nearby targets, and

name: Temporal Floe Sword
description: The Temporal Floe Sword is a craftable Hardmode broadsword that autoswings. It fires an ice beam that deals 65% of the blade's damage. Upon contact with an enemy or tile, the beam splits into two more beams that deal 32.5% of the sword's damage. The direction that the beams split into is based on the in-game time and an analog clock, with each minute changing the angle of the first beam by 6 degrees, and each hour changing the angle of the second beam by 15 degrees, clockwise starting at 12:00 P

name: Mariana
description: The Mariana is a craftable Hardmode broadsword that autoswings. When hitting an enemy, the enemy explodes into four or five bubble projectiles that travel for a long distance. These bubbles can bounce off of tiles infinitely as well as pierce twice, popping on the third enemy hit or after roughly two seconds have passed. Its best modifier is Legendary. The sword's name is a reference to the Mariana Trench, the deepest known part of the world's oceans. Prior to the introduction of the Aquatic Dis

name: Demonshade armor
description: Demonshade armor is a craftable post-Moon Lord developer armor set crafted from Shadowspec Bars. It takes a total of 45 Shadowspec Bars to craft a full set. Demonshade Armor is arguably the most powerful armor set available in the Calamity Mod, although the wider array of status effects granted by the Auric Tesla armor may make that desirable in some cases. If the full set is visible (whether equipped or in social slots), the player will have afterimages. If the full set is equipped, the player

name: Jungle Dragon Egg
description: The Jungle Dragon Egg is a craftable item used to summon the Jungle Dragon, Yharon boss. It is not consumed upon use; therefore, it can be used as many times as the player desires. It can only be used in the Jungle. Attempting to use it while outside of the Jungle or while Yharon is alive will cause it to do nothing. Although The Dragonfolly and Jungle Dragon Yharon are intended to be fought after Moon Lord, the recipes for both this item and the Exotic Pheromones are technically available at th

name: Yharon's Kindle Staff
description: The Yharon's Kindle Staff is a post-Moon Lord summon weapon. It is dropped by Jungle Dragon, Yharon. When used, it summons a Son of Yharon to attack enemies by ramming into them and shooting fire balls. The Son of Yharon can pass through blocks. Each Son of Yharon requires 5 minion slots to summon. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions ca

name: Dragon's Breath
description: The Dragon's Breath is a post-Moon Lord gun that is dropped by Jungle Dragon, Yharon. When left clicking with the weapon, it fires a spread of 6 bullets, followed by a spread of 6 fast exploding Dragon's Breath rounds, both in even spreads. Right clicking shoots two rounds of three bullets and three Dragon's Breath rounds in a more random spread. Its best modifier is Unreal. This weapon is a reference to real life "dragon's breath" incendiary ammunition.

name: Phoenix Flame Barrage
description: The Phoenix Flame Barrage is a post-Moon Lord wand that drops from Jungle Dragon, Yharon. When used, it rains down a barrage of holy flames in a vertical column which explode after a short delay, dealing additional damage. The projectiles inflict the Holy Flames debuff. Its best modifier is Mythical. The Phoenix Flame Barrage shoots two volleys of holy flames. It is possible to set up a chamber of holy flames by clicking and moving the mouse quickly across the screen this way. The Phoenix Flame

name: Wrathwing
description: The Wrathwing is a post-Moon Lord javelin that is dropped by Jungle Dragon, Yharon. It automatically throws fiery javelins which home in on enemies, explode violently on contact with them and apply the Daybroken debuff. The projectiles can pass through blocks, but do not home in on enemies while inside solid blocks. Performing a stealth strike with the Wrathwing will rain fireballs as it travels and cause it to erupt into three fireballs on enemy hits. Trailed fireballs are affected by gravity a

name: Treasure Bag
description: Treasure Bags are consumable grab bags obtained in Expert Mode as a reward for defeating bosses. Its contents depend on the boss it comes from. It is opened by either right-clicking it inside the inventory or using it while it is in your hand. In multiplayer, each player that is online at the end of the battle receives one Treasure Bag each. Treasure bags are client-side and will despawn if you exit the world. Each Treasure Bag contains the boss's usual drops from normal mode, and most contain a

name: Cloud Elemental
description: The Cloud Elemental is a rare Hardmode mini boss that can be found while it is raining, starting at around the height Floating Islands are found. She moves freely albeit slowly through the air and through tiles, advancing towards the player while occasionally stopping to attack. When attacking, she casts three tornadoes near the player, similarly to the Sand Elemental, which linger for around six seconds. She resembles a valkyrie due to her armor with wing motifs, as well as being a female warri

name: Desert Medallion
description: The Desert Medallion is a craftable Pre-Hardmode item used to summon the Desert Scourge boss. It can only be used in the Desert. Internally, Desert Medallion is named "DriedSeafood".

name: Teratoma
description: Not to be confused with Terratomere, a post-Moon Lord broadsword. The Teratoma is a craftable Pre-Hardmode item used to summon The Hive Mind boss in The Corruption. Note that the boss can also be summoned by killing a Hive Cyst, which spawns rarely in the Corruption. A "teratoma" is a tumor made of several different kinds of tissue, such as hair, muscle, bone, eyeballs or teeth.

name: Bloody Worm Food
description: The Bloody Worm Food is a craftable Pre-Hardmode item used to summon The Perforators boss in The Crimson. Note that the boss can also be summoned by killing a Perforator Cyst, which spawns rarely in the Crimson.

name: Overloaded Sludge
description: The Overloaded Sludge is a craftable Pre-Hardmode item used to summon The Slime God boss anywhere at any time.

name: Cryo Key
description: The Cryo Key is a craftable Hardmode item used to summon the Cryogen boss. It can only be used in the Snow biome or Ice biome.

name: Eye of Desolation
description: The Eye of Desolation is a craftable Hardmode item used to summon the Calamitas boss anywhere at Night. It is not consumed upon use; therefore, it can be used as many times as the player desires.

name: Abombination
description: The Abombination is a craftable Hardmode item used to summon The Plaguebringer Goliath boss. It can only be used in the Jungle or Underground Jungle. This item's name is a portmanteau of the words "abomination" and "bomb", similar to how the Abeemination's name is a portmanteau of "abomination" and "bee". This item was previously named "Abomination".

name: Cosmic Worm
description: The Cosmic Worm is a craftable post-Moon Lord item used to summon The Devourer of Gods boss. It can be used at any time and is not consumed upon use. Attempting to use the item while The Devourer of Gods is alive will cause it to do nothing. While the Cosmic Worm is craftable immediately after the Moon Lord has been defeated, it is not recommended that the player attempts to fight The Devourer of Gods unless they have defeated Providence, the Profaned Goddess and the Sentinels of the Devourer.

name: Biome Blade
description: The Biome Blade is a craftable Pre-Hardmode broadsword that auto-swings. When swung, it fires a Biome Blade projectile which cannot pierce through tiles nor targets. The color and the debuff inflicted by the projectile on hit varies based on the biome that the player is in. All debuffs inflicted last 1.5 seconds, except Glacial State which lasts only 0.5 seconds. Its best modifier is Legendary. Only one biome color and debuff can be applied at a time. The following is a list of biome effects fro

name: Unholy Essence
description: Unholy Essence is a post-Moon Lord crafting material that drops from Scorn Eaters, Impious Immolators, Profaned Energies, and Providence, the Profaned Goddess. 5-10 Unholy Essences can be obtained from Hallowed Crates at a 15% chance once Moon Lord has been defeated.

name: True Biome Blade
description: The True Biome Blade is a craftable Hardmode broadsword that auto-swings and is an upgraded version of the Biome Blade. When swung, it fires a Biome Blade projectile which cannot pierce through tiles nor targets. The color and the debuff inflicted by the projectile on hit varies based on the biome that the player is in. All debuffs inflicted last 6 seconds. Its best modifier is Legendary. Only one biome color and debuff can be applied at a time. The following is a list of biome effects from high

name: Omega Biome Blade
description: The Omega Biome Blade is a craftable post-Moon Lord broadsword that auto-swings and is an upgraded version of the True Biome Blade. When swung, it fires a stack of three Biome Blade projectiles on top of each other, which cannot pierce through tiles nor targets, but can home into enemies. The color and the debuff inflicted by the projectile on hit varies based on the biome that the player is in. Additionally, the player will gain additional buffs during certain moon events. All buffs and debuffs

name: Stormlion Mandible
description: The Stormlion Mandible is a Pre-Hardmode crafting material that drops from Stormlions in the Desert. It is used to craft the Desert Medallion to summon the Desert Scourge and the Storm Surge weapon.

name: Sun Spirit Staff
description: The Sun Spirit Staff is a craftable Pre-Hardmode summon weapon. It summons a Solar Spirit minion that continually floats over the player's head and fires yellow beams of energy at nearby enemies. Unlike most minions, only one Solar Spirit can be summoned. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting ad

name: Skyline Wings
description: Skyline Wings are a Pre-Hardmode wing-type accessory that allow the player to fly and glide at a low height. They can be crafted after defeating Skeletron. If these wings are worn along with Aerospec armor with any Aerospec headpiece, the player's jump speed is increased by 10%. While these wings are available before Hardmode even begins, it is important to note that they have a flight time of 1.33 second and a maximum height of 35 tiles. By personal preference, the player may find the Bundle of

name: Abyssal Tome
description: The Abyssal Tome is a Pre-Hardmode spell tome that drops from The Slime God. It fires a slow moving Abyss Ball that can travel through blocks and is not affected by gravity, and will slowly decelerate until stopping in place. After hitting an enemy twice or after 5 seconds from being shot, it will explode, dealing damage to anything caught in the explosion. It is the Corruption counterpart to the Eldritch Tome. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Barinade
description: The Barinade is a Pre-Hardmode bow that is dropped by the Desert Scourge. When Wooden Arrows are used as ammo, arrows are converted into electric bolt arrows that emit a small explosion upon contact with tiles or enemies. Its best modifier is Unreal. The name Barinade and the bolts it fires are a reference to the Barinade boss in The Legend of Zelda: Ocarina of Time.

name: Victide armor
description: Victide armor is a craftable Pre-Hardmode armor set made from Victide Bars. It takes a total of 12 Victide Bars to craft one full set, and 24 to make every piece. It consists of a Victide Breastplate, Victide Leggings and one of five different headpieces: Victide Mask, Victide Headgear, Victide Helm, Victide Helmet or Victide Visage. Each headpiece provides different stats and a different set bonus. The Victide Breastplate gives 5 defense, 5% damage reduction and 5% increased critical strike cha

name: Catastrophe Claymore
description: The Catastophe Claymore is a craftable Hardmode broadsword that auto-swings. Upon swing, it fires out one of three damaging projectiles, which will inflict numerous debuffs on hit, depending on their color. Hitting an enemy with the blade itself has a chance to inflict multiple debuffs all at once, albeit with a shorter duration than the projectiles. Its best modifier is Legendary.

name: Devastation
description: The Devastation is a craftable post-Moon Lord broadsword that autoswings and is the upgrade of the Catastrophe Claymore. Upon being swung, arching beams are fired from the blade, and beams are fired from the sky. Beams fired from the sky will do half as much damage. Its best modifier is Legendary.

name: Burden Breaker
description: The Burden Breaker is a Hardmode Legendary accessory dropped from Skeletron Prime in Malice Mode. When equipped, once the player reaches a horizontal speed of 25 mph, it accelerates the player by a factor of 2.5% per frame (roughly 4.4x speed per second), until either a solid block is hit or they achieve a speed of 2557 mph, at which point the player's speed is reset to zero. Without any obstacles on their path or when using a flying mount, a player can move a horizontal distance of roughly 2600

name: Entropic Claymore
description: The Entropic Claymore is a craftable Hardmode broadsword that autoswings. When swung, it releases four to five plasma balls that home into enemies. The projectiles cannot pierce through walls or enemies. There are three different sizes that can randomly be picked at an equal chance, each with identical behavior but different damage output. Large balls deal 80% of the weapon's base damage; medium balls deal 65% and small balls deal 50%. Its best modifier is Legendary. This item was previously kno

name: Terra Edge
description: The Terra Edge is a craftable Hardmode broadsword that autoswings. When swung, it shoots a single projectile that deals 75% of the weapon's base damage and inflicts Ichor for 1 second. If the sword itself hits a target, the player will recover 2 to 3 health, and will inflict Ichor for 2 seconds. It is an alternative to the vanilla weapon Terra Blade, having less projectile damage but having the ability to deal more damage and lifesteal in close-ranged combat. Its best modifier is Legendary.

name: Blighted Gel
description: Blighted Gel is a Pre-Hardmode crafting material that drops from Crimulan Blight Slimes and Ebonian Blight Slimes. It is used to make the Overloaded Sludge as well as different weapons and the Zen Potion. 5-8 Blighted Gel can be obtained from Corrupt and Crimson Crates at a 15% drop chance. This item was previously named 'Ebonian Gel' and dropped exclusively by Ebonian Blight Slimes in early versions, while Crimulan Blight Slimes dropped the now removed Crimulan Gel.

name: Corroslime Staff
description: The Corroslime Staff is a Pre-Hardmode summon weapon that is dropped by The Slime God. It summons a miniature Ebonian Blight Slime, which follows the player and attacks enemies. It deals contact damage, similarly to other slimes. If the player gets too far, it grows two wings and flies towards the player. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, min

name: Crimson Crusher Blade
description: The Crimson Crusher Blade is a craftable Pre-Hardmode broadsword. When swung, it emits faint blood particles and inflicts the Ichor debuff upon striking enemies. While no bosses are alive, critical strikes caused by this weapon reduce the target's base contact damage by 5. Its best modifier is Legendary. The amount of contact damage reduction will scale with difficulty. For example, Great Sand Shark has a 60% scaling factor in Expert Mode and 15% scaling factor in Revengeance Mode. Therefore, th

name: Blade of Enmity
description: The Blade of Enmity is a craftable Hardmode broadsword that autoswings. It has an average range and no projectile but swings very quickly and deals high damage. The blade inflicts the Brimstone Flames debuff. Its best modifier is Legendary. This weapon only benefits from 25% of melee swing speed bonuses. This weapon can be considered an alternative to the Omniblade, another true melee weapon which can be crafted at the same progression point. The Blade of Enmity has higher base damage, knockback

name: Animus
description: The Animus is a craftable post-Moon Lord broadsword that auto-swings. Hitting an enemy applies the Brimstone Flames debuff for a significantly long time of 100 seconds. Animus changes its base damage every time it strikes an enemy, choosing a weighted value at random from the following options: 25% chance of 800 damage 25% chance of 1,200 damage 20% chance of 1,800 damage 15% chance of 3,000 damage 10% chance of 6,000 damage 5% chance of 10,000 damage Its best modifier is Legendary. The average

name: Blighted Lens
description: Blighted Lenses are Hardmode crafting materials dropped by Blighted Eyes, Calamity Eyes, and Calamitas. They are one of the ingredients needed to create an Eye of Desolation used to summon Calamitas and are also used in crafting the Magic Quiver. 2-6 Blighted Lenses can additionally be obtained from Brimstone Crates at a 15% drop chance.

name: Cryonic Ore
description: "The ice caves are crackling with frigid energy." Cryonic Ore is a Hardmode ore which generates in the Ice biome upon Cryogen's defeat. It is used to craft Cryonic Bars at an Adamantite Forge or Titanium Forge. It requires at least an Adamantite Pickaxe or Titanium Pickaxe to mine. It is also dropped by Cryo Slimes. This ore glows slightly which makes it easy to spot through walls. Cryonic Ore cannot be destroyed by explosives, even after Cryogen has been defeated. Unlike most other ores, it is

name: Scoria Ore
description: Scoria Ore is a Hardmode ore which generates in the Abyss biome. It can be found on the underside of the floating Abyss Gravel islands, dropping harmful lava particles into the water beneath itself. These lava particles have a base damage of 25. It requires at least a Picksaw to mine, and is used to craft Scoria Bars at an Adamantite Forge or a Titanium Forge. It is also dropped by Chaotic Puffers and Devil Fish after the Golem has been defeated. Scoria Ore cannot be destroyed by explosives, eve

name: Perennial Ore
description: "Energized plant matter has formed in the underground." Perennial Ore is a Hardmode ore which generates in Dirt and Stone Blocks in the Cavern layer after Plantera has been defeated, and is used to craft Perennial Bars at an Adamantite Forge or a Titanium Forge. It requires at least a Pickaxe Axe or a Drax to mine. It is also dropped by Perennial Slimes. Perennial Ore cannot be destroyed by explosives, even after Plantera has been defeated. Unlike most other ores, it is visible without the use o

name: Demon Trophy
description: The Demon Trophy is a Hardmode consumable dropped by the Wall of Flesh in all difficulty modes. It boosts enemy spawn rates in the current world by 33.33% and is not reversible once used. It can only be consumed once. The effect of the Demon Trophy will stack with spawn rate modifiers such as Water Candles, Battle Potions, Revengeance Mode, etc. Once the Demon Trophy has been used in the world, the Wall of Flesh will no longer drop it and it will also no longer be contained in its Treasure Bag.

name: Celestial Onion
description: The Celestial Onion is a consumable dropped by the Moon Lord. It permanently gives the player a sixth (seventh) accessory slot. This effect does not stack and may only be used once per player. If the player does not have a sixth accessory slot yet, the Celestial Onion can be used, and it will grant the sixth accessory slot. If in Expert Mode, the seventh slot will not be granted until the player also consumes the Demon Heart. If the Demon Heart has also been consumed, the seventh slot does not a

name: Aerialite Ore
description: "The ground is glittering with cyan light." Aerialite Ore is a Pre-Hardmode ore which generates anywhere in the Underground and Cavern layers upon defeating The Hive Mind or The Perforators. It is used to craft Aerialite Bars at a Furnace. It requires at least a Nightmare Pickaxe or a Deathbringer Pickaxe to mine. It is also dropped by Aero Slimes. Aerialite Ore can be destroyed by explosives after the Brain of Cthulhu or Eater of Worlds have been defeated. Defeating both the The Perforators and

name: Uelibloom Ore
description: "Fossilized tree bark is bursting through the jungle's mud." Uelibloom Ore is a post-Moon Lord ore which generates in Mud Blocks after Providence, the Profaned Goddess has been defeated. It is used to craft Uelibloom Bars at an Adamantite Forge or a Titanium Forge. It requires at least a Lunar Pickaxe or Laser Drill to mine. It is also dropped by Bloom Slimes. Although it is most commonly found in the Underground Jungle due to its high amount of mud, it can generate in mud patches anywhere in th

name: Wind Blade
description: The Wind Blade is a craftable Pre-Hardmode broadsword. When swung, it creates glowing blue dust particles and fires a wind cyclone that emits projectiles and deals half the broadsword's damage. The projectile drags non-boss enemies towards it and disappears after a short while. The projectile pierces once, however it usually hits one enemy twice instead of piercing due to immunity frames. Its best modifier is Legendary.

name: Hellfire Flamberge
description: The Hellfire Flamberge is a craftable Hardmode broadsword that autoswings. On each swing, it fires out two small fireballs and one large fireball at slightly randomized angles and speeds. Small volcanic fireballs deal 50% of the weapon's damage and large volcanic fireballs deal 75% of the weapon's damage, both additionally inflicting the On Fire! debuff. The fireballs aren't affected by gravity, slow to a stop and disappear shortly after being fired, and cannot penetrate tiles nor enemies. The s

name: Vulcanite Lance
description: The Vulcanite Lance is a craftable Hardmode spear that creates explosions upon contact with enemies and inflicts the On Fire! debuff. Upon critically hitting an enemy, two homing flares will fly in from off-screen and seek a target near them. The flares deal half of the spear's damage. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. The Vulcanite Lance was formerly known as the "Exsanguination Lance", in reference to the term "exsanguination" to refer to death by loss of bl

name: Subduction Slicer
description: The Subduction Slicer is a craftable Hardmode Rogue boomerang that auto-fires. When the scythe impacts an enemy, it inflicts the On Fire! debuff and creates a small explosion. It can be continuously thrown regardless of whether the first scythe has returned. Performing a stealth strike with the Subduction Slicer will create a pillar of fire on enemy hits, dealing 150% of the weapon's damage. Its best modifier is Flawless. Subduction is a geological event in which, when two tectonic plates collid

name: Fault Line
description: The Fault Line is a craftable Hardmode yoyo. Every time it strikes an enemy, it creates a small fiery explosion which deals additional damage. When the yoyo returns to the player, it will be automatically re-thrown if they are still holding the fire button. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. A fault line is the location of a fracture between large volumes of rock at the edge of the Earth's tectonic plates. This weapon was previously known as the "Chaotrix".

name: Helstorm
description: The Helstorm is a craftable Hardmode gun. When used, it rapidly auto-fires two bullets at once, with a slightly random spread. The gun itself deals contact damage to enemies, a unique property for a ranged weapon that it shares with weapons such as Marnite Bayonet and Hellborn. Enemies that take contact damage from the gun will be inflicted with the On Fire! debuff. Its best modifier is Unreal. As the gun's hitbox does not change based on aim, it will not always hit enemies that pass through the

name: Skyfringe Pickaxe
description: The Skyfringe Pickaxe is a Pre-Hardmode pickaxe capable of mining Aerialite Ore and Hellstone. It is one of the fastest pickaxes available before Hardmode. Its best modifier is Legendary. While Light may seem to provide a better speed boost by percentages, rounding reveals that Legendary and Light mine at equal speeds for this tool.

name: Continental Greatbow
description: The Continental Greatbow is a craftable Hardmode bow. It fires 3 arrows at once, quickly followed by two more arrows that will always be either Cursed, Ichor, or Hellfire Arrows. Each of the two additional arrows can be different or the same type. All Wooden Arrows fired will convert into Flaming Arrows. Its best modifier is Unreal. This item's name used to be "Greatbow of Turmoil".

name: Tradewinds
description: The Tradewinds is a craftable Pre-Hardmode spell tome that casts fast moving feather-like projectiles. These projectiles emit light particles and are capable of piercing a single enemy or ricocheting once, disappearing on its second impact. Its best modifier is Mythical. Trade winds are wind belts located around the equator.

name: True Forbidden Oathblade
description: The True Forbidden Oathblade is a craftable Hardmode broadsword that autoswings and is the upgrade to the Forbidden Oathblade. When swung, it will fire 3 demonic scythes that collide with terrain and pierce up to two targets, each dealing 50% of the blade's damage. Both the sword and the fired projectiles inflict the On Fire! and Shadowflame debuffs. Critical hits additionally summon purple explosions on the target. Its best modifier is Legendary. The explosion generated by critical hits deals e

name: Aerial Hamaxe
description: The Aerial Hamaxe is a craftable Pre-Hardmode Hamaxe. Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.

name: Goldplume Spear
description: The Goldplume Spear is a craftable Pre-Hardmode spear that autoswings. On swing, it shoots three gravity-affected, non-piercing feathers that deal 40% of the weapon's base damage. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size.

name: Air Spinner
description: The Air Spinner is a craftable Pre-Hardmode yoyo. While the yoyo is deployed and enemies are nearby, small feathers will be fired from the yoyo that deal 50% of the main throw's damage. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. The Air Spinner moves extremely quickly compared to other yoyos, allowing it to more easily track fast enemies; however, its short airtime can severely hinder the usefulness of its speed.

name: Cryogen
description: "The archmage's prison." Cryogen is a Hardmode boss that can be fought in the Snow or Ice biomes which possesses many phases and features a multitude of projectiles and enemies. Defeating Cryogen will free the Archmage, as well as generate Cryonic Ore in the Ice biome. Cryogen does not spawn on its own and requires the player to summon it with a Cryo Key while in the Snow biome at any time. Cryogen has six phases, each of which has its own attack pattern and AI. It will progress through these ph

name: Old Lord Oathsword
description: The Old Lord Oathsword is a Pre-Hardmode broadsword that drops from Bone Serpents in The Underworld. Critical hits with this weapon summon a fiery explosion on the target, dealing an extra hit of damage and inflicting the On Fire! debuff for 10 seconds. Its best modifier is Legendary. The explosion generated by critical hits deals exactly 100% of the weapon's base damage, can not critically strike, does not damage nearby targets, and cannot be modified by any means.

name: Galeforce
description: The Galeforce is a craftable Pre-Hardmode bow. It shoots arrows at very high velocity, along with a wave of 3 fast non-piercing feathers. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Cosmilite Bar
description: Not to be confused with Cosmolight, a tool used to change time. Cosmilite Bars are post-Moon Lord bars used to craft many late-game armor and tools, as well as other items. The only way to obtain them is to defeat The Devourer of Gods.

name: Feather Knife
description: Feather Knives are craftable Pre-Hardmode daggers. They throw gravity affected knives that periodically release homing explosive feathers. The feather and explosion deal 5% and 50% of the weapon’s damage respectively. Additionally, one extra feather is released on enemy hits which deals twice as much damage. Performing a stealth strike with Feather Knives will cause five knives to be thrown instead of one. The Feather Knife cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers.

name: Aerospec armor
description: Aerospec armor is a craftable Pre-Hardmode armor set made with Aerialite Bars and other Floating Island materials. It requires 23 Aerialite Bars, 19 Clouds, 9 Rain Clouds and 5 Feathers to craft one full set. Making one of every piece requires 43 Aerialite Bars, 31 Clouds, 13 Rain Clouds and 9 Feathers. It consists of an Aerospec Breastplate, Aerospec Leggings and one of five different headpieces: Aerospec Helm, Aerospec Hood, Aerospec Hat, Aerospec Helmet or Aerospec Headgear. Each headpiece pr

name: Lucrecia
description: The Lucrecia is a craftable Hardmode shortsword that auto-swings. When swung, it fires a straight double helix directly left or right in the direction of the cursor which passes through blocks. If an enemy is hit by either the projectile or the sword itself, the player will gain 5 immunity frames. Its best modifier is Legendary. Despite being the size of an average broadsword, this weapon stabs horizontally in front of the player like a shortsword would.

name: Galactus Blade
description: The Galactus Blade is a craftable post-Moon Lord broadsword that auto-swings. It rains down Galactica Comets above the cursor on swing. It inflicts the On Fire! and Frostburn debuffs on hit. The projectile will not pierce, but it will ignore tiles and explode on impact. Its best modifier is Legendary. This is the first item ever added by the Calamity Mod. This item used to be known as "Galactica Blade" and fired a spread of comets.

name: Angel Treads
description: The Angel Treads are a craftable Hardmode accessory which are a combination and upgrade to multiple movement-based accessories, namely the Frostspark Boots, the Lava Waders, and the Harpy Ring. When equipped, they grant ability to fly, sprint up to 40 mph, walk on liquids, 4 seconds of immunity to lava damage, improved movement on ice blocks, increased maximum acceleration by 36%, and boost maximum flight time by 10%. When Angel Treads are equipped, equipping Rocket Boots and/or Harpy Rings or a

name: Calamitas
description: Not to be confused with Supreme Calamitas, a post-Moon Lord boss. "You underestimate my power..." Calamitas is a Hardmode boss fought at night. She is a significant mid-Hardmode boss that is intended to be challenged soon before, or alternatively to, Plantera. She increases substantially in difficulty once Providence, the Profaned Goddess has been defeated, boosting the health and damage of her and her brothers, and she will begin dropping Bloodstone. Calamitas does not spawn on her own and requ

name: Storm Surge
description: The Storm Surge is a Pre-Hardmode ranged weapon. It fires a glowing blue shockwave that can pass through solid blocks and pierce a single enemy, making it useful for dispatching enemies through walls and searching for nearby caves. However, the shockwave has a short range and the weapon lacks auto-fire. Unlike many other early-game ranged weapons, it does not consume ammo. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Statigel armor
description: Statigel armor is a craftable Pre-Hardmode armor set made from Purified Gel and Hellstone Bars. It requires 19 Purified Gel and 33 Hellstone Bars (33 Obsidian and 99 Hellstone) to make the whole set or 39 Purified Gel and 69 Hellstone Bars (69 Obsidian and 207 Hellstone) for a set with all five headpieces. It consists of Statigel Armor, Statigel Greaves and five different headpieces: Statigel Helm, Statigel Headgear, Statigel Cap, Statigel Hood and Statigel Mask. The Statigel Armor gives 10 defe

name: Asgardian Aegis
description: The Asgardian Aegis is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory with a wide array of defensive effects. It grants 10 defense, immunity to knockback and most debuffs, +40 max life, increases life regeneration by 1, and an additional 20 defense while submerged in liquid. While equipped, the wearer can double tap a horizontal movement key to perform a supreme holy flame dash with a base distance of 28 blocks. Striking enemies during the shield dash will heavily damage them, inflict God Slayer Inferno,

name: Ceremonial Urn
description: The Ceremonial Urn is a craftable post-Moon Lord item used to summon Supreme Calamitas at any time when used at an Altar of the Accursed. It is not consumed upon use; therefore, it can be used as many times as the player desires. When the Ceremonial Urn is used, a square arena comprised of Arena Blocks will be created around the player which can only be destroyed by the Crystyl Crusher. The player appears in the center of the arena, making it a high priority to use the item in a proper location.

name: Asgard's Valor
description: The Asgard's Valor is a craftable Hardmode accessory that grants immunity to fire blocks and knockback, immunity to most debuffs including Frostburn and Glacial State, 16 defense while submerged in liquid, and +20 max life. It also reduces the damage over time effect for Brimstone Flames by 50%. While equipped, the wearer can double tap a horizontal movement key to perform a holy dash with a base distance of 18 blocks. Striking enemies during the shield dash will damage them and cause an explosi

name: Elysian Aegis
description: The Elysian Aegis is a post-Moon Lord accessory dropped by Providence, the Profaned Goddess when she is summoned in The Underworld. It grants 8 defense, immunity to fire blocks, knockback and the Holy Flames debuff, +30 max life. While equipped, the wearer can double-tap a horizontal movement key to perform a supreme holy flame dash with a base distance of 28 blocks. Striking enemies during the shield dash will heavily damage them, cause holy explosions, and leave behind a lingering Holy Eruptio

name: Ornate Shield
description: The Ornate Shield is a craftable Hardmode accessory that provides 8 defense. When equipped alongside the Daedalus armor set, it grants an additional 8% damage reduction and +20 maximum life. It also grants a dash with a base distance of 15 tiles. Enemies hit with the dash take 50 damage and are inflicted with the Glacial State debuff for 1 second.

name: Shield of the Ocean
description: The Shield of the Ocean is a craftable Pre-Hardmode accessory that grants +2 defense, and an additional 5 defense when submerged in a liquid. It also increases the player's life regen by 2 and movement speed by 10% when equipped alongside the Victide armor set.

name: Abaddon
description: The Abaddon is a Hardmode accessory that drops from the Brimstone Elemental and reduces the damage over time effect for the Brimstone Flames debuff by 50%, as well as granting immunity to the Searing Lava debuff. In the Bible, Abaddon is the name of a bottomless pit of destruction as well as an angel of the abyss.

name: Charred Idol
description: Not to be confused with Charred Relic, a pet-summoning item. The Charred Idol is a craftable Hardmode item used to summon the Brimstone Elemental boss. It can only be used in the Brimstone Crag.

name: Profaned Shard
description: The Profaned Shard is a craftable post-Moon Lord item used to summon the Profaned Guardians boss in the Underworld or Hallow during daytime.

name: Profaned Core
description: The Profaned Core is a post-Moon Lord item used to summon Providence, the Profaned Goddess in the Underworld or Hallow. It is dropped by the Profaned Guardians. Attempting to use the item outside of the Hallow or Underworld biomes, while Providence is alive, or using it in a world that has no bosses defeated will cause it to do nothing. Using the item during nighttime will summon a different, stronger Providence. This item is one of the two boss summoning items that are neither crafted nor bough

name: Bladecrest Oathsword
description: The Bladecrest Oathsword is a Pre-Hardmode broadsword dropped by Demons and Voodoo Demons in The Underworld. When swung, it fires a scythe projectile that pierces once, emits a faint red light, and inflicts the On Fire! debuff on hit. Its best modifier is Legendary. This weapon was previously the only sword in the Calamity Mod to not have autoswing.

name: Empyrean armor
description: Empyrean armor is a craftable post-Moon Lord armor set crafted from Meld Constructs, as well as Luminite Bars. It serves as the Lunar-tier armor for the rogue class. It requires 52 Meld Constructs and 36 Luminite Bars to make the whole set. If all three pieces of the set are visible (whether equipped or in social slots), the player will have a pulsing aura and afterimages. Additionally, the armor's movement and item swinging animations will change to be more unique than each individual piece's a

name: Daedalus armor
description: Daedalus armor is a craftable Hardmode armor set, crafted from Essences of Eleum, Crystal Shards, and Cryonic Bars. It requires 6 Essences of Eleum, 26 Crystal Shards, and 33 Cryonic Bars to make the whole set or 10 Essences of Eleum, 50 Crystal Shards, and 65 Cryonic Bars for a set with all five headpieces. It consists of a Daedalus Breastplate and Daedalus Leggings as well as five different headpieces: the Daedalus Helm, Daedalus Headgear, Daedalus Hood, Daedalus Mask, and Daedalus Facemask. E

name: God Slayer armor
description: God Slayer armor is a post-Moon Lord armor set crafted from Cosmilite Bars and Ascendant Spirit Essence. It requires 55 Cosmilite Bars and 7 Ascendant Spirit Essence to make a set utilizing one headpiece, which requires defeating The Devourer of Gods at least two times. If the Chestplate, Leggings, and any of the three headpieces of the set are visible (whether equipped or in social slots), the player will have afterimages. It consists of the God Slayer Chestplate and God Slayer Leggings, as wel

name: Tarragon armor
description: Tarragon armor is a post-Moon Lord armor set crafted from Uelibloom Bars and Divine Geodes. It requires 33 Uelibloom Bars and 36 Divine Geodes to make a set utilizing one headpiece; it requires 61 Uelibloom Bars and 60 Divine Geodes to make a set including all of the headpieces. If creating a set utilizing only one headpiece, Providence, the Profaned Goddess is required to be defeated at least thrice (twice in Expert Mode) in order to obtain the sufficient amount of Divine Geodes needed to craft

name: Hydrothermic armor
description: Hydrothermic armor is a craftable Hardmode armor set, crafted from Cores of Chaos, Hellstone Bars, and Scoria Bars. It requires 6 Cores of Chaos, 17 Hellstone Bars, and 32 Scoria Bars to make the whole set or 10 Cores of Chaos, 33 Hellstone Bars, and 60 Scoria Bars for a set with all five headpieces. A full set consists of an Hydrothermic Armor and an Hydrothermic Subligar as well as five different headpieces: The Hydrothermic Mask, Hydrothermic Helmet, Hydrothermic Helm, Hydrothermic Headgear a

name: Reaver armor
description: Reaver armor is a craftable Hardmode armor set, crafted from Essences of Sunlight, Jungle Spores, and Perennial Bars. It requires 6 Essences of Sunlight, 26 Jungle Spores, and 31 Perennial Bars to make the whole set or 8 Essences of Sunlight, 34 Jungle Spores, and 43 Perennial Bars for a set with all three headpieces. It consists of a Reaver Scale Mail and Reaver Cuisses as well as three different headpieces: The Reaver Visage, Reaver Helm and Reaver Headgear. None of the helmets provide a boost

name: Abyssal Warhammer
description: The Abyssal Warhammer is a craftable Hardmode hammer. Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes. Despite being called the “Abyssal” Warhammer, it has no direct relation to the Abyss. The Abyssal Warhammer has the slowest tool speed of any hammer in either vanilla or Calamity.

name: Aeries
description: Not to be confused with Aries, an enemy that spawns in the Astral Infection. The Aeries is a craftable Hardmode gun that autofires and is a direct upgrade to the Cursed Capper. When Musket Balls are used as ammo, it fires a light blue shockblast round that emits an aesthetic particle cloud on impact. It inflicts two hits of damage per bullet and returns life to the wielder equivalent to 5% of the damage dealt to the enemy. Its best modifier is Unreal. Its name and function are a reference to the

name: Providence, the Profaned Goddess
description: "The profaned flame blazes fiercely..." Providence, the Profaned Goddess is a post-Moon Lord boss fought in either The Hallow or The Underworld biomes. Defeating Providence will provide the player with Divine Geodes, as well as the Rune of Kos used to summon the Sentinels of the Devourer. Additionally, Uelibloom Ore will generate in the world, and Calamitas, the Brimstone Elemental, the Ravager and Brimstone Crag enemies will be buffed and start to drop Bloodstone. Providence does not spawn on h

name: Brimstone Elemental
description: "The most powerful of the elementals, bent on exacting revenge..." The Brimstone Elemental is a Hardmode boss fought in the Brimstone Crag biome. She cycles through three distinct behaviors, with varying levels of aggression and methods of attack. After Providence, the Profaned Goddess has been defeated, she becomes much stronger and begins dropping Bloodstone, which can be combined with Phantoplasm and Blood Orbs to make Bloodstone Cores. The Brimstone Elemental does not spawn on her own and re

name: Rune of Kos
description: The Rune of Kos is a craftable post-Moon Lord non-consumable summoning item that is also dropped by Providence, the Profaned Goddess. It is used to summon the Sentinels of the Devourer bosses at various locations in the world. Each location summons a different sentinel. When used in Space, it summons the Storm Weaver. When used in the Dungeon, it summons the Ceaseless Void. When used in The Underworld, it summons Signus, Envoy of the Devourer. The name of the item is a reference to the character

name: Gelpick
description: The Gelpick is a Pre-Hardmode pickaxe capable of mining Cobalt Ore and Palladium Ore. Sharing the same pickaxe power with the Molten Pickaxe, it is the fastest pickaxe available before Hardmode. Its best modifier is Legendary. While Light may seem to provide a better speed boost by percentages, rounding reveals that Legendary and Light mine at equal speeds for this tool. It is the only pure pickaxe tool with the word "pick" in its name that doesn't also have the word "axe" in its name.

name: Effulgent Feather
description: Effulgent Feathers are post-Moon Lord crafting materials that drop from Draconic Swarmers and The Dragonfolly.

name: Gelitic Blade
description: The Gelitic Blade is a craftable Pre-Hardmode broadsword. When swung, it releases a wide wave projectile with both it and the projectile emitting purple slime particles and inflicting the Slime debuff upon striking enemies. The projectile pierces once, passes through tiles, and slows down after hitting one enemy. It is possible for the projectile to hit the same enemy twice. Its best modifier is Legendary.

name: Armored Shell
description: Armored Shells are post-Moon Lord crafting materials that drop from the Storm Weaver. They can be used to craft the Cosmic Worm, which is used to summon The Devourer of Gods, along with several weapons and Prismatic armor set.

name: Twisting Nether
description: Twisting Nether is a post-Moon Lord crafting material that drops from Signus, Envoy of the Devourer. It can be used to craft the Cosmic Worm used to summon The Devourer of Gods, among various other items. This item's name is a reference to the Warcraft location of the same name, though it was specifically inspired by its Hearthstone card.

name: Dark Plasma
description: Dark Plasma is a post-Moon Lord crafting material that drops from the Ceaseless Void. It can be used to craft the Cosmic Worm used to summon The Devourer of Gods, along with several magic and rogue weapons.

name: Storm Weaver
description: Storm Weaver is a post-Moon Lord boss and is one of the Sentinels of the Devourer. It drops Armored Shells, which are a crafting material required to craft the Cosmic Worm. The Storm Weaver does not spawn on its own and requires the player to summon it with the Rune of Kos, causing it to rain. It must be summoned in the Space layer. It will begin to rain when summoned into battle, and much like other bosses who have a similar effect, it will not occur during the Boss Rush event. Storm Weaver has

name: Ceaseless Void
description: The Ceaseless Void is a post-Moon Lord boss and is one of the Sentinels of the Devourer. It drops Dark Plasma, which is a crafting material required to craft the Cosmic Worm. The Ceaseless Void does not spawn on its own and requires the player to summon it by using the Rune of Kos in the Dungeon. Upon being summoned, the Ceaseless Void is completely invincible to damage, and 11 Dark Energies are spawned in a 3-armed star formation centered on the boss. The Dark Energies will oscillate back and f

name: Profaned Guardians
description: "The ever-rejuvenating guardians of the profaned flame." The Profaned Guardians are a group of post-Moon Lord bosses fought in The Underworld or The Hallow. They need to be killed in order to obtain the Profaned Core, used to summon Providence, the Profaned Goddess, and each Guardian also drops a special respective "Relic" item. Multiple weaker Guardians are also summoned during the fight against Providence. The Profaned Guardians will not spawn on their own and must be summoned by using a Profa

name: The Dragonfolly
description: "A failure of twisted scientific ambition..." Not to be confused with Dragonflies, a type of critter. The Dragonfolly is a post-Moon Lord boss fought in the Jungle. It drops Effulgent Feathers, which are needed to craft the Jungle Dragon Egg, the item that summons Jungle Dragon, Yharon, as well as the Silva armor set. The Dragonfolly can be spawned by the player using Exotic Pheromones in the Jungle. The Dragonfolly is a very fast boss, often aligning itself vertically with the player to horizon

name: Bloody Worm Tooth
description: The Bloody Worm Tooth is a Pre-Hardmode, Expert Mode-exclusive accessory obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped by The Perforators. It grants 5% increased damage reduction, 5% increased melee damage, and 5% increased melee speed when equipped in an accessory slot. The bonuses are doubled when below 50% life. The damage reduction will stack with the damage reduction of the Worm Scarf. If the player lives in a Corruption world, defeating The Hive Mind for the first time will allow the Dryad to sel

name: Bloody Worm Scarf
description: The Bloody Worm Scarf is a craftable Hardmode, Expert Mode-exclusive accessory that provides a 10% increase to damage reduction and increases melee damage and speed by 10%. This accessory can be considered the Crimson counterpart to the Amalgamated Brain, even though they both can be crafted regardless of the world evil. If the player lives in a Crimson world, defeating the Brain of Cthulhu will make the Dryad sell the Worm Scarf. If the player lives in a Corruption world, defeating The Hive Min

name: Supreme Calamitas
description: Not to be confused with Calamitas, a Hardmode boss. "Do you enjoy going through hell?" Supreme Calamitas is a post-Moon Lord boss that can be fought anywhere and at any time of day. She is currently one of the most challenging enemies in the Calamity Mod and is notoriously difficult, especially on Revengeance Mode, Death Mode or Malice Mode. The player should be very well equipped both physically and mentally before taking her on. Supreme Calamitas does not spawn on her own and requires the play

name: Perforator Cyst
description: The Perforator Cyst is a rare Pre-Hardmode stationary enemy that spawns in The Crimson biome. When killed, it will summon The Perforators. The Perforator Cyst has abnormally high life for Pre-Hardmode, ensuring that early players won't accidentally summon the boss. The Perforator Cyst can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer and its upgrades. The Perforators will spawn directly where the Perforator Cyst was after killing it, which means that unprepared players might be taken by surprise. Despite

name: Hive Cyst
description: The Hive Cyst is a rare Pre-Hardmode stationary enemy that spawns in The Corruption biome. When killed, it will summon The Hive Mind. The Hive Cyst has abnormally high life for Pre-Hardmode, ensuring that early players won't accidentally summon the boss. The Hive Cyst can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer and its upgrades. The Hive Mind will spawn directly where the Hive Cyst was after killing it, which means that unprepared players might be taken by surprise. Despite being classified as an e

name: Bars
description: Bars are crafting materials generally crafted from mined ores at a Furnace. Crafting most ore-related items requires that raw ores are first crafted into bars. The Calamity Mod currently adds 11 different bar types. Obtaining many of these only requires their respective ores as crafting ingredients. Astral, Auric Tesla, and Victide Bars are exceptions that require secondary materials in addition. Cosmilite Bars are not crafted but are instead dropped by The Devourer of Gods respectively. Some ba

name: Storm Spray
description: The Storm Spray is a Pre-Hardmode wand obtained from the Desert Scourge. When used, it fires an arc of water particles that damage enemies. From points across the arc, extra trails of water fire downward which damage enemies as well. Its best modifier is Mythical. The Storm Spray is very similar to the Aqua Scepter, the main differences being the Storm Spray's dripping trails effect and that it can be obtained before fighting Skeletron.

name: Blood Bath
description: The Blood Bath is a craftable Pre-Hardmode wand that is also dropped by The Perforators. When used, it causes large red droplets to drop from the sky at a fast pace. It is the Crimson counterpart to the Shadowdrop Staff. Its best modifier is Mythical. The projectiles will dissipate after striking any tile, so it can be difficult to use it underground. If the player has the "Blood and Gore" Setting turned off, its projectile trail will look like clouds instead of blood.

name: Elysian Arrow
description: Elysian Arrows are post-Moon Lord arrows that are crafted with 150 Holy Arrows and an Unholy Essence. Upon hitting an enemy or a tile, Elysian meteors swarm the area of impact, dealing 50% of the used weapon's damage to any enemy they hit. All damage is halved before being applied to the target.

name: Vanquisher Arrow
description: Vanquisher Arrows are craftable post-Moon Lord arrows that are made from Cosmilite Bars. Fired Vanquisher Arrows pierce through tiles and fade after 1.5 seconds, spawning a homing arrow clone after 0.75 seconds. The arrow clone behaves similarly to the main one but does not pierce through tiles. The main arrow will strike an enemy twice if they are struck at the end of the arrow's lifespan. Both arrows inflict the God Slayer Inferno debuff on enemy hits. Cloned Vanquisher Arrows deal typeless da

name: Forbidden Oathblade
description: The Forbidden Oathblade is a craftable Hardmode broadsword that autoswings and is the upgrade of both the Bladecrest Oathsword and the Old Lord Oathsword. When swung, it fires a demonic scythe that collides with terrain and pierces up to two targets. Both the sword and the fired projectiles inflict the On Fire! and Shadowflame debuffs. Critical hits additionally summon purple explosions on the target. Its best modifier is Legendary. The explosion generated by critical hits deals exactly 200% of

name: Seraph Tracers
description: The Seraph Tracers are a post-Moon Lord accessory that combines the effects of the Angel Treads with Wings, negating the need to have a set of wings equipped. Along with the effects of Angel Treads, wearing these boots alone allows the player to reach up to 47 mph while running. Despite being a direct upgrade to the Angel Treads, Seraph Tracers do not inherit the Rocket Boots nor Harpy Ring. Despite the recipe requiring 'Any Wings', certain wings will not count for the recipe. These wings are Je

name: Necklace of Vexation
description: The Necklace of Vexation is a craftable Hardmode accessory that increases damage by 20% when the player has under 50% life. While wearing Reaver armor with any headpiece, all attacks will inflict the Cursed Inferno and Venom debuffs onto enemies for two seconds. Vexation is the state of being annoyed, frustrated, or worried.

name: Badge of Bravery
description: The Badge of Bravery is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory which increases melee speed by 15%, melee damage and critical strike chance by 5%, and armor penetration by 5.

name: Yharim's Insignia
description: The Yharim's Insignia is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory that grants the player the following effects: 10% increased damage when under 50% life 10% increased melee damage and speed 10% additionally increased true melee damage Melee attacks inflict the Holy Flames debuff Temporary immunity to lava Increased melee knockback There is a 25% chance for Holy Flames to be inflicted for 6 seconds, a 37.5% chance to be inflicted for 4 seconds, and a 37.5% chance to be inflicted for 2 seconds.

name: Grax
description: The Grax is a craftable post-Moon Lord hamaxe that has a range five tiles larger than most other tools, and is the final upgrade of the Silver Axe or Tungsten Axe.
