description: The Banshee Hook is a post-Moon Lord spear dropped by Polterghast. It is swung in front of the player at an odd angle, similarly to the Ghastly Glaive, and releases a line of five projectiles at once. Hitting an enemy directly with the weapon causes a ghostly explosion, dealing rapid damage. Its projectiles go through blocks, ignore immunity frames, pierce infinitely, and will slow to a stop some distance away if uninterrupted. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size

name: Daemon's Flame
description: The Daemon's Flame is a post-Moon Lord bow dropped by Polterghast. It fires arrows as well as a Daemon flame, which moves in an up and down squiggly pattern, moves through blocks and explodes after a certain amount of time. Holding left-click continuously will cause the shot speed to increase. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Ethereal Subjugator
description: The Ethereal Subjugator is a post-Moon Lord summon weapon that is dropped by Polterghast. It summons a Phantom, which follows the player and attacks enemies. It deals damage via a laser beam which has a short range. Unlike most minions, the Phantom only takes up half a minion slot. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critica

name: Fate's Reveal
description: The Fate's Reveal is a post-Moon Lord wand dropped by Polterghast. It creates ghostly fire around the cursor that follows the player and explodes if it comes into contact with enemies. The fire explodes after a few seconds. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Ghastly Visage
description: The Ghastly Visage is a post-Moon Lord magic weapon that is dropped by Polterghast. When used, it releases homing ghast energy that travels through blocks and can pierce enemies twice before impacting on the third hit. The ghast energy explodes into smaller energy bolts after about 9 seconds or upon impacting an enemy. These energy bolts can be blue in color, in which they will be affected by gravity, or red in color, in which they will not be affected by gravity and will explode into gravity-af

name: Ghoulish Gouger
description: The Ghoulish Gouger is a post-Moon Lord rogue boomerang dropped by Polterghast. It rapidly throws a scythe that goes through blocks. The scythe moves extremely quickly and ignores NPC immunity frames, allowing it to rack up enormous damage against large targets. Performing a stealth strike with the Ghoulish Gouger will cause a wave of homing souls to release on enemy hits. Only one wave of souls can be active at once. Its best modifier is Flawless.

name: Terror Blade
description: The Terror Blade is a post-Moon Lord broadsword that is dropped by Polterghast. On every swing, it fires a red terror beam that can bounce off tiles or pierce enemies a total of six times before exploding on the seventh impact. Large explosions will occur, on varying delays, at the locations that the beam bounced off of. An explosion also occurs at the first enemy the terror beam pierces. Each explosion deals 30% of the weapon's damage and can deal damage multiple times. Its best modifier is Leg

name: Affliction
description: Affliction is an post-Moon Lord, Expert Mode-exclusive accessory that provides a variety of stat boosts. It is obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped by Polterghast. A player with Affliction equipped will provide all their teammates with the Afflicted buff, which provides all the bonuses of having the accessory equipped. Affliction (and the Afflicted buff) provides the following bonuses: +1 life regeneration +7% damage reduction +10 defense +10% increased damage +10% maximum health Its behavior

name: Phangasm
description: The Phangasm is a craftable post-Moon Lord bow and a direct upgrade to the Phantasm. It shoots volleys of 5 arrows at an initially low rate of fire that increases as it is used continuously. When its arrows hit an enemy, Phangasm spawns an additional barrage of phantasm arrows that home in on that enemy. It can later be used to craft the Contagion. Its best modifier is Unreal. Due to the high amount of projectiles shot when using Vanquisher Arrows, firing them with this weapon can cause severe F

name: Astral Blade
description: The Astral Blade is a craftable Hardmode broadsword that auto-swings. It has a considerable swing speed and has a much higher base critical strike chance than average. The weapon's damage, knockback, and critical strike chance is boosted by the remaining percentage of target's health. If the target's life is above 50% then a solely visual explosion of dust is formed. Its best modifier is Legendary. This weapon only benefits from 25% of melee swing speed bonuses.

name: Needler
description: The Needler is a Hardmode gun. If Musket Balls are used as ammo, bullets are converted into needles that stick to enemies and tiles which explode after a delay. It has a 4% (1/25) chance to be dropped by Moss Hornets. Its best modifier is Unreal. This weapon's name and mechanics may be a reference to a weapon of the same name from the Halo series.

name: Astral Pike
description: The Astral Pike is a craftable Hardmode spear. It emits dust when swung, which produces light. Upon critically hitting a target, three astral stars move in a diagonal pattern towards the player, homing into nearby enemies, and dealing 40% of the spear's damage. The stars can move and home through tiles. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size.

name: Astral Bow
description: The Astral Bow is a craftable Hardmode bow. It shoots out 3 arrows one after another in quick bursts. Arrows travel at a moderate velocity. Each arrow has a use time of 5. Its best modifier is Unreal. This weapon was previously a repeater, and its previous name was "Astral Repeater".

name: Astral Staff
description: Not to be confused with Astralachnea Staff, a wand dropped by Astralachnea. The Astral Staff is a craftable Hardmode wand. On use, it summons a large crystal that falls from the sky on the cursor's location. This crystal has a large area of effect when hitting the ground and is capable of piercing through enemies and platforms. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Astral Pickaxe
description: The Astral Pickaxe is a craftable Hardmode pickaxe capable of mining blocks up to Lihzahrd Brick and Scoria Ore. It has a range bonus of 3 tiles and has a higher than average critical strike chance. It releases light emitting particles when swung, and inflicts the Astral Infection debuff onto enemies upon contact. Its best modifier is Legendary. While Light may seem to provide a better speed boost by percentages, rounding reveals that Legendary and Light mine at equal speeds for this tool. The A

name: Astral Hamaxe
description: The Astral Hamaxe is a craftable Hardmode Hamaxe. Despite being available pre-Moon Lord, it has greater hammer power than the Lunar Hamaxes, but falls one block short of their range. It emits faint purple particles when swung. Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.

name: Astral armor
description: Astral armor is a Hardmode armor set crafted from Astral Bars and Meteorite Bars. It requires 30 Astral Bars and 23 Meteorite Bars to craft the entire set. Astral armor is unique because it permanently grants the effects of Dangersense, Hunter, and Spelunker Potions while it is equipped, allowing its wearer to see all nearby creatures, treasure, ores, and traps. If all three pieces of Astral armor are visible (whether equipped or in vanity slots), the player will have afterimages following them.

name: Magnetic Meltdown
description: The Magnetic Meltdown is a craftable post-Moon Lord wand. It fires 4 purple orbs which go through blocks; the orbs travel a short distance and stay in the air for a couple of seconds, continuously shooting enemies around them with shadowbolts. The orbs act similarly to the orbs fired by the Magnet Sphere with higher damage and a larger range; thus, the Magnetic Meltdown can be considered a direct upgrade of the Magnet Sphere. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Terra Arrow
description: Terra Arrows are craftable Hardmode arrows that are made with one Living Shard and 250 Wooden Arrows. They accelerate while airborne, exploding upon reaching a certain velocity or collision. After exploding, Terra Arrows split into two short-lasting homing arrows which deal 25% of the base arrow's damage. Their effect mirrors that of Terra Bullets. It takes roughly fifty blocks for Terra Arrows to accelerate enough to explode. When used with Daedalus Stormbow, they will only explode upon collisi

name: Spyker
description: The Spyker is a craftable post-Moon Lord gun and a direct upgrade to the Needler. Musket Balls are converted into spikes which stick to enemies and tiles and explode into more spikes, which also have a delayed explosion. The high amount of projectiles the Spyker fires makes it very effective as a crowd-controlling weapon. Its best modifier is Unreal. Despite having the Stynger in its recipe (which uses special Stynger Bolts as ammo), the Spyker uses standard bullets as ammo.

name: Portabulb
description: The Portabulb is a craftable item used to summon Plantera in the Underground Jungle. Due to only requiring early-Hardmode materials to craft, this item can be used to fight Plantera earlier than normal. This is intentional, to give players more freedom as to how they progress through their playthrough. Its name is a portmanteau of the words "portable" and "bulb", which are also the words that made up the item's previous name. Internally, this item is referred to as "Bulb of Doom".

name: Avalanche
description: The Avalanche is a Hardmode melee weapon that is dropped by Cryogen. When the weapon strikes an enemy, it creates ice bombs around the player that travel in either the cardinal or ordinal directions. Each bomb explodes into four gravity affected ice shards on enemy hits or after 3 seconds. Each ice shards deal 50% of the weapon's damage. Its best modifier is Legendary. Despite appearing to be an axe, the Avalanche cannot be used to cut down trees. This weapon was previously known as the "Permafr

name: Amalgamated Brain
description: The Amalgamated Brain is a craftable Hardmode accessory exclusive to Expert Mode. It grants an increase to all damage types, causes shade to rain down when invincibility frames are active, and has a chance to inflict Confused on nearby enemies when the player is hit. The chance to inflict Confused and its duration both scale with the damage the player took. This accessory can be considered the Corruption counterpart to the Bloody Worm Scarf, even though they both can be crafted regardless of the

name: Zerg Potion
description: The Zerg Potion is a craftable Pre-Hardmode buff potion. It grants the Zerg buff, which boosts all spawn rates and maximum spawn count by 400%. It is also used in the crafting of the Chaos Candle. This potion is the opposite of the Zen Potion, which drastically decreases spawn rates. Having the Bloodflare armor equipped alongside this buff during a post-Moon Lord Blood Moon is a great way to get Blood Orbs fast. Make sure you use this in a place where you know you can survive as enemies can quic

name: Butcher (weapon)
description: For the enemy that spawns during the Solar Eclipse, see here. The Butcher is a craftable Hardmode gun that shoots slowly and inaccurately at first, but increases fire rate and accuracy over time while firing, capping at 600% of its original fire rate. Its best modifier is Unreal. It takes about 30 seconds of continuous firing in order to reach maximum speed and accuracy. Its model, name, and effects are similar to a weapon in the action first-person shooter game, Borderlands 2.

name: Raider's Talisman
description: The Raider's Talisman is a Pre-Hardmode rogue accessory. It is craftable as soon as the player is able to obtain Obsidian. Every time the player lands a critical strike with a rogue weapon, the player's rogue damage increases by 0.1%. The damage bonus stacks up to 150 times at a cap of 15%. If the player un-equips the accessory then re-equips it, the bonus is not reset. If the player dies or quits the game, the bonus is lost and has to be rebuilt. Damage can only be stacked from hitting enemies

name: The Community
description: The Community is a Hardmode Legendary accessory exclusive to Malice Mode. It has a 100% chance to be dropped from Leviathan and Anahita. When equipped it boosts the player's flight time by 15%, reduces damage received from Damage over Time (DoT) effects, and grants the player boosts to several stats that scale as the player progresses through the game by killing more bosses. Note that the life regen bonuses listed below only apply if the player currently has negative life regen, meaning they're

name: Soul Harvester
description: The Soul Harvester is a craftable Hardmode melee weapon. It works similarly to the Death Sickle, as it shoots out spinning, flaming plague scythes, which stop after a certain time and spin in place, inflicting the Plague and On Fire! debuffs to enemies. This projectile can pierce through multiple enemies, goes through blocks and gives off light, making it useful in caves. Enemies below 15% health hit by main swing itself will take an additional hit resulting from a dust explosion. The sickle add

name: Fabsol's Vodka
description: Fabsol's Vodka is a craftable Hardmode potion that is also sold by the Drunk Princess NPC. It grants the Fab debuff when consumed, which gives a +8% boost to all damage but lowers defense by 20 in exchange. While affected by the buff, the player receives 10 extra immunity frames when struck for more than one damage and 5 when struck for one damage. This effect is not boosted by the Cross Necklace or its upgrades but will stack with the extra immunity frames of the Deific Amulet or Rampart of Dei

name: Aquatic Discharge
description: The Aquatic Discharge is a Pre-Hardmode shortsword that is dropped by the Desert Scourge. When swung, it emits harmless particles of electricity. Upon killing an enemy with it, it will release small electric sparks which linger on the ground for a short time, dealing damage to enemies that touch them. Like every shortsword, it has an incredibly short range, but unlike most other vanilla shortswords, it has autoswing. Its best modifier is Legendary.

name: Seabow
description: The Seabow is a craftable Pre-Hardmode bow that auto-fires, with an additional short-ranged water blast every fire. The water blast's velocity varies with the velocity of arrow type. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Claret Cannon
description: The Claret Cannon is a craftable post-Moon Lord gun that shoots bullets in bursts of 3. If Musket Balls are used as ammo, bullets are converted into bloody tears that have a 50% chance to heal the player for 1 HP on a successful hit, making it a good weapon to heal health quickly with against hordes of enemies or large bosses. Each bullet has a use time of 3. Its best modifier is Unreal. However, Rapid may be preferred for faster healing. The word "claret" can refer to a color of deep red or a v

name: MOAB
description: The MOAB is a craftable Hardmode accessory which grants a variety of abilities related to vertical movement. It allows the player to quadruple jump and, after the jumps are expended, fly for 1.25 seconds. It also negates fall damage, boosts jump speed and height, and allows auto-jump when worn. It is considered to be a wing accessory due to its flight capability. While the MOAB is an upgrade of Bundle of Balloons, the jump height alone is worse, but also includes additional flight time. This acc

name: Solstice Claymore
description: The Solstice Claymore is a craftable post-Moon Lord broadsword that shoots a different colored sword based on the real-time season. It inflicts the Daybroken debuff during the day, causing targets to lose 100 health every second, and the Nightwither debuff during the night, causing targets to lose 100 health every second. Its best modifier is Legendary.

name: Sanguine Flare
description: The Sanguine Flare is a craftable post-Moon Lord wand. When used, it fires a random spread of 6 to 8 red orbs, which begin waving erratically after 3 seconds of travel. The orbs can pass through blocks and, upon contact with enemies, inflict the Brimstone Flames debuff onto them and each return 1 HP to the player. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Shroomite Visage
description: The Shroomite Visage is a Hardmode helmet armor piece, crafted with 12 Shroomite Bars at a Hardmode Anvil. It grants 11 defense as well as 25% increased ranged damage for flamethrowers. When equipped with the Shroomite Breastplate and Shroomite Leggings, the full set grants 51 armor, 38% increased ranged damage for flamethrowers, 13% ranged damage for all non-flamethrower ranged weapons, 13% increased ranged critical strike chance, 12% increased movement speed, and 20% chance not to consume ammo

name: Stasis Probe
description: Stasis Probes were post-Moon Lord boss servant enemies that spawned during the Storm Weaver boss fight. They behaved similarly to the Probes spawned by The Destroyer but they moved much faster and had a higher rate of fire. Up to 3 of each Stasis Probe variant could spawn at a time. The Stasis Probes made the Storm Weaver boss fight harder, so it was wise to destroy them first. The naked variant of the Stasis Probe moved faster than the regular variant. However, it had much less defense than the

name: Soul Seeker
description: Not to be confused with Soul Slurper, a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Brimstone Crag. Soul Seekers are Hardmode and post-Moon Lord boss servant enemies that are spawned during Calamitas and the Supreme Calamitas boss fights. Both variants circle their respective boss, attacking by firing Brimstone Dart projectiles. The normal Soul Seekers stay close to the Calamitas, acting as a shield to protect her while also providing additional firepower. The Supreme Soul Seekers surround Supreme Cal

name: Plaguebringer
description: Not to be confused with The Plaguebringer Goliath, a related boss. The Plaguebringer is a powerful Hardmode mini boss that spawns uncommonly in the Jungle after the Golem has been defeated. Behaving similarly to Queen Bee, it alternates between charging at the player horizontally and hovering above them while firing projectiles and spawning Plague Chargers. When firing projectiles, it has a 6.66% chance to fire a plague rocket instead of an exploding stinger. It can often take unsuspecting playe

name: Cosmic Guardian
description: The Cosmic Guardian is a post-Moon Lord boss servant enemy that is spawned during the fight with The Devourer of Gods. In Revengeance Mode, it spawns when the Devourer of Gods reaches 60% health, and an additional two appear at 20% health. Another three will spawn in the Devourer of Gods' final phase at 30% health in all difficulties. It will fly up high and despawn once the Devourer of Gods is defeated in its first phase. It can also be spawned by the Chibii Devourer pet. Unlike the Devourer of

name: Angry Dog
description: The Angry Dog is a rare Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Snow biome. It charges and rams into the player at high speeds, although it is slow at turning around. When damaged to 50% / 90% health, it will curl up into a ball and roll towards the player with increased maneuverability. It also inflicts the Bleeding debuff on contact. It gets significantly stronger after Cryogen has been defeated, with boosts to its damage, maximum life, and defense.

name: Death
description: For the vanilla mechanic when a player's health reaches zero, see here. For the difficulty activated by this item, see here. Death is an item found within the Starter Bag that activates or disables Death Mode. Attempting to use it while not in Revengeance Mode or during a boss battle will have no effects. It can be crafted at an Altar and does not have any ingredients. This item was formerly used to activate an insta-death mode in which any damage would instantly kill the player. It is also the

name: Aquatic Dissolution
description: The Aquatic Dissolution is a craftable post-Moon Lord broadsword. It fires 3 aquatic spears from the sky, which bounce off tiles twice, disappearing on the third. The projectiles can pass through tiles for a second after spawning. Its best modifier is Legendary.

name: Anti-materiel Rifle
description: The Anti-materiel Rifle is a craftable post-Moon Lord gun. It fires a high-damage High Velocity Bullet, if Musket Balls are used as ammo. If the first bullet critically strikes an enemy, a second swarm of bullets will fly towards the enemy's position from the left side of the screen regardless if the enemy died or not. Holding right click will use its zoom ability, which scrolls the viewing area of the screen in the direction of the cursor in a fashion similar to the Sniper Rifle. Bullets other

name: Photoviscerator
description: The Photoviscerator is a craftable post-Moon Lord flamethrower that uses gel as ammunition. When used with its primary fire (left-click), it rapidly fires five sets of a semi-accurate stream of two purple, green, and rarely yellow exo flames that travel very far, pierce infinitely and ignore enemy immunity frames. Two explosive exo light bombs are also fired at a 12.5% chance per set that travel to, and circle around the player’s cursor and deal damage. Exo light bombs will explode on contact wi

name: Voltaic Climax
description: The Voltaic Climax is a craftable post-Moon Lord wand. Upon use, it summons a circular spread of 8 tile-ignoring magnetic orbs around the cursor. The summoned orbs rapidly fire electric beams at up to two nearby enemies. The orbs cannot target enemies through blocks. Its best modifier is Mythical. The Voltaic Climax has great potential against bosses, as the sheer size of bosses can allow all eight orbs to fire upon them at once.

name: Nebulash
description: The Nebulash is a Hardmode flail dropped by Astrum Aureus. It fires a swinging whip-like projectile that deals damage to enemies it comes in contact with, similar to the Solar Eruption. On enemy hits it causes a short lasting dust that deals an additional 50% damage. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size.

name: Starfall
description: The Starfall is a Hardmode spell tome dropped by Astrum Deus. When used, it summons 5 purple stars from the cursor's location, which travel in a downward spread at a high velocity. The stars do not pierce, but they can go through blocks. Its best modifier is Mythical. Its name and effects could make it a reference to a weapon with the same name from the Exxo Avalon mod.

name: Hematemesis
description: The Hematemesis is a Hardmode wand dropped by the Ravager. It fires 10 wall-piercing bolts that move upwards at a high speed near the player's mouse cursor. These bolts appear off-screen and do not pierce enemies. Its best modifier is Mythical. The word "Hematemesis" means someone vomiting their blood. If the player has the "Blood and Gore" setting turned off, the projectiles will look like clouds instead of blood.

name: Flesh Totem
description: The Flesh Totem is a Hardmode accessory that drops from the Ravager. When equipped, it halves enemy contact damage. It has a 20 seconds cooldown after taking a hit.

name: Blood Pact
description: The Blood Pact is a Hardmode accessory that drops from the Ravager. It doubles the player's max health when equipped, but allows enemies and projectiles to land critical hits at a 25% chance, which deal 2.25 times the normal damage. After being critically hit, the player gains the Bloody Boost buff, which grants 5% damage, 20 defense, 10% damage reduction, increased immunity frames (identical to the Cross Necklace), increased life regeneration (identical to the Crimson armor), and increased heal

name: Perforator Mini
description: The Perforator Mini was a boss servant enemy that was spawned exclusively by The Perforators, but has since been removed from the mod. It behaved identically to the Giant Worm, but it could also inflict the Burning Blood and Bleeding debuffs.

name: Heart of Darkness
description: Not to be confused with Dark Heart, an enemy summoned by The Hive Mind. The Heart of Darkness is a Revengeance Mode-exclusive Pre-Hardmode accessory that fills up the Rage Meter by 1% of the total meter every second. It also prevents the Rage Meter from emptying out of combat. Any Boss Treasure Bag in Revengeance Mode has a 1.67% chance of containing this accessory. All boss bags have a 5% chance of containing any of the three universal Revengeance accessories, the other two being Stress Pills a

name: Chests
description: Chests are furniture used to store items. The Calamity Mod currently adds sixteen types of chests to the game that each correspond to their specific set of furniture, with the exceptions being the Astral Chest, which naturally spawns in the Dungeon and corresponds to the Astral Infection, the Rusty Chest, which naturally spawns in the Sulphurous Sea, and the Security Chest, which naturally spawns in underground Arsenal Labs. All Calamity Chests have a tile value of 500.

name: Phantom Turret
description: Phantom Turrets were post-Moon Lord boss servant enemies that used to spawn during the Polterghast boss fight. Once spawned, Phantom Turrets would attempt to ram the player while shooting Phantom Bolts. The red variants would fire red Phantom Bolts and moved slightly faster than their blue counterparts.

name: Celestus
description: The Celestus is a craftable post-Moon Lord rogue boomerang. It rapidly throws high velocity scythes which can pierce through infinite enemies and pass through tiles. Each time the thrown scythe strikes a target, it emits a dozen double-edged phantom blades outward from the point of impact. The phantom blades deal 70% of the scythe's damage and can also pierce infinite enemies and pass through tiles, but cannot create even more blades by themselves. Performing a stealth strike with the Celestus c

name: Celestial Tracers
description: The Celestial Tracers are a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory that count as Wings, the upgrade of the Elysian Tracers, and the final upgrade of the Hermes Boots line. They provide 4 seconds of immunity to lava and the ability to walk on water. While equipped, the player gains very fast speed on land, ice, water and lava. If a player is hit with 200 or more damage, they receive 30 extra immunity frames. Wearing these boots boosts maximum movement speed and acceleration by 10%, allowing the playe

name: Core of the Blood God
description: The Core of the Blood God is a craftable post-Moon Lord, Expert Mode-exclusive accessory. It boosts the wearer's maximum health by 10%, causes Health Potions to heal 15% more HP, and provides an 8% increase to all damage and damage reduction. All received contact damage is halved from enemies; this effect has a 20 second cooldown. While it is crafted from the Blood Pact, it does not give enemies the ability to perform critical strikes on the player. In compensation, the player's maximum health i

name: Statis' Void Sash
description: If you were looking for another Statis-themed item, see Statis (disambiguation). The Statis' Void Sash is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory. It grants the ability to cling to and slide down vertical walls, quickly dash a base distance of 38 blocks by double-tapping the horizontal movement key, enables auto-jump by holding the ↷ Jump key. Additionally, the player is a granted a guaranteed dodge that can only occur every 90 seconds. When dashing, three Cosmic Scythes are released that home into

name: Princess Spirit in a Bottle
description: Princess Spirit in a Bottle is a post-Moon Lord Mount summoning item. It is obtained from The Devourer of Gods while the player is under the effect of Fabsol's Vodka. When used it summons a rideable Alicorn mount which can run and fly at extreme speeds. The Alicorn is capable of running at a speed of 107 mph while on the ground and can reach 61 mph while flying vertically. While on the ground, the Alicorn behaves similarly to the Unicorn summoned by the Blessed Apple. Like the Unicorn, it can ch

name: Suspicious Looking Jelly Bean
description: The Suspicious Looking Jelly Bean is a post-Moon Lord Mount summoning item that is dropped from Astrum Aureus after Moon Lord has been defeated. When used, it summons a Squishy Bean mount similar to the Slimy Saddle that can horizontally move at a speed of 40 mph and fall very fast with a terminal fall speed of 102 mph. However, it will not deal damage to enemies or bounce on them. Unlike the Slimy Saddle, this mount will negate fall damage. The mount's appearance is a reference to Pyukumuku, a

name: Draedon's Heart
description: Draedon's Heart is an Expert Mode-exclusive post-Moon Lord accessory that is obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped by the Exo Mechs. It reduces the amount of defense damage taken by the player, while also providing bonuses to defense and life regeneration while the player is standing still. While standing still, using an item prevents the defense and life regeneration buff. The accessory is a reference to an ability Senator Armstrong from Metal Gear Rising: Revengeance has where he can stand st

name: Spirit Glyph
description: The Spirit Glyph is a craftable Pre-Hardmode accessory. Whenever a minion hits an enemy, the player will gain one of these buffs: Spirit Power, Spirit Defense or Spirit Regen. Spirit Regen grants +2 life regen. Spirit Defense increases defense by 6 and damage reduction by 3%. Spirit Power increases minion damage by 10%. Although it is primarily a summoner accessory, the good defensive boosts from Spirit Defense and Spirit Regen make it a decent option for players of other classes if they are wil

name: Wulfrum Pickaxe
description: The Wulfrum Pickaxe is a craftable Pre-Hardmode pickaxe. It can mine blocks up to Gold Ore / Platinum Ore. Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.

name: Aquatic Heart
description: The Aquatic Heart is a Pre-Hardmode accessory dropped by ???. Equipping it transforms the user into a water elemental and causes them to emit light. After Skeletron is defeated, they gain a wide variety of bonuses including: Improved underwater breathing ability The ability to move through water unhindered, and the Ocean's Blessing buff while submerged which boosts underwater movement speed even further. Nearby enemies are inflicted with the Glacial State debuff when the player is hurt; the dura

name: Heavenly Gale
description: The Heavenly Gale is a craftable post-Moon Lord bow. It fires two barrages of five arrows for a total of ten arrows per volley. When Wooden Arrows are used as ammo, they are converted into special exo arrows. Exo arrows randomly come in four variants that have different effects based on their color: Blue exo arrows summon three more arrows coming out of random directions towards the target when they're hit. The extra wave of arrows deal 70% damage. Green exo arrows form green tornadoes on contac

name: Levi
description: If you were looking for something other than the Levi pet, see Leviathan (disambiguation). Levi is a post-Moon Lord, Death Mode-exclusive pet summoning item dropped by Supreme Calamitas that summons a miniature Leviathan that follows the player. This item is a reference to the YouTuber Leviathan, known for his trailers, challenges, and documentation about the Calamity Mod. He was also the first person to defeat all bosses on Revengeance and Death Mode without taking damage. The Levi's buff toolt

name: Ancient Ice Chunk
description: For the enemy that drops this item, see here. The Ancient Ice Chunk is a Hardmode summon weapon that drops from Ice Claspers. It summons a flying Ice Clasper that follows the player. It deals damage by dashing through enemies and moving in an erratic pattern. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lastin

name: THE LORDE
description: THE LORDE was a post-Moon Lord joke superboss that is no longer available in the mod. It was to be considered one of, if not the most difficult boss in the Calamity Mod. It was summoned by using NO, which was dropped by BOHLDOHRs in the Jungle Temple after Supreme Calamitas had been defeated. Every single frame, its AI had a chance to change into another AI. All of the possible AIs it could change into were vanilla AIs. This also meant that it could potentially spawn other enemies, like boss min

name: Supreme Bait Tackle Box Fishing Station
description: The Supreme Bait Tackle Box Fishing Station is a craftable Hardmode accessory. When equipped, it increases the player's fishing skill by 80, gives permanent Sonar Potion effects as well as the effects of Angler Tackle Bag, and increases the chance to catch crates by 10%. Due to the combination of permanent potion effects and the sizable fishing power boost, this accessory is an extremely powerful fishing accessory which should be prioritized as soon as possible if one plans to use the Fishing me

name: Purified Jam
description: Not to be confused with Purified Gel, a crafting material dropped by The Slime God. "Invincible" redirects here. For the period of invincibility after getting hit, see immunity frames. Purified Jams are Pre-Hardmode buff potions dropped by The Slime God. It grants the user the Invincible buff when consumed, which grants them full invincibility to all damage and most debuffs for a short amount of time, but also inflicts the Potion Sickness debuff for 30 seconds. A character AND a world will only

name: Disseminator
description: The Disseminator is a craftable post-Moon Lord gun and a direct upgrade to the Conclave Crossfire. It fires three shotgun blasts; one is fired from the gun, the second is fired at the cursor from above, and the third is fired at the cursor from below. Unlike the Conclave Crossfire, the extra bullets can pass through tiles. Its best modifier is Unreal. The weapon is a reference to the Interfacer weapon from Borderlands 2, and is even referred to as such in the mod's code. However, the firing patt

name: Seadragon
description: The Seadragon is a craftable post-Moon Lord gun that is an upgrade to the Megalodon. It fires bullets with a quick rate of fire and has a chance to fire homing rockets that explode into fire shards. Its best modifier is Unreal. This weapon acts similar to the SDFMG.

name: Apotheosis
description: Apotheosis is a craftable Malice Mode-only post-Moon Lord developer spell tome. It summons a cosmic portal that released a mini Devourer of Gods that will swarm an enemy and fire lasers, before disappearing 5 seconds later. The Devourer of Gods inflicts several debuffs: God Slayer Inferno (10 seconds) Demon Flames (10 seconds) Armor Crunch (10 seconds) Exo Freeze (3.33% chance for 2 seconds) On enemies, these combined debuffs cause the target to lose 2750 health per second, have its defense redu

name: Aether's Whisper
description: The Aether's Whisper is a unique craftable post-Moon Lord magic gun and ranged weapon hybrid. It shoots a laser beam that splits into smaller beams that travel through blocks on tile contact and inflicts several debuffs to enemies. The beams additively increase their damage by 0.5% of the weapon's damage for every frame they exist. Right-clicking fires the same laser beam, but it deals ranged damage instead of magic and it does not consume mana. The projectiles can inflict 5 different debuffs: S

name: Mistlestorm
description: The Mistlestorm is a craftable post-Moon Lord wand and the direct upgrade of both the Razorpine and the Leaf Blower. It rapidly fires flurries of quick pine needles, which are slightly affected by gravity, and slower swarms of leaves, which are not affected by gravity. Its best modifier is Mythical. Unlike the Razorpine, the Mistlestorm cannot shoot through thin walls.

name: Molecular Manipulator
description: The Molecular Manipulator is a craftable post-Moon Lord ranged weapon. It is the upgrade to the Nullification Pistol. Each shot will alter its target in some way, as long as it is not a boss. The following effects can happen at an equal chance: Grow 400% bigger Shrink 90% smaller Deal 20 more contact damage Deal 20 less contact damage Become completely resistant to knockback Remove all knockback resistance Increase defense by 10 Decrease defense by 10 Increase velocity upwards Increase velocity

name: Cosmic Immaterializer
description: The Cosmic Immaterializer is a craftable post-Moon Lord summon weapon. It summons an entity of cosmic energy that fires homing energy bolts and exploding stars at enemies. It requires 10 minion slots to summon 1 energy, and only 1 energy can be active at once. When the energy bolts or exploding stars hit an enemy, they will inflict the following debuffs: Exo Freeze (0.5 seconds) Elemental Mix (2 seconds) Cursed Inferno (2 seconds) Frostburn (2 seconds) On Fire! (2 seconds) Ichor (2 seconds) On e

name: Music Boxes
description: The Calamity Mod currently adds 51 new Music Boxes into the game, should its music add-on be installed. The music add-on mod can be installed individually without the base Calamity Mod, and it will contain all of the music boxes and tracks, in case the player wishes to listen to Calamity music in-game without having the full mod installed. The music boxes will be unobtainable, however, requiring the use of cheats to acquire. Calamity music boxes cannot be activated with wires in multiplayer. The

name: Angery Flame
description: The Angery Flame was an invincible flying enemy summoned by Jungle Dragon, Yharon. It fired fireballs toward the player that increased in fire rate as Yharon's health decreased. It would also release homing flare dust as it flew around. It was originally Expert Mode-exclusive, and was pushed to Revengeance Mode-exclusive, then Death Mode-exclusive, before finally being removed. The Angery Flame was removed to put more of an emphasis on dodging Yharon rather than a slew of projectiles.

name: Mushroom Plasma Root
description: The Mushroom Plasma Root is a permanent power-up item obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped from Crabulon. It increases the Rage Mode duration by one second. There are 2 other items that function identically to this: the Infernal Blood and the Red Lightning Container. It can only be used once. The three items that increase the damage and damage reduction of Adrenaline Mode: the Electrolyte Gel Pack, the Starlight Fuel Cell, and the Ectoheart.

name: Infernal Blood
description: The Infernal Blood is a permanent power-up consumable item obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped from Ravager. It increases the Rage Mode duration by one second. There are 2 other items that function identically to this; the Mushroom Plasma Root and the Red Lightning Container. It can only be used once. The three items that increase the damage and damage reduction of Adrenaline Mode: the Electrolyte Gel Pack, the Starlight Fuel Cell, and the Ectoheart.

name: Red Lightning Container
description: The Red Lightning Container is a permanent power-up item obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped from The Dragonfolly. It increases the Rage Mode duration by one second. There are 2 other items that function identically to this: the Mushroom Plasma Root and the Infernal Blood. It can only be used once. The three items that increase the damage and damage reduction of Adrenaline Mode: the Electrolyte Gel Pack, the Starlight Fuel Cell, and the Ectoheart.

name: Electrolyte Gel Pack
description: The Electrolyte Gel Pack is a permanent power-up item obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped from The Slime God. It increases the damage of the Adrenaline Mode buff by +15% and increases how much damage reduction the player gains when hit while the meter is full by +5%. There are 2 other items that function identically to this: the Starlight Fuel Cell and the Ectoheart. It can only be used once. The three items that increase the duration of Rage Mode: the Mushroom Plasma Root, the Infernal Blood

name: Starlight Fuel Cell
description: The Starlight Fuel Cell is a permanent power-up item obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped from Astrum Aureus. It increases the damage of the Adrenaline Mode buff by +15% and increases how much damage reduction the player gains when hit while the meter is full by +5%. There are 2 other items that function identically to this: the Electrolyte Gel Pack and the Ectoheart. It can only be used once. The three items that increase the duration of Rage Mode: the Mushroom Plasma Root, the Infernal Blood

name: Ectoheart
description: The Ectoheart is a permanent power-up item obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped from Polterghast. It increases the damage of the Adrenaline Mode buff by +15% and increases how much damage reduction the player gains when hit while the meter is full by +5%. There are 2 other items that function identically to this: the Electrolyte Gel Pack and the Starlight Fuel Cell. It can only be used once. The three items that increase the duration of Rage Mode: the Mushroom Plasma Root, the Infernal Blood,

name: Fox Drive
description: The Fox Drive is a pet summoning item that summons a fox pet to follow the player. It is obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped by Jungle Dragon, Yharon in Revengeance Mode.

name: Lul
description: lul is an unobtainable accessory. If the player does not have the name 'Fabsol' or ‘Totalbiscuit’, the accessory will instantly kill them when equipped. This effect persists after respawning, so the player will need to remove the accessory during their spawning invincibility frames to survive. If the player is named 'Fabsol' or ‘Totalbiscuit’, they will take no damage whatsoever with this accessory equipped. However, Jungle Dragon, Yharon's border Infernadoes will still kill the player. Its spri

name: Zen Potion
description: The Zen Potion is a craftable Pre-Hardmode buff potion. It grants the Zen buff, which reduces enemy spawn rates by 60% and maximum spawn count by 70%. It is also used in the crafting of the Tranquility Candle. The Zen Potion is the exact opposite of the Zerg Potion, which greatly increases enemy spawn rate. The appearance of the Zen Potion is based off the Yin Yang, a traditional chinese symbol.

name: Brimrose
description: Not to be confused with Brimrose Staff, a Hardmode wand. The Brimrose is a post-Moon Lord Mount summoning item obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped from Brimstone Elemental after Providence has been defeated. When used, it summons a Brimrose Mount which acts similarly to the UFO summoned by the Cosmic Car Key, but is much faster and easier to control. The Brimrose is capable of moving at a speed of 62 mph horizontally and can reach 41 while moving vertically. Unlike the UFO, the Brimrose will

name: Sepulcher
description: The Sepulcher is a post-Moon Lord boss servant enemy that is spawned during the fight with Supreme Calamitas. It spawns twice during the fight: Once when the initial bullet hell ends, and later when Supreme Calamitas reaches 8% health, shortly after the final bullet hell. Ten Brimstone Hearts will spawn along with it, distributed mostly in the upper corners of Supreme Calamitas's arena. These hearts must be destroyed in order to kill the Sepulcher. The Sepulcher, notably, deals no contact damage

name: Sulphurous Sea
description: The Sulphurous Sea, also known as the Sulphur Sea, is a biome added by the Calamity Mod which spawns upon world creation. It replaces the Ocean on the Dungeon side, and is located on top of the Abyss. Its water is turquoise colored, and it contains a hole leading to the Abyss. It is primarily composed of Sulphurous Sand that makes up multiple islands that generate at sea level, where Acidwood Trees will grow when not covered by water. A series of caves composed of Sulphurous Sandstone and Harden

name: Laserfish
description: The Laserfish is an enemy that spawns in the 2nd and 3rd layers of the Abyss. It swims around when passive, but as soon as the player gets too near or hits it, it will swim in their direction and shoot lasers at them. If hit, it will not go passive again, even if the player is far from it. The Laserfish was inspired by Barreleye fish, specifically Pacific Barreleyes, which have transparent heads that contain large yellowish eyes.

name: Moray Eel
description: Not to be confused with Gulper Eel, an enemy that spawns in the lowest 2 levels of the Abyss. The Moray Eel is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Ocean and the 1st layer of the Abyss. It swims around when not aggressive, but as soon as the player gets too near or hits it, it will swim in their direction and attempt to attack them. If hit, it will not go passive again, even if the player is far from it. The Moray Eel's eyes glow in the Abyss, giving a clear indication as to where it is. Mora

name: Cuttlefish
description: The Cuttlefish is an enemy that spawns in the 1st, 2nd and 3rd layers of the Abyss. It stays invisible on the ground, waiting for the player to come near and attack them. Unlike most Abyss enemies, it does not become passive again even if the player didn't hit it. The behavior of the Cuttlefish shares many similarities with its real-life counterpart; both hide with camouflage in an attempt to sneak up on their prey.

name: Anechoic Coating
description: The Anechoic Coating is a craftable Pre-Hardmode buff potion that can also drop from Cuttlefish, Flounders, Frogfish, and Reaper Sharks. It grants the Anechoic Coating buff, which reduces the Abyss enemies' detection radius. This potion can only be crafted at an Alchemy Table.

name: Cloaking Gland
description: Cloaking Glands were a Pre-Hardmode crafting material dropped by several aquatic cloaking enemies. It was solely used to craft Anechoic Coating.

name: Archerfish
description: The Archerfish is a Pre-Hardmode gun obtained from Shadow Chests in the Abyss. If Musket Balls are used as ammo, bullets are replaced with a stream of water in a similar fashion to the Water Gun, albeit much faster and damage-dealing, and can pierce up to 2 enemies before dissipating upon hitting a third. The best modifiers would be Godly or Ruthless. Because of the weapon's autofire function, not all shots will damage the enemy when using a speed boosting modifier such as Unreal. This weapon ca

name: Ball O' Fugu
description: The Ball O' Fugu is a Pre-Hardmode flail obtained from Shadow Chests in the Abyss. It throws out a pufferfish, which behaves similarly to the Flairon, dispersing homing urchin spikes into its vicinity. Like the Flairon, it closely resembles a thrown flail. However, it functions more closely similar to items like Chain Knife and Golem Fist. It is not affected by gravity, does not remain deployed when holding the fire button, and cannot be swung around. Rather, holding the fire button causes it to

name: Black Anurian
description: The Black Anurian is a Pre-Hardmode magic weapon obtained from Shadow Chests in the Abyss. It shoots violet bubbles that travel in an upward arc, alongside two homing planktons which are fired in a random spread. All projectiles fired deal half damage instead of full. Its best modifier is Mythical. This weapon can also be obtained from the Abyssal Crate after either The Slime God or Wall of Flesh have been defeated. Its name is a reference to the biological order which frogs belong to, known as

name: Sulphurous Sand
description: Sulphurous Sand is a Pre-Hardmode block that composes most of the Sulphurous Sea biome, which spawns upon world generation. It will leak water over time and is used to craft Seafood and the Ballistic Poison Bomb at a Hardmode Anvil. It also can be obtained by opening Abyssal Crates, and is dropped by Aquatic Scourge. When underwater, bubbles are released that cannot harm the player until they reach maximum size. When they do, they deal 20 damage and inflict Venom for 2 seconds.

name: Seafood
description: Seafood is a craftable Hardmode item used to summon the Aquatic Scourge boss. It can only be used in the Sulphurous Sea. Upon being summoned, the Aquatic Scourge will not be hostile until attacked.

name: Herring Staff
description: The Herring Staff is a Pre-Hardmode summon weapon that is found in the Shadow Chests in the Abyss. It summons a Herring which charges at enemies in order to attack them. Unlike most minions, the Herring only takes up half a minion slot, allowing the player to summon twice as many Herrings as one-slot minions. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally,

name: Viperfish
description: The Viperfish is an enemy that spawns in the 1st, 2nd and 3rd layers of the Abyss. It will remain passive, swimming back and forth, until the player gets too close to it or attacks it. Once provoked, it will attack by charging at the player to deal contact damage. Like real Viperfish, they both are predators and live in the extreme depths of the ocean.

name: Giant Squid
description: Not to be confused with the Colossal Squid, a mini boss that spawns in third layer of the Abyss. The Giant Squid is an enemy that spawns in the 2nd and 3rd layers of the Abyss. It is initially passive, only becoming aggressive if the player attacks it or draws too close to it. Once hostile, it swims towards the player in short, frequent bursts, attempting to deal contact damage. Due to its height and vertical orientation, it can be a challenging enemy to maneuver around in the confined spaces of

name: Colossal Squid
description: Not to be confused with the Giant Squid, an enemy that spawns in the 2nd and 3rd layers of the Abyss. The Colossal Squid is a mini boss that spawns in the 3rd and 4th layers of the Abyss biome. Once the player gets too close or hits it, it attempts to kill the player by ramming them and firing damaging ink bombs, which burst into hovering ink clouds. It also has the ability to latch onto the player and "eat" them, inflicting the Obstructed debuff, greatly reducing visibility and inflicting rapid

name: Reaper Shark
description: The Reaper Shark is a mini boss that spawns in the 3rd and 4th layers of the Abyss. It is initially stealthed as it hunts for prey, growling to indicate its presence. If approached or attacked by the player, the Reaper Shark will roar and enter an enraged state. Once enraged, it attempts to hurt the player by swimming directly into them. At 50% HP, the Reaper Shark will briefly go invincible and roar, enraging further. It will then perform a series of faster, angled dash attacks, before resuming

name: Box Jellyfish
description: The Box Jellyfish is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Ocean and the 1st layer of the Abyss. It will remain passive until the player gets too close, it will then attempt to attack the player by swimming towards them. The Box Jellyfish acts similarly to its real-life counterpart; they both remain passive until they detect something nearby that may be edible.

name: Anechoic Plating
description: Anechoic Plating is a pre-hardmode accessory found in Shadow Chests in the Abyss. It reduces Abyss creatures' ability to detect you there, and also reduces the defense reduction from the Abyss to one third. This item can also be obtained from the Abyssal Crate after either The Slime God or Wall of Flesh have been defeated. When used in tandem with the Fathom Swarmer Breastplate, defense loss in the Abyss is reduced by 80%, rather than 73.6% that would naturally arise from equipping both. In real

name: Depth Cells
description: Depth Cells are a Hardmode crafting material dropped by enemies in the Abyss after Calamitas has been defeated. It is used in crafting many aquatic themed items, typically in conjunction with Lumenyl and Tenebris. The following table displays the chances and quantities that each enemy will drop Depth Cells after Calamitas has been defeated. Depth Cells may also be obtained from Abyssal Crates after Calamitas is defeated.

name: Depths Charm
description: The Depths Charm is an accessory found in Shadow Chests in the Abyss. It reduces the damage the player takes when out of breath in the Abyss by 30 damage per second. It also removes the bleed effect caused by the Abyss. It is part of the recipe for the Abyssal Diving Gear. Despite not being in the tooltip, it also reduces the damage the player takes from the Crush Depth debuff from 18 health per second to 9 health per second. This item can also be obtained from the Abyssal Crate after either The

name: Iron Boots
description: Not to be confused with Iron Greaves, a piece of Iron armor. Iron Boots are an accessory found in Shadow Chests in the Abyss. It allows the player to fall faster in liquids. It is part of the recipe for the Abyssal Diving Suit. This item can also be obtained from the Abyssal Crate after either The Slime God or Wall of Flesh have been defeated. The Iron Boots are a reference to the item of the same name from The Legend of Zelda series.

name: Lumenyl
description: Lumenyl is a Hardmode crafting material that grows on blocks or is dropped by the enemies in the Abyss after Calamitas has been defeated. It is used in crafting many aquatic items, typically in conjunction with Depth Cells and Tenebris. Similarly to Crystal Shards, they can also be placed on blocks and walls. The following table displays the chances and quantities that each enemy will drop Lumenyl after Calamitas has been defeated. Lumenyl may also be obtained from Abyssal Crates after Calamitas

name: Tenebris
description: Tenebris is a Hardmode block found naturally generated within the Abyss. After Calamitas has been defeated, it can also convert nearby Planty Mush into more Tenebris blocks. It requires at least a Pickaxe Axe or Drax to mine. It is used in crafting many aquatic items, typically in conjunction with Depth Cells and Lumenyl. Tenebris may also be obtained from Abyssal Crates after Calamitas has been defeated. In Latin, the word "tenebris" means "dark" or "darkness".

name: Frogfish
description: The Frogfish is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Ocean. It stays invisible on the sand, waiting for the player to come near or hit it to attack them. Just like their real-life counterparts, Frogfish camouflage into the ocean floor and wait for prey until they lunge and attack.

name: Bloatfish
description: The Bloatfish is an enemy that spawns in lowest layer of the Abyss. While it is not aggressive and will not chase the player to attack them, it can still slightly hurt them via its low contact damage. It serves primarily as a meat-shield for other enemies, as it absorbs projectiles and gets larger as it takes damage, potentially reaching 3 times its original size. The Bloatfish nullifies the piercing capabilities of any projectiles that come in contact with it, effectively absorbing them. Althou

name: Reaper Tooth Necklace
description: The Reaper Tooth Necklace is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory that is an upgrade to both the Sand Shark Tooth Necklace and the Avenger Emblem. While equipped, the player's armor penetration is increased by 15 and all damage is increased by 10%. This accessory is best used with weapons with a high attack speed, as they will get the best benefit from the armor penetration.

name: Flak Kraken
description: The Flak Kraken is a unique craftable Hardmode ranged weapon. It summons a yellow reticle at the cursor's location that deals constant damage to any enemy within it, piercing infinitely. Similarly to other weapons such as the Phantasm, the Flak Kraken will "spin up" the longer the fire button is held, increasing its damage per second and area of effect. Its best modifier is Demonic, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers that affect it. It takes 8.33 seconds of firing in

name: The Amalgam
description: The Amalgam is a craftable post-Moon Lord, Expert Mode-exclusive accessory. It increases damage by 15%, extends the duration of potion buffs by 100%, and causes potion buffs to remain active after dying. When invincibility is active (i.e. when the player is damaged, enters the world or uses the Magic Mirror), shade rains from the sky, dealing 300 typeless damage which can be affected by the average of all damage bonuses. Additionally, enemies in a 12.5-18.75 tile radius are inflicted with Brimst

name: Crown Jewel
description: This page is about the accessory. For the boss servant, see Crown Jewel (enemy). The Crown Jewel is a Pre-Hardmode accessory exclusive to Malice. It is dropped by King Slime. It boosts life regeneration by 2, even while the player is under the effects of a damaging debuff. When worn while being damaged by a debuff, the player's defense will increase by 10 and life regen will increase by an additional 4 (for a total of 5). If the player is under the effect of one of the alcohols sold by the Drunk

name: Eidolic Wail
description: The Eidolic Wail is a post-Moon Lord magic gun that drops from Eidolon Wyrms after Polterghast has been defeated. It fires three sound waves in quick succession that bounce off walls. The sound waves continuously grow in size and damage as they travel, but slow down as they grow larger. The sound waves ignore NPC immunity frames, dealing constant damage to any enemies they touch, and inflict the Crush Depth debuff. Its best modifier is Mythical. The sound waves are fired 17 ticks apart, with a 3

name: Undine's Retribution
description: Undine's Retribution is a craftable Hardmode wand. It summons several aqua javelins from the ground that home in on enemies and inflict the Crush Depth debuff. The spears can also go through blocks, and will disappear after a moderate time if no enemy is hit. If no enemies are nearby, the spears will instead home in on the player. Its best modifier is Mythical. The weapon is a reference to Undines, which are female spirits or nymphs that inhabit water. The sprites of the weapon and its projectil

name: Viruling
description: The Viruling is a Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Jungle surface during the day after Golem has been defeated. It hovers through the air towards the player, and inflicts the Plague debuff on contact. The Viruling cannot fire any projectiles, so any non-melee attacks are useful for killing it. It appears to be a Derpling afflicted with the plague, although its behavior has changed as a result. The Plague also seems to have made it much more machine-like.

name: Flounder
description: Not to be confused with the vanilla fish of the same name, which is obtained from fishing. The Flounder is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Sulphurous Sea. It initially stays invisible on the sand, waiting for the player to come near or hit it, in which it will then become visible and hostile. It attacks by slowly swimming towards the player while spraying sulphuric mist projectiles at them. In real life, flounders are a group of flatfish species. They are found at the bottom of oceans ar

name: Catfish (enemy)
description: Not to be confused with the Catfish quest fish. The Catfish is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Sulphurous Sea. It swims peacefully until the player comes near or hits it. It attacks by swimming towards the player in an attempt to hurt them.

name: Gnasher
description: The Gnasher is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Sulphurous Sea. It walks towards the player in an attempt to attack them and can spawn in both the sea and the beach. The Gnasher is likely based off of a snapping turtle, which both live in murky waters, though they aren't known for killing humans.

name: Mauler
description: The Mauler is a mini boss that spawns in the Sulphurous Sea at any point in the game. It swims peacefully until the player comes near or hits it. Once it detects the player, it swims extremely fast towards them while also shooting quick bursts of sulphuric mist. Occasionally, it releases a large ring of sulphuric bubbles and mist from itself, which is difficult to dodge unless the player is reasonably far away. If the Mauler is out of the water for too long it will explode, leaving no loot and p

name: Aquatic Urchin
description: The Aquatic Urchin is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Sulphurous Sea. It bounces very high towards the player in an attempt to hurt them, and can also bounce when out of the water. Sea Urchin

name: Sea Urchin
description: The Sea Urchin is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Ocean. It bounces high towards the player in an attempt to hurt them, and can also bounce when out of the water. Aquatic Urchin

name: Mantis Shrimp
description: The Mantis Shrimp is a Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Ocean biome. Similarly to Crabs they walk along the Ocean's floor in the player's general direction. When hitting the player, the Mantis Shrimp releases an explosion. The explosion deals no damage and is purely for visual effect. After Plantera has been defeated, they will occasionally drop the Mantis Claws, a claw-like melee weapon that mimics the Mantis Shrimp's main attack. With their extremely high melee damage, they can kill most char

name: Aquatic Parasite
description: The Aquatic Parasite is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Sulphurous Sea. It swims towards the player and can jump out of the water very high in an attempt to catch them. Its original sprite was intended to be a resprite of the Desert Medallion.

name: Aquatic Seeker
description: The Aquatic Seeker is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Sulphurous Sea biome. It is a horned fish that flies through the air towards the player, attempting to hurt them via contact damage and inflicting the Venom and Bleeding debuffs as it does so.

name: Aquatic Scourge
description: If you were looking for something other than the Aquatic Scourge, see Scourge (disambiguation). "A horror born of pollution and insatiable hunger..." The Aquatic Scourge is a boss that can be fought in the Sulphurous Sea biome at any point in the game, but is intended to be fought during Hardmode. Being the hydrated and mutated version of the Desert Scourge, it possesses similarities in its drops but significant differences in its behavior. The Aquatic Scourge spawns naturally, albeit rarely, in

name: Valediction
description: The Valediction is a post-Moon Lord rogue boomerang that drops from Reaper Sharks after Polterghast has been defeated. It continuously throws large homing reaper scythes that travel in high velocity, and can pass through tiles. Each reaper scythe can damage and pierce through unlimited enemies, but a thrown scythe will return soon after striking its intended target at least once. Performing a stealth strike with the Valediction causes three typhoons that deal half of the scythe's damage to appea

name: Calamari's Lament
description: Calamari's Lament is a post-Moon Lord summon weapon that drops from Colossal Squids after Polterghast has been defeated. It summons a baby squid that shoots ink at enemies and dashes towards them. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Calamari's Lament has over a Ruthless on

name: Ballistic Poison Bomb
description: The Ballistic Poison Bomb is a craftable Hardmode bomb. It throws bombs that are affected by gravity. Upon contact with an enemy, it explodes and launches several fragments that fly in random directions, while also creating a poison cloud similar to the one produced by the Toxic Flask. Collision with a tile will cause the bomb to stick onto the tile for a short period of time, after which, it launches the fragments. The shrapnel will stick to all tiles and enemies, and will explode after a short

name: Dreadmine Staff
description: The Dreadmine Staff is a craftable Hardmode sentry. It summons a stationary mine base that summons mines on nearby tiles which home in on enemies. When an enemy comes in contact with a mine, it will blow up. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Dreadmine Staff has over a Ru

name: Sunskater
description: The Sunskater is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in Space. It flies peacefully in one direction and turns around when it hits a block. Once attacked, it starts diving into the player at a fast speed in order to ram them. When the player is fully submerged in water, the Sunskater will stop attacking the player. It is the only Pre-Hardmode enemy able to inflict the Holy Flames debuff. The Hadopelagic Echo has a small chance to play the Sunskater death sound instead of the normal use sound.

name: Ark of the Ancients
description: Not to be confused with Wrath of the Ancients, a Hardmode spell tome. The Ark of the Ancients is a craftable Hardmode broadsword that auto-swings. It fires either a large or a small sword beam projectile along with two stars that fall from the sky at the cursor's position. The Eon Beam pierces two enemies, disappearing on the third enemy, and inflicts the Elemental Mix debuff for 2 seconds. The small projectile is identical to the Enchanted Sword projectile. The stars deal 50% of the weapon's da

name: Jungle Dragon, Yharon
description: "The loyal guardian of the Jungle Tyrant" Jungle Dragon, Yharon is a major post-Moon Lord boss fought in the Jungle. The player should be well equipped and prepared before summoning him as the boss is incredibly challenging. Defeating Yharon will provide the player with Yharon Soul Fragments and generate Auric Ore in the world, granting the player access to one of the highest tiers of equipment. Yharon does not spawn on his own, and requires the player to summon him with a Jungle Dragon Egg in t

name: Bookcases
description: Bookcases are pieces of furniture that function as crafting stations. The Calamity Mod currently adds fourteen types of Bookcases to the game, each corresponding to specific sets of furniture. The Ashen Bookcase's eye will ocassionally blink.

name: Essence of Sunlight
description: Essence of Sunlight is a Hardmode crafting material that drops from certain enemies related to the sky, storms, or the Sun. 5-10 Essences of Sunlight can additionally be obtained from Sunbeam Fish, and 2-4 Essences of Sunlight can be obtained from Sky Crates at a 20% chance in Hardmode. Its name was previously "Essence of Cinder", and it could also be dropped by some Desert enemies.

name: Essence of Eleum
description: Essence of Eleum is a Hardmode crafting material that drops from certain ice-related enemies. 5-10 Essences of Eleum can additionally be obtained from Fish of Eleum. The name of this item is a reference to a location in the Dark Souls series, the Frozen Eleum Loyce.

name: Essence of Chaos
description: Essence of Chaos is a Hardmode crafting material that drops from certain enemies related to fire or evil, such as those present in the Brimstone Crag biome. 5-10 Essences of Chaos can additionally be obtained from Chaotic Fish, and 5-15 can be obtained from Brimstone Crates at a 50% drop chance.

name: Core of Chaos
description: Cores of Chaos are Hardmode crafting materials crafted with Ectoplasm and an Essence of Chaos. They can additionally be obtained from Fleshy and Necromantic Geodes dropped by the Ravager.

name: Core of Sunlight
description: Cores of Sunlight are Hardmode crafting materials crafted with Ectoplasm and an Essence of Sunlight. They can additionally be obtained from Fleshy and Necromantic Geodes dropped by the Ravager. Its name was previously "Core of Cinder".

name: Core of Eleum
description: Cores of Eleum are Hardmode crafting materials crafted with Ectoplasm and an Essence of Eleum. They can additionally be obtained from Fleshy and Necromantic Geodes dropped by the Ravager.

name: Core of Calamity
description: Cores of Calamity are Hardmode crafting materials. They can also be obtained from Necromantic Geodes, a type of grab bag dropped by the Ravager. Crafting all items (excluding any items crafted from Miracle Matter and itself included) requires 52 Cores of Calamity (requiring 156 Cores of Chaos, Sunlight, Eleum and 52 Ashes of Calamity). For a full crafting tree, see here.

name: Shadowspec Bar
description: Shadowspec Bars are post-Moon Lord bars used to craft various developer items. They can be considered a direct upgrade to Auric Bars, crafted using Ashes of Annihilation and Exo Prisms.

name: Life Alloy
description: Life Alloys are Hardmode crafting materials crafted with Cryonic, Perennial, and Scoria Bars, additionally being dropped from Necromantic Geodes at a 50% chance. They are primarily used in the crafting of many powerful upgrades. Additionally, they are used in the crafting of multiple Elemental items, and one of the components of Miracle Matter. For a full crafting tree, see here. Life Alloys were previously named Bars of Life.

name: Cryonic Bar
description: Not to be confused with Frigid Bar, a now-removed crafting material that was dropped by Cryogen. Cryonic Bars are Hardmode bars that are made with 5 Cryonic Ore at a Hardmode Forge and are additionally dropped from the Fleshy and Necromantic Geode. They are mainly used in the crafting of crystal-themed items, as well as being used to craft Life Alloys. Cryonic Bars were previously known as Verstaltite Bars and are still referred to as such in the files.

name: Impious Immolator
description: The Impious Immolator is a post-Moon Lord enemy that spawns in the Hallow and Underworld biomes. Initially, it flies peacefully in one direction and turns around when it hits a block, similarly to the Sunskater. After being attacked, it will fly quickly towards the player while shooting bursts of fire which home in weakly on the player. It drops Unholy Essence, a useful post-Moon Lord crafting material.

name: Bobbit Worm
description: The Bobbit Worm is an enemy that spawns in the lowest layer of the Abyss. It stays attached to the seafloor, waiting for the player to come close enough to it. When they do, it rapidly extends out towards the player, dealing significant damage if contact is made, before quickly returning to its previous location. Upon hitting the player, they inflict Crush Depth for 5 seconds. While it is referred to as a worm, it does not act like a typical Worm AI enemy. Its behavior mimics that of real bobbit

name: Gulper Eel
description: The Gulper Eel is an enemy that spawns in the 3rd and 4th layers of the Abyss. It is initially passive, only becoming aggressive if the player attacks it or draws too close to it. It is a long enemy with multiple segments and a large head, which can deal a lot of damage. Like their real life counterparts they both live in the extremely deep parts of the ocean and both have large jaws, but unlike Gulper Eels in real-life, they are far larger and also way more aggressive.

name: Oarfish
description: The Oarfish is an enemy that spawns in the 2nd and 3rd layers of the Abyss. It is a long enemy with multiple segments. Like most Abyss enemies, it won't attack the player unless they get too close or they attack it. It attacks by using its very long body to trap the player. Oarfish in real life live in deep sea away from turbulent, shallow water. The name likely refers to the discarded belief that the fish use their pelvic fins to "row" through water.

name: Soul Edge
description: The Soul Edge is a post-Moon Lord broadsword that drops from Eidolon Wyrms after Polterghast is defeated. The Soul Edge's projectiles inflict Crush Depth. When swinging the blade, 2-3 Phantom Spirits will be released and seek out nearby enemies. If no enemies are near they will hover around the player until an enemy gets in range, similar to the Exoblade. Its best modifier is Legendary. The Old Duke takes only 75% damage from the homing phantom spirits created by the Soul Edge. The weapon is a r

name: Pestilent Slime
description: The Pestilent Slime is a Hardmode slime that spawns in the Jungle after Golem has been defeated. It attacks by jumping towards the player and shooting high-velocity plague darts whenever they get too close to it or travel above it. The Pestilent Slime can be considered a Spiked Jungle Slime that was infected by the Plague.

name: Barinautical
description: The Barinautical is a Hardmode bow dropped by the Aquatic Scourge; it can be considered an indirect upgrade of the Barinade. It fires bursts of three arrows, with a one-third second of a delay. When Wooden Arrows are used as ammo, arrows are replaced with electric arrows that explode upon impact. Each electric arrow does damage twice, for a total of six hits. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Deepsea Staff
description: The Deepsea Staff is a Hardmode summon weapon dropped by the Aquatic Scourge; it is an indirect upgrade to the Seabound Staff. It summons an aquatic starfish that protects the player by performing dashes into enemies, dealing damage on contact. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a M

name: Urchin Stinger
description: Urchin Stingers are Pre-Hardmode rogue weapons dropped by Sea Urchins and Aquatic Urchins. It fires an urchin spike which pierces once, and travels a short distance before being affected by gravity. On hit it inflicts the Venom debuff. They have a 50% chance of being recovered after being thrown. Performing a stealth strike with Urchin Stingers will cause the next stinger thrown to stick onto an enemy for 10 seconds. Whilst the stinger is stuck onto an enemy, it occasionally releases bubbles in

name: Alluring Bait
description: Alluring Bait is a Pre-Hardmode accessory that is caught while fishing in the Sulphurous Sea or Abyss. It increases the player's fishing power by 30 during day, 45 during night, and 60 during a Solar Eclipse. It also increases the chance to catch fish that are materials in Potions. Alluring Bait increases the chance to catch potion fish through the formula (Fishing Power/10)%, capping the chance at 33.33%. In order to reach this cap, the player must have 333 fishing power or greater. Alluring Ba

name: Abyssal Amulet
description: The Abyssal Amulet is a Pre-Hardmode accessory that can be caught while fishing in the Sulphurous Sea or Abyss. While it is equipped, the player gains 10% increased max life while in the Abyss, inflicts the Crush Depth debuff on all attacks, and gains immunity to the Crush Depth debuff. The Abyssal Amulet can only be caught with a 1/25 (4%) chance if fishing with between 110 and 239 fishing power. There is a 25% chance for Crush Depth to be inflicted for 6 seconds, a 37.5% chance to be inflicted

name: Perennial Bar
description: Perennial Bars are Hardmode bars made with 5 Perennial Ore at a Hardmode Forge and are additionally dropped from the Fleshy and Necromantic Geode. They are used to craft various items themed around savage plant-life, and are also used to craft Life Alloy. 1-3 Perennial Bars can additionally be obtained from Jungle Crates at a 10% drop chance after Plantera has been defeated. Perennial Bars were previously known as Draedon Bars and are still referred to as such in the files.

name: Scoria Bar
description: Scoria Bars are Hardmode bars that are made with 5 Scoria Ore at a Hardmode Forge and are additionally dropped from the Fleshy and Necromantic Geode. They are used to craft various volcanic-themed items, as well as being used to craft Life Alloys. Scoria Bars may also be obtained from Abyssal Crates after Golem has been defeated. Scoria Bars were previously known as Chaotic Bars. Before that, they were known as Cruptix Bars, and are still referred to as such in the files.

name: Meld Construct
description: Meld Constructs are Hardmode crafting materials that are crafted with Stardust and Meld Blobs. They are primarily used to craft powerful Hardmode and post-Moon Lord gear which function as alternatives to the gear provided by the Celestial Pillars; additionally, they are used in the crafting of Empyrean armor, a post-Moon Lord armor that functions as the rogue counterpart to the Celestial armors. Selling Meld Constructs yields a profit of 2  13 per construct, compared to selling their components.

name: Aerialite Bar
description: Aerialite Bars are Pre-Hardmode bars made with 4 Aerialite Ore at a Furnace. They are used to craft various sky-themed items. 1-3 Aerialite Bars can additionally be obtained from Sky Crates at a 10% drop chance after either The Hive Mind or The Perforators have been defeated.

name: Living Shard
description: Living Shards are Hardmode crafting materials that drop from Plantera, used in the crafting of permanent consumables, "Terra" weapons, and various broadswords.

name: Desert Scourge
description: If you were looking for something other than the Desert Scourge, see Scourge (disambiguation). "...A dried up and gluttonous husk on a constant and voracious search for its next meal." The Desert Scourge is a Pre-Hardmode boss. It is intended to be one of the first bosses fought by the player and is considered to be the weakest of all of the bosses added by the Calamity Mod. It is intended to be fought before the Eye of Cthulhu and after the King Slime, but can still pose a considerable challeng

name: Uelibloom Bar
description: Uelibloom Bars are post-Moon Lord bars made with 5 Uelibloom Ore at a Hardmode Forge. They are used to craft various plant-themed items. 1-3 Uelibloom Bars can additionally be obtained from Jungle Crates at a 10% drop chance after Providence, the Profaned Goddess has been defeated. Uelibloom Bars were previously known as Ueliace Bars and are still referred to as such in the files. The word "Uelibloom" contains the word "bloom", as in blooming plants. The word "Ueliace", and therefore the "Ueli-"

name: The Devourer of Gods
description: This article is about the post-Moon Lord boss. For the fishing rod with a similar name, see The Devourer of Cods. "You are no god... but I shall feast upon your essence regardless!" The Devourer of Gods is a post-Moon Lord boss that is intended to be fought after all of the Sentinels of the Devourer have been defeated. The fight against this boss is lengthy and difficult, with several phases and numerous varying attacks and behaviors. Defeating it will provide the player with Cosmilite Bars, a n

name: Galactica Singularity
description: Galactica Singularities are craftable Hardmode crafting materials made from Solar Fragments, Vortex Fragments, Nebula Fragments, and Stardust Fragments. They are used in multiple post-Moon Lord recipes. They will float in midair if dropped, similar to Souls. 1-3 Galactica Singularities can be obtained from Sky Crates at a 10% chance after the Moon Lord has been defeated.

name: Trophies
description: Trophies are rare drops (10%) from most bosses and are essentially the boss version of banners. Unlike banners, trophies do not provide any special effects.
