It will then cause a wave of tile-ignoring beams to go down, then another wave up, then one final wave down again. The sword beams also ignore NPC immunity frames. Its best modifier is Legendary. Because of the weapons large area of effect, it is more effective against larger target

name: Brimlash Buster
description: The Brimlash Buster is a craftable Hardmode broadsword that autoswings. It is an upgraded version of the Brimlash. It shoots one of two projectiles randomly per swing: four brimstone bolts to the left, right, and diagonals of the player, or a large brimstone bolt aimed at the cursor, which splits into multiple smaller ones upon death. It inflicts Brimstone Flames on enemy hits. Its best modifier is Legendary.

name: Holy Collider
description: The Holy Collider is a post-Moon Lord broadsword that autoswings. It is dropped by Providence, the Profaned Goddess. Upon striking an enemy, it spawns eight holy flames in an octagonal pattern that spread outwards before homing onto the closest enemy shortly after. The flames spread out faster horizontally than they do vertically, and will dissipate after one second if they did not hit an enemy. The flames can go through blocks and do not pierce. Its best modifier is Legendary. If the sword stri

name: Mirror Blade
description: The Mirror Blade is a post-Moon Lord broadsword that autoswings. It is dropped by the Ceaseless Void. It fires projectiles that resemble a mirror. Projectiles move based on player movement. If an enemy is struck by the blade, the amount of contact damage that enemy deals is added to the weapon's damage. It cannot deal more than 750 damage. Its best modifier is Legendary. Though it initially deals noticeably less DPS than most other weapons of its tier, striking an enemy with very high contact da

name: Cnidarian
description: Not to be confused with Cnidrion, an enemy that spawns in the Desert. The Cnidarian is a craftable Pre-Hardmode yoyo. While it is thrown, the yoyo will fire out small seashell projectiles when enemies are nearby. Seashells pierce once, return to the player after a short time similarly to boomerangs, and deal 75% of the main throw's damage. When the yoyo returns to the player, it will be automatically re-thrown if they are still holding the fire button. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get m

name: Pumpler
description: The Pumpler is a craftable Pre-Hardmode gun with stats that are comparable to the Minishark, having somewhat low base damage but a very high fire rate and a chance not to consume ammo when fired. Right clicking with this weapon will fire a bouncing pumpkin that deals 140% damage and explodes upon hitting an enemy or after 5 seconds have passed. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Marnite Bayonet
description: The Marnite Bayonet is a craftable Pre-Hardmode gun that can be considered an earlier alternative to the Musket or The Undertaker. Upon use, it auto-fires bullets at an average rate. The gun itself also deals contact damage to enemies, a unique property for a ranged weapon that it shares with weapons such as Helstorm and Hellborn. Its best modifier is Unreal. As the gun's hitbox does not change based on aim, it will not always hit enemies that pass through the sprite. When dealing contact damage

name: Titanium Shuriken
description: Titanium Shurikens are craftable Hardmode rogue weapons. They pierce infinitely and can be recovered after hitting a block about 50% of the time. Performing a stealth strike with Titanium Shurikens causes the shuriken to behave similarly to a boomerang, bouncing off tiles and recovering the shuriken to the player 100% of the time. If the boomerang shuriken hits an enemy, 1-2 homing shurikens appear from the shuriken itself. The Titanium Shuriken cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modi

name: Verdant
description: The Verdant is a post-Moon Lord yoyo crafted from Uelibloom Bars. If enemies are nearby, the Verdant will randomly fire leaf crystals at them, which deal 80% of the yoyo's damage. The leaves can pass through tiles but cannot pierce enemies. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has 100% critical strike chance.

name: Yin-Yo
description: The Yin-Yo is a craftable Hardmode yoyo. If enemies are near, the yoyo will randomly fire Dark Shards towards the target or Light Shards away from the target. Both shards will travel back and forth five times before fading away, passing through walls and piercing any number of enemies. When the yoyo returns to the player, it will be automatically re-thrown if they are still holding the fire button. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. Although this weapon has low

name: Speed Blaster
description: The Speed Blaster is a craftable Hardmode ranged weapon that acts as a direct upgrade to the vanilla Paintball Gun. It fires in rapid bursts of six paintballs, and like the Paintball Gun, it does not consume ammo, making it a very reliable weapon. Its high damage potential is somewhat offset by the gravity effect drop and relatively low projectile velocity. Its best modifier is Unreal. The Calamity Mod allows the Painter to sell the Paintball Gun, allowing the player to obtain the weapon without

name: Spectre Rifle
description: The Spectre Rifle is a craftable Hardmode gun that turns any Musket Balls into high-velocity, homing Spectre projectiles that chase enemies. Its high damage and critical strike chance give it excellent one-off damage potential, but a relatively slow fire rate brings it down in fights against large crowds. Holding right click will use its "zoom" ability, which scrolls the viewing area of the screen in the direction of the cursor. Its best modifier is Unreal. This weapon's seeker projectiles are e

name: Leviatitan
description: If you were looking for something other than the Leviatitan, see Leviathan (disambiguation). The Leviatitan is a Hardmode gun which is dropped by the Leviathan and Anahita. It converts Musket Balls into sea water blasts, with a 1/4 chance of firing a poisonous sea water blast instead, which inflicts both the Poisoned and Venom debuffs onto enemies. Its best modifier is Unreal. The name of this weapon is a portmanteau of the words "Leviathan" and "Titan".

name: Pestilent Defiler
description: The Pestilent Defiler is a Hardmode gun that is dropped by The Plaguebringer Goliath. It fills the role of a sniper rifle, slowly firing extremely powerful shots at high velocity. If Musket Balls are used as ammo, bullets are converted into plague rounds that inflict Plague, Poisoned and Venom debuffs, causing up to 360 additional damage over several seconds. This plague round also splits into three smaller projectiles on impact that fly in random directions, potentially hitting other nearby ene

name: Mineral Mortar
description: The Mineral Mortar is a craftable Hardmode launcher that fires projectiles shaped like Forbidden Fragments. Upon collision with a block, this projectile splits into four flying Sand Shark-shaped projectiles that spread out and do additional damage. Neither the initial rocket nor the sharks can hit more than one enemy, though the initial blast has a small area of effect which ignores enemy immunity frames. Its best modifier is Unreal. Since the sharks released by the weapon slightly home towards

name: Scorpio
description: The Scorpio is a craftable Hardmode launcher with extraordinary area-of-effect capabilities. Its two firing modes both consume a single rocket of any kind upon firing. Left-click gives a fully automatic rapid-fire stream of homing rockets that inflict the weapon's normal damage. Right-click is also automatic, slowly firing seeker rockets that inflict 1.25x the weapon's normal damage and double the knockback, in a ludicrously large area of effect (square radius of 22.5 tiles). Despite its lower f

name: Mycelial Claws
description: The Mycelial Claws are a Pre-Hardmode melee weapon that drops from Crabulon. The claws feature an extremely fast swing speed and very short range, a similar functionality to the Fetid Baghnakhs. Its best modifier is Legendary. When paired with the Fungal Symbiote this weapon can decimate enemies and even some Pre-Hardmode bosses extremely quickly. The Mandible Claws are an acceptable substitue, which are nearly identical in stats except for a very slightly reduced knockback.

name: Comet Quasher
description: The Comet Quasher is a craftable Hardmode broadsword that autoswings. The sword does not fire any projectile when swung, but summons 3 falling meteors towards the mouse cursor whenever it strikes an enemy. The meteors resemble those summoned by the Meteor Staff and deal half the damage of the sword hit that spawned them. Its best modifier is Legendary.

name: Stellar Striker
description: The Stellar Striker is a craftable post-Moon Lord broadsword that is a direct upgrade of the Comet Quasher. Every time the sword strikes an enemy, two lunar flares fall from the sky towards the cursor, which explode upon contact with enemies or upon hitting tiles that are below the cursor. Each flare deals equal damage to the sword strike which spawned it. Its best modifier is Legendary. The Old Duke takes only 80% damage from the Stellar Striker.

name: Neptune's Bounty
description: Neptune's Bounty is a craftable post-Moon Lord broadsword that autoswings. It is a direct upgrade to the Abyss Blade and the final upgrade to the Depth Crusher. When swung, it fires a small trident that pierces infinitely and regularly rains more small tridents under itself as it travels. The small spawned tridents deal 50% of the weapon's damage, home in on enemies, do not pierce enemies, and burst into a water explosion on contact, dealing additional damage to nearby enemies equal to the proje

name: Oblivion
description: The Oblivion is a Hardmode yoyo dropped by Calamitas. While in use, it fires brimstone lasers at nearby enemies which deal half of the yoyo's damage. Both the lasers and the yoyo inflict Brimstone Flames. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. Brimstone lasers appear near the yoyo instead of emitting from it directly. If the yoyo is pressed to a wall or is in a tight space, the lasers may disappear immediately and not be able to hit enemies. This weapon was previou

name: Shimmerspark
description: The Shimmerspark is a craftable Hardmode yoyo. If enemies are nearby, the yoyo will randomly fire slow-moving purple stars at them. The fired stars can pierce one enemy but will not go through walls. When the yoyo returns to the player, another one will be automatically thrown if they are still holding the fire button. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. The Shimmerspark will not perfectly follow the cursor while thrown. When using the Yoyo Glove or Yoyo Bag, th

name: Quagmire
description: The Quagmire is a craftable Hardmode yoyo. While in use, the yoyo randomly and continuously emits spore clouds which deal 50% to 70% of the yoyo's damage. Only the yoyo itself inflicts the Venom debuff. When the yoyo returns to the player, it will be automatically re-thrown if they are still holding the fire button. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. A quagmire or mire is the general name for wetland areas such as bogs, fens, marshes or swamps.

name: Pandemic
description: The Pandemic is a Hardmode yoyo dropped by The Plaguebringer Goliath. Similar to the Oblivion, the Pandemic constantly fires plague seekers at nearby enemies; plague seekers deal 75% of the yoyo's damage. Both the yoyo and its plague seeker projectiles inflict the Plague debuff. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. A pandemic is a real world event where a dangerous disease spreads to multiple different countries and regions.

name: The Obliterator
description: The Obliterator is a post-Moon Lord yoyo dropped by The Devourer of Gods. Unlike other yoyos, The Obliterator ignores NPC immunity frames, allowing it to rapidly bounce off of enemies and inflict much more damage than its damage stat would indicate. If enemies are nearby, The Obliterator will rapidly fire nebula lasers which do 25% less damage than the yoyo itself. The nebula lasers inflict the Frostburn and On Fire! debuffs. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size.

name: Sausage Maker
description: The Sausage Maker is a craftable Pre-Hardmode spear dropped by The Perforators. It can also be crafted from Vertebrae, Crimtane Bars and Blood Samples at an Altar. Upon contact with an enemy, a blood bolt will be fired out that homes in on enemies. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. Real-life sausage makers take meat, condense it, and push it out as a sausage. This could mean that when you strike an enemy, their flesh is condensed into the weapon, then it spits

name: Urchin Spear
description: The Urchin Spear is a craftable Pre-Hardmode spear. When used, it shoots a stinger that homes in slowly on enemies and inflicts the Poisoned and Venom debuffs. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size.

name: Starnight Lance
description: The Starnight Lance is a craftable Hardmode spear. On each swing it will fire out a projectile that inflicts the Frostburn debuff that pierces two enemies, disappearing on the third. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size.

name: Hellion Flower Spear
description: The Hellion Flower Spear is a craftable Hardmode spear. On each swing it fires out a projectile that pierces blocks and enemies twice, while also inflicting the Venom debuff to any hit enemy. Whenever the spear or the projectile inflicts a critical hit, a single petal, such as those from Orichalcum armor, will fly in toward the target's position. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size.

name: Terra Lance
description: The Terra Lance is a craftable Hardmode spear. When swung, it will fire out a projectile that deals 70% of the spear's damage and knockback, pierces infinite enemies, and goes through blocks. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size.

name: Earthen Pike
description: The Earthern Pike is a Hardmode spear dropped by the Earth Elemental. Enemies struck by this weapon are inflicted with the Armor Crunch debuff, greatly reducing their defense temporarily. On swing, the spear releases four fossil shards that deal 50 percent of the spear's damage and can additionally inflict Armor Crunch. The fossil shards are affected by gravity, and cannot travel upward; aiming the spear's swing further upward will only cause the shards to be fired with less horizontal speed. It

name: Diseased Pike
description: The Diseased Pike is a Hardmode spear dropped by The Plaguebringer Goliath. On enemy hits, it will fire out plague seekers that deal 75% of the weapon's damage and inflict Plague debuff. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size.

name: Heart Rapier
description: The Heart Rapier was a craftable Hardmode spear. Whenever it damaged an enemy, it healed the player for 5 HP. Its best modifier was Godly. A rapier is a slender, pointed sword used by thrusting into the opponent.

name: Brimlance
description: The Brimlance is a Hardmode spear that drops from Brimstone Elemental. Upon hitting an enemy, it will inflict the Brimstone Flames debuff. Enemies hit by this weapon spawn brimstone explosions and drop brimstone flames. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size.

name: Gilded Proboscis
description: The Gilded Proboscis is a post-Moon Lord spear that is dropped from The Dragonfolly. It heals the player for 1 HP each time it deals damage. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has 100% critical strike chance.

name: Stream Gouge
description: The Stream Gouge is a craftable post-Moon Lord spear. This weapon ignores enemy immunity frames and shoots out a spear clone which pierces up to 9 enemies, and inflicts God Slayer Inferno debuff. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has 100% critical strike chance.

name: Eldritch Tome
description: The Eldritch Tome is a Pre-Hardmode spell tome that drops from The Slime God. When used, it fires three red tendrils which bend in random directions, similarly to the Shadowflame Hex Doll. It is the Crimson counterpart to the Abyssal Tome. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Elemental Lance
description: The Elemental Lance is a craftable post-Moon Lord spear. It fires one gravity-affected cyan beam that splits into more beams with similar properties. Each usage of the Elemental Lance results in 162 orange beams at most, if the blue and pink beams do not prematurely dissipate on enemies. All beams can move through blocks and inflict the Elemental Mix debuffs for two seconds on contact. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. Ruthless might be preferred if the player

name: The Wand
description: The Wand is a craftable post-Moon Lord wand. It fires a small projectile that inflicts On Fire! and Daybroken, and erupts into a massive translucent infernado on impact with any tile or enemy. If the infernado triggers in mid-air, it will attempt to spawn on the nearest solid surface below it. Only 1 infernado can exist at a time. Its extremely low base damage applies only to the initial projectile. The infernado it creates can extend upwards through solid blocks and ignores enemy invulnerabilit

name: Decapodita Sprout
description: The Decapodita Sprout is a craftable Pre-Hardmode item used to summon the Crabulon boss in the Glowing Mushroom biome. Its name is a portmanteau of the words decapoda and amanita. Decapoda is an order of crustaceans which contains crabs, lobsters, and shrimp. Amanita is a genus that contains around 600 species of capped mushrooms.

name: Cosmic Elemental
description: If you were looking for something other than the Pre-Hardmode enemy, see Cosmic (disambiguation). The Cosmic Elemental is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Cavern. They behave the same as Granite Elementals, flying through walls and rolling into a ball when damaged in Expert Mode. Upon death, the Cosmic Elemental has a chance to drop a number of rare swords that are otherwise not obtainable through conventional means. The Cosmic Elemental always applies the Confused debuff on hit players f

name: Plasma Rod
description: The Plasma Rod is a Pre-Hardmode wand obtained from the Goblin Sorcerer and Tim. It shoots a beam that inflicts many debuffs at once to hit enemies. If it hits a tile instead, it will explode into eight smaller beams with higher damage. Due to the random spread of smaller beams, some may find it difficult to aim smaller beams at the enemy. The direct hit of the wand can inflict 5 different debuffs at once: Shadowflame for 1 second Ichor for 2 seconds Frostburn for 3 seconds On Fire! for 4 second

name: Seashell Boomerang
description: The Seashell Boomerang is a craftable Pre-Hardmode boomerang. Unlike other early game boomerangs, it is capable of throwing an unlimited amount of boomerangs at once, which all return to the player after traveling a short distance. Its best modifier is Flawless.

name: Mandible Claws
description: The Mandible Claws are a Pre-Hardmode melee weapon that drops from Antlions, Antlion Chargers, and Antlion Swarmers. The claws feature an extremely fast swing speed and very short range, functioning similarly to the Fetid Baghnakhs. Its best modifier is Legendary. The Mandible Claws are especially effective against Antlion Chargers; they are able to bring them to a complete stop, allowing the weapon to deal extremely high damage and keep the player safe. The Fungal Symbiote is extremely effectiv

name: Crabulon
description: "A crab and its mushrooms, a love story." Crabulon is a Pre-Hardmode boss. It has the appearance of a giant, gray, fungus-covered crab, with several glowing mushrooms attached to it. Crabulon is summoned by using the Decapodita Sprout in a Glowing Mushroom biome. When spawned, Crabulon will be passive towards the player, completely still and dealing no contact damage. While Crabulon is passive, the player is granted the Mushy buff, increasing defense by 5 and life regen by 1. It will become host

name: Illustrious Knives
description: The Illustrious Knives are a craftable post-Moon Lord developer weapon. When used, the weapon launches a spread of 4-8 slow moving green knives, similar to the Vampire Knives. The knives are destroyed upon contact with tiles, but will rapidly accelerate and home in on nearby enemies. All knives will inflict Holy Flames upon striking an enemy. When a knife hits an enemy, the player is healed by 1.5% of the damage dealt. This lifesteal is far stronger than either the Vampire or Empyrean Knives. It

name: Crushsaw Crasher
description: The Crushsaw Crasher is a Hardmode rogue weapon that has a 8.33% (10%) chance to drop from Catastrophe. When used it auto-fires a homing, spinning axe that can pierce one enemy or bounce once before disappearing on its next impact. The axe inflicts Brimstone Flames upon any enemy it hits. Performing a stealth strike with the Crushsaw Crasher will cause five axes to be thrown instead of one. Its best modifier is Flawless. This weapon does not benefit from the effects of the Invisibility Potion or

name: Meteor Fist
description: The Meteor Fist is a craftable Pre-Hardmode bomb that fires a high-velocity projectile which leaves a particle trail behind. The projectile is slightly affected by gravity, and explodes on contact with enemies or solid blocks. The explosion ignores enemy immunity frames. Performing a stealth strike with the Meteor Fist will cause the next fist thrown to bounce between enemies up to four times before exploding. Its best modifier is Flawless. The particle trail it leaves behind is very useful for

name: The Dance of Light
description: The Dance of Light is a craftable post-Moon Lord developer spell tome. Upon use, it rapidly summons four pairs of fast inaccurate Light Blade projectiles from a cone around the player towards the cursor's direction. Each pair of light blades will curve, converge, and home with each other; each projectile piercing up to two targets and pass through tiles. Once the blades have struck something 300 times, all nearby blades vanish and a flash of light appears from above to damage all enemies in a la

name: Goobow
description: The Goobow is a craftable Pre-Hardmode bow that auto-fires. It will fire two short streams of slime alongside the arrows it fires. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Mandible Bow
description: The Mandible Bow is a Pre-Hardmode bow. It is dropped by Antlions, Antlion Chargers, and Antlion Swarmers. It fires arrows at a very high velocity. Its best modifier is Unreal. The Mandible Bow is tied with the Arterial Assault and Clockwork Bow for the highest velocity of any bow.

name: Lunarian Bow
description: The Lunarian Bow is a craftable Pre-Hardmode bow that auto-fires. It fires two arrows. If Wooden Arrows are used as ammo, it instead fires straight beams that are not affected by gravity and can bounce on a block once; however, the bolts will slide on the hit block rather than bounce off of it. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Bladedge Railbow
description: The Bladedge Railbow is a craftable Hardmode repeater. It fires out 4 arrows at once, quickly followed by a pair of leaves. The leaves inflict no knockback and deal 50% of the weapon's base damage. Its best modifier is Unreal. It used to be called Bladedge Greatbow and, like its name would suggest, looked like a bow.

name: Darkecho Greatbow
description: The Darkecho Greatbow is a craftable Hardmode bow. It fires 2 arrows at once and a crystal dart that bounces around, hitting up to 3 targets nearby. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: The Ballista
description: The Ballista is a craftable Hardmode bow that auto-fires. It converts Wooden Arrows into special arrows that can pierce one enemy and shatter into fossil shards upon hitting a second, as well as upon hitting solid blocks. Fossil shards deal 20% of the weapon's base damage. All projectiles will inflict the Armor Crunch debuff. Its best modifier is Unreal. The Magic Quiver increases the damage of the arrows shot by The Ballista, but doesn't increase the speed. The Ballista nets massive damage outp

name: Nettlevine Greatbow
description: The Nettlevine Greatbow is a craftable post-Moon Lord bow that auto-fires. It fires a spread of four arrows, quickly followed by two more arrows that are either Venom or Chlorophyte Arrows. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Planetary Annihilation
description: The Planetary Annihilation is a craftable post-Moon Lord bow that rains arrows from the sky in groups of seven. It converts Wooden Arrows into rainbow blasts that home in on enemies. Each set of bolts consists of a Red, Orange, Yellow, Green, Blue, Indigo, and Violet bolt which all act identically to each other and are fired in a random order from the sky. Its best modifier is Unreal. For a full crafting tree, see here.

name: Flarewing Bow
description: The Flarewing Bow is a craftable Hardmode bow. When used, it auto-fires a group of 5 parallel arrows per shot, only consuming one arrow to do so. It converts normal Wooden Arrows into fast obsidian bat projectiles, which bounce off of tiles similarly to Chlorophyte Arrows and swoop in a wide clockwise motion. Obsidian bats can either ricochet off tiles or pierce enemies twice, before dissipating on the third tile or enemy impact. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Monsoon
description: The Monsoon is a craftable post-Moon Lord bow that auto-fires five arrows at once. When firing Wooden Arrows, four of the five arrows are converted into sharks, and the fifth, middle arrow is converted into a Typhoon Arrow. Typhoon Arrows erupt into a swirling typhoon on contact with enemies or tiles, dealing damage over time in a wide area. Additionally, arrows deal 10% more damage when firing Wooden Arrows. Its best modifier is Unreal. A monsoon is a seasonal prevailing wind in the region of S

name: Clockwork Bow
description: The Clockwork Bow is a craftable post-Moon Lord bow. When used, 10 arrows are fired towards the cursor with large variations, spanning from player level to the sky similarly to the Daedalus Stormbow. These arrows will travel through tiles, last four seconds, and cannot be recovered regardless of arrow type. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Terra Flameburster
description: The Terra Flameburster is a craftable Hardmode flamethrower. It fires a long-range stream of green flames that pierces through infinite enemies but can not go through blocks. The flames inflicts the On Fire! and Cursed Inferno debuffs to enemies hit by them. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Terra Ray
description: The Terra Ray is a craftable Hardmode wand. It shoots a straight green laser beam, similar to its predecessor Valkyrie Ray's beam, which lingers long enough to hit enemies 4 times before disappearing. When the laser hits an enemy, it spawns homing energy bolt projectiles. The amount of bolts it creates depends on the enemy's distance from the player when hit: If the hit enemy is close to the player, it only creates 1 energy bolt per hit, but it can create up to 3 bolts per hit if the enemy is fa

name: Elemental Ray
description: The Elemental Ray is a craftable post-Moon Lord wand that is a direct upgrade to the Terra Ray. It fires four unique beams behind the player, all aiming towards the mouse cursor, each of which behave differently: Solar beams explode on every enemies hit. Nebula beams initially aim towards the mouse, but they immediately sweep in a short clockwise arc before disappearing. Vortex beams resemble lightning bolts. They do not pierce and are slightly inaccurate, but they inflict the Electrified debuff

name: Executioner's Blade
description: The Executioner's Blade is a craftable post-Moon Lord rogue weapon. It auto-fires a continuous stream of homing purple blades that explode on impact, inflicting God Slayer Inferno on any enemies hit. The blades can pass through walls and travel for quite some distance before being affected by gravity. Thrown blades cannot home in on enemies while they are inside of solid blocks. Each use of the weapon throws a set of three blades, but when the attack button is held down the stream of blades is c

name: Statis' Ninja Belt
description: If you were looking for another Statis-themed item, see Statis (disambiguation). The Statis' Ninja Belt is a craftable Hardmode accessory that combines the abilities of the Master Ninja Gear & Frog Leg. It grants the ability to cling to and slide down vertical walls, quickly dash with a base distance of 24 blocks by double-tapping the horizontal movement key, enables auto-jump by holding the ↷ Jump key. Additionally, the player is a granted a guaranteed dodge that can only occur every 90 seconds

name: Pitbull
description: The Pitbull is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns on the Surface at Night after the Eye of Cthulhu has been defeated. It has the same AI as the Unicorn, charging and ramming into the player at high speeds. This, along with their ability to inflict Bleeding, makes them a dangerous enemy for unprepared players.

name: Aegis Blade
description: The Aegis Blade is a Hardmode Legendary broadsword that drops from Golem in Malice Mode. When used with its primary fire (left-click), it will swing and deal contact damage in a regular manner. Upon striking an enemy, a medium-sized stationary flame explosion is produced, capable of damaging the target 6 more times, each dealing 5% less damage, before dissipating. When used with its secondary fire (right-click), the broadsword itself will not deal damage but will instead shoot a fireball that de

name: Stormlion
description: The Stormlion is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Underground Desert. It walks towards the player relatively slowly in an attempt to do damage, and inflicts the Electrified debuff on contact. It can drop a Stormlion Mandible, which is necessary to craft the Desert Medallion, which summons the Desert Scourge, as well as the Storm Surge and Triumph Potions. Despite having improved stats compared to Antlion Chargers, it moves noticeably slower, lacking the chargers' potentially devastating a

name: Scryllar
description: The Scryllar is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Brimstone Crag. It is a ghostly figure that can travel through blocks. It will swoop around the player before moving in to attack. It also has two variations; the normal variant and the rage variant. While they have different stats, they both drop the same loot. Its stats receive a significant boost and starts dropping Bloodstone after Providence, the Profaned Goddess is defeated. Three Scryllars are depicted in the Underworld's Draedon's L

name: Blighted Eye
description: Blighted Eyes are Hardmode enemies that appear at night on the Surface. They behave similarly to Demon Eyes. They can drop Blighted Lenses, which are a key ingredient in the Eye of Desolation, which is used to summon Calamitas. In Death Mode, Blighted Eyes are capable of becoming intangible and passing through blocks for a brief period of time, in order to reach the player.

name: Despair Stone
description: The Despair Stone is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Brimstone Crag. It moves by rolling and bouncing similarly to an Angry Tumbler. Each bounce causes it to emit red particles and make an impact sound. Its stats receive a significant boost and starts dropping Bloodstone after Providence, the Profaned Goddess is defeated.

name: Heat Spirit
description: The Heat Spirit is a pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Brimstone Crag. They charge around at high speeds and attempt to ram the player for high damage, and once they leave a small area around the player, they turn to charge back again. The Heat Spirit's appearance resembles the Lost Soul Demon from the game DOOM (2016). It is the only enemy in the Brimstone Crag that does not gain an increase in stats or drop Bloodstone after Providence is defeated.

name: Exotic Pheromones
description: Exotic Pheromones are a craftable item used to summon The Dragonfolly boss. It can only be used in the Jungle. Although The Dragonfolly is intended to be fought after Moon Lord, the recipe for this item is technically available at the end of Hardmode after defeating Lunatic Cultist and the Solar Pillar, and does not require Moon Lord to be defeated. The recipe for the Jungle Dragon Egg also does not require any post-Moon Lord materials, meaning it is possible to fight Jungle Dragon, Yharon befor

name: Bohldohr
description: Bohldohr is an enemy that spawns in the Jungle Temple. It rolls and bounces towards the player, similarly to an Angry Tumbler, making a sound of impact whenever it hits the ground. Similarly to Lihzahrds and Flying Snakes, Bohldohrs can be spawned in Pre-Hardmode by standing in front of natural Lihzahrd Brick Walls. This enemy allows the player to obtain Lihzahrd Bricks, and all of the furniture crafted from them, as well as the Death Whistle, before defeating the Golem. This also allows unlimit

name: Augur of the Elements
description: The Augur of the Elements is a craftable post-Moon Lord spell tome that is an upgraded version of the Eldritch Tome, the Tome of Fates and the Shadowflame Hex Doll. It continuously shoots out multiple rainbow tentacles, which is a trait it shares with its ingredients. The tentacles can pass through tiles, but do not pierce enemies. It is later used in the crafting of the Subsuming Vortex. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Staff of the Mechworm
description: The Staff of the Mechworm is a post-Moon Lord summon weapon dropped by The Devourer of Gods. Upon use, it summons a flying mechanical worm that charges, fires lasers, teleports onto enemies and ignores immunity frames. The mechworm is in constant flight and can travel through walls and blocks. The Staff does not spawn multiple minions upon use, instead increasing the number of segments by one. Losing minion slots while the mechworm is active will remove any segments that were associated with the

name: Deathhail Staff
description: The Deathhail Staff is a post-Moon Lord wand that is dropped by The Devourer of Gods. It rains down a barrage of nebula lasers on the cursor's location upon use. The lasers will inflict the Frostburn debuff for 10 seconds and will reduce the number of Immunity frames given to an enemy by 80%. The lasers can pierce up to eight targets and will phase through blocks. Its best modifier is Mythical. The projectiles do not disappear after reaching their pierce limit; they will continue to fly downward

name: Soul Slurper
description: Not to be confused with Soul Seeker, a Boss Servant summoned by Calamitas and Supreme Calamitas. The Soul Slurper is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Brimstone Crag. It continuously faces the player while attempting to ram into them. It also fires slow-moving red lasers, which quickly accelerate and split into three lasers that slightly home into the player. While homing, the lasers travel through blocks. Contact with its lasers inflicts the Brimstone Flames debuff. Its stats receive a si

name: Crystalline
description: The Crystalline is a craftable Pre-Hardmode non-consumable dagger which automatically throws a gemstone dagger that is affected by gravity. Shortly after being thrown, the dagger emits three copies of itself that deal less damage and are not affected by gravity, with each disappearing shortly after spawning. The dagger cannot pass through walls nor pierce through enemies. If the original dagger hits an enemy or a wall before splitting, the extra daggers will not appear. Performing a stealth stri

name: Life Jelly
description: The Life Jelly is a Pre-Hardmode accessory dropped by Pink Jellyfish and Mirage Jelly. It gives the player 20 more HP and boosts life regeneration by +4 while standing still. It can be combined with Mana Jelly and Vital Jelly in order to craft the Grand Gelatin.

name: Astreal Defeat
description: The Astreal Defeat is a craftable post-Moon Lord bow. It autofires streams of Astreal Arrows at four semi-randomized paths, ranging from straight forward to varying levels of curving downward, with a tendency to curve to the right as well. The arrows will begin to spawn spirit flames shortly after they're fired, which home in on nearby enemies and deal 50% of the weapon's base damage. Astreal Arrows inflict the Shadowflame debuff for 6 seconds upon striking an enemy. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Alluvion
description: The Alluvion is a craftable post-Moon Lord bow and a direct upgrade of the Monsoon. It rapidly auto-fires volleys of 6 arrows. While equipped with Wooden Arrows each fired arrow is replaced by either a Torrential Arrow, a shark, or a Typhoon Arrow. Arrows fired have a 7.92% chance of turning into Torrential Arrows, which are high-velocity lasers that ignore NPC immunity frames. Arrows fired have a 3.96% chance of turning into sharks. Arrows fired have a 1% chance of turning into Typhoon Arrows,

name: Ungodly Serpent
description: The Ungodly Serpent was a rare post-Moon Lord enemy that spawned in the The Hallow and in The Underworld. It acted like other worm-type enemies and burrowed through blocks. Its large size made it easy to hit, however, it also made the player more vulnerable to damage.

name: Profaned Energy
description: Profaned Energy is a post-Moon Lord enemy that spawns in both the Hallow and Underworld. It has a singular immobile core with two mobile lanterns protruding from it via chains. The lanterns move somewhat erratically, alternating between swooping in a radius around the core and attempting to hover around one location. The lanterns shoot large Holy Bombs which drift to a stop, then emit smaller Holy Flares every second until it is depleted. Holy Flares slowly drift downward while swooping horizont

name: Vortexpopper
description: Not to be confused with Effervescence, a magic weapon that also fires bubbles. The Vortexpopper is a craftable Hardmode gun. Much like the Xenopopper, it fires bubbles which erupt into bullets after a short delay. The Vortexpopper fires many more bubbles than the Xenopopper and summons extra bubbles off-screen while in use, causing bullets to fly towards the cursor from every direction at once. Its best modifier is Unreal. The Vortexpopper is especially potent when paired with Chlorophyte Bullet

name: Scorn Eater
description: The Scorn Eater is a post-Moon Lord enemy that spawns in the Hallow and Underworld biomes. It jumps towards the player at a high speed, then stands still and pants for a moment before jumping again. Its high contact damage and velocity, along with its large size, make it a dangerous enemy. It drops Unholy Essence, a useful post-Moon Lord crafting material. The Scorn Eater is incapable of moving significant vertical distances; to make up for this, it can pass through blocks while dashing.

name: Soma Prime
description: The Soma Prime is a craftable post-Moon Lord gun. When Musket Balls are used as ammo, it fires high-damage High Velocity Bullets. The Soma Prime fires very rapidly and can inflict the Shred debuff on hit. This debuff deals 750 damage per second over its duration. The Soma Prime has a 50% chance to not consume ammo. Its best modifier is Unreal. But the weapon's firing speed will not be affected. The weapon itself is a reference to the Soma Prime from the video game Warframe. In Warframe, the Soma

name: Deathwind
description: Deathwind is a post-Moon Lord bow that is dropped by The Devourer of Gods. Upon use, the Deathwind turns Wooden Arrows into a spread of 4 blue and pink nebula arrows. Nebula arrows do not pierce tiles nor enemies and inflicts On Fire! and Frostburn debuffs. Unconverted arrows deal 80% damage. Its best modifier is Unreal. Having the ability to maintain relatively high DPS makes the Deathwind a good bossing weapon. Pay attention to the projectiles being fired by the Deathwind, as this can make fig

name: Eradicator
description: The Eradicator is a post-Moon Lord boomerang dropped by The Devourer of Gods. It passes through walls and sporadically fires nebula lasers at any nearby enemies. Its best modifier is Flawless. There is a limit to the number of Eradicator projectiles, only two can be thrown at once. Also, it is limited by the weapon's use time, and existing Eradicator boomerangs will despawn after 8.33 seconds. The Eradicator will bounce back immediately upon striking an enemy, so intentionally missing will allow

name: SHPC
description: The SHPC (or Super Heated Plasma Cannon) is a Hardmode Legendary magic gun that drops from The Destroyer in Malice Mode. Its primary fire launches a set of energy balls that explode on impact with walls or enemies, dealing damage repeatedly in a large radius. These projectiles rapidly lose velocity and float in mid-air; if left untouched, they will explode on their own after several seconds. Holding right-click fires a volley of beams with very high velocity and rate of fire, similar to the Lase

name: Entropy's Vigil
description: The Entropy's Vigil is a Hardmode summon weapon that is dropped by Calamitas. Upon use with two or more minion slots, the staff summons 3 miniature clones of Calamitas and her brothers, Catastrophe and Cataclysm (named Calamitamini, Catastromini, and Cataclymini respectively). Calamitamini will shoot brimstone lasers, Catastromini will charge into enemies, and Cataclymini will breathe brimstone flame. If the player has one minion slot remaining, only Calamitamini will be summoned. Entropy's Vigi

name: Crimslime Staff
description: The Crimslime Staff is a Pre-Hardmode summon weapon that is dropped by The Slime God. It summons a miniature Crimulan Blight Slime, which follows the player and attacks enemies. It deals contact damage, similarly to other slimes. If the player gets too far, it grows two wings and flies towards the player. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, min

name: Eye of the Storm
description: The Eye of the Storm is a Hardmode accessory which drops from the Cloud Elemental. While equipped, it will summon a friendly Cloud Elemental to fight for you. She fights by dashing repeatedly towards enemies. The Cloud Elemental's attacks grant enemies 20 local immunity frames. The Cloud Elemental minion used to be called "Cloudy Waifu". After that, she was known as "Miss Cloudy".

name: Elemental in a Bottle
description: The Elemental in a Bottle is a Hardmode accessory that has a 14.29% / 20% chance to be dropped by Sand Elementals. Equipping it summons a Sand Elemental to fight for you, which deals summon damage and casts sandstorms in a similar fashion to their enemy counterpart. The Sand Elemental grants enemies 30 local immunity frames on contact damage, and the tornadoes it spawns grant 20. This item used to be called "Waifu in a Bottle", while the Sand Elemental herself used to be called "Sand Waifu". Aft

name: Rare Elemental in a Bottle
description: The Rare Elemental in a Bottle is a Hardmode accessory that drops from Sand Elementals. While equipped, it summons a Rare Sand Elemental that summons healing orbs while the player is damaged. These healing orbs are cast once every two seconds, slowly move upwards before disappearing after a few seconds, and restore 15 health each, effectively granting an extra 7.5 health regeneration per second. The effect of the healing orbs and elemental is not boosted by having Summoner gear or a Summon weapo

name: Pearl of Enthrallment
description: The Pearl of Enthrallment is a Hardmode accessory that is dropped by the Leviathan and Anahita. It summons a friendly Water Elemental which remains above the player's head. It fights similarly to the Anahita boss, attacking with water spears, frost mist, and magical notes. The item was previously known as the "Lure of Enthrallment", and was a sentry weapon that could place the Siren Lure at the cursor's location. The item previously summoned Siren Clone as a minion.

name: Rose Stone
description: The Rose Stone is a Hardmode accessory that has a 20% chance to be dropped by the Brimstone Elemental. It summons a friendly Brimstone Elemental to protect you, which attacks nearby enemies by shooting brimstone fireballs or through contact damage. The Brimstone Elemental's attacks grant enemies 20 local immunity frames. The Brimstone Elemental minion used to be called "Brimmy Waifu". After that, she was known as "Miss Brimmy". The Brimstone Elemental’s projectile was previously called "Big Bust

name: Aero Stone
description: The Aero Stone is a Pre-Hardmode accessory dropped by the Desert Scourge. It provides buffs to movement, which makes it a great accessory during Pre-Hardmode. It also causes the player to emit a dim blue light while it is equipped.

name: Cryo Stone
description: The Cryo Stone is a Hardmode accessory that has a 20% chance to drop from Cryogen. It grants the player a rotating ice shield identical to the one protecting Cryogen, that damages and slows down enemies on contact. It is one of the several components required for the Kelvin Catalyst.

name: Chaos Stone
description: The Chaos Stone is a Hardmode accessory dropped by Calamitas with a 20% chance. While equipped, the Mana Sickness debuff is replaced by Mana Burn, which deals damage over time to the player. The damage per second increases exponentially the more time is left on the debuff, peaking at 36 damage per second at the maximum duration. Identically to Mana Sickness, the Mana Burn duration increases by 5 seconds every time a Mana Potion is consumed, and cannot exceed 10 seconds.

name: Bloom Stone
description: The Bloom Stone is a Hardmode accessory that has a 20% chance to drop from Plantera. While it is equipped, the player's life regen is increased by 3 if they are standing on any ground, this effect is doubled during daytime. The Bloom Stone also gives the player an augmented Flower Boots effect, allowing flowers and plants to grow on grass whilst also occasionally allowing random dye plants to appear on dirt that does not have grass upon it. This makes it ideal for farming not only seeds and bait

name: Heart of the Elements
description: The Heart of the Elements is a craftable Hardmode accessory. It will summon all of the Elementals to assist the player and attack enemies. When equipped, the Heart of the Elements will summon a Brimstone Elemental, a Sand Elemental, a Cloud Elemental, and a Water Elemental to attack nearby enemies and a Rare Sand Elemental to heal the player. Elementals have a base damage of 90, and are affected by summon damage bonuses. All of the elementals' attacks grant enemies 20 local immunity frames, exce

name: Blissful Bombardier
description: The Blissful Bombardier is a post-Moon Lord launcher dropped by Providence, the Profaned Goddess. It rapidly fires rockets that explode in a large radius. As the rockets travel, they periodically emit small explosive bursts, which are capable of dealing damage as well; these midair bursts always inflict the Holy Flames debuff on hit enemies. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Cosmilamp
description: Not to be confused with Cosmic Lantern, a boss servant enemy spawned by Signus. The Cosmilamp is a post-Moon Lord summon weapon that drops from Signus, Envoy of the Devourer. It summons a Cosmilamp which follows the player and attacks nearby enemies. Each Cosmilamp takes up 2 minion slots. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal

name: Malachite
description: The Malachite is a Hardmode Legendary dagger that drops from The Plaguebringer Goliath in Malice Mode. Left-clicking will rapidly throw kunai that are affected by gravity and stick to enemies or tiles, exploding after a brief delay. Right-clicking will fire a single larger kunai that pierces one enemy and explodes upon impacting the next. This kunai has extremely high velocity, deals much more damage than the left-click kunai and is not affected by gravity. Performing a stealth strike with Malac

name: Blossom Flux
description: The Blossom Flux is a Hardmode Legendary bow that is dropped by Plantera in Malice Mode. It has two modes of attack: its primary fire (left-click) will shoot leaf arrows at a very high rate, and its secondary fire (right-click) launches a spore orb that travels in a wave pattern and explodes into spore clouds upon impact. Its best modifier is Unreal. Due to its incredible rate of fire and lack of inherent chance to not consume ammo, this weapon can drain arrow reserves extremely quickly. Convers

name: Cleansing Blaze
description: The Cleansing Blaze is a craftable post-Moon Lord flamethrower. It shoots purple flames that deal great damage due to the high fire rate. Any enemy hit will be inflicted with the God Slayer Inferno debuff. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Barracuda Gun
description: The Barracuda Gun is a craftable Hardmode ranged weapon that is an upgraded version of the Piranha Gun. Holding left-click will fire two barracudas that latch on to enemies and deal continuous damage as long as left-click is held down. After an enemy dies, the barracudas will automatically latch onto other enemies in range. The two barracudas cannot latch onto the same enemy. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Onyx Chain Blaster
description: The Onyx Chain Blaster is a craftable post-Moon Lord gun that is a combination of the Onyx Blaster and the Chain Gun. It rapidly fires onyx blasts and volleys of bullets. Onyx blasts deal 250% of the weapon's damage. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: P90
description: The P90 is a craftable Hardmode gun. It has an incredibly high fire rate, surpassing that of the S.D.M.G. and even the Chain Gun, but this is balanced by its very low base damage. Its best modifier is Unreal. But the weapon's firing speed will not be affected. When using Acid Rounds as ammo, its damage is reduced by 25%. Due to its uniquely low stats, it can only receive a limited range of modifiers compared to other weapons. Because of its speed, it achieves the best DPS when paired up with bul

name: Mangrove Chakram
description: The Mangrove Chakram is a craftable Hardmode Rogue boomerang. It inflicts Cursed Inferno and can be thrown multiple times, with Chakrams returning to the owner after a set distance or hitting an enemy or solid block. Chakrams still in flight will disappear if they don't return to the player after a short while. Its best modifier is Flawless.

name: Elemental Disk
description: The Elemental Disk is a craftable post-Moon Lord boomerang. It rapidly throws disks that have a chance of splitting into eight more disks when near an enemy. The split disks will move outward from the point they split from before returning in the player's direction. The split disks have a much shorter duration before disappearing. The disks always inflict the Elemental Mix debuff on hit enemies. Performing a stealth strike with the Elemental Disk causes the next disk thrown to travel slower but

name: Fallen Paladin's Hammer
description: The Fallen Paladin's Hammer is a craftable Hardmode boomerang and an upgrade of the Paladin's Hammer. It throws hammers at a short range that inflict the Brimstone Flames debuff and create small explosions upon striking enemies that inflict On Fire!. Unlike the Paladin's Hammer, the Fallen Paladin's Hammer can pass through walls unhindered. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. The Fallen Paladin's Hammer was previously known as the "True Paladin's Hammer".

name: Icebreaker
description: The Icebreaker is a Hardmode rogue boomerang that is dropped by Cryogen. It throws ice hammers at a long range. The projectiles return to the user after hitting a solid block right by you, or when they reach the end of their throwing range. Multiple projectiles can be thrown at the same time and can phase through tiles while returning to the player. Performing a stealth strike with the Icebreaker causes cosmic explosions to appear on enemy hits. The explosions inflict the Nightwither and Glacial

name: Ancient Crusher
description: The Ancient Crusher is a craftable Hardmode melee weapon. When enemies are hit, it creates spikes that deal additional damage for a few seconds. Spikes that critically hit deal 50% damage. The spikes appear wherever the enemy was hit, making this more effective on stationary or slow-moving targets. Its best modifier is Legendary.

name: Lifehunt Scythe
description: The Lifehunt Scythe is a craftable post-Moon Lord melee weapon. When swung, it fires a short-range projectile that damages enemies on contact, piercing twice before dissipating on the third hit or after 4 seconds. Attacks landed by the scythe itself heal the player for 5 HP per hit. Its best modifier is Legendary. This weapon gets its name from a weapon and spell from the Dark Souls series.

name: Holiday Halberd
description: The Holiday Halberd was a Hardmode melee weapon that dropped from Present Mimics during a Frost Moon. When swung, it created green or red gift bags that bounced on the ground and disappeared after either bouncing or hitting an enemy twice, inflicting Cursed Inferno and On Fire! respectively. There was a 66.67% chance for the bag to be red and 33.33% chance for the bag to be green. These gift bags also created damaging spore clouds of their respective color along their path every 0.25 seconds, wh

name: Essence Flayer
description: The Essence Flayer is a craftable post-Moon Lord melee weapon. When swung, it creates scythe projectiles at a medium range that travel through walls and deal continuous damage for a few seconds. Its projectiles have a weak homing ability. When enemies are killed by the projectiles, healing essence flames are created which restore 8 health to the player on contact. Its best modifier is Legendary.

name: Contagion
description: The Contagion is a craftable post-Moon Lord bow. It fires arrows that leave behind a trail of orbs, exploding after a short delay. Holding left-click will cause the bow to "spin-up", increasing the fire rate appreciably. Both the explosions and projectiles inflict the Plague debuff for varying amounts of time. Its best modifier is Unreal. Holding left-click will cause the Contagion to only consume one arrow, as opposed to consuming multiple arrows due to the "spin up". The word "contagion" refer

name: The Storm
description: If you were looking for something other than the post-Moon Lord bow, see Storm (disambiguation). The Storm is a post-Moon Lord bow that drops from the Storm Weaver. It turns Wooden Arrows into energy bolts that rain down from the sky near the cursor. The bolts that rain down from off-screen are able to go through walls, making this useful in underground or in enclosed spaces. Its best modifier is Unreal. Use this bow against enemies that linger near the top of the screen such as The Devourer of

name: Raider's Glory
description: The Raider's Glory is a Hardmode repeater that has a chance of dropping from Pirate Crossbowers in the Pirate Invasion. The weapon will fire one Ichor Arrow at a time, and will inflict Midas on hit enemies. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Impaler
description: The Impaler is a craftable Hardmode repeater and an upgrade to the Stake Launcher. It rapidly fires fire stakes with a 33.33% chance to fire an exploding stake instead. Exploding stakes pierce 7 enemies and cause explosions on hit, while fire stakes pierce 9 enemies and inflict the On Fire! debuff. Instead of having bonus damage against Vampires like the Stake Launcher, the Impaler will instantly kill Vampires. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Gunk Shot
description: The Gunk Shot is a craftable Pre-Hardmode gun that fires 3-4 bullets in a shotgun pattern. Its best modifier is Unreal. The Gunk Shot shares its name with a Poison-type move from the Pokémon game series. Unlike said move, it can't poison enemies.

name: Fungicide
description: The Fungicide is a Pre-Hardmode gun that has a chance of dropping from Crabulon. When Musket Balls are used as ammo, it fires a fungus bullet that, upon impact with an enemy or tile, splits into smaller spores which are affected by gravity. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: The Hive
description: If you were looking for something other than the launcher, see Hive (disambiguation). The Hive is a Hardmode launcher that has a chance to drop from The Plaguebringer Goliath. Every time it fires, it will shoot 1 of 4 types of rockets, each with varying effects. Its best modifier is Unreal. This weapon is a reference to a rocket launcher of a similar name from Borderlands 2.

name: Astral Blaster
description: The Astral Blaster is a craftable Hardmode gun. When Musket Balls are used for ammo, bullets fired become astral rounds that home in on enemies and inflict the Astral Infection debuff. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Clock Gatlignum
description: The Clock Gatlignum is a Hardmode gun that is a direct upgrade to the Clockwork Assault Rifle, Gatligator, and Venus Magnum. It rapidly fires bullets in 3-round bursts, with each burst having a 33% chance to not consume bullets. Each bullet has a use time of 3. If Musket Balls are used as ammo, bullets fired from the Clock Gatlignum will be converted into High Velocity Bullets. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Conclave Crossfire
description: The Conclave Crossfire is a craftable Hardmode gun and an upgrade to the Tactical Shotgun. It fires two shotgun blasts; one is fired from the gun itself while the other rains from the sky towards the cursor. Shots raining from the sky will not pass through tiles. Its best modifier is Unreal. This weapon is a reference to the Conference Call gun from Borderlands 2, and is referred to by that name in the mod's source files. The weapon directly named Conference Call is referred to as "TrueConferenc

name: Chicken Cannon
description: The Chicken Cannon is a post-Moon Lord launcher that can be dropped by Jungle Dragon, Yharon. It rapidly fires chicken rockets that bounce up when hitting the ground, then explode with a very large radius. The explosion lingers for a few seconds and ignores immunity frames. Right clicking while any rockets are still in the air causes them to instantly explode. Its best modifier is Unreal. The Chicken Cannon's explosions only deal 15% damage to Supreme Calamitas' Supreme Soul Seekers.

name: Shroomer
description: The Shroomer is a craftable Hardmode gun and an upgrade to the Sniper Rifle. It fires bullets at a high velocity along with a translucent mushroom that homes in on and pierces enemies, and deals massive damage. Holding right click will use its "zoom" ability, which scrolls the viewing area of the screen in the direction of the cursor. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Charged Dart Blaster
description: The Charged Dart Blaster is a craftable Hardmode ranged weapon and an upgrade to the Dart Rifle/Dart Pistol. It fires an energy dart that travels very fast and splits into other darts when hitting an enemy or a block alongside a spread of 2 to 4 darts. Right clicking will fire a bouncy explosive dart blast with double damage. Its best modifier is Unreal. The weapon's sprite and function are a reference to the Shredder in Turok 2: Seeds of Evil.

name: Lazhar
description: The Lazhar is a craftable Hardmode magic gun that is the upgraded version of Heat Ray. It rapidly fires explosive heat rays that bounce off of blocks and create small explosions when hitting an enemy. Explosions inflict the On Fire! debuff. Its best modifier is Mythical. But the weapon's mana cost will not be affected. Astrum Deus takes only 75% damage from the Lazhar.

name: Cursed Capper
description: The Cursed Capper is a craftable Hardmode gun and a direct upgrade to the Phoenix Blaster. It transforms bullets into flaming shots that inflict the Cursed Inferno debuff on enemies. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Magna Striker
description: The Magna Striker is a craftable Hardmode gun. Each shot consumes 4 bullets and fires magna blasts in 4-round bursts. Each shot has a use time of 5. The opal shots deal 75% of the weapon's damage, and the magna shots deal full damage. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Nullification Pistol
description: The Nullification Pistol is a Hardmode ranged weapon that has a chance of dropping from the Martian Saucer in the Martian Madness event. It does not use any ammo. Each shot will alter its target in some way, as long as it is not a boss. The following effects can happen at an equal chance: Grow 100% bigger Shrink 50% smaller Deal 10 more contact damage Deal 10 less contact damage Become completely resistant to knockback Remove all knockback resistance Increase defense by 5 Decrease defense by 5 I

name: Proporse Pistol
description: The Proporse Pistol is a Hardmode gun that has a chance to drop from Pirate Deadeyes in the Pirate Invasion. It fires energy blasts that bounce off blocks and pierce through 2 enemies, ignoring some of their immunity frames. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Elemental Blaster
description: The Elemental Blaster is a craftable post-Moon Lord ranged weapon. It rapidly fires rainbow blasts that have slight homing properties. The blasts can travel for a very long range before dissipating. The blasts do not pierce and inflict Brimstone Flames, Frostburn, Plague and Holy Flames for 2 seconds on hit. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: SDFMG
description: The SDFMG (or Space Duke Fishron Machine Gun) is a craftable post-Moon Lord gun and an upgrade to the S.D.M.G. It rapidly fires bullets with a 20% chance to instead fire a water rocket that homes in on enemies. Its best modifier is Unreal. But the weapon's firing speed will not be affected. Its insanely fast rate of fire gives it incredible synergy with the Reaper Tooth Necklace.

name: Svantechnical
description: The Svantechnical is a craftable post-Moon Lord developer gun. It fires a stream of bullets along with firing a large shotgun blast near the cursor. The bullets in the stream have a use time of 2. Holding right click will use its "zoom" ability, which scrolls the viewing area of the screen in the direction of the cursor. Its best modifier is Unreal. Interestingly, there is no shotgun in the crafting recipe, yet the weapon fires a large shotgun blast near the cursor similarly to the Conclave Cros

name: Golden Eagle
description: The Golden Eagle is a post-Moon Lord gun that drops from The Dragonfolly. It rapidly fires bullets in groups of 5 with a small spread. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Dualpoon
description: The Dualpoon is a craftable Hardmode ranged weapon that is the direct upgrade to the Harpoon. It fires two harpoons that are unaffected by gravity. The harpoons travel for a short range before returning to the player. Its best modifier is Unreal. Unlike the Harpoon, the Dualpoon has no visible chains. The weapon is a reference to the Avalon mod's Dual Harpoon.

name: Triploon
description: The Triploon is a craftable Hardmode ranged weapon that is the direct upgrade to the Dualpoon and the final upgrade to the Harpoon. It rapidly fires three harpoons that are unaffected by gravity. The harpoons travel a short distance before returning to the player. Its best modifier is Unreal. Unlike the Harpoon, the Triploon has no visible chains.

name: Meowthrower
description: The Meowthrower is a Hardmode flamethrower that uses gel as ammunition and drops from the Wall of Flesh. It shoots blue and pink flames at a short range and with a more random spread than most flamethrowers. The flames inflict the On Fire! and Frostburn debuffs on contact and pierce infinitely. Upon hitting an enemy, an aesthetic burst of flame occurs, and it makes a meowing sound. Its best modifier is Unreal. This weapon is themed around Meowmere, sharing its pink and blue cat aesthetic and its

name: Spectralstorm Cannon
description: The Spectralstorm Cannon is a craftable Hardmode ranged weapon and an upgrade of the Firestorm Cannon. It inaccurately and rapidly fires three sets of flares and homing lost souls. It consumes flares as ammunition and has a 70% chance of not consuming flares. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Brimstone Flameblaster
description: The Brimstone Flameblaster is a unique Hardmode flamethrower that has a 8.33% (10%) chance to drop from Cataclysm. It fires a Brimstone Ball that bounces off of blocks, ricocheting up to five times before dissipating. This fireball inflicts the Brimstone Flames debuff upon impacting an enemy. Its best modifier is Unreal. The Brimstone Flameblaster differs from other flamethrowers in that it does not fire a defined stream of particles, instead it functions more like the Flower of Fire. Despite th

name: Havoc's Breath
description: The Havoc's Breath is a Hardmode flamethrower that is dropped from Cataclysm. It fires a long-range stream of red flames that inflict the Brimstone Flames debuff. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Blight Spewer
description: The Blight Spewer is a Hardmode flamethrower that has a chance of dropping from The Plaguebringer Goliath. It shoots green flames in a large radius that inflict the Plague debuff. Note that, unlike other flamethrowers, it lacks a chance to not consume gel meaning the player should make sure they do not run out of ammo at an inopportune time. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: God's Bellows
description: God's Bellows is a craftable Hardmode flamethrower that uses gel as ammunition. It shoots a stream of green and purple flames at a long range that pierce indefinitely but do not travel through solid blocks. Its best modifier is Unreal. This item was previously known as "The Empyrean".

name: Harvest Staff
description: The Harvest Staff is a craftable Pre-Hardmode wand. It shoots flaming pumpkins that bounce off of tiles and can pierce one enemy before breaking on the next. The pumpkins disappear after a few seconds. Its projectiles emit a significant amount of light particles that fall down through blocks. This, combined with their physics, makes them ideal for exploring caves and potentially revealing new ones underneath. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Briny Baron
description: The Briny Baron is a Hardmode Legendary broadsword that drops from Duke Fishron in Malice Mode. When used with its primary fire (left-click), it will swing and deal contact damage in a regular manner. Upon striking an enemy, a short-lasting briny typhoon is formed, dealing 50% of the weapon's damage in rapid successions. When used with its secondary fire (right-click), the broadsword itself will not swing but a sharply homing razorblade projectile is thrown out which pierces up to two enemies. I

name: Sea Shell
description: Not to be confused with Seashell, a vanilla item found in the Ocean. The Sea Shell is a Pre-Hardmode accessory dropped by Sea Snails in the Ocean biome. It increases defense by 2 and allows free movement in liquids. Standing in a liquid increases its bonus by 3 defense and additionally gives +5% damage reduction and +15% movement speed. If the player is patient enough to travel to the Ocean and farm Sea Snails, the Sea Shell is a great accessory to use for your first boss battle, as it can provi

name: Mana Jelly
description: The Mana Jelly is a Pre-Hardmode accessory dropped by Blue Jellyfish and Mirage Jelly. It increases the player's maximum mana by 20 and boosts mana regeneration by +4 while standing still. It can be combined with Life Jelly and Vital Jelly in order to craft the Grand Gelatin. The Jellyfish Statue can be used to farm Mana Jelly, which can be quite profitable due to its high drop rates and sell price.

name: Amidias' Spark
description: Amidias' Spark is a Pre-Hardmode accessory dropped by Cnidrions in the Underground Desert. When equipped, the player will release 8 gravity-affected sparks around them when harmed by any source of damage. These sparks linger for 2 seconds, partially ignore immunity frames, and deal 6 damage in Pre-Hardmode which is buffed to 36 in Hardmode. The sparks are able to travel through platforms. The sparks deal melee damage.

name: Vital Jelly
description: The Vital Jelly is a Pre-Hardmode accessory dropped by Green Jellyfish and Mirage Jellies. It increases movement speed and jump speed by 10%. It can be combined with Mana Jelly and Life Jelly in order to craft the Grand Gelatin.

name: Grand Gelatin
description: The Grand Gelatin is a craftable Hardmode accessory that is an upgrade of Life Jelly, Mana Jelly and Vital Jelly. It gives the bonuses of all its ingredients, therefore saving space for more accessory slots. It is later used in crafting The Absorber.

name: Fungal Clump
description: Fungal Clump is an Pre-Hardmode, Expert Mode-exclusive accessory obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped by Crabulon. It summons a free Fungal Clump minion that attaches to enemies, damaging them and spawning blue healing orbs that home in on the player and heal the player for 25% of the damage the clump deals. The healing orbs travel farther if the player is holding a summon weapon. The Fungal Clump occupies no minion slots. The Fungal Clump has a base damage of 10, which can be boosted with the

name: Mana Polarizer
description: The Mana Polarizer is a Pre-Hardmode, Expert Mode-exclusive accessory obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped by the Slime God. It increases the player's maximum mana by 50 and magic damage by 6%. Additionally, striking an enemy with a magic-type projectile will cause a short-lasting heal orb to spawn from an enemy. Upon contact with the player, the orb heals for 20% of the projectile's damage multiplied by the ratio of the player's current mana over their maximum mana. This healing will only wor

name: Void of Calamity
description: The Void of Calamity is a Hardmode, Expert Mode-exclusive accessory that is obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped by Calamitas. It increases the player's damage by 15% and causes brimstone fire to fall from the sky while invincibility is active, such as when the player takes damage, enters the world, or uses a Magic Mirror; however, it also decreases the player's damage reduction by 10%, causing the player to take more damage. The Void of Calamity cannot be equipped if the player is wearing the

name: Soul of Cryogen
description: The Soul of Cryogen is a Hardmode, Expert Mode-exclusive accessory obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped by Cryogen. It is a wing accessory, allowing the player to fly and glide, and grants immunity to fall damage. While flying, the player continuously rains down icicle shards that harm enemies on contact, dealing 25 base damage which is boosted by all class damage boosts. The Soul of Cryogen also increases the damage the player deals by 7%, and causes all of the player's melee attacks to infli

name: Leviathan Ambergris
description: If you were looking for something other than the Leviathan Ambergris, see Leviathan (disambiguation). The Leviathan Ambergris is a Hardmode, Expert Mode-exclusive accessory obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped by the Leviathan and Anahita. It leaves poisonous seawater as the player moves and grants a boosts to damage, defense, and movement speed while submerged in water. If the player is not submerged in liquid, they will receive 5% increased damage and damage reduction. If the player is damag

name: Toxic Heart
description: The Toxic Heart is an Hardmode, Expert Mode-exclusive accessory obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped by The Plaguebringer Goliath. When equipped, it inflicts 50 damage every so often, as well as the Plague debuff, to enemies within an 18.75-tile radius of the player. It makes the player immune to the Plague debuff.

name: Cosmic Discharge
description: The Cosmic Discharge is a post-Moon Lord Legendary flail that is dropped by The Devourer of Gods in Malice Mode. It functions like the Solar Eruption, firing a long spear-like projection from the player's position that quickly retracts. It is capable of striking through walls and generates an explosion on enemy hits for additional damage, as well as granting the player the Cosmic Freeze buff. This buff increases life regeneration while standing still and freezes enemies in a small radius around

name: Craw Carapace
description: The Craw Carapace is a Pre-Hardmode accessory dropped by Crawdads in the Cavern layer. It increases defense by 3, damage reduction by 5%, and makes enemies receive 25% of the damage they deal to player, similar to the Thorns effect. Some worlds may never spawn Crawdads, due to the unique spawn mechanic they share with Salamanders and Giant Shellies, making this item unobtainable there. However, one can still find the Giant Shell and craft The Absorber in these worlds. This item stacks with other

name: Fungal Carapace
description: The Fungal Carapace is a Pre-Hardmode accessory dropped by the Anomura Fungus in the Glowing Mushroom biome. It increases defense by 6 as well as releases 4 floating mushroom spores randomly placed near the player when the player is hit. The mushroom spores explode after 5 seconds, dealing 70 damage. It is used to craft The Absorber. One can create an artificial Surface glowing mushroom biome in order to obtain this accessory during Pre-Hardmode.

name: Giant Tortoise Shell
description: The Giant Tortoise Shell is a Hardmode accessory dropped by Giant Tortoises in the Jungle. When equipped, it decreases movement speed by 10% and reflects 25% of damage back to attackers. This item's effects stacks with other Thorns effects.

name: Radiant Ooze
description: The Radiant Ooze is a Pre-Hardmode accessory. It makes the player emit light and increases the player's life regen by 4 at night. It is used to craft the Ambrosial Ampoule.

name: Archaic Powder
description: The Archaic Powder is a craftable Pre-Hardmode accessory that increases defense by 10, damage reduction by 5%, and mining speed by 20% while the owner is in the Underground, Cavern or Underworld layers.

name: Murky Sludge
description: Not to be confused with Murky Paste, a crafting material dropped by certain Jungle enemies. Murky Sludge is a Pre-Hardmode crafting material that drops from Mother Slimes, Corrupt Slimes and Crimslimes. It is used in the Radiant Ooze accessory, Zerg Potions, and Sludge Splotches. 1-3 Murky Sludge can be obtained from Corrupt and Crimson Crates at a 15% drop chance.

name: Ambrosial Ampoule
description: The Ambrosial Ampoule is a craftable Hardmode accessory that gives the user a wide array of benefits. These include immunity to certain debuffs, increased life regeneration by 4, 6 defense, 7% damage reduction, and making the user emit light. An ampoule is a sealed glass container containing a liquid. The term "ambrosial" refers to ambrosia, the food of the gods in Greek mythology. The Ambrosial Ampoule once also combined the effects of the Archaic Powder and Honey Dew, but these are now standal

name: Demonic Pitchfork
description: The Demonic Pitchfork is a craftable Hardmode wand that fires a demonic pitchfork which pierces up to two enemies. Its best modifier is Mythical. It is possible to get a Demonic Demonic Pitchfork through reforging. The Demonic Pitchfork was implemented based on a community suggestion made by GeekMan on the mod's Terraria Forums post.

name: Icicle Staff
description: The Icicle Staff is a craftable Pre-Hardmode wand. It shoots two icicles from the top of the screen down towards the mouse cursor that break upon contact with an enemy or a block. Its best modifier is Mythical. The projectiles emit a lot of light particles upon impact that travel down through blocks, so can be used to scout for things underground. The item was previously known as "Winter's Fury", a name now used by a Hardmode spell tome. It could be considered a Pre-Hardmode version of the Blizz

name: Sky Glaze
description: The Sky Glaze is a Pre-Hardmode wand obtained rarely from Harpies after defeating the Eye of Cthulhu. It shoots down three feathers from the sky that stick to objects and explode after a few seconds. Note that the feathers that fall directly on the enemy do contact damage. Its best modifier is Mythical. Despite sharing the same design features and color scheme, it is not obtainable at the same point of progression and as such, is comparatively weaker than other Aerialite weapons of its design

name: Bittercold Staff
description: The Bittercold Staff is a Hardmode wand that is dropped by Cryogen. Upon use, the staff shoots 2 to 4 small ice spikes that home on enemies and inflict the Frostburn debuff on contact. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Sun God Staff
description: The Sun God Staff is a craftable Hardmode summon weapon. It summons a Solar God Spirit that continually floats over the player's head and shoots yellow, exploding sun beams at nearby enemies. Unlike most minions, only one Solar God Spirit can be summoned. It is the upgraded version of the Sun Spirit Staff. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, mi

name: Elemental Axe
description: The Elemental Axe is a craftable post-Moon Lord summon weapon. The minion floats around the player and attacks nearby enemies. It will travel through blocks to reach its target. Summoned axes constantly rotate colors. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Elemental Axe has o

name: Vesuvius
description: The Vesuvius is a Hardmode Legendary wand that drops from Ravager in Malice Mode. Its left-click attack is similar to the Meteor Staff; it calls down a swarm of molten asteroids that explode upon hitting a tile or an enemy. Its right-click attack launches several high-speed molten asteroids towards the cursor. Any asteroid that strikes an enemy grants the Molten buff to the user for 6 seconds, which grants resistance to cold attacks similarly to the Warmth Potion. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Cnidrion
description: Not to be confused with Cnidarian, a yoyo made with Victide Bars. Cnidrion is a rare Pre-Hardmode enemy that can spawn in the Surface Desert biome. It will attempt to follow the player while firing a burst of four water blasts every ten seconds. Its firing rate doubles while below 33% / 60% health, and triples while below 10% health. Cnidrion is one of the few enemies that can be detected by the Lifeform Analyzer. It can be a dangerous enemy for Pre-Hardmode players exploring the Desert, due to

name: Storm Dragoon
description: The Storm Dragoon is a post-Moon Lord gun that drops from the Storm Weaver. It fires 5 bullets every volley, with a 90% chance to not consume ammo for each bullet. Each bullet has a use time of 2. Its best modifier is Unreal. Due to its quick fire rate and great damage, it can be used to kill large groups of enemies very quickly when paired with Luminite Bullets.
