Its high chance not to consume ammo allows freer use of expensive or otherwise hard to obtain bullets. For further efficiency, its amm

name: Molten Amputator
description: The Molten Amputator is a post-Moon Lord rogue boomerang that drops from Providence, the Profaned Goddess. Each time the boomerang strikes an enemy, a lava glob flies out from the impact. Lava globs will remain on the ground for quite some time and each glob can damage an enemy once before disappearing. Performing a stealth strike with the Molten Amputator will cause the next scythe thrown to occasionally release Molten Globs as it travels. Additionally, enemies will release more globs when they

name: Hellwing Staff
description: The Hellwing Staff is a craftable Pre-Hardmode wand. Upon use, four non-piercing flaming bats are summoned near the cursor, which are fired in a semi-random, generally downward, direction. These bats can travel through tiles and inflict enemies with the On Fire! debuff on hit. Its best modifier is Mythical. This wand is rather useful for lighting areas on your minimap, to look for chests and ores or to clear world evils using the Clentaminator.

name: Giant Shell
description: The Giant Shell is a Pre-Hardmode accessory dropped by Giant Shellies in the Cavern layer. It increases defense by 6 but decreases movement speed by 15%. When the player is harmed by any source, the player gains a Shell Speed Boost buff that increases movement speed by 90%. Some worlds may never spawn Giant Shellies, due to the unique spawn mechanic they share with Salamanders and Crawdads, making this item unobtainable there. However, one can still find the Craw Carapace and craft The Absorber

name: The Absorber
description: The Absorber is a craftable Hardmode accessory. When equipped, it grants the effects of all its component accessories, along with the added effect of healing the player for 1/20 of the damage from incoming attacks. The item does not grant the speed boost from the Giant Shell or the defense boost from Rover Drive. While all of the ingredients can be obtained as soon as Calamitas is defeated, the Lunatic Cultist must also be defeated to obtain the Ancient Manipulator.

name: Crimson Flask
description: The Crimson Flask is a Pre-Hardmode accessory that increases defense by 3 and damage reduction by 7% while in The Crimson. It is the Crimson counterpart to the Corrupt Flask.

name: Ichor Spear
description: The Ichor Spear is a Hardmode javelin that is rarely dropped by Ichor Stickers. It travels a long distance before being affected by gravity and can pierce one enemy. The Ichor Spear applies the Ichor debuff to all hit enemies. It is the Crimson variant of the Cursed Dagger. Performing a stealth strike with the Ichor Spear causes the resulting javelin to release streams of ichor in random directions as it travels. Its best modifier is Flawless.

name: Magna Cannon
description: The Magna Cannon is a craftable Pre-Hardmode magic gun that fires a blue charge. Despite not being able to penetrate enemies like the Space Gun, it can still be considered a direct upgrade due to the fact that it fires 3 stacked projectiles per shot, effectively tripling its damage output against single targets. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Ancient Bone Dust
description: The Ancient Bone Dust is a Pre-Hardmode crafting material dropped by various Skeleton-type enemies. It is used to make the Archaic Powder, Armor Polish, Calcium Potions, and Crumbling Potions. 5-8 Ancient Bone Dust can additionally be obtained from Iron Crates at a 25% drop chance.

name: Demonic Bone Ash
description: Demonic Bone Ash is a Pre-Hardmode crafting material used to make the Archaic Powder and Zerg Potions. It has a 33.33% / 50% chance to be dropped by Demons and Bone Serpents, and a 100% chance to be dropped by Armored Diggers. 3-5 Demonic Bone Ash can also be obtained from Brimstone Crates at a 100% drop chance.

name: Wrath of the Ancients
description: Not to be confused with Ark of the Ancients, a Hardmode sword. The Wrath of the Ancients is a Hardmode spell tome that drops from Necromancers in the post-Plantera Dungeon. When used, it casts an energy pulse at the mouse cursor, which fires homing spirits at intervals for a significant amount of time. It is later used to craft The Dance of Light. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Tears of Heaven
description: The Tears of Heaven is a craftable Hardmode spell tome that autofires two slow-moving balls of heavenly light that inflict the Holy Flames debuff. The projectiles spread out randomly, travel through walls, and accelerate significantly to home onto enemies. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Coral Spout
description: The Coral Spout is a craftable Pre-Hardmode spell tome. It fires relatively large balls of coral that lay on the ground and damage enemies in a similar fashion to Spiky Balls. These balls of coral will almost immediately halt all horizontal movement after being fired. They can attain large amounts of vertical speed, though, allowing the player to shoot at things above them. Its best modifier is Mythical. But the weapon's mana cost will not be affected.

name: Crawlers
description: "Have you seen those gemstone creatures in the caverns? Their colors are simply breathtaking!" Crawlers are a group of primarily-Pre-Hardmode enemies that are either found in the Underground layer, the Cavern layer, or a specific underground biome, depending on their type. They currently come in eight varieties: One for each of the six gem types, found in either the Underground or Cavern layers depending on gem value. One for Amber, exclusive to the Underground Desert. One for Crystal Shards, ex

name: Draedon's Forge
description: Draedon's Forge is a post-Moon Lord crafting station used to craft end-game items. It counts as a Work Bench, Hardmode Forge, a Cosmic Anvil, a Tinkerer's Workshop, a Table, a Chair, a Demon/Crimson Altar, and an Ancient Manipulator.

name: Astral Ore
description: "The seal of the stars has been broken!" Astral Ore is a Hardmode ore which generates in the world after defeating the Wall of Flesh or Astrum Aureus, converting many blocks around it into the Astral Infection. A Picksaw or a pickaxe of a higher power can mine it, but only if the Astrum Deus boss is defeated. Additionally, after Astrum Deus' defeat, Astral Slimes will begin to drop Astral Ore. Similarly to how Hellstone inflicts Burning, Astral Ore inflicts the Astral Infection debuff on contact

name: Astral Bar
description: Astral Bars are Hardmode bars made with 2 Astral Ore and 3 Stardust per bar. They are primarily used to create Astral-themed gear and are additionally used to craft upgrades to weapons, such as the Radiant Star. As well as being used to craft weapons, Astral Bars are used to craft the Ethereal Core, a consumable that can permanently raise the player's maximum mana. Astral Bars can also be obtained from the Astral Crate once Astrum Deus has been defeated without needing to mine Astral Ore.

name: Mycoroot
description: The Mycoroot is a Pre-Hardmode dagger that is dropped by Crabulon. When used, it auto-fires a continuous stream of short-range fungal roots. The fungal roots cannot pierce enemies, nor can they pass through walls. Performing a stealth strike with the Mycoroot causes a large amount of fungi spores to burst out of the player. These fungi spores home into nearby enemies shortly after. Its best modifier is Flawless. Its insanely fast rate of fire gives it good synergy with the Shark Tooth Necklace a

name: Hyphae Rod
description: The Hyphae Rod is a Pre-Hardmode wand dropped by Crabulon. It creates three hovering mushroom spores near the player that damage enemies. These spores last for 8 seconds before dissipating. Its best modifier is Mythical. This weapon is extremely useful for bosses that can move directly into the spores, such as the Hive Mind and Perforators. Additionally, the spores can be stacked before a boss fight to deal a large amount of damage. Hyphae are long, branching filamentous structures of fungi. The

name: Tome of Fates
description: The Tome of Fates is a craftable Hardmode spell tome. It acts like the Shadowflame Hex Doll, firing curving 'tentacles' at a close range. It has a 14.29% chance to fire a brimstone tentacle instead that deals 150% damage. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Ectoblood
description: Ectoblood is a crafting material that drops from enemies in the post-Plantera Dungeon. Its sole purpose is to craft Ectoplasm.

name: Statis' Blessing
description: If you were looking for another Statis-themed item, see Statis (disambiguation). The Statis' Blessing is a craftable Hardmode accessory that grants the player the following effects: Increased max minions by 2 10% increased summon damage Increased minion knockback Minions inflict the Holy Flames debuff for 5 seconds

name: Statis' Curse
description: If you were looking for another Statis-themed item, see Statis (disambiguation). The Statis' Curse is a craftable Hardmode accessory. It increases the player's max minions by 3, which doesn't stack with downgrades, increases minion damage by 10%, increases minion knockback, and gives minions the ability to inflict the Shadowflame and Holy Flames debuffs on enemy hits for 5 seconds.

name: Artemis Emblem
description: The Artemis Emblem is a Hardmode accessory that grants the player the following effects: 10% increased ranged damage 5% increased ranged critical strike chance 20% reduced ammo usage Defense increased by 5 Life regen increased by 2 15% increased pick speed The Artemis Emblem stacks with the Elemental Quiver, so with both equipped the player can have a total of 25% increased ranged damage, 10% increased ranged crit chance, 36% reduced ammo usage, 10 defense, life regen increased by 4, and 30% inc

name: Chaos Amulet
description: The Chaos Amulet is a craftable Hardmode accessory that grants the player the Spelunker effect, which reveals the location of ores, herbs, chests, etc. It also grants +2 life regen to the player.

name: Revengeance
description: For the difficulty activated by this item, see here. Revengeance is an item placed in a newly spawned player's inventory. Upon being used in Expert Mode, it activates or disables Revengeance Mode. Attempting to use it in Normal Mode or during a boss battle will have no effects. It can be crafted at an Altar and does not have any ingredients. In previous versions of the mod, using the item during a boss fight instantly killed the player with the message, "<Player> tried to change the rules.", as

name: Snowstorm Staff
description: The Snowstorm Staff is a Hardmode wand that is dropped by Cryogen. When used, it spawns a large flying snowflake that is controlled with the cursor, oscillating back and forth in a manner similar to Flying Knife. The snowflake can pass through walls and pierce infinite enemies, but will disappear after 8 seconds. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Plague Staff
description: The Plague Staff is a Hardmode wand dropped by The Plaguebringer Goliath. It shoots out 6-8 plague fangs, which are colored green and are trailed by pink light. The player can tighten the spread of the projectiles by aiming the cursor further away. All the fangs can pierce an enemy at the same time, and they can pierce through 5 enemies. On hit, they inflict the Plague debuff. Its best modifier is Mythical. This weapon can be considered a successor to the Venom Staff, as it has a similar method

name: Crystal Flare Staff
description: The Crystal Flare Staff is a craftable Hardmode wand. It shoots two frost flames that gradually fade in, which explodes on contact with anything, producing a large, blue explosion. Any enemy hit by the projectile or resulting explosion will be inflicted with the Frostburn debuff. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Hell Burst
description: The Hell Burst is a craftable Hardmode wand that is a direct upgrade to the Crystal Vile Shard. It shoots out a consecutive chain of large fire spikes, which lingers for a second and inflicts the On Fire! debuff to enemies on contact. The projectile can hit any enemy up to eight times before disappearing. Its best modifier is Mythical. Aquatic Scourge takes only 90% damage from the Hell Burst. The Hell Burst was implemented based on a community suggestion made by Gouvod on the mod's Terraria For

name: Infernal Rift
description: The Infernal Rift is a craftable Hardmode wand that is an upgrade to the Sky Fracture. It shoots out four red tridents, which, after striking a target, summon more red tridents from off-screen that fly straight towards the hit target. Upon contact with any of these projectiles, the Brimstone Flames debuff is inflicted. The Infernal Rift has a base critical strike chance of 29%, as opposed to the usual 4% of weapons. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Eidolon Staff
description: The Eidolon Staff is a Hardmode wand that drops from the Lunatic Cultist in Malice Mode. It fires either blue stars or an ice ball that acts like the Lunatic Cultist's. The ice ball, on contact with an enemy, spawn several more ice balls, which remain stationary on the enemy until it is killed. Its best modifier is Mythical. Astrum Deus takes only 75% damage from the Eidolon Staff's ice balls. The name and appearance of this weapon is a reference to the Eidolon Wyrm. The weapon was previously kn

name: Vehemence
description: The Vehemence is a post-Moon Lord wand dropped by Supreme Calamitas. It fires a high-velocity hellish bolt that explodes into skulls on contact with enemies or tiles. Direct hits with the main projectile inflict the Demon Flames debuff for 30 seconds. Its best modifier is Mythical. Vehemence means "the display of strong feeling or passion". In previous versions of the Calamity Mod, the Vehemence used to drop from the Wall of Flesh in Prepare to Die mode. In the mod's source files, the Vehemence

name: Gleaming Magnolia
description: The Gleaming Magnolia is a craftable Hardmode wand which is a direct upgrade to the Mana Rose. It casts a bright white-pink flower that decelerates into a complete stop. After 4.17 seconds have passed or upon contact with any enemy or blocks, it will explode into an even spread of six damaging small petals. The petals behave similarly to the main projectile, lasting two seconds before fading away, and dealing 75% of the main damage. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Asteroid Staff
description: The Asteroid Staff is a craftable post-Moon Lord wand. It is a direct upgrade of the Meteor Staff, raining 2 to 3 glowing meteors with green trails from the sky upon use. The meteors fall in the direction of the cursor and explode upon contact with anything, dealing damage to nearby enemies. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Phantasmal Fury
description: Not to be confused with Phantasmal Ruin, a similarly-themed rogue weapon. The Phantasmal Fury is a craftable post-Moon Lord wand that is an upgraded version of the Spectre Staff. The main shot leaves a trail of smaller bolts similar to the Spectre Staff. These bolts quickly home in on enemies within range. When the main shot impacts an enemy or block, it explodes into 8 bolts. Its best modifier is Mythical. The Phantasmal Fury is similar to the Venusian Trident and Shadowbolt Staff in that they

name: Shadowbolt Staff
description: The Shadowbolt Staff is a craftable post-Moon Lord wand that is an upgraded version of the Shadowbeam Staff. It shoots a beam of purple light, which bounces 8 times before disappearing. With every bounce, the damage is increased by 15%. With every enemy pierced, the damage is increased by 10%. Its best modifier is Mythical. The Shadowbolt Staff is similar to the Phantasmal Fury and Venusian Trident in that they are all crafted using a Sentinel drop and Ruinous Souls, and directly upgrade post-Pl

name: Soul Piercer
description: The Soul Piercer is a craftable post-Moon Lord wand. When used, it fires a long-range beam that, upon hitting any enemy, summons 3 additional short-range beams from nearby which shoot through the same enemy. Both beam types travel instantly, pierce infinitely, cannot pass through tiles, and partially ignore enemy immunity frames. Because of their i-frame ignoring properties and the fact that short lasers are summoned every time the main laser lands a hit, an incredibly large amount of lasers may

name: Arch Amaryllis
description: The Arch Amaryllis is a craftable Hardmode wand that is an upgraded version of the Gleaming Magnolia. It fires a red flower that pierces infinitely and slows down horizontally more quickly than it does vertically, causing it to travel in an upwards or downwards curve depending on the direction it's fired. After two seconds, or upon hitting a block, the main projectile splits into six homing petals. The petals last two seconds before fading away, and deal 75% of the main damage. Its best modifier

name: Plasma Rifle
description: The Plasma Rifle is a craftable post-Moon Lord magic gun. Using the left mouse button fires an explosive plasma blast that creates toxic clouds upon contact with an enemy or a block, while using the right mouse button rapidly fires plasma-like bullets. Its best modifier is Mythical. The weapon's name, sprite and function are a reference to the weapon of the same name in Turok 2: Seeds of Evil.

name: Nano Purge
description: The Nano Purge is a craftable Hardmode magic gun. It is a direct upgrade from the Laser Machinegun, dealing higher damage and spinning up faster. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Purge Guzzler
description: The Purge Guzzler is a post-Moon Lord magic gun dropped by Providence, the Profaned Goddess. It fires a spread of 3 holy beams, which can pierce two enemies. Each enemy hit spawns an explosion which inflicts the On Fire! debuff. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: The Swarmer
description: The Swarmer is a craftable Hardmode magic gun and is the upgrade to both the Bee Gun and the Wasp Gun. Like its predecessors, it rapidly fires homing bees that dissipate upon damaging enemies and touching tiles. Its best modifier is Mythical. But the weapon's knockback will not be affected due to already being 0. The Plague Hive is a good accessory to use with this weapon due to the high amount of bee projectiles having their damage increased.

name: Lazinator
description: The Lazinator is a craftable Hardmode magic gun. When used, it automatically rapidly fires a straight, gravity-defying purple or green laser projectile. Green lasers are very slightly shorter and slower than purple ones. Each lasers pierce up to two targets before disappearing on the third. Its best modifier is Mythical. But the weapon's mana cost will not be affected. The Lazinator's model and name are a reference to the Zapinator, which in turn is a reference to a light gun peripheral for the

name: Effervescence
description: Not to be confused with Vortexpopper, a ranged weapon that also fires bubbles. Effervescence is a craftable post-Moon Lord magic gun. It fires a spread of four purple bubbles that travel in a straight line before simultaneously erupting into three blue bubbles each; the blue bubbles travel in the same direction as the purple bubbles and linger before popping. The purple bubbles can pierce infinitely while the blue bubbles pop upon contacting an enemy and have slight homing properties; additional

name: Honey Dew
description: The Honey Dew is a craftable Hardmode accessory. It grants various defensive boosts while in the Jungle biome while providing immunity to the Poisoned and Venom debuffs and giving the effect of the Honey buff anywhere. Additionally, the player receives 25% less damage from most bees, hornets, and their projectiles. The effects of honey life regen provided by Honey Dew will not stack with the Honey buff that a player gets when standing in honey.

name: Living Dew
description: The Living Dew is a craftable Pre-Hardmode accessory that grants immunity to the Poisoned debuff, increases defense by 5, damage reduction by 5%, and life regen by 2 while in the Jungle. It is used to make the Honey Dew.

name: Maneater Bulb
description: The Maneater Bulb was a Pre-Hardmode crafting material dropped by Man Eaters. Additionally, it was possible to obtain 1-3 Maneater Bulbs from Jungle Crates at a 20% chance. It was used to craft the Living Dew and Portabulb.

name: Trapper Bulb
description: The Trapper Bulb is a Hardmode crafting material dropped by Angry Trappers. It is used to craft the Honey Dew, Miracle Fruit, Photosynthesis Potion, and the Portabulb. 1-3 Trapper Bulbs can be obtained from Jungle Crates at a 20% chance in Hardmode.

name: Murky Paste
description: Not to be confused with Murky Sludge, a crafting material dropped by certain slimes. Murky Paste is a Pre-Hardmode crafting material dropped by Arapaimas and Spiked Jungle Slimes. It is used to craft Bezoar, Living Dew and the Portabulb. 1-3 Murky Pastes can be obtained from Jungle Crates at a 15% chance.

name: Gypsy Powder
description: The Gypsy Powder was a Hardmode crafting material dropped by Moths, and was also sold by the Witch Doctor for 10 after Golem was defeated.

name: Beetle Juice
description: Beetle Juice is a Hardmode crafting material dropped by Derplings. It is used to craft Honey Dew, Photosynthesis Potions, and Vitamins. 1-3 Beetle Juices can be obtained from Jungle Crates at a 20% chance in Hardmode. This item's name is a reference to the 1988 film Beetlejuice.

name: Exodus Wings
description: Exodus Wings are a Post-Moon Lord wing-type accessory that allow the player to fly and glide. If these wings are worn along with Empyrean armor, the player's rogue damage and critical strike chance are increased by 5%. Exodus Wings were previously known as "Xeroc Wings".

name: The Sponge
description: The Sponge is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory that provides the following bonuses: 20 defense +30 max life and mana 15% increased damage reduction 5% increased movement speed 5% increased jump speed 6.25% of incoming damage from enemies is converted into healing Standing still boosts life and mana regeneration Water physics are ignored Increased defense by 5, damage reduction by 10% and movement speed by 20% while submerged in liquid Enemies are damaged on contact Emit mushroom spores when

name: Corrupt Flask
description: The Corrupt Flask is a Pre-Hardmode accessory that increases defense by 3 and damage reduction by 7% while in The Corruption. It is the Corruption counterpart to the Crimson Flask.

name: Death Valley Duster
description: The Death Valley Duster is a craftable Hardmode spell tome. It casts a large blast of damaging dust particles, which extend a short distance past the player, and are about as tall as the player. The particles can travel through tiles and pierce enemies infinitely. Its best modifier is Mythical. The name is a reference to the real-life desert Death Valley, one of the hottest locations on Earth.

name: Atlantis
description: The Atlantis is a Hardmode wand which is dropped by the Leviathan and Anahita. It shoots halberds which pierce and travel through walls, in a distinct pattern consisting of one halberd in a straight line, then two halberd connected in the shape of a V, heading outwards from the player in a straight line. Its best modifier is Mythical. The name "Atlantis" originates from a fictional island of the same name from dialogues written by the Athenian philosopher, Plato. This weapon appears to be a halb

name: Everglade Spray
description: The Everglade Spray is a craftable Hardmode spell tome that is an upgrade to the Golden Shower. It shoots out a stream similar to the Golden Shower, but inflicting the Cursed Inferno debuff as well as the Ichor debuff. Its best modifier is Mythical. The Everglades is a natural region of tropical wetlands located within the United States of America.

name: Nuclear Fury
description: The Nuclear Fury is a craftable post-Moon Lord spell tome that is a direct upgrade to the Razorblade Typhoon. It shoots out 8 cosmic typhoons evenly distributed in a circle around the player. These projectiles can pass through walls and home in on any enemy in range, though they will not actively target enemies behind walls or when the projectile itself is in a wall. Its best modifier is Mythical. The Nuclear Fury only deals 50% damage to Ceaseless Void's Dark Energies. An item of the same name

name: Primordial Earth
description: The Primordial Earth is a craftable Hardmode spell tome. It is a direct upgrade to the Death Valley Duster, firing dust blows with a greater area of effect and dealing higher DPS. The dust blows can pass through tiles and burst into explosions of dust upon hitting an enemy, which each last for about a second and deal damage on contact. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Exoblade
description: The Exoblade is a craftable post-Moon Lord endgame broadsword that auto-swings. It has one of the most complex crafting trees of all swords in the Calamity Mod. On swing, it fires a projectile which, after 1.33 seconds, will home in on the player, instead of on other enemies. When homing it will only go down and strafe to match vertical position with the player. The projectile, when impacting an enemy or tile, explodes. Hitting an enemy directly with the blade itself will summon 2-3 comet bolts

name: Elysian Tracers
description: The Elysian Tracers are a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory that count as Wings and are an upgraded version of the Seraph Tracers. Along with all the effects of the Seraph Tracers, wearing these boots boosts maximum movement speed and acceleration by 5%, allowing the player to reach up to 53 mph while running. Despite being an upgrade to the Angel Treads, Elysian Tracers do not inherit the Rocket Boots nor Harpy Ring. The lava immunity stacks with the Lava Charm, Lava Waders and Angel Treads.

name: Elysian Wings
description: Elysian Wings are a post-Moon Lord wing-type accessory that allow the player to fly and glide, dropped by Providence, the Profaned Goddess when summoned in the Hallow. It grants temporary immunity to lava, 15% increased movement speed, and heat protection in Death Mode.

name: Lashes of Chaos
description: The Lashes of Chaos is a Hardmode spell tome that is dropped by Calamitas. It shoots out a blast of brimstone, which pierces once and inflicts the Brimstone Flames debuff. On impact with an object, the brimstone blast explodes, lasting for about 1 second. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Shadecrystal Barrage
description: The Shadecrystal Barrage is a craftable Hardmode spell tome. When used it fires an inaccurate storm of purple crystals that inflict the Frostburn debuff to any enemies hit. Each use has a chance to fire two crystals instead of one. Unlike Crystal Storm, the crystals produced by this weapon will never ricochet off walls. Its best modifier is Mythical. But the weapon's mana cost will not be affected. While its damage is less than the Crystal Storm, it makes up for it with increased fire rate, knoc

name: Seething Discharge
description: The Seething Discharge is a Hardmode spell tome dropped by the Brimstone Elemental. It fires a large blast of brimstone and two smaller projectiles, similar to the attack performed by the Brimstone Elemental while in her rose. The attack has a mild spread and travels through blocks. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Forbidden Sun
description: The Forbidden Sun is a craftable Hardmode spell tome. Similarly to the Venusian Trident, it shoots out a fireball that, upon contact with either a tile or an enemy, creates an explosion of cream-colored particles. The explosion lingers for two seconds, dealing rapid damage to any enemy caught in its radius. The explosion can inflict damage to enemies behind tiles and can damage an unlimited amount of enemies. If the projectile hits less than 4 blocks away from liquid, the explosion will not occu

name: Biofusillade
description: The Biofusillade is a craftable post-Moon Lord spell tome. It rapidly shoots green laser projectiles that can pierce twice. Its best modifier is Godly or Mythical. The Mythical modifier cannot affect use time nor mana cost, making it identical to Godly. The word "fusillade" refers to a barrage or bombardment; numerous projectiles being fired simultaneously or in quick succession. The weapon was previously called Gamma Fusillade and is still referred to as such in the source files.

name: Rouge Slash
description: The Rouge Slash is a post-Moon Lord spell tome dropped by The Dragonfolly. It fires three curved projectiles out from the player, which each vary in their size and speed and will pass through blocks. The projectiles will each pierce an enemy one time and will disappear upon contact with a second. Its best modifier is Mythical. This weapon is a reference to the Avalon mod's Giga Horn which shoots a soundwave that slows down over time.

name: Subsuming Vortex
description: The Subsuming Vortex is a craftable post-Moon Lord spell tome that, on use, fires a large rainbow vortex towards the player’s cursor that damages enemies. If any enemies are nearby, the vortex will travel towards an enemy regardless of the position of the cursor. While traveling, the large vortex will occasionally release homing tentacles that will surround nearby enemies and linger for six seconds. While lingering, tentacles travel in an infinity pattern, dealing damage to all nearby enemies. A

name: Relic of Ruin
description: The Relic of Ruin is a craftable Hardmode spell tome. When used, it fires out 12 spinning blades in a circle from the player, which home in on nearby enemies. The blades are grouped roughly in pairs, with each pair being varying distances apart, and fly away from the player while synchronously alternating between very high speed to very low speed, rather than a continuous motion. The blades neither pierce nor pass through blocks. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Solar Flare
description: For the vanilla armor set, see Solar Flare armor. The Solar Flare is a post-Moon Lord yoyo dropped by Providence, the Profaned Goddess. Every impact with an enemy will produce a large explosion of embers that deal 75% of the weapon's damage and inflict the Holy Flames debuff. Unlike other yoyos, the Solar Flare ignores NPC immunity frames, allowing it to rapidly bounce off of enemies and inflict much more damage than its damage stat would indicate. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modif

name: Miracle Fruit
description: The Miracle Fruit is a craftable Hardmode permanent power-up item that increases the player's maximum life, as an extension to Life Fruits. There are 3 other items that function identically to this: the Blood Orange, the Elderberry, and the Dragonfruit. It is the second of these to be obtainable following boss progression. It can only be used once, and after that the player must use one of the remaining fruit to increase their maximum life. With all of these, the player's maximum life is capped

name: Elderberry
description: For the vanilla item of the same name, see here. The Elderberry is a craftable post-Moon Lord permanent power-up item that increases the player's maximum life, as an extension to Life Fruits. There are 3 other items that function identically to this: the Blood Orange, the Miracle Fruit, and the Dragonfruit. It is the third of these to be obtainable following boss progression. It can only be used once, and after that the player must use one of the remaining fruit to increase their maximum life. W

name: Blood Orange
description: For the vanilla item of the same name, see here. The Blood Orange is a craftable Hardmode permanent power-up item that increases the player's maximum life, as an extension to Life Fruits. There are 3 other items that function identically to this: the Miracle Fruit, the Elderberry, and the Dragonfruit. It is the first of these to be obtainable following boss progression. It can only be used once, and after that the player must use one of the remaining fruit to increase their maximum life. With al

name: Dragonfruit
description: For the vanilla item of a similar name, see here. The Dragonfruit is a craftable post-Moon Lord permanent power-up item that increases the player's maximum life, as an extension to Life Fruits. There are 3 other items that function identically to this: the Blood Orange, the Miracle Fruit, and the Elderberry. It is the last of these to be obtainable following boss progression. It can only be used once, and after that the player must use one of the remaining fruit to increase their maximum life. W

name: Phantoplasm
description: Phantoplasm is a post-Moon Lord crafting material dropped by Phantom Spirits, Overloaded Soldiers and Phantom Debris. It is mostly used to craft post-Devourer of Gods items, as well as Bloodstone Cores and Ascendant Spirit Essences. 1-5 Phantoplasm can be obtained from Dungeon Crates at a 10% chance once Moon Lord has been defeated. Phantoplasm is a reference to the item of the same name from the Exxo Avalon mod.

name: Moonlight
description: The Moonlight was a Hardmode tool and the counterpart to Daylight, moving the clock to night when it is day, "summoning" the moon. It could only be used during the day. It could not be used when any boss is alive. It could be used to skip or end a Solar Eclipse.

name: Cosmolight
description: Not to be confused with Cosmilite Bar, a crafting material dropped by The Devourer of Gods. The Cosmolight is a Hardmode tool. Upon use, it instantly changes the time to 7:30 PM when it is daytime or to 4:30 AM when it is nighttime. It cannot be used when any boss is alive. It cannot be used to trigger events like the Goblin Army, Solar Eclipse, or Blood Moon. Despite this, it can be used to skip events. It cannot be used to change the Angler's current fishing quest. It cannot be used to reset t

name: Daylight
description: The Daylight was a Hardmode tool and the counterpart to Moonlight, moving the clock to day when it was night, "summoning" the sun. It could only be used during the night. It could not be used when any boss is alive. It could be used to skip or end events like the Blood Moon, Frost Moon or the Pumpkin Moon.

name: Starlight Wings
description: Starlight Wings are a Hardmode wing-type accessory that allow the player to fly and glide. If these wings are worn along with Daedalus armor with any Daedalus headpiece, the player's damage and critical strike chance are increased by 5%.

name: Aureate Booster
description: The Aureate Booster is a Hardmode wing-type accessory that allows the player to fly and glide. If these wings are worn along with Reaver armor with any Reaver headpiece, the player's movement speed is increased by 10%. These wings are notable for their great horizontal speed and acceleration, but they have a very poor flight time compared to other options. The Aureate Booster previously looked like a pair of wings, and its previous name was "Aureate Wings".

name: Tarragon Wings
description: Tarragon Wings are a post-Moon Lord wing-type accessory that allow the player to fly and glide. If these wings are worn along with Tarragon armor with any Tarragon headpiece, the player is granted 15 defense and life regeneration is increased by 2.

name: Drew's Wings
description: Drew's Wings are a post-Moon Lord wing-type accessory that allow the player to fly and glide, dropped by Jungle Dragon, Yharon. They are incredibly powerful wings with the best raw flight stats in the game. They are used in crafting the Celestial Tracers. The flight stats of Drew's Wings are near-identical to that of Celestial Tracers, except that Drew's Wings have superior flight time by a value of 111 frames. However, Celestial Tracers has improved horizontal acceleration compared to Drew's Wi

name: Pwnagehammer
description: The Pwnagehammer is a craftable Hardmode melee weapon. It throws a slow-moving gravity-affected hammer which cannot pass through tiles and will travel a short distance before falling. The hammer has a 20% chance to home in on enemies; homing hammers will spawn an additional homing spectral hammer upon hitting an enemy. All hammer projectiles explode and damage nearby targets; the normal hammer deals 75% damage, the homing hammer deals 125% damage and will always critically hit, the spectral hamm

name: Brackish Flask
description: The Brackish Flask is a Hardmode bomb, that is dropped by the Leviathan and Anahita. When used, it is thrown from the player at a medium velocity and with a heavy gravity-affected arc. Once it collides with an object, it shatters and releases 8 seawater blasts in all directions, which then explode into damaging clouds after traveling a short distance or impacting enemies or tiles. All of these projectiles deal 50% of the flask's damage, and inflict the Poisoned and Venom debuffs. Performing a st

name: Wulfrum armor
description: Wulfrum armor is a craftable Pre-Hardmode armor set crafted from Wulfrum Metal Scraps and Energy Cores. It takes a total of 25 Wulfrum Metal Scraps and 3 Energy Cores to make one full set, or 45 and 7 respectively to make every piece. It consists of a Wulfrum Armor, Wulfrum Leggings and one of five different headpieces: Wulfrum Helm, Wulfrum Headgear, Wulfrum Visage, Wulfrum Helmet, or Wulfrum Mask. Each headpiece provides different stats, but they all have the same set bonus. The Wulfrum Armor

name: Wulfrum Metal Scrap
description: Wulfrum Metal Scraps are Pre-Hardmode crafting materials dropped by Wulfrum Enemies. They are used solely to craft the Wulfrum-tier items. 3-5 Wulfrum Metal Scraps can be obtained from Wooden Crates and 5-8 Wulfrum Metal Scraps can be obtained from Iron Crates at a 25% drop chance. The word "Wulfrum" is a modification of "wolfram", the alternate name for Tungsten. Wulfrum Metal Scraps were previously named "Wulfrum Shards".

name: Cursed Dagger
description: The Cursed Dagger is a Hardmode non-consumable dagger that is dropped by Clingers. It inflicts Cursed Inferno to any enemies hit and can pierce through 2 enemies or bounce twice off of tiles. It disappears upon its third impact. Like the Shadowflame Knife, it is heavily affected by gravity. It is the Corruption counterpart to the Ichor Spear. Performing a stealth strike with the Cursed Dagger causes the resulting dagger to release gravity-affected sparks and balls of Cursed Flames as it travels.

name: Gel Dart
description: Gel Darts are Pre-Hardmode daggers that are purchased from the Bandit for 2 50 each after The Slime God has been defeated. They start falling after travelling a short distance. They pierce up to three enemies or bounce off tiles three times before breaking on the fourth impact. They have a 50% chance of being recovered after being thrown. Performing a stealth strike with Gel Darts cause the resulting dart to ignore gravity, bounce farther and faster upon tile collision, pierce or bounce an addit

name: Death Whistle
description: The Death Whistle is a craftable Hardmode item used to summon the Ravager boss anywhere on the Surface at any time. A death whistle was an instrument historically used by the Aztecs during wars, known for its shrill frightening sound. The sound of the Death Whistle item being used is an unused roar in vanilla Terraria's files. It was chosen due to its resemblance to the sound of a real death whistle. The sound is also played when the Ravager spawns in Boss Rush. This item used to be known as the

name: Starcore
description: The Starcore is a craftable Hardmode item. Interacting with the Astral Beacon at night with the Starcore in the player's inventory will summon the Astrum Deus boss. This item is only accessible after the boss has already been defeated; before defeating Astrum Deus, consumable Titan Hearts must be used instead. The Starcore is not consumed upon use; therefore, it can be used as many times as the player desires.

name: Astrum Deus
description: "A star-spawned horror tunnels through the astral infection." Not to be confused with Astrum Aureus, a similarly-themed cyborg boss. Astrum Deus is a Hardmode boss that must be defeated in order to allow Astral Ore to be mined. It begins as a large worm, similar to The Destroyer, but splits later in the fight. Astrum Deus does not spawn on its own and can be summoned by using the Astral Beacon with a Titan Heart or Starcore in the inventory at night. Astrum Deus can be spawned even in early Hard

name: Cosmic Rainbow
description: If you were looking for something other than the magic weapon, see Cosmic (disambiguation). The Cosmic Rainbow is a craftable Hardmode magic weapon. When fired, it spawns 3 rainbows in the direction of the cursor in a similar manner as an arrow flying out of a bow. Additionally, 2 more rainbows fall from the sky at random locations within the vicinity of the cursor. These rainbows deal constant damage to any entity that collides with them. Its best modifier is Mythical. But the weapon's knockbac

name: Ice Star
description: Ice Stars are Hardmode rogue weapons sold by the Archmage NPC. They are large throwing stars made of ice, which pierce 3 times and will fall after traveling a short distance. They are stackable and cannot be recovered after impacting the ground. Ice Stars also have slight homing abilities. Performing a stealth strike with Ice Stars will cause the next star thrown to pierce infinitely for four seconds before disappearing, and release rings of 8 smaller ice stars on enemy hits. The smaller ice sta

name: Shard of Antumbra
description: Shards of Antumbra are craftable Hardmode rogue javelins. They pierce infinitely and travel significant distances before being affected by gravity. Their damage is halved every time they pierce an enemy. They have a 50% chance of being recovered after being thrown. Performing a stealth strike with a Shard of Antumbra will cause it to release slowly spinning homing stars as it travels. These stars will slowly move in the direction the spear was traveling when they spawned, until they slowly fade

name: Tarragon Throwing Dart
description: Tarragon Throwing Darts are craftable post-Moon Lord daggers. They fire a long, spear-like projectile which pierces twice. They travel a significantly further distance than most other thrown items. They have a 50% chance of being recovered after being thrown. Performing a stealth strike with Tarragon Throwing Darts causes a circle of eight thorns to encircle enemies on the resulting hit. Each thorn deals 25% of the dart's damage. The Tarragon Throwing Dart cannot be reforged, and therefore canno

name: Energy Staff
description: The Energy Staff is a post-Moon Lord sentry dropped by Impious Immolators. When used, it summons a stationary Impious Immolator sentry that rapidly fires homing sparks of energy at the nearest enemy. Only one can be summoned at a time. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical E

name: Orichalcum Spiked Gemstone
description: Orichalcum Spiked Gemstones are craftable Hardmode daggers crafted from Orichalcum Bars. They fire a pink colored knife, which travel a short distance before being affected by gravity. However, once it reaches the ground, it will roll further until it hits a wall or stops. The knives pierce up to 5 times before dissipating on the sixth hit, spawning fast moving petals to fly from the side of the screen on each hit. They have a 50% chance of being recovered after being thrown. Performing a stealt

name: Adamantite Throwing Axe
description: Adamantite Throwing Axes are craftable Hardmode rogue weapons made from Adamantite Bars. It fires a consumable throwing axe which pierces infinitely and travels a short distance before being affected by gravity. They have a 50% chance of being recovered after being thrown. Performing a stealth strike with an Adamantite Throwing Axe will cause the projectile to summon three homing lightning bolts from the bottom of the screen upon hitting an enemy. The Adamantite Throwing Axe cannot be reforged,

name: Palladium Javelin
description: Palladium Javelins are craftable Hardmode javelins made from Palladium Bars. They fire a javelin made from palladium, which pierces infinitely, travels a moderate distance before being affected by gravity. They have a 50% chance of being recovered after being thrown. Performing a stealth strike with a Palladium Javelin will cause it to split twice after a short time, resulting in four javelins. The Palladium Javelin cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers.

name: Crystal Piercer
description: Crystal Piercers are craftable Hardmode javelins. They are spear-like projectiles that pierce indefinitely and inflict the Frostburn debuff on contact. They travel a short distance before being affected by gravity. They have a 50% chance of being recovered after being destroyed. Performing a stealth strike with Crystal Piercer causes the resulting javelin to fly through tiles, completely ignore gravity, and summon crystal shards alongside itself as it flies. The Crystal Piercer cannot be reforge

name: Venusian Trident
description: The Venusian Trident is a craftable post-Moon Lord wand that is an upgraded version of the Inferno Fork. It shoots out a fiery trident which erupts into a giant explosion with a radius slightly larger than Explosives upon impacting any tile or enemy. Each explosion emits four to nine cinders which fall to the floor and deal contact damage. The explosion lingers for about 2 seconds and inflicts the On Fire! debuff. Each cinder deals 75% of the weapon's damage. Its best modifier is Mythical. The V

name: Spear of Paleolith
description: The Spear of Paleolith is a craftable Hardmode non-consumable javelin. It automatically throws high-velocity spears which travel extremely far before being affected by gravity. These spears do not pierce through enemies, but they rain down fossil shards while traveling similar to the North Pole. The fossil shards deal half the damage of the spear. Any enemy hit by the spear or the fossil shards will be inflicted with Armor Crunch. Performing a stealth strike with the Spear of Paleolith will caus

name: Mythril Knife
description: Mythril Knives are craftable Hardmode daggers made from Mythril Bars. They fire a knife which travels a short distance before being affected by gravity. They have a 50% chance of being recovered after being thrown. Performing a stealth strike with Mythril Knives will cause the knife to apply a variety of debuffs for 5 seconds. These include Cursed Inferno, Venom, Armor Crunch, Irradiated, and God Slayer Inferno. On enemies, these combined debuffs cause the target to lose 147 health per second, 2

name: Cobalt Kunai
description: Cobalt Kunais are craftable consumable Hardmode daggers made from Cobalt Bars. They can pierce twice and travel a short distance before being affected by gravity. They have a 50% chance of being recovered after being thrown. Performing a stealth strike with a Cobalt Kunai causes three homing cobalt energy bolts to be released instead, that ignore gravity and can pierce twice. The bolts deal 140% damage each. The Cobalt Kunai cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers.

name: Ravager
description: "The flesh golem constructed using twisted necromancy..." The Ravager is a Hardmode boss that can be fought anywhere on the Surface. On top of dropping a unique set of weapons and accessories, its purpose is to act as an efficient, though not necessarily easy, means of acquiring Life Alloys, Cores of Calamity, and other materials via Fleshy Geodes. This boss receives a significant buff after Providence, the Profaned Goddess has been defeated, and it will begin to drop large amounts of Bloodstone

name: Astral Chunk
description: The Astral Chunk is a craftable Hardmode item used to summon the Astrum Aureus boss. It can only be used on the Surface Astral Infection during Night. The item was previously used to summon the Astrageldon Slime at nighttime, before it was replaced by Astrum Aureus.

name: Astrageldon Slime
description: "A titanic slime infected by a star-borne disease..." The Astrageldon Slime was a Hardmode boss that has been replaced by Astrum Aureus. Defeating it caused an Astral Meteor to fall somewhere in the world. After defeating the Moon Lord, the Astrageldon Slime began to drop Lunar Fragments. Additionally in Revengeance Mode or Death Mode, the Astrageldon Slime increased substantially in difficulty, increasing health and damage, and began to drop the Suspicious Looking Jelly Bean. The Astrageldon Sl

name: Astral Bulwark
description: The Astral Bulwark is an Hardmode, Expert Mode-exclusive accessory obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped by Astrum Deus, which causes five stars to drop from the sky when the player is hit. It also grants immunity from the Astral Infection debuff, which is inflicted by enemies in the Astral Infection biome.

name: Arcanum of the Void
description: The Arcanum of the Void is an Expert Mode-exclusive post-Moon Lord accessory that is obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped by Ceaseless Void. It grants the ability to reflect some projectiles, such as arrows or magic bolts, which doesn't damage the player. This effect can only occur every 90 seconds.

name: Wulfrum Blade
description: The Wulfrum Blade is a craftable Pre-Hardmode broadsword that autoswings. Its best modifier is Legendary. The early availability and autoswing feature make it a viable choice for early Pre-Hardmode.

name: Wulfrum Bow
description: The Wulfrum Bow is a craftable pre-Hardmode bow that is crafted with Wulfrum Metal Scraps. Its best modifier is Unreal. It is a good ranged weapon choice in early pre-Hardmode since it has decent damage for the level of progression.

name: Wulfrum Staff
description: The Wulfrum Staff is a craftable Pre-Hardmode wand. It shoots slow moving green projectiles in a straight line. The projectiles are not affected by gravity and pierce a single enemy. Its best modifier is Mythical. But the weapon's mana cost will not be affected.

name: Wulfrum Knife
description: Wulfrum Knives are craftable Pre-Hardmode daggers made from Wulfrum Metal Scraps. They function identically to the Throwing Knives, but with weaker stats and dealing rogue damage instead. They have a 50% chance of being recovered after being thrown. Performing a stealth strike with Wulfrum Knives causes the resulting knife to strike a target twice on hit and travel farther before falling. The Wulfrum Knife cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers. It serves as an early rogue weapo

name: Yharim's Stimulants
description: Yharim's Stimulants are craftable Pre-Hardmode buff potions made from various combat-related potions. It grants the user the Yharim's Power buff when consumed, granting the following effects: +6% all damage +2% all crit chance +5% increased mining speed +100% increased minion knockback +15% movement speed +6% increased damage reduction +8 defense This potion can only be crafted at an Alchemy Table. This stacks with the potions used to craft it. This item is a reference to using steroids, as it t

name: Nightmare Fuel
description: "The harvest moon glows eerily." Nightmare Fuel is a post-Moon Lord crafting material dropped by most Pumpkin Moon enemies after The Devourer of Gods has been defeated. It is occasionally used as an alternative to Endothermic Energy, or in conjunction with Darksun Fragments, Endothermic Energy, and Phantoplasm to make Ascendant Spirit Essences. "Nightmare fuel" is an informal term used to refer to highly disturbing content. The item is a reference to the item of the same name from the game Don't

name: Endothermic Energy
description: "The frigid moon shimmers brightly." Endothermic Energy is a post-Moon Lord crafting material dropped by most Frost Moon enemies after The Devourer of Gods has been defeated. It is occasionally used as an alternative to Nightmare Fuel, or in conjunction with Darksun Fragments, Nightmare Fuel, and Phantoplasm to make Ascendant Spirit Essences. The item is a reference to the Endothermic Fire from Don't Starve, which cools the player.

name: Alchemical Flask
description: The Alchemical Flask is a craftable Hardmode accessory. When equipped, attacks inflict the Plague debuff for 2, 4 or 6 seconds and projectiles spawn a plague seeker on enemy hits. Plague seekers deal 30 typeless damage which are affected by the average of all damage bonuses, and up to 3 seekers can exist at a time. On attack, there is a 25% chance for Plague to be inflicted for 6 seconds, a 37.5% chance to be inflicted for 4 seconds, and a 37.5% chance to be inflicted for 2 seconds.

name: Phantom Heart
description: The Phantom Heart is a craftable post-Moon Lord permanent power-up item that can only be consumed once, and upon consumption, increases the player's maximum mana by 50. There are 2 other items that function identically to this: the Comet Shard and the Ethereal Core. It can only be used once, and after that the player must use one of the remaining items to increase their maximum mana. With all of these, the player's maximum mana is capped at 350. The four items that increase the player's maximum

name: Carnage Ray
description: The Carnage Ray is a craftable Pre-Hardmode wand. It creates a red particle beam which deals much more damage the farther away the enemy is from the player. It is made with Blood Samples in Crimson worlds and is the Crimson counterpart to the Night's Ray. Its best modifier is Mythical. The highly damaging piercing beam makes this weapon highly effective against worm bosses like the Eater of Worlds, the Desert Scourge, and even The Destroyer. It can be considered one of the strongest Pre-Hardmode

name: Bloodflare Core
description: Not to be confused with Bloodstone Core, a crafting material made from Bloodstone. The Bloodflare Core is a post-Moon Lord accessory exclusive to Expert Mode. It is obtained from the Ravager's Treasure Bag after defeating Providence, the Profaned Goddess. While equipped, all damage taken will temporarily reduce the player's defense. The amount of defense lost depends on how much damage was taken up to 50% of the player's max defense. Over time, defense will regenerate at 40 defense points per se

name: Comet Shard
description: The Comet Shard is a craftable permanent power-up item that can only be consumed once, and upon consumption, increases the player's maximum mana by 50. There are 2 other items that function identically to this: the Ethereal Core and the Phantom Heart. It can only be used once, and after that the player must use one of the remaining items to increase their maximum mana. With all of these, the player's maximum mana is capped at 350. The four items that increase the player's maximum life, as an ext

name: Supreme Healing Potion
description: The Supreme Healing Potion is a craftable post-Moon Lord potion that heals the player for 250 health, and inflicts the Potion Sickness debuff upon use. It is also dropped from The Dragonfolly, Providence, the Profaned Goddess, Ceaseless Void, Storm Weaver, Signus, Envoy of the Devourer, Polterghast, and The Old Duke. Supreme Healing Potions can be considered the alternative to Bloodfins, as both are obtainable around the same time, and heal the player for a similar amount. However, the Bloodfin

name: Omega Healing Potion
description: The Omega Healing Potion is a craftable post-Moon Lord potion that heals the player for 300 health, and inflicts the Potion Sickness debuff upon use. It is also dropped from the adult Eidolon Wyrm, The Devourer of Gods, each individual Exo Mech, Jungle Dragon, Yharon and Supreme Calamitas.

name: Counter Scarf
description: The Counter Scarf is a Pre-Hardmode accessory exclusive to Malice Mode. It is dropped by the Eye of Cthulhu. Wearing the scarf grants the player the ability to dash a base distance of 14 blocks left or right by double tapping the ◀ Left or ▶ Right key. While dashing, the player will dodge attacks and is granted the Scarf Cooldown debuff. This debuff will temporarily prevent the user from dodging any more attacks, though they are still able to dash. The scarf also increases damage for true melee

name: Fetid Essence
description: Fetid Essence was a Pre-Hardmode crafting material that dropped from Devourers and World Feeders in The Corruption. Additionally, it was possible to obtain 5-8 Fetid Essences from Corrupt Crates at a 25% drop chance. It was used to craft Blood Relics, Guide Voodoo Dolls, and the Corrupt Flask. It was also the Corruption counterpart to the Bloodletting Essence.

name: Bloodletting Essence
description: Bloodletting Essence was a Pre-Hardmode crafting material that dropped from Face Monsters and Herplings in The Crimson. Additionally, it was possible to obtain 5-8 Bloodletting Essences from Crimson Crates at a 25% drop chance. It was used to craft the Blood Relic, Crimson Flask and Guide Voodoo Doll. It was also the Crimson counterpart to the Fetid Essence. 'Bloodletting' is a term used to describe the practice of withdrawing blood from a patient to prevent or cure illness and disease, a practi

name: Telluric Glare
description: The Telluric Glare is a post-Moon Lord bow that is dropped from Providence, the Profaned Goddess. It fires four arrows in a stream that pass through blocks and explode on contact with enemies. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Ethereal Core
description: The Ethereal Core is a craftable permanent power-up item that can only be consumed once, and upon consumption, increases the player's maximum mana by 50. There are 2 other items that function identically to this: the Comet Shard and the Phantom Heart. It can only be used once, and after that the player must use one of the remaining items to increase their maximum mana. With all of these, the player's maximum mana is capped at 350. The four items that increase the player's maximum life, as an ext

name: Arid Artifact
description: The Arid Artifact is a craftable Hardmode item that, when consumed, will summon a Sandstorm shortly after. When used during a Sandstorm, it will disable the event. It can not be used until the Desert Scourge is defeated. It can be dropped by the Earth Elemental.

name: Bloodstone Core
description: Not to be confused with Bloodflare Core, an accessory dropped by the Ravager after Providence has been defeated. Bloodstone Cores are craftable post-Moon Lord crafting materials. They are used to craft weaponry and armor themed around Bloodstone. 144 Bloodstone Cores are required to craft one of the helmets with the rest of the items, including one set of arrows and bullets. To craft all of the helmets, 188 Bloodstone Cores are needed instead.

name: Bloodstone
description: "The calamitous beings have been inundated with bloodstone." Bloodstone is a post-Moon Lord crafting material dropped by Brimstone Elemental, Calamitas, and enemies in the Brimstone Crag, only after Providence, the Profaned Goddess has been defeated. Additionally, it can be obtained from Necromantic Geodes dropped by the Ravager post-Providence. It is used to craft Bloodstone Cores. 1-3 Bloodstone can additionally be obtained from Brimstone Crates at a 10% drop chance after both Providence and P

name: Deific Amulet
description: The Deific Amulet is a craftable Hardmode accessory that acts as a combination of its ingredients. Given the typical usefulness of its constituent accessories, it is recommended to craft it as soon as possible. It is later used to craft the Rampart of Deities. Despite being crafted with the Star Veil, the Deific Amulet's increase to immunity frames functions separately from it (and by extension the Cross Necklace). The Deific Amulet grants 20 extra immunity frames when struck for more than one d

name: Elemental Gauntlet
description: The Elemental Gauntlet is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory that is the final upgrade to the Titan Glove and Feral Claws. It provides a 15% increase to melee speed and damage and a 5% increase to melee critical strike chance, a 20% increase to true melee damage, increases melee knockback, and gives the player temporary immunity to lava. While wearing the Elemental Gauntlet, any enemy struck by a melee attack will be inflicted with these debuffs: Abyssal Flames for 1.5 seconds Elemental Mix fo

name: Blood Orb
description: Blood Orbs are a crafting material dropped by enemies during a Blood Moon. They can be used to create any vanilla or Calamity buff potions as well as upgrade Supreme Healing Potions into Omega Healing Potions, and craft Bloodstone Cores. Wearing Bloodflare armor or Auric Tesla armor grants an extra, independent chance for enemies to drop Blood Orbs. All Potions crafted with Blood Orbs can only be crafted at an Alchemy Table except the Omega Healing Potion and Calamitas' Brew, which require Draed

name: Bloodflare armor
description: Bloodflare armor is a craftable post-Moon Lord armor set crafted from Bloodstone Cores and Ruinous Souls. 40 Bloodstone Cores as well as 9 Ruinous Souls are required to craft a set utilizing one headpiece. 84 Bloodstone Cores and 17 Ruinous Souls are needed to make a set including all the headpieces. If the Body Armor, Cuisses, and one of the headpiece varieties are visible (whether equipped or in social slots), the player will have a very faint vibrating shadow behind them. It consists of the B

name: Phantom Spirit
description: "Shrieks are echoing from the dungeon." A Phantom Spirit is a post-Moon Lord flying enemy that spawns in the Dungeon after Moon Lord has been defeated. Similarly to a Dungeon Spirit, it has a 16.67% / 25% chance to spawn after defeating certain enemies and can fly through tiles. It drops Phantoplasm, an end-game crafting material used mostly for crafting post-Devourer of Gods items. After killing thirty Phantom Spirits, Polterghast will spawn if it has not yet been defeated in the current world.

name: Frigid Bulwark
description: The Frigid Bulwark is a craftable Hardmode accessory. It is a somewhat direct upgrade to the Frozen Turtle Shell and the Paladin's Shield, combining the effects of both accessories. When below 50% life, damage is reduced by 15%. When below 15% life, it gives 20% damage reduction instead. Despite having the Paladin's Shield in its recipe and being a shield-like item, it cannot be used with the Brand of the Inferno. The vanilla Frozen Shield functions similarly to the Frigid Bulwark.

name: Rampart of Deities
description: The Rampart of Deities is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory that has a lot of different effects. It is an upgrade to the Frigid Bulwark and Deific Amulet. Its primary function is combining all of the effects of both Frigid Bulwark and the Deific Amulet. When below 50% life, damage reduction is increased by 15%. When below 15% life, it gives 20% damage reduction instead. Like the Deific Amulet, the Rampart of Deities' increase to immunity frames functions separately from the Cross Necklace and

name: Frost Barrier
description: The Frost Barrier is a Pre-Hardmode accessory that can be purchased from the Traveling Merchant during a Full Moon or can be obtained from Ice Claspers. It is used to create the Auric Tesla Body Armor. Being hit while wearing the Barrier will briefly debuff all nearby enemies with Glacial State, completely stopping them from moving. Both the range and duration of the Glacial State debuff are based on the damage the player took when the effect activated. It also grants immunity to the Chilled deb

name: Omniblade
description: The Omniblade is a craftable Hardmode broadsword. Attacking with this weapon swings a 90° holdout projectile that swings from the top of the player to the horizontal axis, similar to that of the Murasama, however, it cannot be controlled with the cursor. It has a fast auto-swing rate and a considerable large slash area. It has a 20% chance to inflict the Whispering Death debuff, which reduces the target's defense by 50. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. The Om

name: Darksun Fragment
description: "The dark sun awaits." Darksun Fragments are post-Moon Lord crafting materials dropped by enemies during a Solar Eclipse after The Devourer of Gods has been defeated.

name: Sigil of Calamitas
description: The Sigil of Calamitas is a craftable Hardmode accessory. It grants the user a variety of bonuses to magic damage and max mana, these being an additional 15% increased magic damage, and additional 100 maximum mana, and a 10% decrease in mana usage. The Sigil will also increase pickup range for mana stars.

name: Void of Extinction
description: The Void of Extinction is a Hardmode, Expert Mode-exclusive accessory. It grants the user a 15% increase to all damage types, occasionally drops brimstone fireballs from the sky, rains down brimstone fire while invincibility is active, and grants temporary immunity to lava, reduced lava damage, and a 25% damage boost while in lava. Both the brimstone fire and fireballs inflict Brimstone Flames on hit enemies. The brimstone fireballs act almost identical to the projectiles fired by the Inferno Fo

name: Gehenna
description: Gehenna is a Hardmode accessory exclusive to Expert Mode. It is obtained from the Brimstone Elemental's Treasure Bag. It occasionally causes fireballs to fall from the sky. These fireballs act in a manner almost identical to the Inferno Fork, leaving behind a lingering red explosion after dying. The brimstone fire and fireballs deal typeless damage. They are boosted by the average of player's class bonuses which stacks additively with bonuses to 'all damage', such as the Avenger Emblem. Brimston

name: Shockstorm Shuttle
description: The Shockstorm Shuttle is a Hardmode enemy that spawns in Space. It has two attacks; a blue lightning bolt that deals moderate damage and inflicts the Electrified debuff on hit and a yellow laser that travels at a high velocity and deals higher damage. It seems to be a miniature version of the Martian Saucer in both design and attacks. In previous versions of the mod, it was also able to drop Essence of Eleum.

name: Auric Tesla armor
description: The Auric Tesla armor is a craftable endgame post-Moon Lord armor set made by combining several post-Moon Lord armors and other materials. Crafting any individual piece of Auric Tesla armor requires the corresponding piece from the Tarragon armor, Bloodflare armor, God Slayer armor and Silva armor. Moving with the full set equipped will produce a trail of bright golden sparkles; if all three pieces are visible then the player will also have afterimages. It consists of the Auric Tesla Body Armor

name: Minigun
description: The Minigun is a craftable post-Moon Lord gun that is an upgraded version of the Chain Gun. It shoots at an incredibly high rate while dealing high damage. Its best modifier is Unreal. But the weapon's firing speed will not be affected. Its insanely fast rate of fire gives it good synergy with the Reaper Tooth Necklace. Unlike the Chain Gun, the Minigun has very good accuracy.

name: Plague Hive
description: The Plague Hive is a Hardmode accessory. Equipping it grants the following benefits: All of the wearer's attacks inflict the Plague debuff. All of the wearer's attacks spawn homing plague seekers upon hitting an enemy. Plague seekers deal 25% damage of the attack that spawned them, capped at 30 damage. When the wearer takes damage, several bees are spawned that will seek out and attack nearby enemies. The player's attacks have a 25% chance to inflict Plague for 6 seconds, a 37.5% chance to infli

name: Animosity
description: The Animosity is a Hardmode gun dropped by Calamitas. Its left click attack is slow but accurate and fires a high velocity shot that does heavy damage. Its right click attack is fast and fires a rapid burst of three shots. Its best modifier is Unreal. The high velocity shot fired by Animosity's left click attack deals 580% of the weapon's overall damage, including the damage being contributed by the ammunition used. The right click attack has a fixed use time of 12 ticks, with each bullet having

name: Vivid Clarity
description: The Vivid Clarity is a craftable post-Moon Lord wand and the final upgrade of the Night's Ray or Carnage Ray. It fires a set of 5 beams towards the player's cursor that breaks upon contact with an enemy or tile. Once it breaks, it does one of the following: Summons a beam from the sky that rebound off of walls and pierces enemies up to 9 times. The beam deals 70% of the base damage, increasing by 20% when bouncing off a tile and by 10% when piercing an enemy. Enemies that are within nearby range

name: Mourningstar
description: Not to be confused with Morning Star, a vanilla whip. The Mourningstar is a craftable post-Moon Lord flail and is the direct upgrade of the Solar Eruption. Similarly to the Solar Eruption, the Mourningstar fires two solar spear-like projectiles that extend and retract from the player's position, following a narrow arc in the general area of the cursor for the duration of their travel. The flails have infinite piercing capabilities, ignore tiles, and create explosions when hitting enemies. Both t

name: Silva armor
description: The Silva armor is a craftable post-Moon Lord armor set. It is one of the last armor sets needed to craft the Auric Tesla armor and the Magic/Summoner counterpart to God Slayer armor. It cannot be obtained until after defeating several enemies from the upgraded Solar Eclipse, Pumpkin and Frost Moons as its recipe calls for Ascendant Spirit Essence. If the entire set is visible (whether equipped or in social slots), the wearer will have afterimages. It consists of the Silva Armor and Silva Leggin

name: Psychotic Amulet
description: The Psychotic Amulet is a Hardmode accessory that is rarely dropped by Possessed Armors. It benefits both the Rogue and Ranged classes, increasing the damage and critical strike chance of Rogue and Ranged attacks by 5%. Standing still with this accessory equipped will quickly turn the player invisible as if they were wearing Shroomite armor and give them much stronger boosts to rogue and ranged stats. These bonuses rapidly wear off if the player moves again. Once completely invisible, the player

name: The First Shadowflame
description: The First Shadowflame is a Hardmode accessory dropped by the Goblin Summoner during a Goblin Invasion. It increases the number of minion slots by 1 and grants all minions the ability to inflict the Shadowflame debuff, which prevents health regeneration and deals 15 damage per second, and lasts for 5 seconds. Although it lacks any minion damage boosts, this accessory allows minions to inflict its debuff, as opposed to the Jelly-Charged Battery and Nuclear Rod which only grant a chance to inflict

name: Acid Round
description: Acid Rounds are Hardmode bullets made from Plague Cell Canisters and Musket Balls. Upon contact with an enemy, it explodes into acid, which inflicts the Plague debuff on contact. Additional damage is added to bullets when hitting a target based on target's defense, the damage of the gun & bullet, and the gun's use time. The final damage formula is as follows: Damage = Damage + (EnemyDefense * 0.05 * (Damage / 50) * (WeaponUsetime / 20)) The damage formula uses the enemy's current defense, after

name: Torrential Tear
description: Not to be confused with Caustic Tear, which is used to summon the Acid Rain event. The Torrential Tear is a non-consumable Pre-Hardmode item which, shortly after usage, will begin Rain. If used while it is raining, the rain will stop shortly after. It cannot be used while Slime Rain is active. It can be found inside Shadow Chests in the Abyss or in Abyssal Crates. If used while it is raining in Death Mode, the rain will turn severe for one minute then disperse. The one minute timer cannot be sho

name: Bloodfire Arrow
description: Bloodfire Arrows are post-Moon Lord arrows made from a single Bloodstone Core. They inflict the Brimstone Flames debuff upon hitting an enemy, and have a 33.33% chance to heal the player for 1 HP. They are the default arrows shot by the Arterial Assault.

name: Flash Round
description: Flash Rounds are Pre-Hardmode bullets crafted from Glass and a Grenade. They release a blast of low-damage light after travelling for a short distance, applying the Confused debuff to any enemy caught in the flash.

name: Potion of Omniscience
description: The Potion of Omniscience is a craftable Pre-Hardmode buff potion that grants the Omniscience buff upon usage, which grants the effects of the Hunter, Spelunker, and Dangersense potions simultaneously. This causes enemies, treasures, and traps onscreen to be highlighted. Additionally, the Omniscience buff highlights all enemy projectiles. This potion can only be crafted at an Alchemy Table.

name: Mortar Round
description: Mortar Rounds are a post-Moon Lord bullet type crafted from Rocket IVs and Uelibloom Bars. They can be used by all guns that do not shoot custom bullets. Upon impact, it creates an explosion similar to that of Bombs.

name: Rubber Mortar Round
description: Rubber Mortar Rounds are a post-Moon Lord bullet type and are a variant of the Mortar Round. They can bounce up to two times, creating an explosion that destroys tiles on each bounce. They can be used by all guns that do not shoot custom bullets.

name: Napalm Arrow
description: Napalm Arrows are craftable Hardmode arrows that explode into several shards and flames upon hitting an enemy; the flames linger before dissipating, dealing contact damage and inflicting On Fire! to any enemy that passes over them.

name: Acceleration Round
description: Acceleration Rounds are Pre-Hardmode bullets made from a Victory Shard and Musket Balls. The bullets gain speed over time.

name: Nebulous Core
description: The Nebulous Core is a post-Moon Lord, Expert Mode-exclusive accessory that is obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped by The Devourer of Gods. It grants the player 10% increased damage and summons floating nebula stars around the player, just like the Spore Sac, that deal 1500 damage. It also grants the player a revive when hit with a lethal attack, healing the player for 100 HP when the effect triggers, this effect has a 90 seconds cooldown.

name: Ethereal Talisman
description: The Ethereal Talisman is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory, which is an upgrade to the Sigil of Calamitas and the final upgrade to the Sorcerer Emblem. It provides a 15% increase to magic damage, a 5% increase to magic critical strike chance, a 10% decrease in mana usage, +150 max mana, increases pickup range for mana stars, and will automatically use mana potions when needed. Toggling this accessory’s visibility allows you to disable the Mana Flower effects. For a full crafting tree, see her

name: Nanotech
description: The Nanotech is a post-Moon Lord Accessory for the Rogue class. When equipped, rogue projectiles release a nanoblade while active for every half a second, up to a maximum of five blades at once. Nanoblades deal 60 typeless damage which can be affected by rogue damage bonuses and can slightly home into enemies. The accessory grants the effects of the Raider's Talisman and Electrician's Glove. It also grants +12% increased rogue damage and 15% increased rogue velocity. If the player utilizes a ste

name: Yharim's Gift
description: The Yharim's Gift is a post-Moon Lord, Expert Mode-exclusive accessory that is obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped by Jungle Dragon, Yharon. It gives the player 30 defense and 15% increased damage. While the accessory is equipped, the player occasionally leaves behind exploding dragon dust while moving. The exploding dragon dust deals 175 damage every frame, lasts for roughly 1 second, and inflicts Holy Flames for 2 seconds on hit. When invincibility is active (i.e. when the player is damaged

name: Hyperius Bullet
description: Hyperius Bullets are Hardmode bullets crafted from Life Alloys. When used to hit an enemy, another bullet is brought from the left or right edge of the player's screen to pass through the enemy's position, at the time of being hit. The name of this bullet is most likely a reference to the boss enemy in Borderlands 2, named Hyperius the Invincible. The effect of the bullet is also a reference to the Conference Call weapon, found in Borderlands 2. Both Hyperius and the Conference Call are affiliat

name: Calamitas' Brew
description: Calamitas' Brew is a craftable Hardmode buff potion. It grants the user the Abyssal Weapon buff when consumed, which gives 10% increased movement speed and causes melee and rogue weapons to inflict the Abyssal Flames debuff onto enemies. There is a 25% chance for Abyssal Flames to be inflicted for 6 seconds, a 37.5% chance to be inflicted for 4 seconds, and a 37.5% chance to be inflicted for 2 seconds.

name: Frostspark Bullet
description: Not to be confused with Icy Bullet, which is sold by the Archmage. Frostspark Bullets are a Hardmode bullet type made from Cryonic Bars. They inflict the following debuffs: On Fire! (8 seconds, 100% chance) Frostburn (8 seconds, 100% chance) Glacial State (4 seconds, 100% chance) On enemies, these combined debuffs cause the target to be unable to regenerate life, and lose 12 health per second for 8 seconds. Additionally, for 4 seconds, they will be completely unable to move as well as having the

name: Astral Arcanum
description: The Astral Arcanum is a craftable post-Moon Lord Expert Mode-exclusive accessory. It causes astral stars to fall when the player takes damage, as well as providing immunity to the Astral Infection debuff. When the player is struck by a projectile, they will reflect it, which doesn't damage the player. This effect can only occur every 90 seconds. It also boosts life regeneration by 3, even while the player is under the effects of a damaging debuff. When worn while being damaged by a debuff, the p

name: Cadance Potion
description: The Cadance Potion is a craftable Pre-Hardmode buff potion. It grants the Cadance buff upon usage, which increases life regen by 5 and max life by 25%, and increases heart pickup range. Enemy spawn rates are decreased by 56%, and maximum spawn count is decreased by 44%. The player also becomes immune to the Regeneration and Lifeforce buffs. This potion can only be crafted at an Alchemy Table. Despite mentioning aggro in its tooltip, it actually reduces enemy spawnrates instead. This oddity is sh

name: Lead Core
description: The Lead Core is a Hardmode accessory that provides immunity to the Irradiated debuff, and is used to make the Silva Armor. It is dropped by Irradiated Slimes and Gamma Slimes with a 3.33% chance.

name: Irradiated Slime
description: The Irradiated Slime is a Hardmode slime that only spawns during Tier 2 of the Acid Rain event. Rather than spawning like normal NPCs, they gradually fall from the sky while the event is ongoing, and can fall through platforms while doing so until they are at a similar height to the player. It has a very low chance to drop the Lead Core upon death, which provides immunity to the Irradiated debuff and is used in the crafting of Silva armor. Irradiated Slimes' unique method of spawning is unaffect

name: Verium Bullet
description: Verium Bullets are a type of Hardmode bullet. They pierce once, and possess the ability to home into the previously-struck target within a short period after the first hit. The second hit deals half damage of the first hit.

name: Frost Flare
description: Not to be confused with Frosty Flare, a rogue weapon sold by the Archmage. The Frost Flare is a Hardmode accessory dropped by Cryogen.
