Similarly to other weapons such as the Phantasm, the Flak Kraken will "spin up" the longer the fire button is held, increasing its damage per second and area of effect. Its best modifier is Demonic, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers that affect it. It takes 8.33 seconds of firing in

name: The Amalgam
description: The Amalgam is a craftable post-Moon Lord, Expert Mode-exclusive accessory. It increases damage by 15%, extends the duration of potion buffs by 100%, and causes potion buffs to remain active after dying. When invincibility is active (i.e. when the player is damaged, enters the world or uses the Magic Mirror), shade rains from the sky, dealing 300 typeless damage which can be affected by the average of all damage bonuses. Additionally, enemies in a 12.5-18.75 tile radius are inflicted with Brimst

name: Crown Jewel
description: This page is about the accessory. For the boss servant, see Crown Jewel (enemy). The Crown Jewel is a Pre-Hardmode accessory exclusive to Malice. It is dropped by King Slime. It boosts life regeneration by 2, even while the player is under the effects of a damaging debuff. When worn while being damaged by a debuff, the player's defense will increase by 10 and life regen will increase by an additional 4 (for a total of 5). If the player is under the effect of one of the alcohols sold by the Drunk

name: Eidolic Wail
description: The Eidolic Wail is a post-Moon Lord magic gun that drops from Eidolon Wyrms after Polterghast has been defeated. It fires three sound waves in quick succession that bounce off walls. The sound waves continuously grow in size and damage as they travel, but slow down as they grow larger. The sound waves ignore NPC immunity frames, dealing constant damage to any enemies they touch, and inflict the Crush Depth debuff. Its best modifier is Mythical. The sound waves are fired 17 ticks apart, with a 3

name: Undine's Retribution
description: Undine's Retribution is a craftable Hardmode wand. It summons several aqua javelins from the ground that home in on enemies and inflict the Crush Depth debuff. The spears can also go through blocks, and will disappear after a moderate time if no enemy is hit. If no enemies are nearby, the spears will instead home in on the player. Its best modifier is Mythical. The weapon is a reference to Undines, which are female spirits or nymphs that inhabit water. The sprites of the weapon and its projectil

name: Viruling
description: The Viruling is a Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Jungle surface during the day after Golem has been defeated. It hovers through the air towards the player, and inflicts the Plague debuff on contact. The Viruling cannot fire any projectiles, so any non-melee attacks are useful for killing it. It appears to be a Derpling afflicted with the plague, although its behavior has changed as a result. The Plague also seems to have made it much more machine-like.

name: Flounder
description: Not to be confused with the vanilla fish of the same name, which is obtained from fishing. The Flounder is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Sulphurous Sea. It initially stays invisible on the sand, waiting for the player to come near or hit it, in which it will then become visible and hostile. It attacks by slowly swimming towards the player while spraying sulphuric mist projectiles at them. In real life, flounders are a group of flatfish species. They are found at the bottom of oceans ar

name: Catfish (enemy)
description: Not to be confused with the Catfish quest fish. The Catfish is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Sulphurous Sea. It swims peacefully until the player comes near or hits it. It attacks by swimming towards the player in an attempt to hurt them.

name: Gnasher
description: The Gnasher is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Sulphurous Sea. It walks towards the player in an attempt to attack them and can spawn in both the sea and the beach. The Gnasher is likely based off of a snapping turtle, which both live in murky waters, though they aren't known for killing humans.

name: Mauler
description: The Mauler is a mini boss that spawns in the Sulphurous Sea at any point in the game. It swims peacefully until the player comes near or hits it. Once it detects the player, it swims extremely fast towards them while also shooting quick bursts of sulphuric mist. Occasionally, it releases a large ring of sulphuric bubbles and mist from itself, which is difficult to dodge unless the player is reasonably far away. If the Mauler is out of the water for too long it will explode, leaving no loot and p

name: Aquatic Urchin
description: The Aquatic Urchin is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Sulphurous Sea. It bounces very high towards the player in an attempt to hurt them, and can also bounce when out of the water. Sea Urchin

name: Sea Urchin
description: The Sea Urchin is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Ocean. It bounces high towards the player in an attempt to hurt them, and can also bounce when out of the water. Aquatic Urchin

name: Mantis Shrimp
description: The Mantis Shrimp is a Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Ocean biome. Similarly to Crabs they walk along the Ocean's floor in the player's general direction. When hitting the player, the Mantis Shrimp releases an explosion. The explosion deals no damage and is purely for visual effect. After Plantera has been defeated, they will occasionally drop the Mantis Claws, a claw-like melee weapon that mimics the Mantis Shrimp's main attack. With their extremely high melee damage, they can kill most char

name: Aquatic Parasite
description: The Aquatic Parasite is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Sulphurous Sea. It swims towards the player and can jump out of the water very high in an attempt to catch them. Its original sprite was intended to be a resprite of the Desert Medallion.

name: Aquatic Seeker
description: The Aquatic Seeker is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Sulphurous Sea biome. It is a horned fish that flies through the air towards the player, attempting to hurt them via contact damage and inflicting the Venom and Bleeding debuffs as it does so.

name: Aquatic Scourge
description: If you were looking for something other than the Aquatic Scourge, see Scourge (disambiguation). "A horror born of pollution and insatiable hunger..." The Aquatic Scourge is a boss that can be fought in the Sulphurous Sea biome at any point in the game, but is intended to be fought during Hardmode. Being the hydrated and mutated version of the Desert Scourge, it possesses similarities in its drops but significant differences in its behavior. The Aquatic Scourge spawns naturally, albeit rarely, in

name: Valediction
description: The Valediction is a post-Moon Lord rogue boomerang that drops from Reaper Sharks after Polterghast has been defeated. It continuously throws large homing reaper scythes that travel in high velocity, and can pass through tiles. Each reaper scythe can damage and pierce through unlimited enemies, but a thrown scythe will return soon after striking its intended target at least once. Performing a stealth strike with the Valediction causes three typhoons that deal half of the scythe's damage to appea

name: Calamari's Lament
description: Calamari's Lament is a post-Moon Lord summon weapon that drops from Colossal Squids after Polterghast has been defeated. It summons a baby squid that shoots ink at enemies and dashes towards them. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Calamari's Lament has over a Ruthless on

name: Ballistic Poison Bomb
description: The Ballistic Poison Bomb is a craftable Hardmode bomb. It throws bombs that are affected by gravity. Upon contact with an enemy, it explodes and launches several fragments that fly in random directions, while also creating a poison cloud similar to the one produced by the Toxic Flask. Collision with a tile will cause the bomb to stick onto the tile for a short period of time, after which, it launches the fragments. The shrapnel will stick to all tiles and enemies, and will explode after a short

name: Dreadmine Staff
description: The Dreadmine Staff is a craftable Hardmode sentry. It summons a stationary mine base that summons mines on nearby tiles which home in on enemies. When an enemy comes in contact with a mine, it will blow up. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Dreadmine Staff has over a Ru

name: Sunskater
description: The Sunskater is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in Space. It flies peacefully in one direction and turns around when it hits a block. Once attacked, it starts diving into the player at a fast speed in order to ram them. When the player is fully submerged in water, the Sunskater will stop attacking the player. It is the only Pre-Hardmode enemy able to inflict the Holy Flames debuff. The Hadopelagic Echo has a small chance to play the Sunskater death sound instead of the normal use sound.

name: Impious Immolator
description: The Impious Immolator is a post-Moon Lord enemy that spawns in the Hallow and Underworld biomes. Initially, it flies peacefully in one direction and turns around when it hits a block, similarly to the Sunskater. After being attacked, it will fly quickly towards the player while shooting bursts of fire which home in weakly on the player. It drops Unholy Essence, a useful post-Moon Lord crafting material.

name: Bobbit Worm
description: The Bobbit Worm is an enemy that spawns in the lowest layer of the Abyss. It stays attached to the seafloor, waiting for the player to come close enough to it. When they do, it rapidly extends out towards the player, dealing significant damage if contact is made, before quickly returning to its previous location. Upon hitting the player, they inflict Crush Depth for 5 seconds. While it is referred to as a worm, it does not act like a typical Worm AI enemy. Its behavior mimics that of real bobbit

name: Gulper Eel
description: The Gulper Eel is an enemy that spawns in the 3rd and 4th layers of the Abyss. It is initially passive, only becoming aggressive if the player attacks it or draws too close to it. It is a long enemy with multiple segments and a large head, which can deal a lot of damage. Like their real life counterparts they both live in the extremely deep parts of the ocean and both have large jaws, but unlike Gulper Eels in real-life, they are far larger and also way more aggressive.

name: Oarfish
description: The Oarfish is an enemy that spawns in the 2nd and 3rd layers of the Abyss. It is a long enemy with multiple segments. Like most Abyss enemies, it won't attack the player unless they get too close or they attack it. It attacks by using its very long body to trap the player. Oarfish in real life live in deep sea away from turbulent, shallow water. The name likely refers to the discarded belief that the fish use their pelvic fins to "row" through water.

name: Soul Edge
description: The Soul Edge is a post-Moon Lord broadsword that drops from Eidolon Wyrms after Polterghast is defeated. The Soul Edge's projectiles inflict Crush Depth. When swinging the blade, 2-3 Phantom Spirits will be released and seek out nearby enemies. If no enemies are near they will hover around the player until an enemy gets in range, similar to the Exoblade. Its best modifier is Legendary. The Old Duke takes only 75% damage from the homing phantom spirits created by the Soul Edge. The weapon is a r

name: Pestilent Slime
description: The Pestilent Slime is a Hardmode slime that spawns in the Jungle after Golem has been defeated. It attacks by jumping towards the player and shooting high-velocity plague darts whenever they get too close to it or travel above it. The Pestilent Slime can be considered a Spiked Jungle Slime that was infected by the Plague.

name: Barinautical
description: The Barinautical is a Hardmode bow dropped by the Aquatic Scourge; it can be considered an indirect upgrade of the Barinade. It fires bursts of three arrows, with a one-third second of a delay. When Wooden Arrows are used as ammo, arrows are replaced with electric arrows that explode upon impact. Each electric arrow does damage twice, for a total of six hits. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Deepsea Staff
description: The Deepsea Staff is a Hardmode summon weapon dropped by the Aquatic Scourge; it is an indirect upgrade to the Seabound Staff. It summons an aquatic starfish that protects the player by performing dashes into enemies, dealing damage on contact. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a M

name: Urchin Stinger
description: Urchin Stingers are Pre-Hardmode rogue weapons dropped by Sea Urchins and Aquatic Urchins. It fires an urchin spike which pierces once, and travels a short distance before being affected by gravity. On hit it inflicts the Venom debuff. They have a 50% chance of being recovered after being thrown. Performing a stealth strike with Urchin Stingers will cause the next stinger thrown to stick onto an enemy for 10 seconds. Whilst the stinger is stuck onto an enemy, it occasionally releases bubbles in

name: Alluring Bait
description: Alluring Bait is a Pre-Hardmode accessory that is caught while fishing in the Sulphurous Sea or Abyss. It increases the player's fishing power by 30 during day, 45 during night, and 60 during a Solar Eclipse. It also increases the chance to catch fish that are materials in Potions. Alluring Bait increases the chance to catch potion fish through the formula (Fishing Power/10)%, capping the chance at 33.33%. In order to reach this cap, the player must have 333 fishing power or greater. Alluring Ba

name: Abyssal Amulet
description: The Abyssal Amulet is a Pre-Hardmode accessory that can be caught while fishing in the Sulphurous Sea or Abyss. While it is equipped, the player gains 10% increased max life while in the Abyss, inflicts the Crush Depth debuff on all attacks, and gains immunity to the Crush Depth debuff. The Abyssal Amulet can only be caught with a 1/25 (4%) chance if fishing with between 110 and 239 fishing power. There is a 25% chance for Crush Depth to be inflicted for 6 seconds, a 37.5% chance to be inflicted

name: Lumenous Amulet
description: The Lumenous Amulet is a craftable Hardmode accessory. While it is equipped, the player's attacks inflict the Crush Depth debuff, and, while in the Abyss, they gain 25% increased max life and increased Abyss light level by 2. It also grants immunity to the Crush Depth debuff. There is a 25% chance for Crush Depth to be inflicted for 6 seconds, a 37.5% chance to be inflicted for 4 seconds, and a 37.5% chance to be inflicted for 2 seconds.

name: Cryon
description: The Cryon is a Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Snow biome. It jumps and charges towards the player in an attempt to deal damage. It will always inflict the Frostburn debuff onto the player if they are hit and has a 33% chance to inflict Glacial State. It has a 50% chance to drop an Essence of Eleum. A Cryon is depicted in the Ice Biome's Draedon's Log.

name: Melter
description: The Melter is a Hardmode enemy that spawns in the surface of the Jungle biome after Golem has been defeated. It appears to be a Giant Flying Fox afflicted with the Plague.

name: Plagueshell
description: The Plagueshell is a Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Jungle after Golem has been defeated. It attacks by going into its shell and hurling itself at players, dealing large amounts of damage on contact. Damaging the Plagueshell causes it to stop its attack animation. This does not occur in Revengeance Mode if the Plagueshell is under 25% health. The Plagueshell seems to be a regular Giant Tortoise that has been struck by the same Plague mentioned in The Plaguebringer Goliath's lore.

name: Phantom Debris
description: The Phantom Debris is a Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Underground layer and resembles a background rock. It initially moves very quickly, but slows down noticeably the closer it gets to the player. It constantly emits a magenta glow, allowing it to be easily seen in dark caves. After Moon Lord is defeated, its stats are buffed and it begins dropping Phantoplasm, a versatile crafting material. It is one of two enemies which can drop Phantoplasm that spawn in the Cavern layer, the other being

name: Overloaded Soldier
description: The Overloaded Soldier is a Hardmode enemy which can be found in the Underground layer and the Dungeon. It moves similarly to other Skeleton-type enemies, but its movement speed accelerates considerably the nearer it is to the player. It constantly emits a magenta glow, allowing it to be easily seen in dark caves. After the Moon Lord is defeated, its stats are buffed and it begins dropping Phantoplasm, a versatile crafting material. It is one of two enemies which can drop Phantoplasm that spawn

name: Reaper Tooth
description: Reaper Teeth are post-Moon Lord crafting materials dropped by Reaper Sharks after Polterghast has been defeated. They are used to craft the Reaper Tooth Necklace, Omega Blue armor, and several weapons. Reaper Teeth may also be obtained from Abyssal Crates after Polterghast and The Old Duke have been defeated.

name: Strange Orb
description: The Strange Orb is a light pet summoning item that summons an ocean spirit to follow the player. It is obtained from the Shadow Chests in the Abyss. When equipped while the player is not submerged in a liquid, it sleeps while holding the orb and gives a small amount of light. When in liquid, it swims above the player and provides much more light. The Ocean Spirit is a very effective way to increase your light level in the Abyss. This item can also be obtained from the Abyssal Crate after either

name: Downpour
description: The Downpour is a Hardmode wand dropped by the Aquatic Scourge; it can be considered an indirect upgrade to the Storm Spray. It fires a stream of water that, at evenly spaced points throughout, drips extra streams of water downward. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Mantis Claws
description: The Mantis Claws are a Hardmode melee weapon that autoswings. They are dropped from Mantis Shrimps once Plantera is defeated and act similarly to the Fetid Baghnakhs, having a very short range but extremely fast speed. Mantis Claws additionally create a small explosion on enemy hits. However, the explosion deals no damage and is purely visual. Its best modifier is Legendary. This weapon only benefits from 25% of melee swing speed bonuses. The explosion effect is a reference to real life Mantis s

name: Scourge of the Cosmos
description: If you were looking for something other than the Scourge of the Cosmos, see Scourge (disambiguation). The Scourge of the Cosmos is a craftable post-Moon Lord melee weapon which is a direct upgrade of the Scourge of the Corruptor. When used, it launches a fast projectile that is heavily affected by gravity and can bounce off of tiles up to two times before vanishing. On each bounce or when impacting an enemy, the projectile releases mini Devourer heads, which fly and home in on nearby foes. The m

name: Empyrean Knives
description: The Empyrean Knives are a craftable post-Moon Lord melee weapon that are a direct upgrade to the Vampire Knives. When used, the player throws a spread of 4 to 8 homing knives, each dealing damage and healing the player for 0.5% of the damage dealt. The knives can bounce off of walls twice and travel much farther than the Vampire Knives before spinning and fading away. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. The amount of knives thrown per usage follows the same calc

name: Abyssal Diving Gear
description: The Abyssal Diving Gear is a craftable Hardmode accessory which combines and enhances effects of the Arctic Diving Gear and the Depths Charm. It is part of the recipe for the Abyssal Diving Suit. It is recommended to craft this item as soon as possible when planning to explore the Abyss further, as it makes getting more abyss materials far easier, and is required to craft the Abyssal Diving Suit later. The Arctic Diving Gear is obtainable from Ice Bio-center Labs.

name: Abyssal Diving Suit
description: The Abyssal Diving Suit is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory which transforms the user into an armored diver when equipped. It provides water breathing, and it combines and enhances the effects of the Abyssal Diving Gear, Anechoic Plating and Iron Boots, making it the ultimate tool for exploring the Abyss. Additionally, while the player is underwater, their movement speed and acceleration are boosted by 5%; otherwise, their movement speed and acceleration are reduced by 60%. The suit possesse

name: Aquatic Emblem
description: The Aquatic Emblem is a Hardmode, Expert Mode-exclusive accessory obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped by Aquatic Scourge. It grants underwater breathing, and prevents Crabs, Pink Jellyfish, Sea Snails, Sharks, and Squids from targeting or dealing damage to the player, while providing a defense boost while underwater and slowing the player down. The defense boost and movement speed reduction will slowly increase and cap out at +50 and -10% respectively. The boosts persist outside of water but

name: Sulphuric Acid Cannon
description: The Sulphuric Acid Cannon is a post-Moon Lord gun that is dropped by the Mauler after Polterghast has been defeated. It fires sulphuric orbs at enemies. The bubbles shot by this weapon will stick on to enemies hit. After a few seconds, sulphuric mist puffs will occasionally fly out from the orbs in random directions; these do not travel through tiles. This repeats a few times before the bubbles evaporate. The bubbles shot by this weapon inflict the Venom debuff on contact with, and stick to, any

name: Lionfish
description: The Lionfish is a Pre-Hardmode rogue weapon obtained from Shadow Chests in the Abyss. When used, it hurls a Lionfish which travels in a straight line for a long distance before being affected by gravity. The Lionfish inflicts Venom on contact with enemies and sticks to them. Unlike most weapons that deal Venom, the damage over time dealt by the Lionfish stacks. Up to six Lionfish can be impaled on an enemy at once, similar to Daybreak spears for a maximum of 300 damage per second. This can stack

name: Abyss Gravel
description: Abyss Gravel is a block that comprises the first two layers of the Abyss biome. It spawns naturally upon world generation and constantly leaks water. It can be mined with a Nightmare Pickaxe or a Deathbringer Pickaxe. When Abyss Gravel is first mined, it will leave a full tile of water in its place, similar to how mining Hellstone leaves behind lava. Abyss Gravel blocks are extremely durable, requiring five times as many hits as Ebonstone Blocks. Abyss Gravel is immune to explosives. In previous

name: Typhon's Greed
description: The Typhon's Greed is a craftable Hardmode melee weapon. On use it spins in a 360-degree circle and summons floating orbs that deal 50% of the weapon's base damage, pass through tiles, and travel from off-screen towards the player, exploding into particles upon contact with enemies or after some time has passed. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. Typhon is a powerful aquatic monster in Greek mythology. He is known for possessing snake-like body parts, which was

name: Submarine Shocker
description: The Submarine Shocker is a Hardmode shortsword that drops from the Aquatic Scourge; it can be considered an indirect upgrade to the Aquatic Discharge. It unleashes 1-2 sparks upon hitting an enemy, which are affected by gravity and fall through platforms. These sparks linger for 1 second and can hit up to 4 times. Its best modifier is Legendary.

name: Planty Mush
description: Planty Mush is a Pre-Hardmode block that can be found naturally generated inside the Abyss. Viper Vines automatically grow from underneath it. It can be mined with any pickaxe. It is used as a crafting material for Life Fruit and Fathom Swarmer armor. Planty Mush can also be obtained from Abyssal Crates, as well as by fishing in the Sulphurous Sea or the Abyss with a fishing power between 0 and 80. Planty Mush's coded requirement is actually 40 to 80. However, as this item replaces Junk catches

name: Hadal Stew
description: The Hadal Stew is a Pre-Hardmode food item that can also be crafted and heals the player for 120 life and restores 150 mana, and also grants the Well Fed buff for 60 minutes. It applies a shortened version of the Potion Sickness debuff upon use, allowing the player to heal more often. It has a chance to be obtained from Abyssal Treasures, which drop from pots in the Abyss. If the player has the Philosopher's Stone or its upgrades, the Potion Sickness duration is reduced to 37 seconds and the too

name: Trasher
description: The Trasher is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Sulphurous Sea. In water, it swims quickly towards the player in an attempt to attack them, but can also walk slowly on land. It moves faster as it loses more health. It can spawn in both water and on land. If the Angler is not present in the world, he will drop out of the Trasher when it is killed. If the Angler is present in the world, when killed by a Trasher in Hardmode he will drop a Golden Fishing Rod. The Trasher will remain passive u

name: Wulfrum Hammer
description: The Wulfrum Hammer is a craftable Pre-Hardmode hammer. Its best modifier is Legendary. While Light may seem to provide a better speed boost by percentages, rounding reveals that Legendary and Light mine at equal speeds for this tool.

name: Dungeon Wall Unsafe
description: Dungeon Walls Unsafe are background walls which can be bought from the Clothier for 10 each. They come in 9 variants - brick, slab, and tiled, each in blue, green, and pink. They have the same ID as naturally occurring Dungeon Brick Walls when placed, and thus allow NPC spawns even when placed by the player. One can use them to create a functioning Dungeon anywhere in the world, as long as the other requirements (e.g. having 250 Dungeon Bricks onscreen) are met. Upon placing, destroying, and pic

name: Abyss Gravel Wall
description: Abyss Gravel Walls are background walls that are naturally generated in the Abyss. Naturally-generated walls cannot be destroyed or collected and spawn water in front of them whenever a nearby tile updates. Safe versions of Abyss Gravel Walls can be crafted from Abyss Gravel, which have the same appearance but do not release water. The walls' own water generation counts as a tile update for adjacent walls so that they generate water as well. This may lead to a chain reaction, which is useful for

name: Wulfrum Axe
description: The Wulfrum Axe is a craftable Pre-Hardmode axe. Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes.

name: Cosmic Plushie
description: The Cosmic Plushie is a post-Moon Lord Death Mode-exclusive pet summoning item that summons a miniature Devourer of Gods gijinka. It is obtained by opening The Devourer of Gods' Treasure Bag with a Hardcore character while Death Mode is active. The Chibii Devourer will follow the player on foot. If the player moves or flies far away, it will create and fly on a miniature Cosmic Guardian to keep pace. Whenever it summons or dispels the worm, the pet will generate a small burst of red light akin t

name: Astrum Deus Probe
description: Astrum Deus Probes were variants of the Astral Probe summoned by Astrum Deus. The flying Astrum Deus Probes moved freely through the air and fired lasers at the player, similarly to the Probes spawned by The Destroyer. They differed from normal Astral Probes due to their greatly increased health and further increased damage reduction in Revengeance Mode. The orbiting Astrum Deus Probes circled around the head of one of the Astrum Deus worms, typically in very large groups. If that worm was destr

name: Charred Relic
description: Not to be confused with Charred Idol, the summoning item for the Brimstone Elemental. For the Brimling enemy, see here. The Charred Relic is a pet summoning item that summons a Brimling. It is obtained by opening the Brimstone Elemental's Treasure Bag in Revengeance Mode. The Brimling will float behind the player and follow them very closely. If the player manages to outrun her for too long, she will teleport near them and create some red dust in the process. The Brimling will also go in her she

name: Brimling
description: This article is about the enemy. For the pet with the same name, see Charred Relic. Brimlings are Hardmode boss servant enemies that are spawned by the Brimstone Elemental in Revengeance Mode or during the Boss Rush. A maximum of two can exist at a time during the fight. Brimlings follow a similar movement pattern to the Brimstone Elemental's first phase, flying towards the player and occasionally teleporting. They do not deal contact damage, instead shooting hellfire balls in order to damage th

name: Auric Ore
description: "A godly aura has blessed the world's caverns." Auric Ore is a post-Moon Lord ore found in the Cavern layer after Jungle Dragon, Yharon has been defeated. Its main use is to craft Auric Bars, which are used in creating some of the most powerful gear in the Calamity Mod. It requires at least a Blossom Pickaxe to mine. Unlike most other ores, Auric Ore spawns in enormous clusters. The largest veins can easily have 150 blocks of ore or more; to compensate, Auric Bars require an increased number of

name: Aureus Cell
description: The Aureus Cell is a Hardmode potion dropped by Astrum Aureus. When consumed, it restores the player for 200 mana, inflicting the Mana Sickness debuff, and granting Mana Regeneration and Magic Power buffs for 6 minutes. It is additionally used as a crafting material for several items. Aureus Cells may also be obtained from Astral Crates after Astrum Aureus is defeated. The item was previously known as "Astral Jelly", and was dropped from the Astrageldon Slime.

name: Celestial Jewel
description: The Celestial Jewel is a craftable Hardmode accessory. It boosts life regeneration by 2, even while the player is under the effects of a damaging debuff. When worn while being damaged by a debuff, the player's defense will increase by 15 and life regen will increase by an additional 2 (for a total of 4). Pressing the Astral Teleport key while no bosses are alive will teleport the player to a random location in the same manner as a Teleportation Potion, and has no cooldown. If the player is under

name: Divine Geode
description: Divine Geodes are a post-Moon Lord crafting material dropped exclusively by Providence, the Profaned Goddess.

name: Eidolist
description: The Eidolist is a Hardmode enemy that appears in the 3rd layer of the Abyss and are also summoned by the adult Eidolon Wyrm during its first four phases. Eidolists will stay in one place until they are damaged, in which they will attempt to fly towards the player, going through blocks and teleporting periodically. Once provoked, they will release lightning orbs and ice balls that emit ice shards. Both attacks are very similar to those of the Lunatic Cultist. The lightning inflicts the Electrifie

name: Eidolon Tablet
description: The Eidolon Tablet is a Hardmode summoning item that is dropped by Eidolists. If the Lunar Events are currently not active, it is used to summon the Lunatic Cultist near the player. Since this item can be obtained Pre-Golem, it can allow the player to fight the Lunatic Cultist and access the Celestial Pillars earlier before defeating Golem. This item cannot be used if the Mysterious Tablet and its Cultists are present at the Dungeon. It also cannot be used if the Lunatic Cultist is alive or if t

name: Starter Bag
description: The Starter Bag is a grab bag item that is given to every newly spawned player. Right-clicking on the bag while it is in the inventory will give the player many items, all of which will help them progress through the beginning of the game more quickly and easily. Since the bag gives the player Bombs, the Demolitionist town NPC can arrive as soon as a house is available after starting a new character.

name: Dark Sun Ring
description: The Dark Sun Ring is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory which grants a wide array of benefits. It provides +1 life regeneration, 10 defense, a 12% increase to damage, 12% increased melee speed, +2 extra minion slots, +120% minion knockback, and 15% increased mining speed. During the day, the Dark Sun Ring provides an additional +3 life regeneration for a total of +4. At night, it instead provides an extra 15 defense for a total of 25 defense. During a Solar Eclipse, the player gets both bonuse

name: Blood Relic
description: Not to be confused with Blood Rune, the ammunition for Ice Barrage. The Blood Relic is a craftable Hardmode consumable item that, when used at night, immediately summons a Blood Moon. Using it during the day or while a Blood Moon is already occurring will do nothing and won't consume the item.

name: Defiled Feather
description: The Defiled Feather is a craftable item that when favorited, will prevent Wings from working. It is obtained from opening a Starter Bag or by crafting it at a Demon Altar or Crimson Altar. This item was formerly known as the "Defiled Rune". This item is a reference to the Defiled Chalice from the game Bloodborne, and it had some similar functions to it previously. The sprite and tooltip are references to the game Celeste. The item's appearance is based on the Feathers from the game. In previous

name: Armageddon
description: Armageddon is an item found within the Starter Bag that can be activated and deactivated. When active, it has multiple effects on gameplay: While a boss is alive (either from Calamity Mod or vanilla), any damage to the player (such as enemy or projectile contact, fall damage, or Grenades) will result in instant death. The player's respawn time is much shorter. Bosses will drop an additional 5 Treasure Bags even in Normal Mode if said boss has never been defeated previously in the world. Right cl

name: Toxic Minnow
description: The Toxic Minnow is an enemy that spawns in the 1st, 2nd and 3rd layers of the Abyss. It swims in one direction and turns around when it hits a wall, dealing contact damage if the player touches it. It never moves to attack the player or fires projectiles of any kind, even if it is approached or hit. Once killed, it bursts into roughly 10 toxic green skull clouds, which deals damage and inflicts the Poisoned debuff onto anything they touch, including enemies. These clouds linger for 10 seconds b

name: Draedon's Remote
description: If you were looking for something other than the Draedon's Remote, see Draedon (disambiguation). Draedon's Remote is a non-consumable Hardmode item, which drops from Armored Diggers. When used at night, it will summon all three Mechanical Bosses at once. The bosses are much stronger (and larger) than in their original fights. The summoned bosses have the following stats changed: Both of The Twins' health have been raised by x1.8. The Destroyer's health is raised by x1.8 and its size by x1.5. Eac

name: Old Power Cell
description: The Old Power Cell is a Hardmode summoning item that, when used deep within the Jungle Temple, summons the Golem boss. Unlike Lihzahrd Power Cells, the Old Power Cell is not usable at a Lihzahrd Altar and can be used before Plantera has been defeated. Using a normal Lihzahrd Power Cell at the Lihzahrd Altar before Plantera is defeated will not summon Golem, meaning that these items are required to summon it if the Temple Key was crafted early.

name: Mirage Jelly
description: The Mirage Jelly is an enemy which spawns in the third layer of the Abyss. It slowly swims upward, ignoring all blocks in its way, and will occasionally teleport somewhere else on the screen upon taking damage. It never moves to directly attack the player, serving more as a living hazard than an enemy.

name: Luminous Corvina
description: The Luminous Corvina is an enemy that spawns in the second layer of the Abyss. It simply swims from side to side, never attempting to chase the player, even if they damage it. If the player is in front of it for 5 seconds, it will emit a shrill scream which inflicts the Fish Alert debuff, allowing Abyss enemies to notice the player more easily. Once damaged, however, it will scream every 5 seconds as long as it has a line of sight on the player. Due to this enemy's high luminescence, the player

name: Tumbleweed
description: The Tumbleweed is a craftable Hardmode flail. It functions like a normal flail, but it cannot be dragged by holding the mouse button. Once the flail contacts an enemy, the chain will break, releasing a rolling tumbleweed that can pierce many enemies before disappearing. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size.

name: Great Sand Shark
description: "The desert sand shifts intensely!" The Great Sand Shark is a Hardmode, post-Plantera mini boss that spawns during a Sandstorm after killing 10 Sand Sharks. It can be summoned manually by using a Sandstorm's Core at any time in a Desert. While it swims through sand like the more common Sand Shark, it has a much greater variety of attacks on top of its increased size, speed, health and damage, making it a dangerous foe. It always drops a Grand Scale when defeated, which can be used to upgrade var

name: Sandstorm's Core
description: The Sandstorm's Core is a craftable Hardmode summoning item that, when consumed, will summon a Great Sand Shark along with a Sandstorm.

name: Sandstorm (weapon)
description: Not to be confused with the Sandstorm event. The Sandstorm is a craftable Hardmode ranged weapon that is an upgrade to the Sandgun. It uses Sand Blocks as ammo and fires sand blasts which burst on impact. Unlike its predecessor, it does not place Sand Blocks where its projectiles land. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Grand Scale
description: The Grand Scale is a Hardmode, post-Plantera crafting material dropped solely by the Great Sand Shark. It is used to craft powerful sand-related upgrades to previous weapons.

name: Shifting Sands
description: The Shifting Sands is a craftable Hardmode Wand that is a direct upgrade to the Magic Missile. Upon use, it fires a swift projectile that follows the mouse cursor and pierces up-to 4 enemies, and will explode on the fifth enemy or upon tile contact. Unlike the Magic Missile, the weapon auto-fires. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Sand Sharknado Staff
description: The Sand Sharknado Staff is a craftable Hardmode summon weapon that is an upgrade to the Forgotten Apex Wand. Upon use, it summons a sandnado to fight for you by firing miniature high-velocity Sand Sharks at nearby enemies. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Sand Sharknad

name: Duststorm in a Bottle
description: The Duststorm in a Bottle is a craftable Hardmode bomb that hurls a jar filled with sand. The jar explodes into a large number of swirling dust clouds upon hitting an enemy or a block. The dust clouds gradually spread out, damaging any enemy that touches them and passing through walls before slowly fading away. Performing a stealth strike with the Duststorm in a Bottle causes more dust clouds to be spawned, as well as increasing the duration of the clouds. Its best modifier is Flawless. Despite

name: Super Dummy
description: The Super Dummy is a craftable Pre-Hardmode summoning item which spawns a Super Dummy enemy when used with left-click. This enemy is nigh-invincible, with a whopping 9,999,999 health that it is constantly regenerating. It also cannot be killed by damage-over-time from inflicted debuffs. However, right-clicking with the Super Dummy item in hand will cause all Super Dummy enemies to immediately be killed. Due to the Super Dummy enemy's high resilience and inability to harm the player (despite bein

name: Uelibloom Brick
description: Uelibloom Bricks are craftable post-Moon Lord blocks crafted with Uelibloom Ore and Stone Blocks. They are used to make Botanic furniture.

name: Aerialite Brick
description: Aerialite Brick is a craftable block crafted with Aerialite Ore and Stone Blocks.

name: Astral Brick
description: Astral Brick is a craftable Hardmode block crafted with Astral Ore and Stone Blocks.

name: Chaotic Brick
description: Chaotic Bricks are craftable Hardmode blocks crafted with Scoria Ore and Stone Blocks.

name: Cryonic Brick
description: Cryonic Brick is a craftable Hardmode block crafted with Cryonic Ore and Stone Blocks.

name: Perennial Brick
description: Perennial Brick is a craftable Hardmode block crafted with Perennial Ore and Stone Blocks.

name: Aerialite Brick Wall
description: Aerialite Brick Wall is a background wall crafted with Aerialite Brick.

name: Cryonic Brick Wall
description: Cryonic Brick Wall is a background wall crafted with Cryonic Brick.

name: Perennial Brick Wall
description: Perennial Brick Wall is a background wall crafted with Perennial Brick.

name: Astral Brick Wall
description: Astral Brick Wall is a background wall crafted with Astral Brick.

name: Chaotic Brick Wall
description: Chaotic Brick Wall is a background wall crafted with Chaotic Brick.

name: Uelibloom Brick Wall
description: Uelibloom Brick Wall is a background wall crafted with Uelibloom Brick.

name: Siren Clone
description: The Siren Clone was a Hardmode boss servant that used to spawn during the Siren and Leviathan boss fight, summoned by the Siren at 66% / 100% and 33% of her health. They launched water spears at the player that would be fired at an increased rate in Death Mode, and were invincible.

name: Halibut Cannon
description: The Halibut Cannon is a gun dropped from the adult Eidolon Wyrm. It fires out between 25 and 35 bullets per shot that slowly spread out, while only consuming one unit of ammo. Its best modifier is Unreal. When using Acid Rounds or Ichor Bullets as ammo, its damage is reduced by 15%. With the exception of Luminite Bullets, piercing bullets are not effective when using the Halibut Cannon as only one bullet will strike per salvo. This weapon is a reference to the late game critic TotalBiscuit, prev

name: Iron Heart
description: The Iron Heart is an item placed in a newly spawned player's inventory. Upon being used in Expert Mode, it enables or disables several effects on every character in the current world: Natural Health regeneration cannot increase beyond 0, preventing the player from naturally healing over time. If the player is under effects that decrease life regeneration (such as the Drunk Princess' Drinks, Mana Polarizer, or Ethereal Extorter), life regeneration bonuses are able to offset them up to the point w

name: Revivify Potion
description: The Revivify Potion is a craftable Hardmode buff potion. It grants the Revivify buff for 3 minutes, which causes enemy attacks to heal the player for 1/15 of their damage. Revivify essentially acts as a ~6.66% separate DR boost. However, given that it heals after the damage has been taken, it is unable to affect fatal damage.

name: Brimstone Slag Wall
description: Brimstone Slag Wall is a background wall. It is crafted with Brimstone Slag.

name: Smooth Brimstone Slag
description: Smooth Brimstone Slag is a craftable Hardmode block crafted using Brimstone Slag. It is used to create Ashen furniture. Unlike other craftable decorative blocks, Smooth Brimstone Slag has a Pickaxe Power mining requirement.

name: Smooth Brimstone Slag Wall
description: Smooth Brimstone Slag Wall is a background wall crafted from Smooth Brimstone Slag.

name: Cinderplate
description: Cinderplate is a craftable Pre-Hardmode block that can also be found in the core of the Space Bio-center Lab of a world. It can be used as a building material, and is also required to craft the Normality Relocator. Cinderplate's name references Essence of Sunlight's older name, which was Essence of Cinder. Before the introduction of the other 'plate' blocks (Chaosplate, Navyplate, Plagueplate and Elumplate), Cinderplate was used to craft all of the Soul Artifacts as well as the Normality Relocat

name: Exodium Cluster
description: "A cold and dark energy has materialized in space." Exodium Cluster is a post-Moon Lord ore that generates in Planetoids after Moon Lord has been defeated. It requires at least one of the Luminite Pickaxes to mine. It is used to craft several items, including Stratus equipment as well as the four Soul Artifacts, which are accessories that correspond to Lunatic Cultist, Providence, the Profaned Goddess, The Devourer of Gods, and Jungle Dragon, Yharon. This ore does not have a Slime counterpart. T

name: Cosmilite Brick
description: Cosmilite Brick is a craftable post-Moon Lord block crafted with Cosmilite Bars and Stone Blocks. It is also dropped by The Devourer of Gods.

name: Golden Gun
description: The Golden Gun is a Hardmode classless weapon that shoots yellow ichor projectiles, and does not belong to any damage class. Its damage cannot be increased by any stat bonuses. Its projectile inflicts the Ichor debuff to enemies, which makes it useful to weaken bosses regardless of one's choice of class. This weapon does not consume any ammo or mana. The Golden Gun cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers. As this weapon does not count as a specific weapon type, it does not provok

name: Ancient Altar
description: The Ancient Altar is a Hardmode crafting station used to craft the Ancient furniture set themed around the Brimstone Crag.

name: Ashen Altar
description: The Ashen Altar is a Hardmode crafting station used to craft the Ashen furniture set themed around the Brimstone Crag. It is also able to create a Music Box.

name: Void Condenser
description: The Void Condenser is a crafting station used to craft furniture themed around the Abyss. It can be used to create two different furniture sets, one made from Smooth Abyss Gravel and the other from Smooth Voidstone.

name: Static Refiner
description: The Static Refiner is a craftable Pre-Hardmode crafting station used to craft furniture themed around Statigel items and several items that use Purified Gel. It also functions as a Solidifier.

name: Profaned Rock
description: Profaned Rock is a a craftable post-Moon Lord block crafted with Unholy Essence and Stone Blocks, and also comprises the box that spawns around Providence, the Profaned Goddess's loot when she is defeated.

name: Profaned Slab
description: Profaned Slab is a craftable post-Moon Lord block crafted with 5 Profaned Rocks.

name: Runic Profaned Brick
description: Runic Profaned Brick is a craftable post-Moon Lord block crafted with Profaned Rock and Profaned Crystal.

name: Profaned Crystal
description: Profaned Crystal is a craftable post-Moon Lord block crafted with Unholy Essence and Glass.

name: Smooth Abyss Gravel
description: Smooth Abyss Gravel is a craftable block crafted with Abyss Gravel and is used to create Abyss-themed furniture.

name: Voidstone
description: Voidstone is a block that generates in the bottom two layers of the Abyss, replacing Abyss Gravel. It requires at least an Adamantite, Titanium, or Shardlight Pickaxe to mine. Enemies found in the lower layers of the Abyss will also drop Voidstone on death. It cannot be destroyed with explosives.

name: Smooth Voidstone
description: Smooth Voidstone is a craftable block crafted using Voidstone. It is used to create Void furniture.

name: Grandfather Clocks
description: Grandfather Clocks are furniture pieces that tell the in-game time. The Calamity Mod currently adds fourteen types of Grandfather Clocks to the game, each corresponding to specific sets of furniture. The Ashen Monolith adjusts its eye to look at the closest player at all times.

name: Smooth Voidstone Wall
description: Smooth Voidstone Wall is a background wall crafted from Smooth Voidstone.

name: Statigel Block
description: Statigel Block is a craftable block crafted from Purified Gel. It is used to make Statigel furniture.

name: Eldritch Soul Artifact
description: The Eldritch Soul Artifact is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory which reduces mana costs by 15%, increases the velocity of ranged projectiles by 25%, increases max minions by 2, increases melee speed by 10%, and gives a 15% rogue damage boost. This item was originally used to summon the Ancient Doomsayer at any time, who has since been removed.

name: Dimensional Soul Artifact
description: The Dimensional Soul Artifact is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory. When worn, all damage dealt by the player is boosted by 25%. However, all damage inflicted onto the player is increased by 15%. The Reaper Tooth Necklace provides a lower damage boost, but the armor penetration bonus can sometimes be preferable. Due to this, Reaper Tooth Necklace may be prioritized over this accessory. The damage-taken boost is the same as the head and tail of The Devourer of Gods. The Dimensional Soul Artifa

name: Beds
description: Beds are furniture items that allows the player to set their spawn point. The Calamity Mod currently adds fourteen types of beds to the game, each corresponding to specific sets of furniture.

name: Godly Soul Artifact
description: The Godly Soul Artifact is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory. When worn, the player is granted an additional minion slot for every Son of Yharon that has been summoned, the same minion that are summoned by the Yharon's Kindle Staff weapon. The Godly Soul Artifact was previously a usable item that summoned the Dragon God, Yharon boss, who has since been removed.

name: Candles
description: Candles are pieces of furniture that emit light. The Calamity Mod currently adds nineteen types of candles to the game, with twelve corresponding to specific sets of furniture, two acting as upgrades to the Water Candle and Peace Candle, and the remaining four being purchasable from the Drunk Princess. For the purpose of housing Town NPCs, Chaos and Tranquility candles and Drunk Princess candles do not count as a light source. Additionally, The Drunk Princess' candles cannot be toggled by wire,

name: Future bosses
description: The future bosses, also known as the Soul Artifact bosses, were a group of three post-Moon Lord bosses that the Calamity Mod added to the game. They were buffed versions of previous bosses, which took the form of their future selves had they not been defeated by the player. They were all summoned using Soul Artifacts crafted with Cinderplates and Exodium Clusters, both of which were found on planetoids. The Ancient Doomsayer was a more powerful variation of the Lunatic Cultist, summoned using th

name: Cosmilite Brick Wall
description: Cosmilite Brick Wall is a background wall crafted with Cosmilite Brick, which is in turn crafted with Cosmilite Bars.

name: Profaned Rock Wall
description: Profaned Rock Wall is a background wall crafted with Profaned Rock.

name: Smooth Abyss Gravel Wall
description: Smooth Abyss Gravel Wall is a background wall crafted with Smooth Abyss Gravel.

name: Profaned Slab Wall
description: Profaned Slab Walls are background walls crafted with Profaned Slabs.

name: Profaned Crystal Wall
description: Profaned Crystal Wall is an aesthetic building material. It is crafted with Profaned Crystal.

name: Runic Profaned Brick Wall
description: Runic Profaned Brick Wall is a post-Moon Lord background wall crafted with Runic Profaned Brick.

name: Statigel Wall
description: Statigel Wall is a background wall crafted with a Statigel Block.

name: Voidstone Wall
description: Voidstone Wall is a background wall that generates naturally in the two bottom layers of the Abyss, replacing Abyss Gravel Wall. It can also be crafted. Naturally generated Voidstone Walls are unbreakable and not visible on the map.

name: Candelabras
description: Candelabras are pieces of furniture that emit light. The Calamity Mod currently adds thirteen types of candelabras to the game, each corresponding to specific sets of furniture.

name: Lamps
description: Lamps are pieces of furniture that emit light. The Calamity Mod currently adds fourteen types of lamps to the game, each corresponding to specific sets of furniture.

name: Cinderplate Wall
description: Cinderplate Wall is a background wall crafted with Cinderplate.

name: Chairs
description: Chairs are pieces of furniture. The Calamity Mod currently adds fourteen types of chairs to the game, each corresponding to specific sets of furniture.

name: Doors
description: Doors are pieces of furniture that can be opened and closed to allow or prevent entry respectively. The Calamity Mod currently adds sixteen types of Doors to the game, each corresponding to specific sets of furniture. Unlike other doors, Aged Laboratory and Laboratory Doors are 4 blocks high instead of 3.

name: Dressers
description: Dressers are pieces of furniture that allow the player to change their character's appearance. They additionally can be used as storage, similar to Chests. The Calamity Mod currently adds fourteen types of Dressers to the game, each corresponding to specific sets of furniture.

name: Bathtubs
description: Bathtubs are pieces of furniture. The Calamity Mod currently adds fourteen types of Bathtubs to the game, each corresponding to specific sets of furniture.

name: Tables
description: Tables are pieces of furniture that also function as minor crafting stations. The Calamity Mod currently adds fourteen types of Tables to the game, each corresponding to specific sets of furniture.

name: Sinks
description: Sinks are pieces of furniture that also function as minor crafting stations. The Calamity Mod currently adds fourteen types of Sinks to the game, each corresponding to specific sets of furniture. Ashen, Ancient and Profaned Sinks count as a source of lava, and Botanic Sinks count as a source of honey; the other sinks count as a source of water.

name: Eidolon Wyrm (juvenile)
description: For the superboss, see Eidolon Wyrm (adult). The juvenile Eidolon Wyrm is a mini boss that spawns in the 3rd and 4th layers of the Abyss and are also summoned from the adult Eidolon Wyrm during its first four phases. It is initially passive and will not attempt to hurt the player. However, if the player deals damage to it, it will become hostile and attack the player with contact damage or magic projectiles. The juvenile Eidolon Wyrm spawns in the third and fourth layers of the Abyss at any poin

name: Sofas
description: Sofas are pieces of furniture. The Calamity Mod currently adds fourteen types of Sofas to the game, each corresponding to specific sets of furniture.

name: Pianos
description: Pianos are pieces of furniture. The Calamity Mod currently adds fourteen types of Pianos to the game, each corresponding to specific sets of furniture.

name: Ashen Key
description: The Ashen Key was a crafting material whose sole use was to craft with an Ashen Chest to remove the lock. The glyph on the key was the alchemical symbol for death.

name: Brimstone Key
description: The Brimstone Key was an unobtainable item. That had no purpose when it was removed. The key previously allowed the player to access the since removed Locked Ashen Chests when in the their inventory. It was not consumed when opening the chest, nor was the lock removed on the chest when opened. The shape of the key is the alchemical symbol for brimstone or sulphur, also known as the Leviathan Cross.

name: Hooks
description: Hooks are tools which aid the player in traversing terrain. When used, hooks fire a chain that latches to a surface or platform and pulls the player towards it. The Calamity Mod adds two new hooks, and also augments the descriptions of vanilla hooks by adding various stats regarding tile reach, launch, and pull velocities. Hooks on the vanilla wiki.

name: Lanterns
description: Lanterns are pieces of furniture that emit light. The Calamity Mod currently adds fifteen types of Lanterns to the game, each corresponding to specific sets of furniture.

name: Chandeliers
description: Chandeliers are pieces of furniture that emit light. The Calamity Mod currently adds fourteen types of Chandeliers to the game, each corresponding to specific sets of furniture.

name: Platforms
description: Platforms are pieces of furniture that function as tiles and can be walked on. The Calamity Mod currently adds thirteen types of Platforms to the game, each corresponding to specific sets of furniture.

name: Voidstone Slab
description: Voidstone Slab is a craftable block crafted with Smooth Voidstone.

name: Eidolon Wyrm (adult)
description: "Eidolon Wyrm" redirects here. For the mini boss, see Eidolon Wyrm (juvenile). The adult Eidolon Wyrm is a Superboss battled in the 4th layer of the Abyss. While it can be summoned at any time, it is intended to be fought after both the Exo Mechs and Supreme Calamitas have been defeated. Its only unique drop is the Halibut Cannon, a powerful endgame gun. The adult Eidolon Wyrm does not spawn on its own and will spawn at any time if a player is affected with the Chaos State debuff (given by Rod o

name: Ashen Slab
description: Ashen Slab is a craftable block crafted with Smooth Brimstone Slag. The slab has four different possible glyphs that can appear on it that take the form of alchemical symbols. These include: 🜏, the Leviathan Cross, the alchemical symbol for sulfur (brimstone). 🜍, an alternate alchemical symbol for sulfur. Ω, upper-case Omega, the last letter of the Greek alphabet, and also the alchemical symbol for death. 🜂, the alchemical symbol for fire.

name: Basins
description: Basins are placeable furniture items unique to the Calamity Mod. Unlike the other furniture sets, only six types of basin exist in the Mod.

name: Abyss Torch
description: Abyss Torches are torches that can function both on land and underwater. When placed or held, they emit a gray light and release light blue sparks.

name: Arena Block
description: Arena Block, also known as Arena Tile or simply Arena, is an unobtainable block encountered only during the Supreme Calamitas fight. It is almost completely indestructible, unable to be mined with any pickaxe or destroyed with any explosives, only able to be broken by the Crystyl Crusher. It is spawned by using Ashes of Calamity or an Ceremonial Urn at an Altar of the Accursed, forming a box centered around said altar. This box varies in size depending on the difficulty mode, being 159x159 (inne

name: Drataliornus
description: Drataliornus is a craftable Malice Mode-exclusive post-Moon Lord bow. It is an upgrade to Blossom Flux. Its left click initially shoots fireballs at a very low rate, but increases in speed until reaching its highest fire rate after six seconds. The fireballs will create small explosions similar to Heavenly Gale's orange bolts and always inflict a slew of debuffs for 8 seconds: Ichor Betsy's Curse Daybroken Holy Flames On enemies, these combined debuffs cause the target to be unable to regenerate

name: Astrum Aureus
description: "A titanic cyborg infected by a star-borne disease..." Not to be confused with Astrum Deus, a similarly-themed worm-like boss. Astrum Aureus is a Hardmode boss. Defeating it causes an Astral Infection meteor to fall somewhere in the world. After defeating the Moon Lord, Astrum Aureus increases substantially in difficulty, with boosted health and damage, and drops a new mount. Astrum Aureus does not spawn on its own and must be summoned at Night using the Astral Chunk in the Astral Infection biom

name: Drunk Princess
description: Not to be confused with Princess, a vanilla NPC. The Drunk Princess is an NPC vendor that sells Alcohol depending on the player's progression, she also has the unique ability to count the number of times the player has died in the world. The Drunk Princess will spawn once the following conditions have been met: There is an empty house. A player in the world has Fabsol's Vodka in their inventory. The world is in Hardmode. When threatened by enemies, she will defend herself with a ray of light tha

name: Town NPCs
description: The Calamity Mod adds five friendly NPCs to provide the player with a multitude of weapons and buffs in progression. These NPCs only move to the player's house once their requirements are met. In Revengeance Mode, the price of the Nurse's healing scales with progression in the game. The price for healing will also be multiplied by 5 if any bosses are alive. Some vanilla NPCs have new items sold under certain conditions. Vanilla NPCs will have new additional quotes that can be seen under certain

name: Archmage
description: The Archmage is a Hardmode NPC vendor that will spawn once the following conditions have been met: There is an empty house. Cryogen has been defeated. When threatened by enemies, he will defend himself with a dark ice crystal. The Archmage will always be named Permafrost. While homeless: "I deeply appreciate you rescuing me from being trapped within my frozen castle.... It's been many, many years..." "I have not seen such a sky in decades. Who are you, to so brazenly march against that Tyrant?"

name: Terminus
description: Terminus is a non-consumable summoning item that is used to start and cancel the Boss Rush event. It can only be obtained by finding it in the Shrine at the bottom layer of the Abyss. Using Terminus while a boss is alive will instantly despawn the boss and trigger the Boss Rush. Using Terminus to deactivate the Boss Rush will not display a status message. The word "terminus" means the end, the limit, or the final goal. In previous versions of the mod, the item could alternatively be obtained as

name: Grape Beer
description: Grape Beer is a Hardmode potion that is sold by the Drunk Princess NPC. It grants the Grape Beer debuff when consumed, which reduces defense and movement speed, as well as healing 100 life and mana. It also inflicts the Potion Sickness debuff for 1 minute and the Mana Sickness debuff for 5 seconds.

name: Red Wine
description: Red Wine is a Hardmode potion that is sold by the Drunk Princess NPC. It inflicts the Red Wine debuff when consumed, which reduces life regen by 1, and heals 200 life. It also inflicts the Potion Sickness debuff for 1 minute. If the player is under the effect of the Baguette buff, it heals 250 life but reduces life regen by 4 instead.

name: Moonshine
description: Moonshine is a Hardmode potion that is sold by the Drunk Princess NPC after defeating Golem. It grants the Moonshine debuff when consumed, which reduces life regen but increases defense and damage reduction. While the effects of the Moonshine debuff are mostly beneficial, it is still considered a debuff, and therefore cannot be removed by right-clicking the icon.

name: Vodka
description: Vodka is a Hardmode potion that is sold by the Drunk Princess NPC after all the Mechanical Bosses have been defeated. It grants the Vodka debuff when consumed, which reduces life regen and defense, but boosts damage and critical strike chance. While the effects of the Vodka debuff are mostly beneficial, it is still considered a debuff, and therefore cannot be removed by right-clicking the icon.

name: Whiskey
description: Whiskey is a Hardmode potion that is sold by the Drunk Princess NPC. It grants the Whiskey debuff when consumed, which reduces defense, but boosts damage, critical strike chance and knockback. While the effects of the Whiskey debuff are mostly beneficial, it is still considered a debuff, and therefore cannot be removed by right-clicking the icon.

name: Tequila
description: Tequila is a Hardmode potion that is sold by the Drunk Princess NPC. It grants the Tequila debuff when consumed, which reduces life regen, but boosts damage, critical strike chance, knockback, defense and damage reduction during the day. While the effects of the Tequila debuff are mostly beneficial, it is still considered a debuff, and therefore cannot be removed by right-clicking the icon.

name: Rum
description: Rum is a Hardmode potion that is sold by the Drunk Princess NPC. It grants the Rum debuff when consumed, which reduces defense, but boosts life regen and movement speed. While the effects of the Rum debuff are mostly beneficial, it is still considered a debuff, and therefore cannot be removed by right-clicking the icon.

name: Fireball
description: Fireball is a Hardmode potion that is sold by the Drunk Princess NPC. It grants the Fireball debuff when consumed, which reduces life regen and boosts the damage of weapons that have the - Fire Weapon - tag in their tooltips by 5%. While the effects of the Fireball debuff are mostly beneficial, it is still considered a debuff, and therefore cannot be removed by right-clicking the icon.

name: Cinnamon Roll
description: Cinnamon Roll is a Hardmode potion that is sold by the Drunk Princess NPC after defeating Golem. It grants the Cinnamon Roll debuff when consumed, which reduces defense, but boosts mana regeneration rate and the damage of weapons that have the - Fire Weapon - tag in their tooltips. While the effects of the Cinnamon Roll debuff are mostly beneficial, it is still considered a debuff, and therefore cannot be removed by right-clicking the icon.

name: Everclear
description: Everclear is a Hardmode potion that is sold by the Drunk Princess NPC after Astrum Aureus has been defeated. It grants the Everclear debuff when consumed, which reduces life regen and defense, but boosts damage by 25%. While the effects of the Everclear debuff are mostly beneficial, it is still considered a debuff, and therefore cannot be removed by right-clicking the icon. This alcohol counts as two alcohols for the purposes of Alcohol Poisoning, unlike most other drinks sold by the Drunk Princ

name: Bloody Mary
description: Bloody Mary is a Hardmode potion that is sold by the Drunk Princess NPC during a Blood Moon if Astrum Aureus has been defeated. It grants the Bloody Mary debuff when consumed, which reduces life regen and defense, but boosts damage, critical strike chance, movement speed and melee speed during a Blood Moon. While the effects of the Bloody Mary debuff are mostly beneficial, it is still considered a debuff, and therefore cannot be removed by right-clicking the icon.

name: Star Beam Rye
description: Star Beam Rye is a Hardmode potion that is sold by the Drunk Princess NPC during the night if Astrum Aureus has been defeated. It grants the Star Beam Rye debuff when consumed, which reduces life regen and defense, but boosts magic damage, max mana and reduces mana usage. While the effects of the Star Beam Rye debuff are mostly beneficial, it is still considered a debuff, and therefore cannot be removed by right-clicking the icon.

name: Evergreen Gin
description: Evergreen Gin is a Hardmode potion that is sold by the Drunk Princess NPC after Plantera has been defeated. It grants the Evergreen Gin debuff when consumed, which reduces life regen, but boosts damage reduction and the damage of weapons that have the - Nature Weapon - tag in their tooltips. While the effects of the Evergreen Gin debuff are mostly beneficial, it is still considered a debuff, and therefore cannot be removed by right-clicking the icon.

name: Astral Dirt
description: Astral Dirt is a Hardmode block which replaces Dirt Blocks in the Astral Infection biome upon its creation. It spontaneously creates Astral Grass, since Astral Grass Seeds cannot be obtained.

name: Astral Dirt Wall
description: Astral Dirt Walls are background walls that replace Dirt Walls in the Astral Infection biome upon its creation.

name: Astral Stone
description: Astral Stone is a Hardmode block which replaces Stone Blocks in the Astral Infection biome upon its creation.

name: Astral Ice
description: Astral Ice is a Hardmode block which replaces Ice Blocks in the Astral Infection biome upon its creation.

name: Astral Sand
description: Astral Sand is a Hardmode block which replaces Sand Blocks in the Astral Infection biome upon its creation.

name: Astral Sandstone
description: Astral Sandstone is a Hardmode block which replaces Sandstone Blocks in the Astral Infection biome upon its creation.

name: Hardened Astral Sand
description: Hardened Astral Sand is a Hardmode block which replaces Hardened Sand Blocks in the Astral Infection biome upon its creation.

name: Astral Monolith
description: Astral Monolith is a Hardmode block which replaces Wood in the Astral Infection biome and can be obtained by cutting down Monoliths. It is not part of the Any Wood recipe group and therefore cannot be used in recipes requiring wood.

name: Astral Stone Wall
description: Astral Stone Wall is a background wall that replace Stone Wall in the Astral Infection biome upon its creation.

name: Hardened Astral Sand Wall
description: Hardened Astral Sand Wall is a background wall that replace Hardened Sand Wall in the Astral Infection biome upon its creation.

name: Astral Sandstone Wall
description: Astral Sandstone Walls are background walls that replace Sandstone Walls in the Astral Infection biome upon its creation.

name: Astral Ice Wall
description: Astral Ice Walls are background walls that replace Ice Walls in the Astral Infection biome upon its creation.

name: Astral Grass Wall
description: Astral Grass Walls are background walls that replace Grass Walls in the Astral Infection biome upon its creation. Unlike other natural walls generated by the Astral Infection, natural Astral Grass Walls can be collected. Player placed Astral Grass Walls will not count as valid housing.

name: Star Cannon EX
description: The Star Cannon EX is a craftable Hardmode ranged weapon and the upgrade to the Star Cannon. It consumes Fallen Stars to rapidly fire three different types of star projectiles: red, yellow, and pink. Pink stars pass through tiles with unlimited range, red stars pass through tiles with a limited range, and yellow stars do not pass through tiles and have unlimited range. Its best modifier is Unreal. Grinding Astrum Aureus is an efficient, though not necessarily easy, way of obtaining Fallen Stars.

name: Margarita
description: Margarita is a Hardmode potion that is sold by the Drunk Princess NPC after defeating Plantera. It grants the Margarita debuff when consumed, which reduces life regen and defense, but halves the duration to most debuffs. It also heals the player for 200 life and mana. It also inflicts the Potion Sickness debuff for 1 minute and the Mana Sickness debuff for 5 seconds. While the effects of the Margarita debuff are mostly beneficial, it is still considered a debuff, and therefore cannot be removed

name: Caribbean Rum
description: Caribbean Rum is a Hardmode potion that is sold by the Drunk Princess NPC after Plantera has been defeated. It grants the Caribbean Rum debuff when consumed, which reduces defense, but boosts life regen, movement speed and wing flight time. While the effects of the Caribbean Rum debuff are mostly beneficial, it is still considered a debuff, and therefore cannot be removed by right-clicking the icon. When used with the Featherfall Potion and pressing ▲ Up, the player can float upwards. The floaty

name: Tequila Sunrise
description: Tequila Sunrise is a Hardmode potion that is sold by the Drunk Princess NPC after defeating Golem. It grants the Tequila Sunrise debuff when consumed, which reduces life regen, but boosts damage, critical strike chance, damage reduction, knockback and defense during the daytime and Solar Eclipses. While the effects of the Tequila Sunrise debuff are mostly beneficial, it is still considered a debuff, and therefore cannot be removed by right-clicking the icon.

name: White Wine
description: White Wine is a Hardmode potion that is sold by the Drunk Princess NPC after all the Mechanical Bosses have been defeated. It grants the White Wine debuff when consumed, which reduces life regen and defense, but boosts magic damage. It also inflicts Mana Sickness for 5 seconds. While the effects of the White Wine debuff are mostly beneficial, it is still considered a debuff, and therefore cannot be removed by right-clicking the icon.

name: Moscow Mule
description: Moscow Mule is a Hardmode potion that is sold by the Drunk Princess NPC after defeating Golem. It grants the Moscow Mule debuff when consumed, which reduces life regen, but boosts damage, knockback and critical strike chance. While the effects of the Moscow Mule debuff are mostly beneficial, it is still considered a debuff, and therefore cannot be removed by right-clicking the icon.

name: Screwdriver
description: Screwdriver is a Hardmode potion that is sold by the Drunk Princess NPC after all the Mechanical Bosses have been defeated. It grants the Screwdriver debuff when consumed, which reduces life regen, but boosts the damage of piercing projectiles by 5%. While the effects of the Screwdriver debuff are mostly beneficial, it is still considered a debuff, and therefore cannot be removed by right-clicking the icon.

name: Enchanted Metal
description: Enchanted Metal was a Hardmode crafting material sold by the Archmage NPC. It was used as an alternative to craft the summoning items for the Mechanical Bosses.

name: Coldheart Icicle
description: The Coldheart Icicle is a unique Hardmode shortsword that is sold by the Archmage. It always deals 1 damage to enemies, regardless of any modifiers or attack boosts the player may have, and it cannot inflict critical hits. Whenever an enemy is struck with this weapon, their health is decreased by 2% of their max health, ignoring all defense and damage reduction. Its best modifier is Light, as the Coldheart Icicle has minimal knockback and does not benefit from increased damage or critical strike

name: Big Sightseer
description: Not to be confused with Small Sightseer, a similar enemy that also spawns in the Astral Infection. The Big Sightseer is a Hardmode enemy which spawns in the Astral Infection biome. It slowly pursues the player in an attempt to ram them, occasionally firing a projectile with a double-helix trail. It will emit dust from its mouth shortly before firing, telegraphing the attack. The projectile harmlessly bursts upon contact with tiles or any weapon.

name: Small Sightseer
description: Not to be confused with Big Sightseer, a similar enemy that also spawns in the Astral Infection. The Small Sightseer is a Hardmode enemy which spawns in the Astral Infection biome. They pursue the player and attempt to charge at them. Unlike the Big Sightseers, they do not have any projectiles and can only damage the player through contact damage.

name: Aries
description: Not to be confused with Aeries, a Hardmode gun. The Aries is a Hardmode enemy which spawns on the Surface Astral Infection biome. It leaps quickly towards the player with both small and larger strides. Aries is named after the Zodiac astrological sign of the same name.

name: Atlas
description: Atlas is a Hardmode enemy which spawns on the Surface Astral Infection biome. It is initially idle, in which it stands still and occasionally turns around. If it notices the player, it will walk slowly towards them, attempting to jump over any obstacles in the way. When Atlas gets close enough to the player, it will uppercut them with its big arm and launch them far away, after which the attack will enter a short cooldown. If it loses sight of the player for long enough, it will return to its id

name: Mantis
description: The Mantis is a Hardmode enemy which spawns on the Surface Astral Infection biome. It chases the player on the ground, gaining speed if continuously running in one direction, slowing down when turning around, and hopping if it encounters a gap in the ground or a change in elevation. If the player is on the ground and close enough, it briefly stops and fires a short-ranged spinning scythe projectile at them. The Mantis' projectile is a reference to the projectiles fired by the Mantis Lords boss a

name: Nova
description: The Nova is a Hardmode enemy which spawns on the Surface Astral Infection biome. Initially, it loosely hovers near the player. If it maintains a line of sight on the player for long enough, it starts pulsating and stops in place, then begins to accelerate in a straight line until it collides with the player or any surface, exploding on contact. This enemy will not drop any loot if it dies by charging into a block. This enemy is named after a nova (Latin for "new", as in "new star"); a strong and

name: Astralachnea
description: The Astralachnea is a Hardmode enemy which spawns in the Underground Astral Infection biome. It is an Astral variation of Wall Creepers and Black Recluses, chasing the player and climbing on walls when possible.

name: Hive (enemy)
description: If you were looking for something other than the enemy, see Hive (disambiguation). The Hive is a Hardmode enemy which spawns in the Underground Astral Infection biome. It is stationary, and attacks by spawning Hivelings which attempt to fly into the player, it will also spawn Hivelings when damaged. There is no limit on how many Hivelings can be alive at one time.

name: Stellar Culex
description: The Stellar Culex is a Hardmode enemy which spawns in the Underground Astral Infection biome. It flies over the player's head and attempts to slowly swoop down on them. This enemy's name refers to a genus of mosquito.

name: Fusion Feeder
description: The Fusion Feeder is a Hardmode enemy which spawns in the Desert Astral Infection biome. It is the Astral variant of Sand Shark, although unlike Sand Sharks it is unable to swim freely through blocks nor lunge at the player through them. Instead, it crawls along the tops of blocks or submerges shallowly, about 1 block deep, to approach the player. It is able to swim and lunge at the player if it is within a body of water. Killing Fusion Feeders will count toward spawning the Great Sand Shark aft

name: Hadarian
description: The Hadarian is a Hardmode enemy which spawns in the Desert Astral Infection biome. It behaves like the Vulture, initially waiting in place for a player to come near, then takes off once approached and begins hovering above the player, periodically swooping down to deal damage. It is much faster than a Vulture and is able to hover and pursue the player at a better pace. This enemy's name refers to the Hadar star system, also known as Beta Centauri.

name: Blight Slime
description: The Blight Slime is a decently uncommon Pre-Hardmode slime that spawns in the Corruption/Crimson biome. It has two variants, which appear depending on the world's evil biome. It drops Blighted Gel, a crafting material used in the crafting of the Overloaded Sludge, which is the summoning item for The Slime God, as well as various other recipes such as the Zen Potion. Blight Slimes seem to be smaller versions of the Ebonian and Crimulan Slime Gods' previous sprites, but with the colors swapped.

name: Starmada
description: The Starmada is a craftable post-Moon Lord ranged weapon, the direct upgrade to the Starfleet, and the final upgrade of the Star Cannon.
