It automatically fires a barrage of five random star-related projectiles. These projectiles do not pierce and have randomly varying movement speeds, even amongst others of the same type, although the plasma blasts are always the fastest. The Starmada initially fires rather slowly, but fires faster the longer the player uses the weapon. Upon reaching around 10 s

name: Astral Solution
description: Astral Solution is a Hardmode solution that is sold by the Steampunker. It is usable in the Clentaminator and spreads the Astral Infection to any non-infected block.

name: Permafrost's Concoction
description: Permafrost's Concoction is a Hardmode accessory that is sold by the Archmage NPC for 36 . It increases the wearer's maximum mana by 50, decreases mana cost by 15%, and grants life regen that increases as the wearer's health lowers, with a significant bonus if the player is afflicted with the Poisoned, On Fire! or Brimstone Flames debuffs. If the player takes fatal damage while this accessory is equipped, they will be revived for 30% of their max health instead of dying. However, they are also in

name: Absolute Zero
description: The Absolute Zero is a Hardmode broadsword that autoswings, and is sold by the Archmage NPC for 80 after the defeating all three minibosses in the Frost Moon event. When swung, it fires a dark ice projectile which explodes upon impact with any enemy or surface, potentially hitting twice. Uniquely, its projectiles deal 50% less damage if they critically hit. Striking an enemy directly also creates large frost explosions. Both the blade and its projectiles always inflict the Frostburn and Glacial

name: Frostbite Blaster
description: The Frostbite Blaster is a Hardmode gun sold by the Archmage NPC. It fires 3 rounds of 2 bullets in uneven spreads before pausing to reload for 0.9 seconds. If Musket Balls are used as ammo, bullets are replaced with icicles that inflict Frostburn. Its best modifier is Unreal. The icicles fired by this weapon are identical to those from the Blizzard Staff.

name: Eternal Blizzard
description: The Eternal Blizzard is a Hardmode bow that auto-fires, and is sold by the Archmage NPC for 80 after defeating all three minibosses in the Frost Moon event. In addition to firing a regular arrow, the bow also fires an Icicle Arrow, which bursts upon impact. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Winter's Fury
description: The Winter's Fury is a Hardmode spell tome sold by the Archmage NPC for 80 after defeating all three minibosses in the Frost Moon event. It fires a stream of ice orbs along with a barrage of ice shards towards the player's cursor. These projectiles have a long range, are affected by gravity, and inflict the Frostburn debuff upon hitting an enemy. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Arctic Bear Paw
description: The Arctic Bear Paw is a Hardmode magic weapon sold by the Archmage NPC for 48 after all three Mechanical Bosses have been defeated. It fires large ice claws with very high knockback that pass through walls and enemies. The projectiles slow down shortly after being fired and then disappear, inflicting Glacial State and Confused on hit enemies. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Icicle Trident
description: The Icicle Trident is a Hardmode wand sold by the Archmage NPC. It shoots out volleys of three icicle shards which will pierce through enemies once and inflict the Frostburn and Glacial State debuffs. Its best modifier is Mythical. The Icicle Trident can be considered to be the counterpart to the Poison Staff as both function similarly, have similar damage and both inflict strong debuffs. Despite shooting three icicle shards at once, an enemy can only be hit once at any given time, instead of ta

name: Frosty Flare
description: Not to be confused with Frost Flare, an accessory which drops from Cryogen in Revengeance Mode. Frosty Flares are consumable Hardmode rogue weapons sold by the Archmage NPC for 8 each after the defeating all Mechanical Bosses. When thrown, icicle shards rain down from the sky around the flare. The flares remain fixed on struck enemies, causing the icicles to fall on the marked enemy. A max of five flares can mark a single enemy at a time. Thrown flares that hit enemies will always inflict the Fr

name: Cryogenic Staff
description: The Cryogenic Staff is a Hardmode sentry sold by the Archmage NPC for 48 after defeating all the Mechanical Bosses. When summoned, the ice sentry fires an ice ball that inflicts the Frostburn debuff, as well as their rate increasing the longer an enemy is targeted. After targeting an enemy for three seconds, the sentry goes into a frenzied state, spinning around rapidly and firing ice balls with significantly increased fire rate as well as icicles in all directions. Its best modifier is Ruthless

name: Icy Bullet
description: Not to be confused with Frostspark Bullet, which is crafted with Cryonic Bars. Icy Bullets are Hardmode bullets sold by the Archmage NPC for 80 each after the defeating all three minibosses in the Frost Moon event. The bullets are able to pierce into enemies twice until they are broken upon hitting the third enemy. Each time a bullet breaks, it releases three to five ice shards that deal 50% less damage to everything. The damage penalty the Ice Shards possess takes the gun's base damage into acc

name: Icicle Arrow
description: Not to be confused with Arctic Arrow, which is crafted with Cryonic Bars. Icicle Arrows are Hardmode arrows sold by the Archmage NPC for 80 each after the defeating all three minibosses in the Frost Moon event. They shatter into shards upon impact with a tile or an enemy and inflict the Frostburn debuff on hit enemies. The Eternal Blizzard also fires Icicle Arrows in addition to Wooden Arrows. The ice shards will deal 40% less damage to everything. The damage penalty takes the bow's base damage

name: Delicious Meat
description: The Delicious Meat is a consumable food item sold by the Archmage NPC for 50 . When consumed, it grants the Well Fed buff for 30 minutes.

name: Aureus Spawn
description: The Aureus Spawn is a Hardmode boss servant that is summoned by Astrum Aureus in Revengeance Mode or during the Boss Rush. Upon initially spawning, it is harmless, moving closer the player and occasionally teleporting to some location near the player. It can only take 1 damage from attacks, or 2 damage if the attack is a critical strike. Once its health drops below 1000, it becomes invincible and starts accelerating towards the player, acting much like a projectile. Once in this state, it will e

name: Divine Retribution
description: Divine Retribution is a craftable post-Moon Lord wand and a direct upgrade to Undine's Retribution. It summons many high-speed divine spears from below that home in on enemies and inflict the Crush Depth and Holy Flames debuffs. The spears can also go through blocks, and will disappear after a moderate time if no enemy is hit. If no enemies are nearby, the spears will instead home in on the player. Its best modifier is Mythical. The spears that spawn while using the weapon are identical to the H

name: Dark Spark
description: Dark Spark is a craftable post-Moon Lord magic weapon and upgrade to the Last Prism. It initially fires a single black beam of light that splits into six different beams as it charges. Over time, these beams will change to white and, eventually, various colors. Dark Spark projects a single thick beam that deals individual damage, splitting and spinning at a fast rate out of the tip of the weapon. Over time, this spin effect slows down. The process for charging Dark Spark to max takes approximate

name: Light God's Brilliance
description: Light God's Brilliance is a craftable post-Moon Lord spell tome. When used, it rapidly fires a spray of light beads alongside larger light balls. All of Light God's Brilliance's projectiles emit a dim white light. The light beads home in on enemies and, upon impact with them or tiles, releases a tiny non-homing shard which settles some distance away. These shards will damage any enemy that touches them and will disappear upon dealing damage or if untouched for long enough. The light balls travel

name: Supreme Mana Potion
description: The Supreme Mana Potion is a post-Moon Lord potion crafted using a Super Mana Potion and Phantoplasm. Upon drinking, it restores 400 of the player's mana and inflicts the Mana Sickness debuff. It restores the same amount of mana as the Strange Brew. However, it does not inflict the Potion Sickness debuff on use, making it far more ideal for usage during boss battles that require frequent health and mana restoration.

name: Profaned Soul Artifact
description: The Profaned Soul Artifact is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory. It summons miniature Profaned Guardians to assist the player, based on different requirements that must be met by the player. When equipped, the Healer Guardian is summoned, which heals the player for 5 health every 5 seconds. Additional Guardians will scale the healing by 5 health for a maximum of 15 health every 5 seconds. When the player has at least 10 minion slots, the Defensive Guardian will be summoned, which rapidly dash

name: Magic Scarf and Hat
description: The Magic Scarf and Hat are a Hardmode accessory sold by the Archmage. Equipping them grants the Popo buff, turning the user into a snowman. If the player is damaged by a Demon, Voodoo Demon or Red Devil, the Noseless Popo debuff is inflicted upon the player and they lose their nose for 10 minutes. The accessory is considered a vanity item, as it provides no stats or bonuses. Equipping the accessory in the vanity slot will cause the player to appear as a snowman without the Popo buff. The player

name: Bear's Eye
description: Bear's Eye is a pet summoning item that can be purchased from the Bandit for 5 . It summons a guardian angel cat named Bear to follow the player. If the player moves too fast, Bear will use blue wings to fly towards them. This item is based on Lilac Vrt Olligoci's real pet cat, Bear, who was blind with cataracts. Bear sadly passed away on December 2nd, 2018, hence this item's depiction of him as a "guardian angel". In previous versions, the Archmage would sell this item.

name: Rogue Emblem
description: The Rogue Emblem is a Hardmode accessory dropped by the Wall of Flesh. While equipped, it increases rogue damage by 15%. It is the rogue-class equivalent of the vanilla class emblems.

name: Devil Fish
description: The Devil Fish is an enemy that spawns in the 1st and 2nd layers of the Abyss. It remains passive, swimming back and forth, until the player reaches under 1/4 of their max health, after which it will become aggressive and attempt to attack the player. Its mask also protects it from 5 hits, after which it will break and the Devil Fish will become permanently aggressive. When the mask is broken, it receives a speed boost. Unlike other fish in the Abyss, summons currently do not target or damage th

name: Chaotic Puffer
description: The Chaotic Puffer is an enemy that spawns in the 2nd and 3rd layers of the Abyss. It slowly swims towards the player and inflicts the Brimstone Flames debuff on contact, while periodically puffing up every 5 seconds. While it is unable to damage the player while not puffed, if it hits the player or dies while puffed up, it creates a large brimstone explosion, which also hurts other enemies. It receives increased knockback upon being hit. Though the Chaotic Puffer technically has 100% knockback

name: Sconce
description: Sconces are placable furniture items unique to the Calamity Mod. They are placed on background walls and emit light. Only one type of sconce exists in the mod.

name: Plague Keeper
description: The Plague Keeper is a craftable post-Moon Lord broadsword and upgrade to the Bee Keeper and Virulence. When swung, it releases a large cloud of plague dust that goes through tiles and can pierce infinitely, spawning 25 bees in its path. The cloud slows down and fades away after a second, reducing its damage by 40% while fading. It also releases 3 bees upon true melee contact with enemies. Bees do not pierce through tiles nor enemies, and deal one-third of the sword's damage. Its best modifier i

name: Omega Blue armor
description: Omega Blue armor is a craftable post-Moon Lord armor set crafted from several primarily Abyssal materials, and is only obtainable after Polterghast has been defeated. A total of 30 Reaper Teeth, 19 Lumenyl, 19 Tenebris, and 9 Ruinous Souls are required to craft a full set. If the full set is visible (whether equipped or in social slots), the player will have a pulsating aura around them. It consists of an Omega Blue Helmet, Omega Blue Chestplate, and Omega Blue Tentacles. The full set grants the

name: Level Meters
description: Not to be confused with the Stat Meter, the informational accessory that displays player stats. Level Meters are accessories purchased from the Goblin Tinkerer that tell the player their current levels of proficiency with a certain class, as well as the exact stats gained depending on the class. In addition to this, if they are equipped, they give the player a 10% chance to earn double proficiency if their current proficiency is not divisible by 100.

name: Astral Scythe
description: The Astral Scythe is a Hardmode broadsword that is dropped from Mantises after defeating Astrum Aureus. When swung, it will fire out a spinning ring projectile much like the ones fired by Mantises, which deals 60% of the scythe's base damage, can pierce up to seven targets, and disappears upon tile contact. It will also form a cosmetic dust explosion when the projectile is destroyed. Its best modifier is Legendary. This weapon can also be obtained from the Astral Crate after Astrum Aureus has be

name: Stellar Cannon
description: The Stellar Cannon is a Hardmode ranged weapon that is dropped from Novas after Astrum Aureus has been defeated. It fires explosive astral crystals that explode on contact with enemies, inflicting the Astral Infection debuff. The astral crystal fired requires no ammo and will pass through blocks. Its best modifier is Unreal. This weapon can also be obtained from the Astral Crate after Astrum Aureus has been defeated.

name: Titan Arm
description: The Titan Arm is a Hardmode broadsword that is dropped from Atlases after Astrum Aureus has been defeated. It has an abnormally high knockback, similar to the Slap Hand, and is guaranteed to inflict critical hits. Otherwise, it functions as a normal broadsword. Its best modifier is Legendary. This weapon, having the knockback it does, is almost guaranteed to send an enemy off-screen and despawn it, so it is not recommended for fighting for the loot. However, it can be used when exploring, as ene

name: Astralachnea Staff
description: Not to be confused with Astral Staff, a wand crafted using Astral Bars. The Astralachnea Staff is a Hardmode wand that is dropped from Astralachneas after Astrum Aureus has been defeated. It fires 4-7 homing astral fangs that inflict the Astral Infection debuff on their target. The player can tighten the spread of the projectiles by aiming the cursor further away. The fangs will not pass through blocks. Its best modifier is Mythical. This weapon can also be obtained from the Astral Crate after A

name: Hive Pod
description: The Hive Pod is a Hardmode sentry that is dropped from Hives after Astrum Aureus has been defeated. The Astral Hive will spawn Hivelings if there are any enemies nearby, which will home onto the closest enemy to them, even through walls. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical

name: Magnum
description: Not to be confused with Marked Magnum, a debuff-based classless weapon. The Magnum is a craftable Pre-Hardmode classless weapon that deals massive damage, and deals increased damage against organic creatures. It uses Magnum Rounds as ammo, which can be purchased from the Arms Dealer if the player has the Magnum in their inventory. Once a boss is spawned, the Magnum is only fireable three times until the boss is defeated. The Magnum cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers. Organic

name: Bazooka
description: The Bazooka is a craftable Hardmode classless weapon that deals massive damage and deals increased damage against inorganic creatures. It uses Grenade Shells as ammo, which can be purchased from the Arms Dealer if the player has the Bazooka in their inventory. Once a boss is spawned, the Bazooka is only fireable twice until the boss is defeated. The Bazooka cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers. Inorganic targets will have 5% of their max life added to the Bazooka's damage when

name: Magnum Rounds
description: Magnum Rounds are Pre-Hardmode ammunition that are used by the Magnum, Lightning Hawk, and Elephant Killer. They are sold by the Arms Dealer if either the Magnum, Lightning Hawk, or Elephant Killer are in the player's inventory. Crits scored when using Magnum Rounds will deal x2.5 damage instead of x2. As well as this, the knockback is increased by 50% as opposed to the normal 40%. As Magnum Rounds are hard to come by before Hardmode, it is wise to save them for boss fights. The Magnum's high ba

name: Lightning Hawk
description: The Lightning Hawk is a craftable Hardmode classless weapon that is a direct upgrade of the Magnum. Like its predecessor, it deals massive damage and deals extra damage to organic creatures. Like the Magnum, it uses Magnum Rounds as ammo, which can be purchased from the Arms Dealer if the player has the Lightning Hawk in their inventory. Once a boss is spawned, the Lightning Hawk is only fireable three times until the boss is defeated. The Lightning Hawk cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot

name: Elephant Killer
description: The Elephant Killer is a craftable post-Moon Lord classless weapon. It is a direct upgrade of the Lightning Hawk and the final upgrade of the Magnum. Like its predecessors, it deals massive damage to enemies and deals increased damage to organic creatures. Like the Magnum and Lightning Hawk, it uses Magnum Rounds as ammunition, which can be purchased from the Arms Dealer if the player has the Elephant Killer in their inventory. Once a boss is spawned, the Elephant Killer is only fireable three t

name: Grenade Shells
description: Grenade Shells are pre-Hardmode ammunition that are used exclusively by the Bazooka. They can be purchased from the Arms Dealer if the Bazooka is in the player's inventory.

name: Onyxia
description: The Onyxia is a craftable post-Moon Lord gun that is the direct upgrade of the Onyx Chain Blaster and the final upgrade to the Onyx Blaster. It rapidly fires bursts of six bullets at a time alongside an onyx blast that deals 145% the damage of the fired bullets. The bullets from the Onyxia are fired in 3 symmetric pairs surrounding the onyx blast. It has a 50% chance to not consume ammo when fired. Its best modifier is Unreal. The Onyxia only deals 90% damage to Supreme Calamitas. Its name is a

name: Chaos Candle
description: The Chaos Candle is a craftable Hardmode piece of furniture that will emit light and grant the Chaos Candle buff, which boosts all spawn rates by 66.67% and maximum spawn count by 150%. The Chaos Candle is the direct opposite of the Tranquility Candle, which drastically decreases spawn rates. Similar to the Water Candle, the player can receive the effects of the candle while holding it. The Chaos Candle and its counterpart were implemented based on a community suggestion made by Celest on the mo

name: Tranquility Candle
description: The Tranquility Candle is a craftable Hardmode piece of furniture that emits light and grants the Tranquility Candle buff, which reduces enemy spawn rates by 28.57% and maximum spawn count by 60%. The Tranquility Candle is the exact opposite of the Chaos Candle, which greatly increases spawn rate. Similar to the Peace Candle, the player can receive the effects of the candle while holding it. The Tranquility Candle and its counterpart were implemented based on a community suggestion made by Celes

name: Sea King
description: If you were looking for something other than the town NPC, see Amidias (disambiguation). The Sea King is an NPC vendor that provides a plethora of helpful information, several useful weapons, and a unique buff known as Amidias' Blessing. The Sea King will immediately spawn upon killing a Giant Clam, but if killed he will only move in once the following conditions have been met: There is an empty house. The Desert Scourge has been defeated. When threatened by enemies, he will defend himself with

name: Heavenfallen Stardisk
description: The Heavenfallen Stardisk is a Hardmode post-Astrum Aureus rogue weapon that fires projectiles. It is always found inside the Dungeon's Astral Chest. Astrum Aureus must be defeated in order to open the Chest. When fired, the main projectile flies straight upwards before flying in the direction of the cursor. If the player is moving vertically at the time it is thrown and when it lands, the disk will split into several energy bolts that deal 40% of the main disk's damage. Performing a stealth str

name: Giant Clam
description: "A specimen which has developed a grand size, and inexplicably, impressive psychic abilities." The Giant Clam is a mini boss that rarely spawns in the Sunken Sea after defeating the Desert Scourge, and is generally the first mini boss that the player will encounter. It receives a huge buff during Hardmode. It is initially passive and closed up, but once the player hits it 5 times, the player receives the Clamity debuff, which boosts the spawn rate of Clams and making them aggressive while reduci

name: Prismalline
description: The Prismalline is a craftable Hardmode non-consumable dagger that is an upgrade to the Crystalline. It shoots a piercing projectile that is affected by gravity and cannot pass through tiles. Shortly after it is thrown, it emits 5 copies of itself in a random spread, some homing and some non-homing. Copies that home in deal 110% of the original projectile's damage; copies that do not home deal 75% of the original projectile's damage. Performing a stealth strike with the Prismalline causes the re

name: Ataraxia
description: Ataraxia is a post-Moon Lord broadsword that autoswings. When swung, Ataraxia fires three rocket-like projectiles, two small and one large, towards the cursor. The larger projectile explodes on impact with a tile or enemy. The smaller projectiles split into several needles on impact, which fly a short distance from the impact point and rapidly damage enemies. When the blade itself strikes a foe, five additional homing projectiles are produced, flying around the target in a flower-like pattern. T

name: Face Melter
description: The Face Melter is a craftable post-Moon Lord magic weapon. When the primary-fire (left click) is used, streams of two red musical notes are rapidly fired from the player in the cursor's direction. The notes can pierce up to ten enemies, travel through blocks, and linger shortly before disappearing. The darker beamed eighth notes deal 1.5x as much damage while the lighter quarter notes move 1.5x as fast. When the alternate-fire (right click) is used, an amplifier is summoned at the cursor's posi

name: Hadarian Wings
description: Hadarian Wings are a Hardmode wing-type accessory that allow the player to fly and glide. Pressing ↷ Jump and ▼ Down allows the player to hover and increase flight time. If these wings are worn along with Astral armor, the player's movement speed and jump speed are increased by 10%. This pair of wings has a slightly faster max speed than Exodus Wings, but lower acceleration and 50% less flight time. It also has a hover, unlike Exodus Wings. Because the bonus while wearing Astral armor does not i

name: Navystone
description: Navystone is a block that generates in the Sunken Sea biome, alongside Eutrophic Sand. It can only be mined after Desert Scourge has been defeated in the world. Navystone can additionally be obtained as a drop from both Clams and the Giant Clam. 10-30 Navystone can additionally be obtained as a drop from Sunken Crates, even before the Desert Scourge is defeated.

name: Eutrophic Sand
description: Eutrophic Sand is a block that generates in the Sunken Sea biome, alongside Navystone. It can be mined with any pickaxe, but only after Desert Scourge has been defeated. Unlike Sand, Eutrophic Sand is not affected by gravity. 10-30 Eutrophic Sand can additionally be obtained as a drop from Sunken Crates, even before the Desert Scourge has been defeated.

name: Unsafe Eutrophic Sand Wall
description: Unsafe Eutrophic Sand Wall is a background wall that generates naturally in the Sunken Sea biome, alongside Unsafe Navystone Wall. Eutrophic Sand Walls will release water whenever the nearby tiles update. It can be removed using any hammer, but only after Desert Scourge is defeated.

name: Unsafe Navystone Wall
description: Unsafe Navystone Wall is a background wall that generates naturally in the Sunken Sea biome, alongside Unsafe Eutrophic Sand Wall. It can be removed using any hammer, but only after Desert Scourge is defeated.

name: Banners
description: The Calamity Mod features banners for many of the enemies introduced in the mod's various biomes. The Draconic Swarmer, Twinkler, and the Super Dummy are the only non boss-exclusive NPCs without a banner. This is due to Twinkler being a similar Critter to the Firefly, the Draconic Swarmer is normally a boss summon, and the Super Dummy being a utility NPC.

name: Sea Prism
description: Sea Prisms are a Pre-Hardmode ore found naturally generated within the Sunken Sea and can be crafted using Prism Shards. They can be mined with any pickaxe but are only mineable after the player has defeated the Desert Scourge. Sea Prisms are used as crafting materials in several weapons themed around the Sunken Sea, as well as Mollusk armor and pieces of the Eutrophic furniture set. They are also used to craft Tesla Potions. 2-5 Sea Prisms can also be obtained from Sunken Crates at a 20% drop c

name: Seafoam Bomb
description: The Seafoam Bomb is a Pre-Hardmode non-consumable bomb. Upon use, it throws a bomb that travels a small distance before being affected by gravity. Upon hitting a tile or enemy, the bomb explodes into damaging bubbles which ignore enemy immunity frames. Performing a stealth strike with the Seafoam Bomb causes the next bomb thrown to move faster and explodes into five bubbles instead of one. Its best modifier is Flawless. This is a very useful weapon for starting Rogues because it does good damage

name: Mollusk Husk
description: Mollusk Husks are Hardmode crafting materials dropped by Clams and the Giant Clam mini boss. They are used to craft the Mollusk armor and the Prismalline. 2-5 Mollusk Husks can additionally be obtained from Sunken Crates at a 12% drop chance in Hardmode.

name: Radiant Star
description: The Radiant Star is a craftable Hardmode non-consumable dagger that is an upgrade to the Prismalline. It shoots a projectile that is affected by gravity and cannot pass through walls. Shortly after it is thrown, it explodes and emits 3 gravity-defying copies of itself which deal half of the base damage. Hitting an enemy with the explosion will cause fallen, hallowed, and astral stars to rain down on the enemy. Performing a stealth strike with the Radiant Star will cause the next dagger thrown to

name: Shattered Sun
description: The Shattered Sun is a craftable post-Moon Lord non-consumable dagger that is an upgrade to the Radiant Star and the final upgrade of the Crystalline. It shoots an infinitely piercing dagger that is not affected by gravity and can pass through walls. Upon hitting an enemy, it creates an explosion that inflicts Holy Flames and deals 15% of the dagger's damage. Shortly after it is thrown, it splits into 5 homing Scorching Daggers that does not pierce through enemies or solid tiles. Scorching Dagge

name: Amidias' Pendant
description: Amidias' Pendant is a Pre-Hardmode accessory that is dropped by the Giant Clam mini boss after the Desert Scourge has been defeated. It causes three different Prism Shards to fall from the sky every 2 seconds: 2 small functionally identical shards that deal 15 damage, and a large shard that deals 30 damage and homes in onto enemies. When the Prism Shards hit blocks, they release a considerable amount of light, which can be used for exploration underground.

name: Stellar Knife
description: The Stellar Knife is a Hardmode dagger dropped by Aries after Astrum Aureus is defeated. When thrown, it moves and rapidly spins in the direction it was initially thrown, slowly decelerating and losing spin speed over time. Once the knife fully decelerates, it then remains still until an enemy is within its detection range for it to home in. Performing a stealth strike with the Stellar Knife causes ten knives to be thrown instead of one. If more than fifteen knives are present, this effect canno

name: Mollusk armor
description: Mollusk armor is a craftable Hardmode armor set crafted from several Sunken Sea materials. A total of 31 Mollusk Husks and 60 Sea Prisms are required to craft a full set. It consists of the Mollusk Shellmet, Mollusk Shellplate, and Mollusk Shelleggings. The full set grants the following stats and bonuses (this includes the set bonus): 55 defense 37% increased damage 14% increased critical strike chance 22% decreased movement speed Can move freely through liquids. Summons two Shellfishes. Decreas

name: The Pack
description: The Pack is a craftable post-Moon Lord launcher that fires a single large rocket upon use. The large rocket will explode within 10 blocks of an enemy, splitting into 5 smaller rockets that will home in on the nearest target. The explosions created upon impact have a large radius and also damage enemies. The large rocket can go through tiles. Its best modifier is Unreal. The design and effect of the weapon are based off of the Gjallarhorn, a weapon from Bungie's Destiny. These rockets will not de

name: Hadarian Membrane
description: Hadarian Membrane is a Hardmode crafting material that drops from Hadarians after Astrum Aureus is defeated. It is used solely to craft Hadarian Wings.

name: Magical Conch
description: Not to be confused with Magic Conch, a vanilla teleportation tool. The Magical Conch is a Pre-Hardmode summon weapon that is purchased from the Sea King at any time. It will run on the ground, dealing contact damage to enemies. If the player is flying, the Hermit Crab will float alongside the player, but won't directly attack enemies. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resul

name: Shellfish Staff
description: The Shellfish Staff is a Hardmode summon weapon that drops from the Giant Clam mini boss. It summons a Shellfish that follows the player and attacks nearby enemies by attaching itself to them. Each Shellfish takes up 2 minion slots. Shellfish only deal direct damage when initially latching onto an enemy. From there, it inflicts the Shellfish Claps debuff for as long as it remains attached to the enemy. This debuff deals a total of 125 damage per second for every shellfish attached to an enemy. U

name: Keelhaul
description: The Keelhaul is a Hardmode wand that has a 10% chance to drop from Giant Cursed Skulls in the Dungeon after Leviathan and Anahita have been defeated. When used, a small blue projectile is fired in the cursor's direction that creates a geyser upon impact with a tile or an enemy. The geyser stays in place and rapidly damages any enemy that it makes contact with. The geyser can pierce unlimited enemies and ignores tiles, and disappears four seconds after it is spawned. Its best modifier is Mythical

name: Sand Dollar
description: The Sand Dollar is a Pre-Hardmode rogue boomerang that is purchased by the Sea King at any time. This weapon can be stacked up to two. The amount of boomerangs thrown is dependent on stack size. Performing a stealth strike with Sand Dollar causes two sand dollars to be thrown out regardless of stack size. They travel farther before returning to the player and spawns a gravity-affected coral shard on enemy hits. The Sand Dollar cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers. In real life

name: Snap Clam
description: The Snap Clam is a Pre-Hardmode rogue weapon that can be purchased from the Sea King for 2 at any time. For the first half second upon being thrown, the snap clam is open. Afterwards, the clam will visually close up and deal 20 percent less damage. Upon hitting an enemy, the snap clam will cling to them and deal damage over time. Enemies will lose 30 health per second per clam, up to a maximum of 60 health per second at 2 or more clams. Performing a stealth strike with the Snap Clam will cause f

name: Explosive Shotgun Shell
description: Explosive Shotgun Shells are Hardmode ammunition that are used exclusively by the Hydra. They can be purchased from the Arms Dealer if the Hydra is in the player's inventory.

name: Hydra
description: The Hydra is a craftable Hardmode classless weapon that deals massive damage to all enemies. When used, it fires fifteen extremely fast pellets that create small explosions when hitting an enemy or a tile. The damage it deals is proportional to the hit enemy's max health, making it incredibly effective against enemies with large amounts of health, such as late-game bosses. It exclusively uses Explosive Shotgun Shells as ammo, which can be bought from the Arms Dealer if the player has the Hydra i

name: Handheld Tank
description: The Handheld Tank is a post-Moon Lord launcher that fires a small, high velocity rocket upon use. The rocket will explode on contact, damaging enemies that are in the range of its blast. Its best modifier is Unreal. The Tiger Skin in the recipe is a reference to the German Tiger tank. Previously, the Handheld Tank held the title of the slowest attacking weapon in the game, taking over a second of real-time in between shots without any speed modifiers. This title now belongs to the Infinity.

name: Trash Can (pet)
description: For the vanilla storage item, see here. Trash Can is a pet summoning item dropped by Trashers. It summons a little Danny Devito to follow the player. If the player moves too fast, Danny Devito will use a little red carpet to fly towards them. This item is based on a famous episode from the show It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia, in which Danny DeVito, playing as Frank Reynolds, becomes a wrestler known as The Trash Man. The item itself is dedicated to Uncle Danny, the owner and head administrato

name: Odd Mushroom
description: The Odd Mushroom is a Hardmode consumable item that can be purchased from the Drunk Princess for 1 . Consuming it grants the Trippy buff for one hour, which gives every enemy and projectile on-screen a hallucination effect similar that of Expert Mode Brain of Cthulhu, as well as giving enemies and projectiles a rainbow hue that constantly cycles. It also places a wavy Heat Distortion effect across the entire screen. Lastly, the Trippy buff grants the player a whopping 50% increase to all damage.

name: Normality Relocator
description: Normality Relocator is a post-Moon Lord tool. While it is in the player's inventory, they may press the Normality Relocator key to instantly warp to the position of the cursor. Unlike the Rod of Discord, the Relocator cannot be used normally like other tools via selecting it in the hotbar and pressing the ⚒ Use / Attack key. The player's momentum is fully conserved when teleporting. Using the Relocator costs no mana or ammunition but will inflict the Chaos State debuff, which prevents further te

name: Sea Minnow
description: The Sea Minnow is a critter. It is found in the Sunken Sea and passively swims back and forth, gaining a speed boost when hitting a wall. It attempts to swim away from the player. It can also be caught with a Bug Net or Golden Bug Net. Sea Minnows may also be obtained from Sunken Crates.

name: Baby Ghost Bell
description: The Baby Ghost Bell is a critter found in the Sunken Sea, and remains absolutely still. It can be caught with a Bug Net or Golden Bug Net. There is a 5% chance for a Baby Ghost Bell that spawns to sparkle; sparkling Baby Ghost Bells will drop the Rusted Jingle Bell when caught with a Bug Net or Golden Bug Net, a light pet that provide extra light while submerged. Ghost Bell

name: Shellshooter
description: The Shellshooter is a Pre-Hardmode bow that is purchasable from the Sea King at any time. Wooden Arrows are converted into shells that have a very low velocity and pierce up to four enemies, breaking on the fifth. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Coral Cannon
description: The Coral Cannon is a Pre-Hardmode ranged weapon that can be purchased from the Sea King at any time for 2 . It fires a small piece of coral when used, and does not consume any ammo. There is a 20% chance for the coral to be larger, with twice as much damage and knockback, a slightly slower velocity, and the ability to briefly stun normal enemies. Its best modifier is Unreal. The stun effect will not apply if any bosses are alive or to certain rare creatures.

name: Serpentine
description: The Serpentine is a Hardmode spell tome that is dropped by Sea Serpents with a 1/4 (25%) chance. It casts a serpent projectile that homes in on the mouse cursor and is not affected by gravity. The projectile propels itself forward, dissipating on contact with tiles, and propels itself back to the area of the mouse cursor. It can pierce up to 4 enemies, dissipating upon contact with the fifth. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Eutrophic Shank
description: The Eutrophic Shank is a Pre-Hardmode shortsword that is dropped by Eutrophic Rays with a 1/3 (33.33%) chance after the Desert Scourge has been defeated. When used, it shoots electrical sparks which linger on the ground and deal 40% of the weapon's base damage. Its best modifier is Legendary.

name: Ghost Bell
description: The Ghost Bell is a Pre-Hardmode enemy found within the Sunken Sea that bounces up and down. They are always passive, even if attacked by the player, and only bob up and down in the water. However, despite being passive, they are still able to deal contact damage, and will also inflict the deadly Electrified debuff on contact. Ghost Bells receive a boost to their stats when the world enters Hardmode. If a Ghost Bell ends up outside of water, it will slowly fall to the ground, at which point it w

name: Eutrophic Scimitar
description: The Eutrophic Scimitar is a Hardmode broadsword that is dropped by the Blinded Angler in the Sunken Sea. Upon being swung, it fires an electric shock projectile which briefly stuns normal enemies on contact. The projectile does not pierce and cannot pass through tiles. Its best modifier is Legendary. The stun effect will not apply if any bosses are alive or to certain rare creatures.

name: Prism Shard
description: Prism Shards are Pre-Hardmode crafting materials that are naturally generated in the Sunken Sea biome. They are used to craft Sea Prisms, the Aquashard Shotgun, and pieces of the Eutrophic furniture set. Prism Shards can additionally be obtained as a drop from Blinded Anglers and Prism-Backs after the Desert Scourge is defeated. 5-10 Prism Shards can additionally be obtained as a drop from Sunken Crates after the Desert Scourge is defeated. Prism Shards counts as a light source in housing requir

name: Giant Pearl
description: The Giant Pearl is a Pre-Hardmode accessory dropped by the Giant Clam mini boss after the Desert Scourge has been defeated. When equipped, it causes the player to emit light and inflict all enemies within a 3 block radius with the Pearl Aura debuff, which slows down their horizontal and vertical speeds considerably. The slowing effect of Pearl Aura does not take effect while any bosses are alive. Despite being a debuff, Pearl Aura's icon has a blue background like a buff. Destructible projectile

name: Waywasher
description: The Waywasher is a Pre-Hardmode spell tome sold by the Sea King NPC. The spell tome rapidly fires water bolts within a small spread that pierce once before being destroyed. Its best modifier is Mythical. But the weapon's mana cost will not be affected. There appears to be an image of a wave on the front cover.

name: Prism-Back
description: The Prism-Back is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Sunken Sea biome. They are always passive, even if the player attacks them, and only swim back and forth. However, despite being passive, they are able to deal contact damage, and deal even more contact damage if they player touches the top of their spiked shells. Prism-Backs receive a boost to their stats when the world enters Hardmode. Players should avoid getting in the path of Prism-Backs, as they deal high contact damage at the point

name: Biome Chest
description: Biome Chests are Hardmode Chests found within the Dungeon. The only Biome Chest currently in the Calamity Mod is the Astral Chest. It contains a Heavenfallen Stardisk, in addition to other miscellaneous items. While Astral Chests are placed during world creation, they are initially locked and can only be opened once a certain boss is defeated. Only one Astral Chest will spawn in a particular world. To open an Astral Chest: Defeat Astrum Aureus to allow the Astral Chest to be opened. Return to th

name: Sea Serpent
description: Sea Serpents are Hardmode enemies that spawn in the Sunken Sea biome. They are initially passive, and swim in a loop underneath the player. After they take damage, they become aggressive and try to swim directly towards the player. Sea Serpents can swim through blocks and do not require water to move. Sea Serpents are able to deal contact damage while they are passive.

name: Blinded Angler
description: The Blinded Angler is a Hardmode enemy found in the Sunken Sea biome. Much like other enemies in the Sunken Sea, they are initially passive and slowly swim back and forth. Unlike other Sunken Sea enemies, however, they become aggressive if the player is very close to them (~5 blocks away), and will try to swim towards the player to deal contact damage. They go back to being passive if the player gets out of range, and dealing damage to them does not change their behavior.

name: Aquashard Shotgun
description: The Aquashard Shotgun is a craftable Pre-Hardmode gun. Upon firing, it will shoot a spread of 1-3 bullets. If Musket Balls are used as ammo, the bullets are replaced with aquamarine shards that split into six smaller weakly homing shards upon contact with an enemy, which deal reduced damage. Its best modifier is Unreal. It is considered a side-grade to the Boomstick, as it trades higher damage and bullet count for a faster fire rate, auto-fire, and the ability to shoot splitting bullets given th

name: Ace's Apron of Affection
description: Ace's Apron of Affection is a vanity item that can be crafted in Pre-Hardmode. It can be equipped in the social shirt slot. This item is a reference to the character Ralsei from the game Deltarune, who wears a similar green robe with a black heart printed on it.

name: Resilient Candle
description: The Resilient Candle is a Hardmode piece of furniture that is purchased from the Drunk Princess for 50 . The candle emits light and grants the Adamant Will buff to all players within a 120x86 rectangular area, which boosts the effectiveness of defense by 5%. Since a player is 2 tiles wide and just under 3 tiles tall and the candle buffs a 120x86 area, covering a large area with no gaps can be done by placing candles every 243 blocks horizontally and 176 blocks vertically. Covering the entire acc

name: Weightless Candle
description: The Weightless Candle is a Hardmode piece of furniture that is purchased from the Drunk Princess for 50 . The candle emits light and grants the Limber buff to all players within a 120x86 rectangular area, which boosts boost movement speed by 10%, flight time by 10% and movement acceleration by 5%. Since a player is 2 tiles wide and just under 3 tiles tall and the candle buffs a 120x86 area, covering a large area with no gaps can be done by placing candles every 243 blocks horizontally and 176 bl

name: Vigorous Candle
description: The Vigorous Candle is a Hardmode piece of furniture that is purchased from the Drunk Princess for 50 . The candle emits light and grants the Vigor buff to all players within a 120x86 rectangular area, which causes players to regenerate 0.4% of their maximum health each second. The life regen bypasses the Revengeance Mode cap and will consistently give off its boost, even if the player is moving. Since a player is 2 tiles wide and just under 3 tiles tall and the candle buffs a 120x86 area, cover

name: Spiteful Candle
description: The Spiteful Candle is a Hardmode piece of furniture that is purchased from the Drunk Princess for 50 . The candle emits light and grants the Spite buff to all players within 120x86 rectangular area, which causes enemies to take 5% more damage from all sources, regardless of their damage reduction stat. This does not affect enemies with more than 99% DR such as Sepulcher and adult Eidolon Wyrms. Since a player is 2 tiles wide and just under 3 tiles tall and the candle buffs a 120x86 area, coveri

name: Clam Crusher
description: The Clam Crusher is a Hardmode flail that is dropped by the Giant Clam mini boss in the Sunken Sea. It throws out a giant gravity-affected clam that will inflict the Eutrophication debuff onto enemies. The Clam will deal 2.5x more damage if it is first fired into the air, then falls and lands onto an enemy. Once the clam hits a block or an enemy, it will retract back to the player. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. The Clam Crusher can additionally be obtained

name: Urchin Flail
description: The Urchin Flail is a Pre-Hardmode flail that is purchased from the Sea King at any time. It throws out an urchin ball that will shoot an urchin spike into an enemy, inflicting the Venom debuff. Once the urchin ball hits a block or an enemy, it will retract back to the player. It is not affected by gravity and cannot be swung around or be redeployed while the urchin has already been thrown out. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size.

name: Clam
description: Clams are Pre-Hardmode enemies that spawn in the Sunken Sea biome. They are initially passive, but become hostile after taking damage three times. While hostile, they chase the player by making short leaps towards them. If the Giant Clam is hostile, the spawn rate of Clams is drastically increased via the Clamity debuff, which causes them to become instantly aggressive as well. The Giant Clam also occasionally spawns groups of Clams while hostile. Once the world enters Hardmode, Clams receive a

name: Eutrophic Ray
description: Eutrophic Rays are Pre-Hardmode enemies that spawn in the Sunken Sea biome. They are passive until attacked, and when aggressive, they charge at the player, passing through blocks. They can drop the Eutrophic Shank with a 1/3 (33.33%) chance. A Eutrophic Ray is depicted in the Sunken Sea's Draedon's Log.

name: Sea Floaty
description: Sea Floaties are Pre-Hardmode Enemies that spawn in the Sunken Sea biome that crawl along the seafloor and never chase the player. Upon being hit, they will swim through blocks and escape.

name: Poseidon
description: The Poseidon is a Hardmode spell tome that drops from the Giant Clam mini boss. It shoots a circular Poseidon typhoon sigil that homes in on enemies and lingers on top of them for a short duration, repeatedly dealing damage until it dissipates. Each Poseidon typhoon will pierce 3 to 8 times. Poseidon typhoons will also rebound off of blocks 9 times before disappearing. Its best modifier is Mythical. Poseidon can additionally be obtained from Sunken Crates in Hardmode at a 7% drop chance after th

name: Clamor Rifle
description: The Clamor Rifle is a Hardmode gun that drops from the Giant Clam mini boss. It transforms Musket Balls into aquatic energy bolts that will home in on enemies. Upon impact with an enemy or a tile, the aquatic energy bolt will split into three smaller bolts, that will not home towards enemies and will deal 33% less damage than the initial bullet. Its best modifier is Unreal. The Clamor Rifle can additionally be obtained from Sunken Crates at a 7% drop chance in Hardmode after the Giant Clam has b

name: Aquamarine Staff
description: The Aquamarine Staff is a craftable Pre-Hardmode wand that fires 2 aquamarine bolts that cannot pass through blocks. Its best modifier is Mythical. But the weapon's mana cost will not be affected.

name: Riptide
description: The Riptide is a craftable Pre-Hardmode yoyo. While deployed, the yoyo will occasionally fire a spiral aqua stream in a random direction that will only deal 22.22% of the yoyo's damage. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. This weapon is referred to as 'Whirlpool' in the mod's source code. In real life, rip tides are very strong water currents that flow out into the ocean, known for being deadly towards swimmers.

name: Seashine Sword
description: The Seashine Sword is a craftable Pre-Hardmode sword. When swung, it fires a glowing aquamarine sword beam that emits glowing particles, deals damage and travels indefinitely, disappearing upon hitting a block or an enemy. Its best modifier is Legendary.

name: Amidias' Trident
description: Amidias' Trident is a Pre-Hardmode spear that is purchasable from the Sea King at any time. It shoots an aquamarine whirlpool that passes through blocks, homes in on enemies, and disappears after contacting an enemy. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. The whirlpools produce a dim light; therefore, they can be a viable option to search for caverns underground.

name: Botanic Planter
description: The Botanic Planter is a post-Moon Lord crafting station used to craft the Botanic furniture set themed around Uelibloom.

name: Effulgent Manipulator
description: The Effulgent Manipulator is a post-Moon Lord crafting station used to craft the Silva furniture set themed around Silva. It also counts as a basin.

name: Eutrophic Shelf
description: The Eutrophic Shelf is a Pre-Hardmode crafting station used to craft the Eutrophic furniture set themed around the Sunken Sea. It can only be placed sideways on blocks.

name: Plague Infuser
description: The Plague Infuser is a Hardmode crafting station used to craft the Plague furniture set themed around the Jungle Plague.

name: Silva Crystal
description: For the minion, see Silva armor. Silva Crystal is a post-Moon Lord block that is crafted from Effulgent Feathers.

name: Otherworldly Stone
description: Otherworldly Stone is a craftable post-Moon Lord block crafted from Armored Shells, Dark Plasma, Twisting Nether, Stone Blocks and Silk. Otherworldly Stone is internally referred to as "Occult Stone", and all of the furniture it crafts are also internally named "Occult".

name: Eutrophic Sand Wall
description: Eutrophic Sand Wall is a background wall crafted with Eutrophic Sand. It will not contribute to the creation an artificial Sunken Sea biome nor will it release water.

name: Profaned Crucible
description: The Profaned Crucible is a post-Moon Lord crafting station used to craft the Profaned furniture set themed around Providence, as well as the Profaned Soul Crystal. The Profaned Crucible also counts as a basin.

name: Silva Wall
description: Silva Wall is a background wall crafted with Silva Crystal.

name: Plagued Containment Brick
description: Not to be confused with Plagueplate, a similarly-themed Pre-Hardmode block generated in Arsenal Labs. Plagued Containment Brick is a craftable Hardmode block crafted from Plague Cell Canisters and Stone Blocks. This item was previosuly known as "Plagued Plate". The name was possibly changed to avoid confusion with the Plagueplate.

name: Smooth Navystone
description: Smooth Navystone is craftable block crafted with Navystone.

name: Plagued Containment Wall
description: Plagued Containment Wall is a background wall crafted with Plagued Containment Bricks. This item was previosuly known as "Plagued Plate Wall".

name: Stratus Brick
description: The Stratus Brick is a post-Moon Lord block that is crafted with a Ruinous Soul, Lumenyl, and Stone Blocks.

name: Stratus Wall
description: Stratus Wall is a background wall crafted with Stratus Bricks.

name: Smooth Navystone Wall
description: Smooth Navystone Wall is a background wall crafted with Smooth Navystone.

name: Astral Monolith Wall
description: Astral Monolith Wall is a background wall crafted with Astral Monolith.

name: Navystone Wall
description: Navystone Wall is a background wall crafted with Navystone. It will not contribute to the creation of an artificial Sunken Sea biome.

name: Otherworldly Stone Wall
description: Otherworldly Stone Wall is a background wall crafted with Otherworldly Stone.

name: Voidstone Slab Wall
description: Voidstone Slab Walls are background walls crafted with Voidstone Slabs at a Work Bench.

name: Ashen Slab Wall
description: Ashen Slab Wall is a background wall crafted with Ashen Slabs.

name: Romajeda Orchid
description: The Romajeda Orchid is a pet summoning item sold by the Dryad NPC. It summons a dog named Kendra to follow the player. When the player is idle, Kendra will either yawn or bark to alert the player. If the player moves too fast, Kendra will use black dragon wings to fly towards them. This item is based on LordMetarex' real pet dog, Kendra. Kendra sadly died on the 31st of December 2018, hence this item's depiction of her as a "never forgotten friend". The term "Romajeda" was used due to the dog br

name: Ultimus Cleaver
description: The Ultimus Cleaver is a Hardmode broadsword that drops from the Ravager. When swung, five homing gravity-affected sparks will fly out of the weapon, with each one piercing once and dealing one-tenth of the initial damage of the Cleaver. The five sparks are always thrown out at the same semi-equidistant angles, with the highest going straight upward and the lowest going straight forward, regardless of where the player is aiming. Each spark lasts for 1.5 seconds before dissipating. Additionally,

name: Scarlet Devil
description: The Scarlet Devil is a craftable post-Moon Lord developer javelin. It fires an extremely-high velocity spear that leaves behind projectiles as it travels. The projectiles are not affected by gravity and home in on nearby enemies slightly after being spawned. Upon contact with an enemy, the spear creates a Scarlet Blast which rapidly damages any enemy caught in its blast radius. The spear and its projectiles can travel through blocks and only hit one enemy. Performing a stealth strike with the Sc

name: Realm Ravager
description: The Realm Ravager is a Hardmode gun that drops from the Ravager. It fires a shotgun blast of 3 to 4 bullets. If Musket Balls are used as ammo, bullets are converted into explosive bullets. Explosions resulting from the bullet deal half damage. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: The Oracle
description: The Oracle is a craftable post-Moon Lord yoyo. It builds charge each time it strikes an enemy directly, creating a growing aura of red lightning which shocks nearby enemies and ignores immunity frames. Once the yoyo is sufficiently charged, it fires three orbs in a triangular pattern on every sixth direct hit. Each orb deals triple the yoyo's damage. The Oracle's red lightning aura shrinks and eventually vanishes when not striking any foes. Its size and damage increase with every successive hit

name: Spikecrag Staff
description: The Spikecrag Staff is a Hardmode sentry that drops from the Ravager. When used, a spikecrag sentry is summoned. The spikecrag fires an intense upward spray of gravity-affected spikes when enemies are nearby; 5 to 7 spikes every 1/6th of a second. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage

name: Cranium Smasher
description: The Cranium Smasher is a Hardmode bomb that drops from the Ravager. When used it auto-fires a spinning disk that can pierce four enemies before disappearing on its next impact. Disks that are thrown will also roll along the ground, and have a chance to spawn as an explosive disk that will explode on contact with enemies and blocks. Performing a stealth strike with the Cranium Smasher causes it to deal 175% damage and fire a disk that will explode on enemy hits and can pierce nine enemies before

name: Trinket of Chi
description: The Trinket of Chi is a Pre-Hardmode accessory found in the Surface/Underground shrine. When equipped and the player has not moved for one second, the player will receive a 50% damage boost to all weapons and will take 15% reduced damage from all sources. Once the player moves again, the bonuses are revoked. If the player is moving, the accessory will have no effect on the player. If the player un-equips the accessory then all bonuses are lost. Even if staying still, being on a mount will not gr

name: Luxor's Gift
description: Luxor's Gift is a Pre-Hardmode accessory found in the Underground Desert shrine. When equipped, most weapons when fired will release one of five projectiles that change based on the weapon's damage type. Most True melee weapons are not affected as well as various vanilla weapons such as the Minishark. The projectiles deal less damage when used with weapons with a use time less than 10. The damage decreases by 10% for each point of use time below 10, i.e. a use time of 4 would deal 60% less damag

name: Tundra Leash
description: The Tundra Leash is a Pre-Hardmode mount summoning item obtained from the Snow Biome shrine. When used, it summons an Angry Dog which acts similarly to the Basilisk summoned by the Ancient Horn but is much slower. The Angry Dog is capable of moving at a speed of 33 mph horizontally and can reach 41 while moving vertically. Like the Basilisk, it can charge enemies and deals 50 damage upon contact. This damage can be boosted through summoner bonuses. While horizontally moving at over half the moun

name: Onyx Excavator Key
description: The Onyx Excavator Key is a Pre-Hardmode mount summoning item obtained from the Cavern shrine. When used, it summons an Onyx Excavator which acts similarly to the Basilisk summoned by the Ancient Horn but allows the player to drill through almost all blocks in the game. Like the Basilisk, it can charge enemies and deals 25 damage upon contact. This damage can be boosted through summoner bonuses. The Onyx Excavator is capable of moving and digging at a speed of 40 mph horizontally and can jump a

name: Gladiator's Locket
description: The Gladiator's Locket is a Pre-Hardmode accessory found in the Marble shrine. When equipped, two Sword Spirits will circle the player and will damage enemies that they contact. The swords orbit in opposite directions, at slightly different speeds. Each sword has a base damage of 30 and ignores enemy immunity frames. The swords deal classless damage, boosted by an average of each of the player's class damage bonuses.

name: Unstable Prism
description: The Unstable Prism is a Pre-Hardmode accessory found in the Granite shrine. When equipped three blue sparks will be released from an enemy upon critically hitting them. The sparks are affected by gravity and will pierce indefinitely until they despawn. The sparks deal 15 typeless damage which is affected by an average of all damage bonuses. Sparks are only generated from enemies that have a damage stat of 5 or higher, with the exception of enemies spawned from statues, which won't drop any spark

name: Fungal Symbiote
description: The Fungal Symbiote is a Pre-Hardmode accessory found in the Glowing Mushroom biome shrine. When equipped all weapons classified as true melee will fire three to five spinning mushrooms after each swing, depending on the weapon used. Each mushroom does 15% damage (based on the player's melee damage multiplier and the weapon's damage) and will linger until it collides with an enemy or 3 seconds have elapsed. In addition to this true melee damage is increased by 15% with this equipped. The Fungal

name: Crimson Effigy
description: The Crimson Effigy is a Pre-Hardmode effigy found in the Crimson shrine. When placed down, all players nearby will receive a 15% damage boost as well as 10 defense, but will have their maximum health decreased by 10%. The Crimson Effigy is the counterpart to the Corruption Effigy, trading a damage and defense boost with a health penalty for a movement speed and crit chance boost and a damage reduction penalty.

name: Corruption Effigy
description: The Corruption Effigy is a Pre-Hardmode effigy item found in the Corruption shrine. When placed down, all players nearby will receive a 10% movement speed boost as well as a 10% increase to crit chance, but all players nearby will have their DR reduced by 5%, potentially bringing it below 0% The Corruption Effigy is the counterpart to the Crimson Effigy, trading a movement speed and crit chance boost with a damage reduction penalty for a damage and defense boost with a health penalty.

name: Ceaseless Hunger Potion
description: The Ceaseless Hunger Potion is a craftable post-Moon Lord buff potion made from Dark Plasma. Upon consumption it grants the Ceaseless Hunger buff, causing all items within the world to be sucked up by the player over a course of ten seconds.

name: Holy Wrath Potion
description: The Holy Wrath Potion is a craftable post-Moon Lord buff potion made from Unholy Essence. Upon consumption it grants the Holy Wrath buff, boosting the player's damage by 12% and movement and flight speed by 5%. In addition to this, all weapons will inflict the Holy Flames debuff. The player will also become immune to the Wrath buff. It can be considered the upgrade to the vanilla Wrath Potion. In a Corrupt world, 1-2 Holy Wrath Potions can be obtained from Hallowed Crates at a 10% chance once Pr

name: Profaned Rage Potion
description: The Profaned Rage Potion is a craftable post-Moon Lord buff potion made from Unholy Essence. Upon consumption it grants the Profaned Rage buff, boosting the players critical strike chance by 12% and movement and flight speed by 5%. The player will also become immune to the Rage buff. It can be considered the upgrade to the vanilla Rage Potion. In a Crimson world, 1-2 Profaned Rage Potions can be obtained from Hallowed Crates at a 10% chance once Providence, the Profaned Goddess has been defeated

name: Bounding Potion
description: The Bounding Potion is a craftable Pre-Hardmode buff potion. Upon consumption it grants the Bounding buff, increasing the player's jump height by 10, their jump speed by 5%, and fall resistance increases by 25 blocks, allowing the player to fall 50 blocks before taking fall damage. The Bounding buff can be considered a consumable version of the Frog Leg, due to its similar but varied stats.

name: Astral Injection
description: Not to be confused with Astral Infection, a Hardmode biome. The Astral Injection is a craftable Hardmode buff potion made from Aureus Cells. Upon consumption it grants the player +180 mana regen per second at the cost of the player losing 5 health and being inflicted with the Mana Sickness debuff. Astral Injections may also be obtained from Astral Crates once Astrum Aureus has been defeated. This item essentially acts as a mana potion that restores 900 Mana, over a time of 5 seconds, which is su

name: Calcium Potion
description: The Calcium Potion is a craftable Pre-Hardmode buff potion. Upon consumption it grants the Calcium buff, causing the player to become immune to all fall damage. The Calcium Potion can be used to negate all fall damage when riding a mount such as the Slimy Saddle. The Calcium Potion will also negate fall damage from the Stoned debuff. Calcium is known for its role in the formation and strengthening of bones.

name: Crumbling Potion
description: The Crumbling Potion is a craftable Hardmode buff potion. Upon consumption it grants the Armor Crumbling buff, causing all melee and rogue attacks to inflict the Armor Crunch debuff as well as increases melee and rogue critical strike chance by 5%. On attack, there is a 25% chance for Armor Crunch to be inflicted for 6 seconds, a 37.5% chance to be inflicted for 4 seconds, and a 37.5% chance to be inflicted for 2 seconds.

name: Forgotten Dragon Egg
description: The Forgotten Dragon Egg is a pet summoning item dropped by Jungle Dragon, Yharon. It summons Akato, the son of Yharon, to follow the player.

name: Shattering Potion
description: The Shattering Potion is a craftable Hardmode buff potion that is a direct upgrade to the Crumbling Potion. Upon consumption it grants the Armor Shattering buff, causing all melee and rogue attacks to inflict the Armor Crunch debuff as well as increasing melee and rogue damage and critical strike chance by 8%. The player will also become immune to the Armor Crumbling buff. On attack, there is a 25% chance for Armor Crunch to be inflicted for 6 seconds, a 37.5% chance to be inflicted for 4 second

name: Gravity Normalizer Potion
description: The Gravity Normalizer Potion is a craftable Hardmode buff potion made from Aureus Cells. Upon consumption it grants the Gravity Normalizer buff, allowing the player to move normally in space as well as provides immunity to the Distorted debuff. Gravity Normalizer Potions may also be obtained from Astral Crates once Astrum Aureus has been defeated.

name: Gaze of Crysthamyr
description: Gaze of Crysthamyr is a post-Moon Lord Mount summoning item. When used it summons a rideable Shadow Dragon mount which can run and fly at high speeds. The Shadow Dragon is capable of running at a speed of 77 mph while on the ground and can reach 69 mph while flying vertically. The Shadow Dragon mount cannot double jump but is capable of 12.5 seconds of flight, boasting incredibly quick horizontal movement but weak upwards acceleration. Like the Hoverboard, holding ▼ Down and ↷ Jump while in the

name: Penumbra Potion
description: Not to be confused with Penumbra, a post-Moon Lord rogue weapon. The Penumbra Potion is a craftable Hardmode buff potion made from Solar Tablet Fragments. Upon consumption it grants the Penumbra buff, increasing the rate that rogue stealth builds by 15% while moving and 15% while standing still at night. These bonuses are boosted to 20% during a Solar Eclipse. The buff will grant the player Eclipse benefits if Umbraphile armor is equipped, regardless of time and Eclipse conditions of the buff.

name: Photosynthesis Potion
description: The Photosynthesis Potion is a craftable Hardmode buff potion. Upon consumption it grants the Photosynthesis buff, which provides 6 additional life regen when the player isn't moving. The regeneration increases to 34 during the daytime, regardless of where you are in the world. In addition, dropped hearts will heal an extra 5 HP. The boosted life regeneration from the Photosynthesis buff is overridden by the effects of the Shiny Stone, the Demonshade Breastplate, the Cosmic Freeze buff, and Drae

name: Penumbra
description: Not to be confused with Penumbra Potion, a stealth-based buff potion. The Penumbra is a craftable post-Moon Lord rogue bomb. It fires shadow bombs that charge in the direction of the player's cursor and explode into homing souls. Performing a stealth strike with the Penumbra will cause a shadow bomb to appear at the location of the cursor, quickly exploding into many homing souls. Its best modifier is Flawless. The Penumbra could be considered a counterpart to the Hypothermia due to their simila

name: Carnage
description: The Carnage is a Pre-Hardmode broadsword that drops from The Hive Mind and The Perforators in Malice Mode. Whenever it deals a finishing blow, 6-8 homing blood bolts erupt out of the enemy. Each bolt deals damage and heals the player for 2 HP upon enemy contact. Its best modifier is Legendary. It was formerly the rare variant of the Bloody Edge.

name: Draconic Elixir
description: The Draconic Elixir is a craftable post-Moon Lord buff potion. Upon consumption it grants the Draconic Surge buff which increases the flight time of Wings by 35%, increases maximum flight speed and acceleration by 15%, and grants 16 defense. If the player is wearing Silva armor or Auric Tesla armor and takes fatal damage, Silva Immunity will also heal them to half their health. If either revive effect is triggered, the player loses the Draconic Surge buff, disallowing them from drinking another

name: Evil Smasher
description: The Evil Smasher is a Hardmode melee weapon that drops from Wall of Flesh in Malice Mode. Upon killing an enemy, the weapon gains 10% increased damage, attack speed and knockback. This stacks up to 10 times. Using another item will remove the stacks. Getting hit by an enemy will remove 1 stack. Its best modifier is Legendary. This weapon is a reference to the weapon of the same name from Borderlands 2. It was formerly the rare variant of the Ancient Crusher.

name: Grand Dad
description: The Grand Dad is a Post-Moon Lord broadsword that drops from the Moon Lord in Malice Mode. Whenever the Grand Dad contacts a non-boss enemy, their defense is reduced to zero and their knockback resistance is set to -600%. It also has an exceptionally high knockback stat and size. Its best modifier is Legendary. Grand Dad deals 75% of its original damage on Polterghast and Signus, Envoy of the Devourer. The Grand Dad's knockback resistance removal can affect enemies that are immune to knockback.

name: Swordsplosion
description: The Swordsplosion is a post-Moon Lord broadsword that drops from The Dragonfolly in Malice Mode. The sword functions very similarly to the Ark of the Elements; however, the sword fires beam swords in place of the homing projectiles of the Ark of the Elements. Additionally, rather than firing beams from the sword, several beam swords rain from the sky instead. The sword rotates between firing different colored beam swords. Its best modifier is Legendary. This weapon is a reference to the weapon o

name: Piggy
description: The Piggy is a critter. It is found on the Surface and passively walks back and forth. It can also be caught with a Bug Net or Golden Bug Net. Unlike most critters, the Piggy has a much higher health stat and drops a hefty amount of gold coins. If the player is lucky, they can encounter and kill a Piggy very early on in their playthrough, which will help immensely due to the large amount of money it drops. This may take a while due to its large amount of HP. Despite having the same sell value as

name: Arbalest
description: The Arbalest is a Hardmode repeater that drops from The Twins in Malice Mode. When fired, four volleys of unevenly spread arrows are shot. The arrows initially start at 50% of their original size, damage, and knockback, but with each use, the arrows eventually reach a cap of 150% of their original stats, along with gaining an increased spread. After the cap is reached, the next use resets all three stats back to 50%. Its best modifier is Unreal. An arbalest was a late variation of the crossbow c

name: Conference Call
description: The Conference Call is a Hardmode gun that drops from Astrum Deus in Malice Mode. The gun shoots a tight spread of five bullets with tripled velocity. If an enemy is nearby, 12 bullets are additionally fired from the sky targeting the enemy present. If multiple enemies are present, the 12 bullets are equally distributed along the enemies. The bullets from the sky have halved lifespan, tripled velocity, can pass through solid tiles, and deal 70% damage. Its best modifier is Unreal. Enemies are de

name: Hellborn
description: The Hellborn is a Hardmode gun that drops from the Brimstone Elemental in Malice Mode. The gun fires three to five bullets per shot in an uneven spread. If Musket Balls are used as ammo, they are transformed into explosive bullets that can damage the player. The gun itself also deals contact damage to enemies, a unique property for a ranged weapon that it shares with weapons such as Marnite Bayonet and Helstorm. If the gun touches an enemy, a massive explosion is created, and the gun gains incre

name: Infinity
description: The Infinity is a post-Moon Lord gun that drops from the Moon Lord in Malice Mode. The gun rapidly fires two streams of bullets that swerve up and down to form a helix shape. The gun has two firing modes. Pressing left-click will cause the gun to rapidly fire out energy bolts that explode into smaller bolts that bounce after traveling a short distance. Pressing right-click will cause the gun to rapidly fire out whatever bullets the player had currently equipped. Once fired, the Infinity will not

name: Lead Wizard
description: The Lead Wizard is a Hardmode gun that drops from Golem in Malice Mode. When fired, bullets are transformed into yellow high-velocity bullets that shoot out from the gun at angles above and below the cursor's position forming roughly a 30 degree angle. Its best modifier is Unreal. This weapon's name is a reference to The Wiz from The Binding of Isaac: Rebirth, which also makes the player's shots fire at a 30-degree angle away from wherever they are aiming. This weapon's tooltip is a reference to

name: Norfleet
description: The Norfleet is a post-Moon Lord ranged weapon that drops from The Devourer of Gods in Malice Mode. When used, it fires ten large stars that explode upon contact with an enemy. Upon collision, each star will create a massive explosion similar to that of the Starmada. It uses Fallen Stars as ammo and consumes six fallen stars per shot fired. Its best modifier is Unreal. Similarly to the Starmada, this weapon fires faster the longer the player uses it, and emits a particle ring to indicate when th

name: Pearl God
description: The Pearl God is a post-Moon Lord gun that drops from Polterghast in Malice Mode. On its first and second uses, it fires a shockblast round that heals the player, along with two of which ever ammo is being used in a spread. On its third, fourth, fifth, and sixth uses, shockblasts continue to be shot, with the normal bullet spread continuously increasing along with more being shot. On its seventh use, only a shockblast is shot which has double damage and knockback. Shockblasts create harmless dus

name: Skullmasher
description: The Skullmasher is a post-Moon Lord gun that drops from The Devourer of Gods in Malice Mode. The gun fires four high velocity bullets. Upon collision with enemies, more high velocity bullets and which ever ammo type is being used are shot at the enemy from random positions near it. Its best modifier is Unreal. This weapon is a reference to the gun of the same name from the Borderlands series. It was formerly the rare variant of the Anti-materiel Rifle.

name: Cryophobia
description: Cryophobia is a Hardmode magic gun that drops from Cryogen in Malice Mode. When used it fires a light blue growing wave that splits into 3 twice, for 9 final waves, each pierces three times and inflicts the Glacial State and Frostburn debuffs. Its best modifier is Mythical. This weapon shares its name with the Cryophobia rocket launcher from Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel. The name of this weapon, Cryophobia, means an irrational fear of the cold. It was formerly the rare variant of the Magna Cannon

name: The Bee
description: Not to be confused with Bee, a vanilla enemy. The Bee is a Pre-Hardmode accessory that drops from the Queen Bee in Malice Mode. When the player is hit, hallowed stars rain from the sky and several bees are released. When at full health, damage dealt by the player will be increased by half of their Damage Reduction, excluding separated damage reduction boosts. Additionally, taking a hit while at full health will have the incoming damage be halved, with a 10-second cooldown. This accessory is a re

name: Eye of Magnus
description: Eye of Magnus is a Hardmode magic gun that drops from the Lunatic Cultist in Malice Mode. When used it fires a fast, blue-and-white beam that homes in on enemies and will restore 25 mana and 1 HP upon contact with an enemy. Upon impact, each beam will create an explosive plume of blue-and-white particles which can deal additional damage. Its best modifier is Mythical. The additional hits from the impact explosion will not replenish HP or mana, only the initial enemy hit will. This weapon shares

name: Deep Diver
description: The Deep Diver is a Hardmode accessory that drops from the Aquatic Scourge in Malice Mode. It grants 8 defense. While the player is submerged in water or honey, damage, movement speed and acceleration are all increased by 15%, the player gains an extra 15 defense while submerged in water or honey, and the player gains the ability to dash a base distance of 36 blocks by double tapping the ◀ Left or ▶ Right key. Using this accessory alongside an item that eliminates water physics such as Victide a

name: The Evolution
description: The Evolution is a post-Moon Lord accessory that drops from the Ceaseless Void in Malice Mode. Any projectile that strikes the player will be reflected. When a projectile is reflected, it will deal 10 times its original damage to any enemy it touches, and the player will gain a life regeneration boost. This effect can only occur every 120 seconds. Additionally, if the next projectile to hit the player is of the same type, the projectile will deal 15% less damage. This effect will only trigger on

name: Regenator
description: The Regenator is a Hardmode accessory that drops from Calamitas in Malice Mode. While equipped, the player's maximum health is halved. In return, the player gains 12 extra life regeneration. This accessory is a reference to the Reogenator shield from Borderlands: The Pre-Sequel. It was formerly the rare variant of the Ornate Shield.

name: Warbanner of the Sun
description: The Warbanner of the Sun is a Post-Moon Lord accessory that drops from Providence, the Profaned Goddess in Malice Mode. Melee damage, true melee damage and melee speed boosts linearly scale with how close the player is to an enemy, with a maximum boost of +20%. Bonuses start when the player is 30 tiles or closer to an enemy. It should be noted that the general melee damage and the true melee damage boosts stack, meaning true melee weapons will do a total of 40% more damage at maximum. In previou

name: Flame-Licked Shell
description: The Flame-Licked Shell is a Hardmode accessory that drops from the Brimstone Elemental in Malice Mode. It reduces movement speed and acceleration by 50%, but in return it gives a massive defense boost. Additionally, enemy damage is reflected back at them, dealing 25% of the original hit. Movement speed is increased by 90% and defense decreased by 18 for a short time after the player is harmed by any source. The accessory also grants 4 seconds of immunity to lava damage. Shell Speed Boost will no

name: Thorn Blossom
description: The Thorn Blossom is a Hardmode wand that drops from Plantera in Malice Mode.
