When used it behaves similarly to the Arch Amaryllis, firing a pink flower that pierces enemies and slows down horizontally more quickly than it does vertically, causing it to travel in an upwards or downwards curve depending on the direction it's fired. After two seconds, or upon hitting a block, the main projectile splits into six homing petals. The petals last two seconds before fading away, and deal 75% of the main

name: Clothier's Wrath
description: Clothier's Wrath is a Pre-Hardmode magic weapon that drops from Skeletron in Malice Mode. When used it fires three shadowflame skulls that pierce four times and inflict the Shadowflame debuff. Each skull cannot pass through blocks and will explode after traveling a short distance. Its best modifier is Mythical. The shadowflame skull projectiles fired have an identical sprite to the projectiles fired by the Clothier. It was formerly the rare variant of the Book of Skulls.

name: The Transformer
description: The Transformer is a Pre-Hardmode accessory that drops from Crabulon in Malice Mode. Sparks are released when the player is damaged, dealing 8 damage in Pre-Hardmode and 48 damage in Hardmode. Additionally, it gives immunity to the Electrified debuff, causes enemy bullets to be reflected back at the enemy for 800% of their original damage, and reduces damage from electrical projectiles and enemies and enemy bullets by 50%. This accessory is great for the post-Plantera or post-Moon Lord Dungeon f

name: Thunderstorm
description: This page is about the magic weapon. For the event, see here. Thunderstorm is a post-Moon Lord magic gun that drops from Storm Weaver in Malice Mode. When used it will fire a stream of green plasma bullets that explode upon contact with blocks or enemies. Each explosion causes five smaller plasma bullets to rain down within the vicinity of the explosion. Each smaller plasma bullet will do full damage and will pass through blocks for a few seconds. A decorative green circle is also created by the

name: Void Vortex
description: The Void Vortex is a post-Moon Lord wand that drops from the Jungle Dragon, Yharon in Malice Mode. When used, it fires twelve magnetic orbs at the cursor that quickly spin out in a circular fashion away from the cursor. Each magnetic orb will rapidly fire electric beams at nearby enemies, which ignore immunity frames and deal incredibly high amounts of damage per second. The electric beams will not pass through blocks, and the orbs will despawn after traveling for 3 seconds. Its best modifier is

name: Dune Hopper
description: Not to be confused with Scourge of the Seas, a visually similar javelin dropped by the Aquatic Scourge. The Dune Hopper is a Pre-Hardmode javelin that drops from the Desert Scourge in Malice Mode. When used it will throw a Dune Hopper that will bounce five times before disappearing. Performing a stealth strike with the Dune Hopper will cause three javelins to be thrown instead of one. The three javelins have slightly higher velocity. Its best modifier is Flawless. The weapon's sprite resembles t

name: Quasar
description: The Quasar is a Hardmode non-consumable dagger that drops from Astrum Deus in Malice Mode. It functions identically to the Radiant Star with the main difference being that the explosion will pull in enemies. The black hole-like effect does not affect bosses. If an enemy is hit by a Quasar knife that is caught up in the explosion, astral, fallen, and hallowed stars will rain down on them, dealing full damage of the Quasar knife. Unlike the Radiant Star, the split knives of Quasar do not home in o

name: Dragon Pow
description: The Dragon Pow is a craftable post-Moon Lord flail. It fires out a dragon head that releases red, orange, and yellow homing sparks that inflict several debuffs on hit, and each spark will deal one-eighth of the initial swing. When fired, the roar of the Jungle Dragon, Yharon can be heard. Upon contact with an enemy, twelve petals are spawned and will travel in two sets to create an X pattern that will damage enemies, ignoring immunity frames, and passing through blocks, with each petal doing one

name: Spear of Destiny
description: The Spear of Destiny is a Hardmode javelin that drops from Skeletron Prime in Malice Mode. When fired, it throws out a projectile identical to the Ichor Spear, alongside two rapidly moving spears which will aggressively home in onto enemies. Each spear will inflict the Ichor debuff and pierce once. Performing a stealth strike with the Spear of Destiny will cause all three spears to aggressively home, ignore tiles, and pierce two additional times. Its best modifier is Flawless. The homing of the

name: Plaguenade
description: Plaguenades are craftable Hardmode bombs. They are explosive projectiles that release 20 plague-infected bees upon explosion. Both the explosion and the bees inflict the Plague debuff on contact. The bees spawned by the Plaguenade fly much faster than normal bees and are unaffected by liquids. Performing a stealth strike with Plaguenades causes the resulting grenade to emit a larger explosion with 3.75x the explosion radius which releases 8 more bees. The Plaguenade cannot be reforged, and there

name: The Reaper
description: Not to be confused with the Reaper, an enemy that spawns during the Solar Eclipse. The Reaper is a post-Moon Lord rogue weapon that drops from The Old Duke in Malice Mode. When fired, it throws out a reaper scythe that homes in onto enemies. Each reaper scythe will hit an enemy twelve times before disappearing, inflicting the Crush Depth debuff onto enemies. Performing a stealth strike with The Reaper will cause four scythes to be thrown instead of one. Its best modifier is Flawless. This weapon

name: Hide of Astrum Deus
description: The Hide of Astrum Deus is a Hardmode accessory that drops from Astrum Deus in Malice Mode. The wearer creates an astral infection explosion and twelve astral stars rain from the sky that damage nearby enemies upon being struck or dealing a true melee hit. True melee damage is boosted by 50% for up to fifteen seconds after being struck by an enemy. The Hide of Astrum Deus also provides immunity to Astral Infection, Cursed Inferno, On Fire!, and the Frostburn debuffs. Any enemy that hits you will

name: Soaring Potion
description: The Soaring Potion is a craftable Hardmode buff potion. Upon consumption it grants the Soaring buff, which increases wing flight time and horizontal flight speed by 10%. In addition, it restores a fraction of the player's wing time whenever an enemy is hit by a true melee weapon. The amount of flight time restored scales with the player's melee stats and weapon swing speed.

name: Triumph Potion
description: The Triumph Potion is a craftable Pre-Hardmode buff potion. Upon consumption it grants the Triumph buff, which reduces enemy contact damage by a percentage equal to the percentage of the enemy's missing health multiplied by 0.15. (For example, an enemy with 30% health remaining would deal 10.5% reduced contact damage.)

name: Stellar Contempt
description: The Stellar Contempt is a craftable post-Moon Lord boomerang. It repeatedly throws high velocity hammers at a medium range, which can pass through tiles. Upon contact with a target, lunar flares will rain down onto the target. If it is nighttime, the hammer itself will inflict the Nightwither debuff on every enemy it strikes. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. The Old Duke takes only 80% damage from the Stellar Contempt.

name: Galaxy Smasher
description: The Galaxy Smasher is a craftable post-Moon Lord boomerang. It is the direct upgrade to the Stellar Contempt. It repeatedly throws high velocity hammers at a short range, which can pass through tiles. Upon contact with a target, the hammer will inflict the God Slayer Inferno and summon five Nebula lasers to strike at the target's position, inflicting the Frostburn and On Fire! debuffs. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size.

name: Nanoblack Reaper
description: The Nanoblack Reaper is a craftable post-Moon Lord rogue boomerang. It rapidly throws high velocity scythes at a massive range which can pass through tiles. Each scythe thrown constantly summons spinning energy blades which aggressively home in on nearby enemies. Both the scythes and the energy blades ignore NPC immunity frames. If there are any bosses nearby, the energy blades will ignore other enemies and only target bosses. Its best modifier is Flawless. The Nanoblack Reaper was intentionally

name: Helium Flash
description: The Helium Flash is a craftable post-Moon Lord wand. It fires a burning star core which bursts on impact into an enormous flaming explosion much like the Inferno Fork. The explosion ignores NPC immunity frames and inflicts the Daybroken debuff for an extended period of time. The burning star core additionally inflicts the Irradiated debuff if it strikes an enemy directly. Its best modifier is Mythical. This weapon is named after the astronomical phenomenon in which red giant stars reach a critic

name: Devil's Sunrise
description: The Devil's Sunrise is a craftable post-Moon Lord melee weapon that is a direct upgrade to the Arkhalis. While being swung, white blurred slashes will appear in the direction of the mouse, creating an illusion that the sword itself is being swung very quickly. Any enemies that are hit by the slashes will take damage and are inflicted with the Brimstone Flames debuff. The Devil’s Sunrise’s slashes will turn red the longer it is deployed, with its damage increasing immensely. The Devil's Sunrise w

name: Angelic Shotgun
description: The Angelic Shotgun is a craftable post-Moon Lord gun. Each time the weapon is fired, it shoots eight bullets and summons a radiant beam from the sky towards the cursor. The beam deals five times the damage of an individual bullet and pierces infinitely through both enemies and walls. If Musket Balls are used as ammo, the bullets are replaced with special illuminated bullets. Both the illuminated bullets and the beam inflict the Holy Flames debuff onto enemies. Its best modifier is Unreal. The i

name: Nadir
description: Nadir is a craftable post-Moon Lord spear. Each use fires a writhing void essence which passes through walls, weakly homes in on enemies and erupts into gray void tentacles after traveling some distance. Void essences slow down rapidly upon touching an enemy and quickly disintegrate, dealing damage several times in the process. When near or touching enemies, the essences constantly spawn void tentacles which impale any nearby targets. The spear itself, the void essences it fires and their spawne

name: Corpus Avertor
description: The Corpus Avertor is an Expert mode-exclusive Hardmode rogue weapon that drops from the Ravager. When used, a translucent black knife is thrown that creates smaller homing red knives as it travels. The red knives pass through blocks, only deal 40% of the Corpus Avertor’s base damage, and heal the player for 5% of their damage. 10% of the player's missing health is added to the weapon's base damage. Its best modifier is Flawless. This weapon has incredible synergy with the Blood Pact, as the dou

name: Bloody Vein
description: The Bloody Vein is a pet summoning item dropped by The Perforators. It summons a mini Perforator Hive to follow the player.

name: Resurrection Butterfly
description: The Resurrection Butterfly is a craftable Hardmode summon weapon. Upon use with two or more minion slots, the Resurrection Butterfly summons a purple and pink butterfly. The purple butterfly will ram into enemies, while the pink butterfly will fire three petals towards enemies that only deal 50% of the summon's base damage. Although the staff summons two minions per use, each cast only uses one minion slot. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bo

name: The Last Mourning
description: The Last Mourning is a craftable post-Moon Lord melee weapon that is an upgrade to the Baleful Harvester. Upon striking an enemy, Mourning Skulls and Flaming Pumpkins will spawn from all directions off-screen and move in towards the enemy that was struck. Mourning Skulls explode into two fire orbs upon hitting an enemy. The sword, the Mourning Skulls and their fire orbs inflict the On Fire! debuff. Its best modifier is Legendary. The Last Mourning's projectiles only deals 40% damage to The Old D

name: Time Bolt
description: The Time Bolt is a craftable post-Moon Lord dagger. When thrown, a sky blue knife is thrown that releases a trail of cosmetic blue particles that glow. When the knife contacts an enemy or a block, it releases a large blue ring that inflicts the Time Distortion debuff onto enemies, reducing their movement speed by 15%. The knife will also release 5 copies of itself in a similar manner to the Influx Waver. Copy knives do not release blue rings or particles. Performing a stealth strike with the Tim

name: Deep Sea Dumbbell
description: The Deep Sea Dumbbell is a post-Moon Lord rogue weapon that drops from Reaper Sharks after Polterghast has been defeated. When used, it throws a dark blue dumbbell that is not affected by gravity and bounces twice off of tiles or enemies, breaking on the third impact. Every time it bounces, it releases 2 smaller gravity-affected blue weights which fly out in random directions and velocities. The weights break upon contact with enemies or tiles, and only deal 25% of the weapon's base damage. The

name: Mad Alchemist's Cocktail Glove
description: The Mad Alchemist's Cocktail Glove is a craftable post-Moon Lord magic weapon. When the primary-fire (left click) is used, a sequence of four flasks are thrown out towards the cursor. The different colors of flasks include red, blue, green, and purple respectively which will each contain unique on-hit effects. After all four flasks have been fired, the cycle repeats itself. When the alternate-fire (right-click) is used, a special flask is thrown that inflicts the Crush Depth, Cursed Inferno, Fro

name: Fearless Goldfish Warrior
description: The Fearless Goldfish Warrior is a rare Pre-Hardmode enemy which spawns naturally on the Surface during Rain. It resembles a walking Goldfish equipped with a Tin Helmet and Magic Dagger, both of which it can drop when killed. It will slowly approach the player in an attempt to stab them with the dagger. The Fearless Goldfish Warrior is a reference to rwm8558 whose avatar shares a very similar sprite to the enemy. The Fearless Goldfish Warrior will instantly kill players named "Metarex" or "LordM

name: Kelvin Catalyst
description: The Kelvin Catalyst is a craftable Expert Mode-exclusive, Hardmode boomerang that does rogue damage. It inflicts the Frostburn debuff and multiple boomerangs can be deployed at once, with the boomerang returning to the owner after a set distance, and breaking upon contact with a solid block. Upon contact with an enemy, the boomerangs spawn eight ice stars each, which do one sixth of the boomerang's base damage, sharply home-in onto enemies, and go through tiles. If no enemies are nearby, the ice

name: Yateveo Bloom
description: The Yateveo Bloom is a craftable Pre-Hardmode flail. It throws out a rose flail that inflicts the Poisoned and Venom debuffs. The flail pierces indefinitely and is affected by gravity. If the player holds down left-click, the flail will drag alongside the player, dealing damage to any enemy it contacts. Pressing or holding right-click will fire a short flower spear that does two-thirds of the flail's base damage. Only the right-click attack will have True melee boosts applied to it. Its best mod

name: Roxcalibur
description: Roxcalibur is a craftable Hardmode broadsword that can also be found in Pre-Hardmode, though the sword cannot be swung until the Wall of Flesh is defeated. When swung, it launches three gravity affected rock shards that do 40% of the Roxcalibur's base damage. The shards are always launched upward in an arc, though their horizontal velocity is based on the cursor's position, and they have a semi-random spread. While in the air, right-clicking with the Roxcalibur will cause the player to dive down

name: Hermit's Box of One Hundred Medicines
description: "You have been blessed by the Third Sage!" Hermit's Box of One Hundred Medicines is a Hardmode pet summoning item dropped by Wall of Flesh that summons a small flying snake that follows the player. If the Hermit's Box is selected in the player's toolbar and they right click, they will be blessed with the ability to respawn at full health. This does not consume the item. Using the item in the same way again will remove the blessing. The box drops directly from the Wall of Flesh and will not drop

name: Karasawa
description: Karasawa is a craftable post-Moon Lord gun. It slowly fires a light blue energy pulse that explodes into a trefoil. Both the energy pulse and the trefoil inflict the On Fire!, Confused, and the Irradiated debuffs. Each time the gun fires, it consumes five bullets instead of one. Its best modifier is Unreal. The name KARASAWA is a staple of the Armored Core series of games where it typically appears as an extremely powerful Laser Rifle. Its power is often offset by the weight of the weapon (as re

name: Dodu's Handcannon
description: Dodu's Handcannon is a craftable post-Moon Lord gun. It fires high velocity peanut shells, regardless of the used bullet. The peanut shells explode on impact with enemies or blocks. Its best modifier is Unreal. The "power of the nut" mentioned in the weapon's tooltip and the weapon's ability to shoot peanuts is a reference to the donor's identifying character, who is a peanut.

name: Dyes
description: Dyes are cosmetic items that can be placed in the Dye Slots of a player's inventory to alter the colors/textures of equipped armor, vanity items, and accessories. The Calamity Mod currently adds 30 types of dyes to the game, most of them being crafted at a Dye Vat. Profaned Moonlight Dye changes color based on the time of day, with red and yellow during the day and blue and purple at night. As it turns from day to night and vice versa, it will be a mix of the two. Profaned Moonlight Dye's aurora

name: Glaive
description: The Glaive is a Pre-Hardmode rogue boomerang sold by the Bandit for 3 , and it can be stacked up to three times. The amount of boomerangs thrown is dependent on stack size. Each boomerang will return to the player after hitting four enemies or traveling a certain distance. Performing a stealth strike with the Glaive will cause the next boomerang thrown to travel 80% faster and not bounce off of enemies. The Glaive cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers. This item may be a refere

name: Cinquedea
description: The Cinquedea is a Pre-Hardmode non-consumable dagger sold by the Bandit for 9 . When used, it automatically throws a dagger that is affected by gravity. The dagger can pierce one enemy. Performing a stealth strike with the Cinquedea will cause the next dagger thrown to home in on nearby enemies after striking an enemy. Its best modifier is Flawless. In real life, a cinquedea is a Renaissance-era shortsword known for having a very wide blade.

name: Bandit
description: The Bandit is an NPC vendor that provides a plethora of weapons and accessories that tailor to the Rogue class. The Bandit will move into an available NPC house if the following conditions have been met: There is an empty house. Skeletron has been defeated. The player has at least 1 in their inventory or personal storage items (such as the Piggy Bank). (This condition will not be required if the Bandit has moved in before on that world) When threatened by enemies, she will defend herself with th

name: Abyssal Mirror
description: The Abyssal Mirror is a craftable Hardmode rogue accessory that is the direct upgrade to the Mirage Mirror. When equipped the player can build rogue stealth 30% faster while standing still and 20% faster while moving. If the player is hit by an enemy, the attack will be evaded and several lumenyl fluid particles will be released from the player, which deal large amounts of damage and inflict the Eutrophication debuff onto enemies. When this effect triggers, the player’s rogue stealth will increa

name: Coin of Deceit
description: The Coin of Deceit is a craftable Pre-Hardmode rogue accessory. When equipped, the player’s rogue critical strike chance is increased by 6% and all stealth strikes only consume 75% of the player's maximum stealth when performed.

name: Dark God's Sheath
description: The Dark God’s Sheath is a craftable Hardmode rogue accessory. When equipped: The player’s rogue stealth cap is increased by 20. The player receives an increase to rogue stealth regeneration rate while moving and not attacking. All stealth strikes only require half of the player's maximum stealth to perform, only consume half of the player’s maximum stealth once performed, and are guaranteed to critically strike. The player's rogue damage and critical strike chance are increased by 6% each.

name: Dragon Scales
description: Dragon Scales are post-Moon Lord rogue accessory purchased from Bandit for 40 after Jungle Dragon, Yharon has been defeated. When equipped, the player's movement speed and acceleration is increased by 10%, and all rogue projectiles create fireballs as they travel. Fireballs are spawned every 0.83 seconds the projectile has been active, slowly homing into nearby enemies, or spin in place otherwise. Additionally, all stealth strikes executed will create a massive infernado on enemy hits, which lin

name: Eclipse Mirror
description: The Eclipse Mirror is a craftable post-Moon Lord rogue accessory that is the final upgrade to the Coin of Deceit, Silencing Sheath, Mirage Mirror, and Ink Bomb. When equipped: The player's rogue stealth cap is increased by 20. The player's rogue damage and critical strike chance are increased by 6% each. Enemy aggro is reduced by 700. Enemies in the Abyss have their detection radius multiplied by 0.3. The player can build rogue stealth 20% faster while standing still. The player receives an incr

name: Feather Crown
description: The Feather Crown is a craftable Pre-Hardmode rogue accessory. While equipped it boosts the velocity of any thrown rogue weapon by 15%. If the player utilizes a stealth strike and hits an enemy with this accessory equipped, three sticky feathers will rain down onto the target. The feathers deal 15 typeless damage which can be affected by rogue damage bonuses. This effect only triggers for the first five enemies hit, and has a cooldown of 0.25 seconds.

name: Glove of Precision
description: The Glove of Precision is a Hardmode rogue accessory purchased from the Bandit for 60 after Plantera has been defeated. When equipped all rogue weapons thrown by the player have 25% increased velocity and 12% increased rogue damage and critical strike chance, but the usetime of all rogue weapons is also increased by 20%. This accessory is the direct counterpart to the Glove of Recklessness. This accessory synergizes very well with stealth due to the fact that stealth strikes do not suffer from t

name: Glove of Recklessness
description: The Glove of Recklessness is a Hardmode rogue accessory purchased from the Bandit for 60 after Plantera has been defeated. When equipped all rogue weapons thrown by the player have 12% decreased usetime but do 10% less damage. Rogue weapons thrown also have a large deviation based on how much velocity the weapon thrown has; the faster the initial velocity, the higher the deviation is. This accessory is the direct counterpart to the Glove of Precision. This accessory synergizes very poorly with s

name: Ink Bomb
description: The Ink Bomb is a Pre-Hardmode rogue accessory that drops from Cuttlefish, Colossal Squids, and Giant Squids. Upon being hit by an enemy, several ink bombs are released from the player that deal a large amount of damage and inflict the Confused debuff onto enemies. The bombs have a twenty-second cooldown and will not deploy again until the cooldown is finished. If the player does not have full rogue stealth then the player will receive 50% of their rogue stealth cap upon the Ink Bombs activation

name: Mirage Mirror
description: The Mirage Mirror is a craftable Pre-Hardmode rogue accessory. When equipped the player can build rogue stealth 30% faster while standing still and 20% faster while moving. Enemy aggro is also reduced by 200, as long as the player is not within the Abyss biome.

name: Momentum Capacitor
description: The Momentum Capacitor is a Hardmode rogue accessory purchased from Bandit for 60 after all three Mechanical Bosses have been defeated. When equipped, pressing the Momentum Capacitor Effect key will create a large circular energy field around the player’s cursor that lingers for 10 seconds at the cost of 30% of the player’s stealth. While the field is up, any rogue projectile that passes through it gains a 15% damage bonus, and also a velocity boost to make the projectile travel further. This ef

name: Moonstone Crown
description: The Moonstone Crown is a craftable post-Moon Lord rogue accessory that is a direct upgrade to the Feather Crown. While equipped it boosts the velocity of any thrown rogue weapon by 15%. In addition, all thrown rogue projectiles release a moon sigil while active for every two seconds, up to a maximum of five sigils at once. Sigils deal 45 typeless damage which can be affected by rogue damage bonuses, slightly home into enemies, and capable of infinite pierce. If the player utilizes a stealth stri

name: Ruin Medallion
description: The Ruin Medallion is a craftable Hardmode rogue accessory. When equipped, stealth strikes only require and consume half of the player's maximum stealth to perform. It also grants the player a 6% increase to rogue damage and critical strike chance.

name: Silencing Sheath
description: The Silencing Sheath is a craftable Pre-Hardmode rogue accessory. When equipped, the player's rogue stealth cap is increased by 20. The player also receives a 15% increase to rogue stealth build time.

name: Thief's Dime
description: The Thief's Dime is a Hardmode rogue accessory that is purchased from Bandit for 1 after the Pirate Invasion has been defeated. When equipped, a metallic brown coin will circle the player and deal contact damage to enemies and inflicts the Midas debuff. If the coin contacts an enemy, there is a 20% chance it will spawn 10 to 20 Silver coins, and a 10% chance to spawn a Gold coin. The coin partially ignores enemy immunity frames, allowing it to deal damage and spawn coins very frequently if it re

name: Twinkling Pollox
description: The Twinkling Pollox is a fishing catch caught in the Astral Infection. It replaces Bass when fishing in the Astral Infection, and can be used to craft Cooked Fish. The item's name is a dual reference of the Pollux star in the Gemini constellation and a common name for fish in the Pollachius genus.

name: Astral Crate
description: The Astral Crate is a Fishing Crate variant that can only be hooked in the Astral Infection. The crate contains several items based originally in the Astral Infection, including weapons and boss drops. Several of the crate's drops are locked behind Astrum Aureus and Astrum Deus. Astral Crates drop different tiers of healing and mana potions depending on what bosses have been defeated: Healing and Mana potions are dropped normally. Greater Healing and Mana potions are dropped if any Mechanical Bo

name: Crates
description: Crates are grab bag-type items which can be hooked while fishing, containing random loot. The Calamity Mod currently adds four new crates, and adds Calamity-based loot to vanilla crates. Crates on the vanilla wiki.

name: Procyonid Prawn
description: The Procyonid Prawn is a fishing catch caught in the Astral Infection. It replaces Shrimp when fishing in the Astral Infection, and can be used to craft Cooked Shrimp. This item's name is a reference to the Procyon binary star system.

name: Twinkler
description: Not to be confused with Twinkle, an enemy from the Stardust Pillar. The Twinkler is a Hardmode critter found within the Astral Infection that acts similarly to a Firefly. Twinklers can be caught with a Bug Net or Golden Bug Net and, unlike other critters added by the Calamity Mod, may be used as fishing bait, with a bait power of 40%. Twinklers can be summoned using the Firefly Statue. Twinklers may also be obtained from Astral Crates.

name: Arcturus Astroidean
description: The Arcturus Astroidean is a Hardmode bait obtained randomly from Astral Crates that has a base bait power of 40%. While in the Astral Infection, Sulphurous Sea, or Abyss biomes, the player's Fishing Power is increased by 10%. Arcturus is the name of the brightest star in the Boötes constellation. "Astroidean" refers to Asteroidea, the biological class that starfish belong to.

name: Throwing Brick
description: The Throwing Brick is a craftable consumable Pre-Hardmode rogue weapon. Additionally, the Starter Bag contains 150 of them. When used, it throws a gravity affected brick that travels a short distance before falling to the ground and breaking. Performing a stealth strike with the Throwing Brick will cause the next brick to shatter into 3 fragments upon impact, which each deal 30% of the damage of the main brick. The Throwing Brick cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers. This weap

name: Iron Francisca
description: Iron Franciscas are craftable consumable Pre-Hardmode rogue weapons that are the direct counterpart to the Lead Tomahawks. They throw gravity affected axes that travel a short distance before falling to the ground. Each axe's damage has a 2x damage increase for the first 0.33 seconds after being thrown. All axes thrown have a 75% chance of breaking upon contact with an enemy or block. Performing a stealth strike with Iron Franciscas causes the resulting francisca to pierce enemies indefinitely.

name: Lead Tomahawk
description: Lead Tomahawks are craftable consumable Pre-Hardmode rogue weapons that are the direct counterpart to the Iron Franciscas. They throw gravity affected axes that travel a short distance before falling to the ground. Each axe's damage has a 2x damage increase for the first 0.33 seconds after being thrown. All axes thrown have a 75% chance of breaking upon contact with an enemy or block. Performing a stealth strike with Lead Tomahawks causes the resulting tomahawk to pierce enemies indefinitely. Th

name: Enchanted Axe
description: The Enchanted Axe is a craftable Pre-Hardmode rogue boomerang that is the direct upgrade to both the Iron Francisca and Lead Tomahawk. When used, it throws an enchanted axe that travels a medium distance and acts similarly to a boomerang. After reaching its maximum distance or hitting a block, it will fire a magical axe at an enemy that passes through walls and pierces once, dealing about 15% more than the weapon's base damage. The main axe cannot pass through blocks and pierces indefinitely. Pe

name: Monkey Darts
description: Monkey Darts are consumable Hardmode daggers purchased from the Bandit for 4 each after Plantera has been defeated. When used, they throw a gravity affected dart that has a 50% chance of breaking upon contact with an enemy or block. Performing a stealth strike with Monkey Darts will cause three bouncing darts to be thrown instead of one. Only one dart will be consumed when this occurs. The Monkey Darts cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers. This item is a reference to the Bloon

name: Gacruxian Mollusk
description: The Gacruxian Mollusk is a Hardmode non-consumable rogue weapon that can be fished up in the Astral Infection. When used, it throws a snail that drops sparks as it travels. The snail travels in a straight line for a moderate distance before being affected by gravity. The sparks are affected by gravity, ignore tiles, and weakly home in on enemies. Performing a stealth strike with the Gacruxian Mollusk will cause the snail to leave a trail of additional snails, which continuously emit sparks for 3

name: Polaris Parrotfish
description: The Polaris Parrotfish is a non-consumable ranged weapon that can be fished up in the Astral Infection. When used, it fires deadly lasers which will increase in power the more shots you hit. If the laser damages an enemy, the player will be granted the Polaris Boost buff, which increases the player's defense by 2, Damage Reduction by 1%, and life regen by 1. After the player has hit an enemy ten times without losing the Polaris Boost buff, the laser will boost in power. After the first boost, la

name: Old Die
description: The Old Die is a Pre-Hardmode accessory that can be purchased from the Bandit for 40 at any time. When equipped, the random damage deviation of each attack is increased. The minimum damage that can be rolled is -7.85% damage and the highest damage that can be rolled is +12.05% damage instead of the ±15% damage deviation that vanilla Terraria has. This means that non-rogue attacks deal 2.1% more damage on average. If the player is holding a rogue weapon or wearing a rogue armor, the damage roll i

name: Elemental Excalibur
description: The Elemental Excalibur is a craftable post-Moon Lord broadsword and the upgrade of the Greatsword of Blah. On each swing, it fires a different colored beam that has different properties depending on its color and inflicts several debuffs. The sword beam colors are fired in a fixed looping order: Red beams have no special effects Orange beams curve back to the player Yellow beams split into 3 red beams after travelling a certain distance Lime beams home back in on the player Green beams home in

name: Scourge of the Seas
description: If you were looking for something other than the Scourge of the Seas, see Scourge (disambiguation). The Scourge of the Seas is a Hardmode javelin dropped by the Aquatic Scourge that is an indirect upgrade to the Scourge of the Desert. When used it automatically throws a javelin that gains velocity while in flight. Thrown javelins are slightly affected by gravity and when contact is made with an enemy, they will explode into toxic clouds. The javelin and clouds inflict the Venom debuff. Performin

name: Blazing Star
description: The Blazing Star is a craftable Hardmode rogue boomerang that can be stacked up to four times. The amount of stars thrown will stop when it reaches the maximum stack limit. Each star will return to the player after hitting four enemies or traveling a certain distance. Performing a stealth strike with Blazing Stars will cause all of the stars in the stack to be thrown at once, and will cause all of the aforementioned stars to each deal 155% damage and pierce infinitely. The Blazing Star cannot be

name: Astrophage
description: The Astrophage is a pet summoning item obtained from Astral Crates. It summons an astrophage to follow the player. The Astrophage is designed and named after bacteriophages, which are real life viruses known for their uniquely insectoid and mechanical appearance. An astrophage-like enemy was originally developed by a community member named L0st_M1ner while Calamity 1.4's Astral Infection expansion was being planned. A pet version of that enemy was added to the Calamity's Vanities fan mod, prior

name: Crown Jewel (enemy)
description: This page is about the boss servant. For the accessory, see Crown Jewel. The Crown Jewel is an invincible boss servant that is summoned by King Slime in Revengeance Mode or during the Boss Rush at 50% health. The jewel hovers above the player and pursues them, firing three red bolts in a spread. The servant will only despawn once King Slime is defeated.

name: Ursa Sergeant
description: The Ursa Sergeant is a Hardmode accessory that is rarely fished up while in the Astral Infection biome. When equipped, the player becomes immune to the Astral Infection and Feral Bite debuffs, and gains 20 defense, but their movement speed is reduced by 35%. In addition, the player’s life regeneration increases as their health lowers: If they are below 50% life, life regen is increased by 1. If they are below 25% life, life regen is increased by 2. If they are below 15% life, life regen is incre

name: Black Hawk Remote
description: The Black Hawk Remote is a Hardmode summon weapon dropped by the Wall of Flesh. It summons a fighter jet which follows the player, and attacks by aiming and firing at enemies. The jets are able to target and fire bullets through blocks. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical

name: Bouncing Eyeball
description: The Bouncing Eyeball is a Pre-Hardmode rogue weapon that drops from Dripplers. When used, it throws a bouncing eyeball that pierces two enemies, bounces five times, or lasts 5 seconds before dissipating. Its knockback is increased by 3 during a Blood Moon. Performing a stealth strike with the Bouncing Eyeball will cause the eyeball thrown to pierce and bounce an unlimited number of times within 5 seconds, makes it travel much faster and unaffected by gravity, and makes it bounce almost directly

name: Kylie
description: Kylie is a Pre-Hardmode rogue boomerang purchased from the Bandit for 9 . When used, it throws a slow-moving boomerang that travels a medium distance before returning to the player. Up to three boomerangs can be thrown out at a time. Performing a stealth strike with the Kylie will cause three short-range boomerangs with higher velocity to be thrown out. Its best modifier is Flawless. The Kylie is a reference to the Kylie Boomerang from Bloons TD 6. This in turn is a reference to traditional kyli

name: Halley's Inferno
description: Halley's Inferno is a craftable post-Moon Lord flamethrower that uses gel as ammunition. It shoots a light blue comet that pierces enemies ten times and inflicts the Nightwither debuff. There is a 50% chance for gel not to be consumed when fired. Pressing right-click while holding this weapon will allow the player to zoom out a large distance. Its best modifier is Unreal. The name of the weapon is the reference to Halley's comet, a comet that can be seen from Earth roughly every 75 years.

name: Spark Spreader
description: The Spark Spreader is a craftable Pre-Hardmode flamethrower that uses gel as ammunition, and is currently the earliest obtainable flamethrower. It shoots short-ranged orange flames when used. The flames inflict the On Fire! debuff and pierce three enemies. There is a 70% chance for gel not to be consumed upon firing. Its best modifier is Unreal. The Spark Spreader was implemented based on a community suggestion made by ThomasThePencil on the mod's Discord server.

name: Consecrated Water
description: The Consecrated Water is a craftable Hardmode bomb. When used, a gravity affected flask is thrown that breaks upon contact with enemies and blocks. Upon breaking, the flask releases a 20 block high flame pillar that damages enemies and dissipates after three seconds. Performing a stealth strike with the Consecrated Water will cause the next flask thrown to spawn two additional flame pillars to the left and right of the main pillar. Its best modifier is Flawless. This weapon is a reference to the

name: Celestial Reaper
description: The Celestial Reaper is a post-Moon Lord rogue weapon that is sold by the Bandit for 2 after the Moon Lord has been defeated. When thrown, it will home in on an enemy and will bounce back from the enemy when it hits, allowing it to redirect itself to hit and bounce off of a different enemy, or simply turn around and hit the same enemy again. It will do this up to six times or 10 seconds, slowing down after each hit. After it hits for the sixth time or after the weapon lingers for 10 seconds, it

name: Stormfront Razor
description: The Stormfront Razor is a craftable Hardmode non-consumable dagger that is an upgrade to the Cinquedea. When used, it automatically throws a dagger that releases three gravity-affected sparks as it travels. The dagger can pierce four enemies. Performing a stealth strike with the Stormfront Razor causes the resulting dagger to move much faster and release a lot more sparks. Its best modifier is Flawless.

name: Eclipse's Fall
description: The Eclipse's Fall is a craftable post-Moon Lord javelin which is an upgrade to the Night's Gaze and the final upgrade to the Daybreak. It throws a rapid spear that can pierce infinitely and goes through blocks. Each time the spear strikes a target, a barrage of three to five smaller spears fall from the sky which very briefly home in on enemies that are not hidden behind tiles. Smaller spears can deal from 32% to 56% damage and 70% to 100% knockback. Performing a stealth strike with the Eclipse

name: The Syringe
description: The Syringe is a Hardmode rogue weapon dropped by The Plaguebringer Goliath. It auto-fires a high velocity syringe that increases damage as it travels and inflicts the Plague debuff. On contact with an enemy or block, it will shatter into glass and plague cinders. Performing a stealth strike with The Syringe will cause the next syringe thrown to release several plague bees upon shattering. Its best modifier is Flawless. This weapon does not benefit from the effects of the Invisibility Potion or

name: Blast Barrel
description: The Blast Barrel is a Hardmode bomb dropped by the Wall of Flesh. When thrown, it will roll across the ground and infinitely pierce enemies it comes into contact with a wall. Upon colliding with a wall, it will explode into shrapnel and fire shards or bounce again then explode. Shrapnel and fire shards inflict the On Fire! debuff. Performing a stealth strike with the Blast Barrel will cause the next barrel thrown to bounce off of walls 2 times before exploding on the third wall. Its best modifie

name: Bloodsoaked Crasher
description: The Bloodsoaked Crasher is a post-Moon Lord non-consumable rogue weapon that is an upgrade to the Crushsaw Crasher. It throws a gravity-affected axe that can hit enemies 6 times and bounces twice before disappearing. The axe speeds up while in flight, but slows down upon hitting an enemy, allowing it to "grind" against that enemy and hit them several times. It additionally heals the player for 3HP on enemy hits. Performing a stealth strike with the Bloodsoaked Crasher will cause the next axe thr

name: Slick Cane
description: The Slick Cane is a Hardmode rogue weapon that is purchased from the Bandit for 25 . Upon use, it waves a short-ranged cane out in front of the player which ignores enemy immunity frames. Each time the cane hits an enemy while being swung, that enemy will drop a small amount of coins proportional to the amount the enemy drops on death. Performing a stealth strike with the Slick Cane will cause the next cane to have a 1/15 chance to force the enemy hit to drop one to three gold coins. Its best mo

name: Utensil Poker
description: The Utensil Poker is a post-Moon Lord dagger that drops from the Moon Lord. It fires random utensils in sets of three that grant the player the Well Fed buff for three seconds on enemy hits. Its best modifier is Flawless. The Utensil Poker is a reference to the weapon of the same name from the Chicken Invaders game series.

name: Fish of Flight
description: The Fish of Flight is a grab bag-type fish that can be caught in the Space Biome during Hardmode. When opened, the player will receive between 2 to 5 Souls of Flight.

name: Fish of Light
description: The Fish of Light is a grab bag-type fish that can be caught in the Underground Hallow Biome during Hardmode. When opened, the player will receive between 2 to 5 Souls of Light.

name: Fish of Night
description: The Fish of Night is a grab bag-type fish that can be caught in the Underground Corruption or Underground Crimson Biomes during Hardmode. When opened, the player will receive between 2 to 5 Souls of Night.

name: Wulfrum Fishing Pole
description: The Wulfrum Fishing Pole is a craftable Pre-Hardmode fishing pole. It has slightly higher fishing power than the Wood Fishing Pole, and has no special effects.

name: Verstaltite Fishing Rod
description: The Verstaltite Fishing Rod is a craftable Hardmode fishing rod. While fishing in the snow biome, the player's fishing power is increased by 10%. Its name is based off Cryonic Bar's older name, which was the Verstaltite Bar.

name: Slurper Pole
description: The Slurper Pole is a Pre-Hardmode fishing pole dropped by Soul Slurpers. Unlike most fishing rods, the Slurper Pole can be used to fish in Lava. It can be considered an earlier and weaker version of the Hotline Fishing Hook as it has much weaker stats than the Hotline Fishing Hook, which has 45% fishing power. The tooltip is a quote by Charles Spurgeon.

name: Navy Fishing Rod
description: The Navy Fishing Rod is a craftable Pre-Hardmode fishing rod. While held with the bobber deployed, enemies near the player are slightly damaged, and emit damaging electric sparks, on short semi-random intervals. The electric aura has a radius of roughly 13 blocks, and has a base damage of 10. The electric sparks have a base damage of 5. The Navy Fishing Rod's tooltip is a reference to the book Life of Pi.

name: Lunar Kunai
description: Lunar Kunai are craftable consumable post-Moon Lord daggers. When used, three gravity-ignoring lunar kunai are thrown that slightly home in on enemies and do not pierce. After being in the air for roughly one second, the kunai will supercharge, causing them to speed up, change color from brown to teal, start emitting dust, and home in far more aggressively. Additionally, supercharged kunai will explode upon impact with tiles or enemies, or after enough time has passed. Performing a stealth strik

name: Heron Rod
description: The Heron Rod is a craftable Pre-Hardmode fishing rod. While fishing in Space, the player's fishing power is increased by 10%. The tooltip references a quote from the book "Of Mice and Men" written by John Steinbeck.

name: Feral Double Rod
description: The Feral Double Rod is a craftable Hardmode fishing rod. When swung, two fishing lines are deployed at once instead of one.

name: Early Bloom Rod
description: The Early Bloom Rod is a craftable post-Moon Lord fishing rod. When swung, six fishing lines are deployed at once instead of one. In addition to this, fishing lines will not break in a similar manner to equipping the High Test Fishing Line. This item's tooltip is a parody of the common English expression "The early bird catches the worm." The name "Early Bloom" may be a mispronunciation of Uelibloom, the material that the rod is made out of.

name: The Devourer of Cods
description: This article is about the fishing rod. For the post-Moon Lord boss with a similar name, see The Devourer of Gods. The Devourer of Cods is a craftable post-Moon Lord fishing pole. When swung, ten fishing lines are deployed at once instead of one. In addition to this, fishing lines will not break in a similar manner to equipping the High Test Fishing Line and it can be used to fish in Lava. The color of the fishing line is randomized between blue and pink. This item's name is a play on The Devoure

name: Fishing Poles
description: Fishing Poles are used with Bait for Fishing. The Calamity Mod adds 9 new fishing rods, including 2 post-Moon Lord fishing poles. Fishing poles on the vanilla wiki.

name: Rift Reeler
description: The Rift Reeler is a craftable Hardmode fishing rod. When swung, three to five fishing lines are deployed at once instead of one. In addition to this, it can be used to fish in Lava. This item's tooltip is a reference to a quote said by Napoleon Bonaparte. This item was originally known as the "Chaotic Spread Rod".

name: Sky Stabber
description: The Sky Stabber is a craftable Pre-Hardmode spiky ball. It throws up to 4 gravity-ignoring spiky balls, with the amount of balls thrown depending on stack size. The balls move very slowly and decelerate to a stop after travelling a short distance. The balls bounce off tiles and will despawn after landing 20 enemy hits or after a long amount of time. Right-clicking with the weapon will delete all the existing spiky balls. Performing a stealth strike with the Sky Stabber will cause the next spiky

name: Enchanted Starfish
description: The Enchanted Starfish is a permanent power-up item found by fishing on the Surface at night that increases the player maximum mana by 20 when consumed. It acts as an alternative to a Mana Crystal in that multiple Starfish can be consumed, but only until the player's maximum mana is at 200. Once the player is at 200 mana, they must use the Comet Shard, Ethereal Core and Phantom Heart to increase their maximum mana further. If used at the maximum amount of mana, the player will complete the norma

name: Luminous Striker
description: The Luminous Striker is a craftable Hardmode non-consumable javelin which is a direct upgrade to the Spear of Paleolith. It automatically throws a spear that doesn't pierce and isn't affected by gravity. While the spear travels, it releases trails of non-piercing stardust shards that accelerate upwards and deal a quarter of the spear's damage. Upon hitting an enemy, the spear shatters into more stardust shards that randomly spread out. Performing a stealth strike with the Luminous Striker will c

name: Duke's Decapitator
description: Duke's Decapitator is a Hardmode non-consumable rogue weapon that drops from Duke Fishron. It throws a fast spinning axe that slowly decelerates to a stop and shatters shortly after. The axe will stop completely upon hitting an enemy, "latching" onto them while dealing several hits. While "latched" onto an enemy this way, the frequency of hits correspond to the speed of the spin, as the spinning decreases the longer the axe lingers. Performing a stealth strike with Duke's Decapitator will cause

name: Sandslasher
description: The Sandslasher is a craftable Hardmode non-consumable rogue weapon. It automatically throws a large sand shuriken projectile that pierces twice and is unaffected by gravity. It speeds up horizontally and deals more damage as it travels, up to a maximum of +42 horizontal velocity and over 10x damage after 10 seconds. It cannot be fired directly upwards, it will curve to either the left or right when attempting to do so. Performing a stealth strike with the Sandslasher will cause the next shurike

name: Epidemic Shredder
description: The Epidemic Shredder is a craftable Hardmode rogue boomerang. It automatically throws a returning plague disk that pierces five times and inflicts the Plague debuff. The disk can bounce on tiles indefinitely until it reaches the player or despawns. The disk also releases homing plague seekers on each bounce and on enemy hits, dealing a quarter of the base damage and inflicting the Plague debuff. Performing a stealth strike with the Epidemic Shredder will cause the next disk to release plague se

name: Bouncing Betty
description: Bouncing Betties are consumable rogue bombs sold by the Bandit for 4 after defeating any Mechanical Boss. They throw an explosive grenade that bounces off of enemies twice, exploding with each bounce. The grenade will bounce off of blocks for a short time after being thrown. Performing a stealth strike with Bouncing Betties will cause the next grenade thrown to release 12 projectiles on explosion. These projectiles will be a mix of damaging pieces of shrapnel, and sparks of flame that inflict th

name: Septic Skewer
description: The Septic Skewer is a Post-Moon Lord ranged weapon that drops from The Old Duke. It automatically launches a harpoon that pierces indefinitely and is unaffected by gravity. The harpoon returns to the player after travelling 125 blocks or upon tile collision, gaining extra speed and randomly releasing bacteria particles on its way back. Bacteria particles deal 40% of the harpoon's damage, can travel through solid blocks, and decelerate to a stop before disappearing after contacting an enemy or f

name: Hell's Sun
description: The Hell's Sun is a post-Moon Lord rogue spiky ball. It automatically fires up to 10 spiky balls, with the amount of balls thrown depending on stack size. The balls move slowly and decelerate to a stop after travelling a short distance. Once the ball comes to a stop, sun orbs of varying speeds and sizes are released in all directions, which do not pierce. The balls go through tiles and will despawn after landing 20 enemy hits or after a long amount of time. Right-clicking with the weapon will de

name: Prismatic Guppy
description: The Prismatic Guppy is a fishing catch caught in the Sunken Sea. It replaces Bass when fishing in the Sunken Sea, and can be used to craft Cooked Fish. The tooltip on the Prismatic Guppy is a reference to the game Insaniquarium Deluxe.

name: Scarred Angelfish
description: The Scarred Angelfish is a Hardmode fishing catch caught in the Sunken Sea. It is used for the crafting of the Revivify Potion.

name: Brimstone Crate
description: The Brimstone Crate is a Fishing Crate variant that can only be hooked in lava in the Brimstone Crag. The crate contains several items based originally in the Brimstone Crag and The Underworld, as well as plenty of generic crate items. Brimstone Crates drop different tiers of healing and mana potions depending on what bosses have been defeated: Lesser Healing and/or Mana potions are dropped normally. Healing and Mana potions are dropped if Skeletron has been defeated. Greater Healing and Mana po

name: Sunken Crate
description: The Sunken Crate is a Fishing Crate variant that can only be hooked in the Sunken Sea. The crate contains several items based originally in the Sunken Sea, including blocks and drops from the Giant Clam. Several of the crate's drops are locked behind Desert Scourge and in Hardmode. Sunken Crate Crates drop different tiers of healing and mana potions depending on what bosses have been defeated: Lesser Healing and/or Mana potions are dropped normally. Healing and Mana potions are dropped if Skelet

name: Radiator
description: The Radiator is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns during the Acid Rain event. It slowly crawls around the sides of tiles much like a Snail, and emits an aura around it that inflicts Irradiated and Poisoned onto the player. After defeating Polterghast, the aura will additionally inflict Sulphuric Poisoning and Venom. There's a 5% chance for a Radiator to be spawned with brighter green glow compared to normal ones. These Radiators will drop a Radiating Crystal when hit with a Bug Net or Golden Bug

name: Radiating Crystal
description: The Radiating Crystal is a light pet summoning item that summons a pet Radiator that will emit a faint glow. It can be caught from special "glowing" Radiators when hit with a Bug Net or Golden Bug Net. The Radiators which can be captured to receive this item will glow a much brighter green color, as compared to the normal ones. They have a 5% chance to spawn instead of a normal Radiator, and will also disappear once hit by a net. Holothurin, mentioned in the item's tooltip, is a toxin contained

name: Auric Bar
description: Auric Bars are post-Moon Lord bars that are made with Auric Ore and a Yharon Soul Fragment. They are used in creating some of the most powerful items the Calamity Mod has to offer, as well as Shadowspec Bars, which are used in the crafting of developer-tier items. Crafting all items (excluding all items crafted from Shadowspec bars which have Auric Bars in its recipe) requires 180 Auric Bars (2160 Auric Ore and 36 Yharon Soul Fragments; requires defeating Jungle Dragon, Yharon 2–3 / 2 times). In

name: Vampiric Talisman
description: The Vampiric Talisman is a craftable Hardmode accessory. While equipped, it increases rogue damage by 12% and heals the player on rogue weapon critical hits. The amount healed is 1.5% the damage dealt, rounded down and up to a maximum of 6, meaning a minimum of 68 damage (a crit of 34) must be dealt in order to receive any healing. The lifesteal is indicated by a red streak travelling from the hit enemy back the player. This accessory works well when equipped alongside the Dark God's Sheath, whi

name: Sunken Sailfish
description: The Sunken Sailfish is a fishing catch caught in the Sunken Sea with a 15% chance. It is used for the crafting of the Soaring Potion.

name: Coralskin Foolfish
description: The Coralskin Foolfish is a fishing catch caught in the Sunken Sea. It is used for the crafting of the Titan Scale Potion.

name: Stat Meter
description: Not to be confused with Level Meters, similar items that display Proficiency. The Stat Meter is a Tool purchased from the Goblin Tinkerer for 1 . It tells the player of their various stats within the tooltip. The stats displayed in the meter's tooltip are as follows: Adrenaline and Rage Meter charge times. (In Revengeance and Death Modes only) Melee damage, crit chance, and melee swing speed. (While holding a Melee weapon) Ranged damage, crit chance, and ammo reduction. (While holding a Ranged w

name: Filthy Glove
description: The Filthy Glove is a Pre-Hardmode rogue accessory dropped by The Hive Mind. When equipped, the player's stealth strikes deal 10% more damage, and have +10 armor penetration. This accessory is the counterpart to the Bloodstained Glove dropped by The Perforators.

name: Bloodstained Glove
description: The Bloodstained Glove is a Pre-Hardmode rogue accessory dropped by The Perforators. When equipped, the player's stealth strikes gain +10 armor penetration and heal the player for 1 HP. This accessory is the counterpart to the Filthy Glove dropped by The Hive Mind. This accessory can synergize quite well with Sticky Spiky Balls, due to the fact that their stealth strike effect throws 7 balls that each can hit up to 5 times. If all of the balls hit enemies, they can heal the player for a total of

name: Electrician's Glove
description: The Electrician's Glove is a craftable Hardmode rogue accessory that is the direct upgrade to both the Bloodstained Glove and Filthy Glove. When equipped, the player's stealth strikes deal 10% more damage, have +20 armor penetration, and heal the player for 1 HP. Stealth strikes also release several gravity affected sparks that linger on the ground for several seconds, damaging enemies that contact them. The sparks deal 20 typeless damage which can be affected by rogue damage bonuses. Sparks can

name: Chaotic Fish
description: Not to be confused with Chaos Fish, a crafting material for Teleportation Potions. The Chaotic Fish is a rare fishing catch caught in lava in the Brimstone Crag in Hardmode at an 8% chance. When opened, the player will receive between 5 to 10 Essences of Chaos.

name: Shadowfish
description: The Shadowfish is a rare fishing catch caught in lava in the Brimstone Crag. It is used to craft Shadow Potions.

name: Solar Veil
description: Solar Veil is a Hardmode crafting material that drops from Reaper and Psycho enemies that spawn during a Solar Eclipse once either Calamitas or Plantera have been defeated. It is used to craft a variety of rogue items.

name: Astral Snow
description: Astral Snow is a Hardmode block which replaces Snow Blocks in the Astral Infection biome upon its creation.

name: Astral Clay
description: Astral Clay is a Hardmode block which replaces Clay Blocks in the Astral Infection biome upon its creation.

name: Glimmering Gemfish
description: The Glimmering Gemfish is a grab bag-type fish that can be caught in the Cavern at a 6.67% chance. It contains various Gems. If the Thorium Mod is enabled, the following gems can also be dropped:

name: Stuffed Fish
description: The Stuffed Fish is a grab bag-type fish that can be caught on the Surface during the Day at a 6.67% chance. It contains various herbs and seeds. If the Thorium Mod is enabled, the following herbs and seeds can also be dropped: If the Shadows of Abaddon Mod is enabled, the following herbs and seeds can also be dropped:

name: Celestial Remains
description: Celestial Remains is a Hardmode block which replaces Desert Fossils in the Astral Infection biome upon its creation. Like its counterpart, it can be used in the Extractinator. If the condition for getting Fallen Stars or Astral Ore from the Extractinator is not met but the player succeeds in rolling either of those items, the vanilla loot table is used instead. If the condition for the tier 2 and 3 Hardmode ores are not met, the highest unlocked tier is extracted instead.

name: Novae Slag
description: Novae Slag is a Hardmode block which replaces Silt Blocks and Slush Blocks in the Astral Infection biome upon its creation. Like its counterpart, it can be used in the Extractinator. If the condition for getting Fallen Stars or Astral Ore from the Extractinator is not met but the player succeeds in rolling either of those items, the vanilla loot table is used instead. If the condition for the tier 2 and 3 Hardmode ores are not met, the highest unlocked tier is extracted instead. Unlike Silt and

name: Rusted Jingle Bell
description: The Rusted Jingle Bell is a light pet summoning item dropped from Baby Ghost Bells when hit with a Bug Net or rarely by fishing in the Sunken Sea. It summons a Baby Ghost Bell to follow the player and provide a large amount of light while underwater.

name: Sea's Searing
description: The Sea's Searing is a Hardmode Legendary ranged weapon that drops from the Aquatic Scourge in Malice Mode. It has two modes of attack: its primary fire (left-click) will shoot a barrage of sea bubbles that summon several additional bubbles from the sides of the screen upon contacting an enemy that inflict the Wet debuff. Its secondary fire (right-click) launches a sea blast that creates a water spout on contact with blocks and enemies, the sea blast itself inflicts the Glacial State debuff. All

name: Astral Snow Wall
description: Astral Snow Walls are background wall that replace Snow Walls in the Astral Infection biome upon its creation.

name: Celestial Remains Wall
description: Celestial Remains Wall is a background wall that replace Desert Fossil Wall in the Astral Infection biome upon its creation.

name: Spadefish
description: The Spadefish is a Pre-Hardmode pickaxe that can be fished up in the Underground Layer with a 2.5% chance. It can mine up to Gold Ore and Platinum Ore. Though it has a very low pickaxe power, its mining speed is higher than most other pickaxes of its tier. Its best modifier is Light for harvesting purposes and Legendary for combat purposes. The Spadefish has the lowest pickaxe power of any pickaxe in either vanilla or Calamity, requiring four hits to break a Stone Block.

name: Aldebaran Alewife
description: The Aldebaran Alewife is a Hardmode fishing catch caught in the Astral Infection with a 20% chance. It is used for the crafting of the Gravity Normalizer Potion. "Aldebaran" is the name of the brightest star in the Taurus constellation, and "alewife" is the name of a species of North American herring.

name: Coastal Demonfish
description: The Coastal Demonfish is a fishing catch caught in lava in the Brimstone Crag with an 8% chance. It is used for the crafting of the Hadal Stew.

name: Brimstone Fish
description: The Brimstone Fish is a fishing catch caught in lava in the Brimstone Crag with a variable chance. Due to how the fishing catch chance is coded, the chance to catch the Brimstone Fish depends on a few variables: The base chance is 40%: If the player is under the effects of a Crate Potion, subtract 10% If the player has not yet killed Providence, add 10% If the world is in Pre-Hardmode, add 11%

name: Sparkling Empress
description: The Sparkling Empress is a Pre-Hardmode magic weapon obtained by fishing in the Sunken Sea after defeating Desert Scourge with a 3% chance. When used, it briefly charges, then releases a concentrated light-blue laser that pierces infinitely. Upon killing an enemy, they explode into two to three prism shards that shoot out in random directions, dealing 20% of the weapon's base damage. Its best modifier is Mythical. But the weapon's knockback will not be affected due to already being 0. The Sparkl

name: Dragoon Drizzlefish
description: The Dragoon Drizzlefish is a Pre-Hardmode flamethrower that is rarely fished up in the Brimstone Crag. It shoots one of two flame projectiles: A gravity affected fireball that lingers for a short amount of time after halting. A fireball that splits into three fireballs after traveling a short distance. Both projectiles have a 50% chance to be either orange or red. Orange projectiles inflict the On Fire! debuff onto enemies while the red projectiles inflict Brimstone Flames. Its best modifier is

name: Crag Bullhead
description: The Crag Bullhead is a fishing catch caught in lava in the Brimstone Crag. It is used to craft Cooked Fish.

name: Bloodfin
description: Bloodfin is a post-Moon Lord food item that is fished up in the Brimstone Crag once Providence, the Profaned Goddess has been defeated, at a 10% chance. It heals 240 health and grants the player the Bloodfin Boost buff on consumption which boosts the player's life regen by 5, and an additional 5 while the player is suffering from a damage over time debuff. Once consumed, the player receives Potion Sickness for 60 seconds. If the player is below 75% life, they receive an additional 4 life regen.

name: Fantasy Talisman
description: Fantasy Talismans are craftable consumable Hardmode rogue weapons. When used, they throw a talisman that latches onto enemies and sticks there, periodically releasing homing souls that deal 50% of the talisman's base damage. Up to three talismans can be stuck to an enemy at once. Performing a stealth strike with Fantasy Talismans causes the resulting talisman to deal 80% damage and release additional souls once latched on, as well as making that talisman release lingering souls as it travels tha

name: Umbraphile armor
description: Umbraphile armor is a Hardmode armor set crafted from Solar Veils and Hallowed Bars which grants stats to the Rogue class. It requires 44 Solar Veils and 34 Hallowed Bars to make the whole set. While wearing all three set pieces, a motion blur afterimage is displayed while the player is walking. It consists of a Umbraphile Hood, Umbraphile Regalia, and Umbraphile Boots. The full set grants the following stats and bonuses (this includes the set bonus): 36 defense 27% increased rogue damage 16% in

name: Totality Breakers
description: The Totality Breakers is a craftable Hardmode bomb that hurls explosive flasks. On impact with tiles or enemies, the flasks create shortly lingering explosions and shoot out three explosive tar projectiles that each release lingering flames. The tar projectiles inflict the Oiled and On Fire! debuffs onto enemies. Performing a stealth strike with the Totality Breakers will cause the next flask thrown to release tar projectiles as it travels. Its best modifier is Flawless. For a full crafting tree

name: Insidious Impaler
description: The Insidious Impaler is a post-Moon Lord spear which drops from The Old Duke. It throws a spear that is unaffected by gravity and sticks to blocks and enemies, releasing toxic and sulphuric clouds that inflict the Venom and Sulphuric Poisoning debuffs. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has 100% critical strike chance. Despite the tooltip mentioning a harpoon, the projectile behaves more like a spear.

name: Gael's Greatsword
description: Gael's Greatsword is a post-Moon Lord Legendary broadsword that drops from Supreme Calamitas in Malice Mode. While using the primary (left-click) swing, it cycles through the following functions: A true melee swing with no special effects Fires two small homing Blood Skulls that move swiftly and attack an enemy twice. Fires a single enormous Blood Skull that moves slowly and hits an enemy three times. When the player's life is below 50%, 2 blood droplets rain down near the player. Occasionally,

name: Nasty Cholla
description: The Nasty Cholla is a craftable consumable Pre-Hardmode spiky ball. It throws a gravity affected cactus ball that explodes into three to four cactus needles after landing, each dealing 25% of the ball's damage. The cactus ball will stick to all blocks and enemies. Unlike most weapons, the Nasty Cholla can damage Town NPCs. Performing a stealth strike with Nasty Chollas will cause five cactus balls to be thrown instead of one. The Nasty Cholla cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifie

name: Web Ball
description: The Web Ball is a craftable consumable Pre-Hardmode spiky ball. It throws a gravity affected web-covered ball that inflicts the Webbed debuff onto enemies for one second, slowing their movement. Performing a stealth strike with Web Balls causes the next ball thrown to inflict three seconds of Webbed instead of one. The Web Ball cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers.

name: Gilded Dagger
description: The Gilded Dagger is a craftable Pre-Hardmode non-consumable dagger. It throws a fast moving golden dagger that ricochets towards the nearest target after hitting an enemy. The dagger pierces once and breaks on contact with blocks. Performing a stealth strike with the Gilded Dagger will cause the next dagger thrown to pierce three times and home in on enemies after ricocheting, as well as granting it 20% increased damage per ricochet. Its best modifier is Flawless. This weapon functions identica

name: Gleaming Dagger
description: The Gleaming Dagger is a craftable Pre-Hardmode non-consumable dagger. It throws a fast moving platinum dagger that ricochets towards the nearest target after hitting an enemy. The dagger pierces once and breaks on contact with blocks. Performing a stealth strike with the Gleaming Dagger will cause the next dagger thrown to pierce three times and home in on enemies after ricocheting, as well as granting it 20% increased damage per ricochet. Its best modifier is Flawless. This weapon functions id

name: Abyssal Crate
description: The Abyssal Crate is a Fishing Crate variant that can only be hooked in the Sulphurous Sea. The crate contains several items based originally in the Abyss biome throughout various points of progression, and serves as an alternative way of getting these items through fishing. Abyssal Crates drop different tiers of healing and mana potions depending on what bosses have been defeated: Lesser Healing and/or Mana potions are dropped normally. Healing and Mana potions are dropped if Skeletron has been

name: Wyvern's Call
description: The Wyvern's Call is a craftable Hardmode wand that is a direct upgrade to the Sky Glaze. It automatically fires out a volley of 3 projectiles from the sky, which can be the same type or different. None of the projectiles pierce through enemies or tiles. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Aestheticus
description: The Aestheticus is a Pre-Hardmode classless weapon which automatically swings and deal damage in a similar manner to broadswords while firing homing crystals that get their damage multiplied by damage bonuses from all classes. When the crystal hits an enemy or after a few seconds, it splits into 4 crystals that damage and home into enemies after a short time, exploding on successful enemy hits. Both crystals inflict the Vaporfied debuff which deals 15 damage per second and reduces enemy movement

name: Infernal Kris
description: Infernal Krises are craftable Pre-Hardmode daggers. When used, a dagger is thrown that begins to spin after traveling a short distance. While spinning, each dagger does 75% more damage. The daggers can pierce one enemy before breaking on the second. When contacting an enemy they inflict the On Fire! debuff for two seconds. They have a 50% chance of being recovered after being thrown. Performing a stealth strike with Infernal Krises will cause the next dagger thrown to glow orange, create an expl

name: Equanimity
description: Equanimity is a craftable Hardmode rogue boomerang. It automatically throws a series of returning light/dark disks that pierce infinitely. When contacting an enemy, several light and dark shards are released from the disk that deal 10% of the disk's base damage. Performing a stealth strike with the Equanimity will cause the next boomerang thrown to release additional light and dark shards. Its best modifier is Flawless. The word equanimity refers to a state of mental calmness and evenness of tem

name: Deep Wounder
description: The Deep Wounder is a Hardmode non-consumable rogue weapon that is sold by the Bandit for 60 after Calamitas has been defeated. It automatically throws a fast spinning hatchet that can pierce infinitely, damaging all enemies that it comes into contact with, inflicting Armor Crunch and Marked for 2 seconds. Performing a stealth strike with the Deep Wounder will cause the next hatchet to travel at a much higher velocity and leave a trail of water behind it, inflicting Crush Depth in addition to th

name: Frostcrush Valari
description: The Frostcrush Valari is a craftable Hardmode rogue boomerang that is a direct upgrade to the Kylie. It automatically throws a slow-moving boomerang that travels a long distance before returning to the player. When contacting an enemy, several gravity-affected ice shards will be released from the boomerang that deal 33% of the boomerang's base damage. Each boomerang inflicts the Frostburn, Crush Depth and Glacial State debuffs onto enemies. Performing a stealth strike with the Frostcrush Valari

name: Terra Disk
description: The Terra Disk is a craftable Hardmode Rogue boomerang. It automatically fires up to 3 disks that have a chance to create 6 smaller disks outwards from the disk while an enemy is near. Performing a stealth strike with the Terra Disk will cause the next disk thrown to travel slower, but also continuously generate smaller disks that will rotate around it. Its best modifier is Flawless.

name: Shinobi Blade
description: The Shinobi Blade is a Pre-Hardmode dagger dropped by Dark Casters. It automatically fires fast daggers that are unaffected by gravity, and do not pierce enemies or blocks. Enemies killed by the projectile spawn slow homing blue orbs that heal the player for 10 health. Performing a stealth strike with the Shinobi Blade causes three daggers to be thrown instead of one. Its best modifier is Flawless.

name: Turbulance
description: The Turbulance is a craftable Pre-Hardmode non-consumable javelin. When used, it automatically throws a javelin that releases four wind slashes in random directions upon contact with enemies or blocks. If the player performs a critical strike on the javelin itself, the wind slashes home on nearby enemies. Wind slashes deal one-third of the weapon's damage and do not pierce enemies or blocks. Performing a stealth strike with the Turbulance will cause the next javelin thrown to periodically releas

name: Bouncy Spiky Ball
description: Bouncy Spiky Balls are craftable Pre-Hardmode consumable spiky balls. They throw gravity-affected spiky balls that bounce off solid blocks. When a ball hits an enemy, it ricochets to other nearby enemies and gains a multiplicative boost of 1.1x per enemy hit. Performing a stealth strike with Bouncy Spiky Balls causes the next spiky ball thrown to have its damage be increased by 1.5 times per bounce instead of 1.1. The Bouncy Spiky Ball cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers.

name: Sticky Spiky Ball
description: Sticky Spiky Balls are craftable consumable Pre-Hardmode spiky balls. They throw gravity-affected spiky balls that stick to solid blocks and platforms. They additionally latch onto enemies and deal damage every second for 5 seconds, as well as inflicting the Slimed debuff. Up to 10 balls can be stuck on an enemy at once. Performing a stealth strike with Sticky Spiky Balls causes seven spiky balls to be thrown instead of one and allows each ball to last for 20 seconds instead of the typical 5 sec

name: Nychthemeron
description: The Nychthemeron is a craftable Hardmode spiky ball. It throws up to 10 gravity-ignoring spiky balls that decelerate over time, with the amount of balls thrown depending on stack size. The spiky balls break after hitting four enemies, contacting a solid block, recalling to the player, or completely stopping.
