name: God's Paranoia
description: God's Paranoia is a craftable post-Moon Lord rogue spiky ball. It automatically fires up to 10 homing spiky balls, with the amount of balls thrown depending on stack size. The balls latch onto enemies and unleash god slayer kunai. Right-clicking with the weapon causes all existing God's Paranoia balls owned by the player to dissipate. Both the balls and the kunai go through blocks and inflict the God Slayer Inferno debuff. Performing a stealth strike with God's Paranoia causes the resulting spik

name: Defective Sphere
description: The Defective Sphere is a Hardmode rogue boomerang that is dropped by Deadly Spheres. Defective Spheres can be stacked up to five times, the amount of spheres thrown depends on the amount of stacks the player has. Spheres thrown can become one of four variants, listed below. Performing a stealth strike with Defective Spheres will cause all 4 sphere types to be thrown at once, regardless of stack limit, while making each sphere deal 65% damage instead of 100%. The Defective Sphere cannot be refor

name: Shroomerang
description: For the vanilla item of the same name, see here. The Shroomerang is a boomerang dropped by Crabulon. It fires a slow-moving boomerang that pierces infinitely before returning to the player. Performing a stealth strike with the Shroomerang will cause the next boomerang thrown to release homing spores every so often as it travels and temporarily grant the Mushy buff when hitting an enemy. Its best modifier is Flawless.

name: Leviathan Teeth
description: The Leviathan Teeth are a Hardmode non-consumable dagger dropped by Leviathan and Anahita. When used, they rapidly throw an inaccurate spread of 1 to 3 gravity-affected teeth that inflict the Venom debuff on contact with enemies and stick to them. Up to 18 teeth can be stuck on an enemy at once, and the damage over time inflicted by the debuff stacks accordingly, up to 216 damage per second. Performing a stealth strike with Leviathan Teeth will cause three gravity-ignoring teeth with a 130% dama

name: Jaws of Oblivion
description: The Jaws of Oblivion are a craftable post-Moon Lord non-consumable dagger that is a direct upgrade to the Leviathan Teeth. When used, it rapidly throws a tight spread of six gravity-ignoring reaper teeth that stick to enemies and inflict the Venom debuff. Up to 6 teeth can be stuck on an enemy at once, and the damage over time inflicted by the debuff stacks accordingly, up to 72 damage per second. Performing a stealth strike with the Jaws of Oblivion will cause the next set of teeth to create a

name: Phantom Lance
description: Phantom Lances are craftable Hardmode javelins. They automatically throw spears that slow down and fade away over time. Each spear leaves a trail of homing lost souls that deal less damage the later they are released. The damage linearly decreases from 70% of the spear's damage to 0 over 5 seconds. Both the souls and the spear go through blocks but do not pierce enemies. Performing a stealth strike with Phantom Lances will cause the next javelin thrown to always move at constant velocity and sou

name: Phantasmal Ruin
description: Not to be confused with Phantasmal Fury, a similarly-themed magic weapon. The Phantasmal Ruin is a craftable post-Moon Lord non-consumable javelin. It is the upgrade of the Luminous Striker and the final upgrade to the Spear of Paleolith. It automatically throws a gravity-ignoring spear that leave trails of floating lost souls. The lost souls float around and home onto nearby enemies, dealing half of the weapon's base damage. Upon contact with an enemy, the spear breaks and unleashes a wave of 1

name: Desecrated Water
description: The Desecrated Water is a craftable Hardmode bomb. When used, a gravity affected flask is thrown that breaks upon contact with enemies and blocks. Upon breaking, the flask releases five to eleven bubbles that travel in multiple directions away from where the flask broke. Each bubble will aggressively home in onto enemies and will deal 50% of the flask's base damage. Performing a stealth strike with the Desecrated Water will cause the next flask thrown to release three to five more bubbles and al

name: Profaned Partisan
description: The Profaned Partisan is a craftable post-Moon Lord javelin that is an upgrade to Crystal Piercers. It automatically fires unholy spears that leave cosmetic yellow trails. The spears explode upon contact with a block or after piercing 5 enemies. All projectiles inflict the Holy Flames debuff. Performing a stealth strike with the Profaned Partisan will cause the next spear thrown to periodically spawn small Profaned Spears that fly alongside the main spear. Profaned Spears bounce and home onto en

name: Sylvan Slasher
description: The Sylvan Slasher is a post-Moon Lord rogue weapon that is bought from the Bandit for 5 after Providence, the Profaned Goddess has been defeated. When used, it creates a small barrage of slashes at the cursor's position that are visually similar to the Arkhalis. Rogue stealth builds up with each slash that hits an enemy, at a rate of 50 stealth per second. When striking enemies, sword waves have a chance to be released, which travel opposite to the player's direction relative to the cursor. The

name: Hardened Honeycomb
description: Hardened Honeycombs are craftable Pre-Hardmode consumable rogue weapons that are also dropped by the Queen Bee. They automatically throw honeycomb projectiles that grants the Honey buff to the player. The honeycombs are affected by gravity and shatter into 3 fragments on impact with an enemy or block. The honeycomb fragments share the same properties as the main projectile but deal 30% of the weapon's base damage. Performing a stealth strike with Hardened Honeycombs will cause the next honeycomb

name: Ashen Stalactite
description: The Ashen Stalactite is a Pre-Hardmode dagger that is dropped by Fire Imps. It automatically throws a gravity-affected stalactite that does not pierce and breaks into cosmetic dust shortly after. Performing a stealth strike with the Ashen Stalactite will cause the next stalactite thrown to be larger, travel slower, have a longer lifespan, and break into piercing, damaging dust. Its best modifier is Flawless. Due to its high damage and fast speed, this weapon is a very good early game choice for

name: Dynamo Stem Cells
description: The Dynamo Stem Cells is a post-Moon Lord, Expert Mode-exclusive accessory that is obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped by The Dragonfolly. It grants the player 10% increased movement speed and a 20% chance for ranged weapons to release miniature swarmers when fired. The swarmers deal more damage the higher the weapon's use time, up to a maximum of 70% of the weapon's base damage for weapons with a use time of 10.5 or higher. The swarmers are softcapped at 1000 damage. In real life, stem cells

name: The Microwave
description: The Microwave is a Hardmode yoyo dropped by Astrum Deus. While the yoyo is in the air, a small aura surrounds it which continuously damages nearby enemies, dealing 35% of the yoyo's base damage and inflicting the Astral Infection debuff. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. The Microwave emits a notable humming noise as it travels, and a beep sound when enemies are killed with it, mimicking that of a real-life microwave oven. Its tooltip makes reference to this,

name: Clamor Noctus
description: Clamor Noctus is a post-Moon Lord wand which is an upgrade to the Wyvern's Call and the final upgrade of the Sky Glaze. It fires 3 projectiles from the sky that are either Night Wyverns or Stars. Stars deal 15% of the weapon's damage, inflicting the Nightwither debuff, and sticking on enemies and tiles for 2 seconds before exploding for 135% damage. Night Wyverns do not have special effects, but they deal 375% of the weapon's damage. Its best modifier is Mythical. "Clamor Noctus" translated roug

name: Poison Pack
description: The Poison Pack is a craftable Pre-Hardmode spiky ball. It throws up to 3 gravity-affected spiky balls, with the amount of balls thrown depending on stack size. The balls inflict the Poisoned debuff, bounce and slide on contact with solid blocks, and decelerate to a stop as it travels. The balls will despawn after a long amount of time, or after right-clicking with the weapon. Performing a stealth strike with the Poison Pack will cause the next spiky ball thrown to release spore clouds as it tra

name: Sand Cloak
description: The Sand Cloak is a Pre-Hardmode accessory dropped by the Desert Scourge. While equipped, it increases defense by 1 and movement speed by 5%. Pressing the Sand Cloak Effect key will create a large, stationary damaging dust veil around the player that lingers for 15 seconds at the cost of 25% of the player's stealth. The player gains an additional 6 defense and 2 life regen while staying in the ring. The cloak has a 30 second cooldown after deploying the dust veil before being able to use again.

name: Spectral Veil
description: The Spectral Veil is an Expert Mode-exclusive Post-Moon Lord rogue accessory that is obtained from the Treasure Bag dropped by Signus, Envoy of the Devourer. While equipped, pressing the Spectral Veil Teleport key teleports the player to the position of the cursor at the cost of 25% of the player's stealth and receiving the Chaos State debuff. If the cursor's position is over 52.8125 tiles away, the player will be teleported 52.8125 tiles in the direction of the cursor as long as no blocks are i

name: Star of Destruction
description: The Star of Destruction is a craftable Hardmode bomb. It automatically throws a gigantic gravity-ignoring mine. The mine moves slowly, travels through blocks, and explodes shortly after being thrown out. The mine explodes into homing bolts, with the amount of bolts equal to the amount of enemies hit up to a maximum of 16. If the mine hits a sixteenth target, it immediately explodes into 16 bolts. Performing a stealth strike with the Star of Destruction will cause the next mine thrown to always b

name: Latcher Mine
description: Latcher Mines are Hardmode consumable rogue bombs that are sold by the Bandit for 3 each after defeating one of the Mechanical Bosses. They automatically throw tiny flat mines that stick to enemies and detonate 3 seconds after latching onto them. Upon detonation or contact with blocks, a burst of 6 gravity-affected flame projectiles are flung up in the air which deals damage and inflicts the On Fire! debuff. Performing a stealth strike with the Latcher Mines will cause the next mine thrown to be

name: Exorcism
description: The Exorcism is a craftable Hardmode bomb. It automatically throws a gravity-affected hallowed cross that explodes into a large explosion which deals more damage to enemies closer to it. The amount of damage increases as the cross falls, releasing white particles when fully charged. Performing a stealth strike with the Exorcism will cause the next cross thrown to be fully charged with 115% damage, and hallowed stars additionally fall from the sky when the cross explodes, each dealing 57.5% damag

name: Ethereal Extorter
description: The Ethereal Extorter is a Hardmode accessory sold by the Bandit for 1 after the Golem has been defeated. While equipped, all rogue projectiles explode into 2 homing souls upon impact. These souls have 25 base damage and are affected by rogue damage bonuses. Additionally, rogue damage is increased by 10%, at the cost of -1 life regen.

name: Plagued Fuel Pack
description: The Plagued Fuel Pack is a Hardmode accessory dropped by Plaguebringers. While equipped, rogue damage and projectile velocity are passively increased by 5% and 15% respectively. The player's stealth also generates 10% faster. Pressing the Booster Dash key causes the player to dash diagonally upwards in the player's direction at the cost of 25% of the player's stealth, leaving a trail of damaging clouds that inflict the Plague debuff. The dash has a 3 second cooldown before being usable again. Th

name: Terror Talons
description: The Terror Talons is a craftable Hardmode rogue weapon. It automatically fires small and swift claws, alternating and creating a double sine-wave like movement from the player towards the direction of the cursor. The claws do not pierce enemies or blocks. Performing a stealth strike with the Terror Talons will cause the next claw thrown to move very quickly forward, pierce up to nine enemies, and deal 3.25x the weapon's base damage. Its best modifier is Flawless. This weapon does not benefit fro

name: Plantation Staff
description: The Plantation Staff is a craftable Hardmode summon weapon. It summons a miniature Plantera that protects the player by firing seeds, spores, and thorn balls at enemies. It additionally is surrounded by six tentacles that deal contact damage. If the player reaches 75% health, the minion will enrage and begin to ram into enemies, dealing contact damage. name: Borealis Bomber
description: The Borealis Bomber is a Hardmode summon weapon that drops from Astrum Aureus. It summons a floating Aureus Bomber that does not take up minion slots and follows the player. It attacks by charging at enemies and then exploding upon impact, inflicting the Astral Infection debuff. If an Aureus Bomber explodes, the minion will despawn. Its best modifier is Mythical, due to its unique nature of not requiring minion slots to be used and being able to be summoned in large numbers with a low enough use

name: Star Sputter
description: The Star Sputter is a Hardmode ranged weapon dropped by Astrum Deus. It fires volleys of three Sputter Comets and fires one Large Sputter Comet on every fourth volley fired, consuming Fallen Stars as ammo. Its best modifier is Unreal. The flavor text in the tooltip is a reference to the opening text of the Star Wars movies.

name: Wulfrum Controller
description: The Wulfrum Controller is a craftable Pre-Hardmode summon weapon. When used, it summons a Wulfrum Droid minion. The droid floats by the player and attacks nearby enemies by firing green projectiles at them. The droid will travel through blocks to reach its target. Its best modifier is Mythical. While Ruthless may seem to provide a bigger damage by percentages, rounding reveals that Mythical and Ruthless boost the damage equally for this weapon.

name: Wulfrum Battery
description: The Wulfrum Battery is a Pre-Hardmode accessory dropped by Wulfrum Enemies. While equipped, it increases minion damage by 7%.

name: Godspawn Helix Staff
description: The Godspawn Helix Staff is a Hardmode summon weapon dropped by Astrum Deus. It summons an Astral Probe that orbits the player and fires homing astral lasers that pass through tiles. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Godspawn Helix Staff has over a Ruthless one is knockb

name: Flurrystorm Cannon
description: Not to be confused with Firestorm Cannon, a ranged weapon that consumes Flares. The Flurrystorm Cannon is a craftable Pre-Hardmode ranged weapon. It fires snowballs at a gradually increasing rate as it is held out, increasing its fire rate every second until reaching a maximum of eight seconds. It has a 20% chance to fire an additional ice chunk that splits into three ice shards. Ice chunks deal 1.5x damage and ice shards deal 0.45x damage. Both the ice chunk and the ice shards inflict the Frost

name: Cosmic Shiv
description: The Cosmic Shiv is a craftable post-Moon Lord shortsword that is the direct upgrade to the Elemental Shiv. When used, it releases homing cosmic orbs that travel in a sine-wave pattern. Upon contacting an enemy, the orbs spawn several cosmic blades and cause galaxy stars to rain down. Its best modifier is Legendary. Its past damage value being 666 was a reference to the number of the beast.

name: Galileo Gladius
description: The Galileo Gladius is a craftable post-Moon Lord shortsword. When swung, the weapon auto-fires homing crescent moons that deal 33.33% of the weapon's base damage and pass through blocks. Hitting an enemy with a true melee hit will cause large blue planetoids to rain on the enemy. These planetoids explode on contact with tiles and enemies. Its best modifier is Legendary. Galileo was known as the "Father of observational astronomy" due to his massive contributions to the field, which gave the wea

name: Voltaic Jelly
description: The Voltaic Jelly is a Pre-Hardmode accessory dropped by Ghost Bells after Desert Scourge has been defeated. While equipped, it grants +1 minion slots and a chance for minions to inflict the Electrified debuff for one second.

name: Jelly-Charged Battery
description: The Jelly-Charged Battery is a craftable Pre-Hardmode accessory that is the direct upgrade to both the Voltaic Jelly and Wulfrum Battery. While equipped, it grants +1 minion slots, increases minion damage by 7%, and gives a chance for minions to inflict the Electrified debuff for one second. All minions will also spawn energy orbs that deal 15 summon damage with a cooldown of one second.

name: Exo Gladius
description: The Exo Gladius is a craftable post-Moon Lord shortsword that auto-swings. It is the final upgrade to the Night's Stabber. When swung, it auto fires rainbow orbs that travel through blocks and home in on enemies. Upon hitting an enemy, the orbs will summon off-screen color-changing sword beams that home in on enemies. name: Venerated Locket
description: The Venerated Locket is a post-Moon Lord accessory purchased from the Bandit for 25 after The Devourer of Gods has been defeated. While equipped, it increases rogue damage by 10%. While a rogue weapon is thrown, a weaker copy of the weapon's projectile rains down from the sky. The copy projectiles deal 6.5% of the weapon's damage and deal typeless damage. name: Blazing Core
description: The Blazing Core is a post-Moon Lord Expert Mode-exclusive accessory obtained from Providence, the Profaned Goddess's Treasure Bag. While equipped, it increases the player's damage reduction by 10%. If the player is hit by an enemy, a miniature sun is created at the player's location for ten seconds that sucks enemies towards it, deals damage, and inflicts the Holy Flames debuff for three seconds. Only one sun can be active at a time. The Blazing Sun deals 1270 typeless damage, cannot critically

description: The Ace's High is a craftable Post-Moon Lord gun. It automatically fires a line of 3 cards with a mild delay between each set, randomly choosing one of four types, each with varying effects. All cards inflict the Brimstone Flames debuff upon contact with enemies. Its best modifier is Unreal. The usage of 52 cards in its crafting recipe is a reference to a standard deck containing 52 playing cards.

name: Sludge Splotch
description: The Sludge Splotch is a craftable Pre-Hardmode consumable rogue weapon. It throws a gravity-affected sludge ball that inflicts the Slow debuff on enemies. The sludge ball dissipates upon hitting a tile or striking an enemy. Performing a stealth strike with a Sludge Splotch causes the resulting ball to split into several smaller sludge blobs on impact. name: Fearmonger armor
description: Fearmonger armor is a post-Moon Lord armor set that is an upgrade to the Spooky armor. It requires an entire Spooky armor set along with 7 Ascendant Spirit Essence, 30 Cosmilite Bars and 30 Souls of Fright to craft the entire set. While wearing all three set pieces, a motion blur afterimage is displayed while the player is walking. name: Metal Monstrosity
description: The Metal Monstrosity is a craftable Pre-Hardmode non-consumable spiky ball. It throws a heavy gravity-affected metal ball that breaks upon hitting a tile or enemy. Upon breaking it releases 3 spiky balls and 3 spikes that stick into enemies inflicting damage over the time and fading away shortly after. Performing a stealth strike with the Metal Monstrosity will make the metal ball shoot several spikes in random directions until the metal ball breaks. Its best modifier is Flawless.

name: The Camper
description: The Camper is a craftable Hardmode, Expert Mode-exclusive accessory. While equipped, the player receives the Well Fed, Heart Lamp, and Campfire buffs at all times. description: The Forgotten Apex Wand is a craftable Hardmode summon weapon. It summons an Ancient Mineral Shark that follows the player and charges at nearby enemies, slamming into them and rebounding away. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Forgotten Apex Wand has over a Ruthless one

description: The Xerocodile is a grab bag-type fish that can be caught on the Surface during a Blood Moon with a 6.67% chance. When opened, the player will receive between 5 to 15 Blood Orbs. The Xerocodile's name is a portmanteau of the words "crocodile" and "Xeroc", a figure in the mod's lore.

name: Fish of Eleum
description: The Fish of Eleum is a grab bag-type fish that can be caught in the Snow and Ice biomes during Hardmode at an 8% chance. When opened, the player will receive between 5 to 10 Essences of Eleum.

name: Sunbeam Fish
description: The Sunbeam Fish is a grab bag-type fish that can be caught in Space during Hardmode at an 8% chance. When opened, the player will receive between 5 to 10 Essences of Sunlight.

name: Supernova
description: The Supernova is a craftable post-Moon Lord rogue bomb. It throws a gravity-affected bomb that explodes upon contact with a tile or enemy. At the impact zone, the supernova bomb will create a huge explosion radius, spawn six homing Supernova energies, and three Supernova spikes that travel in random directions. It fires a ring of stars around the player that orbit their location at the time it was used, and home in on nearby enemies. Performing a stealth strike with the Regulus Riot will cause it to explode into energy stars on death. Its best modifier is Flawless. Regulus is a star system composed of four stars, which has been known for being one of the brightest objects in the night sky.

name: Crescent Moon
description: The Crescent Moon is a craftable post-Moon Lord flail that auto-swings. The flail passes through tiles. When swung, it leaves behind homing crescent moons that deal 40% of the weapon's base damage. It behaves similarly to the Solar Eruption. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. Ruthless might be preferred if the player already has 100% critical strike chance. The Old Duke takes only 60% damage from the Crescent Moon's projectiles and 55% damage from the Crescent

name: Shock Grenade
description: Shock Grenades are craftable consumable Hardmode rogue bombs that can also drop from the majority of enemies that spawn during the Martian Madness event. It throws a shock grenade that explodes upon striking a tile or enemy, releasing several small lightning bolts that can go through tiles. If the grenade's explosion was caused by striking a tile, all of the lightning bolts travel away from the tile in question. Performing a stealth strike with a Shock Grenade causes an electrifying aura, which

name: Baguette
description: The Baguette is a food item. When consumed, it grants the Baguette buff for 5 minutes. The Baguette buff augments the effects of Red Wine, increasing its healing from 200 to 250, but also strengthening the life regen reduction from 1 to 4. Baguettes can be very useful for crafting The Camper due to Hay being easy to amass. The "je suis Monte" in the tooltip is written in a pale shade of yellow (#FCE391 ●). description: The Seeking Scorcher is a craftable post-Moon Lord melee boomerang that is a direct upgrade of the Possessed Hatchet. It fires a holy hatchet that can pass through tiles, home in and hit up to four enemies before returning to the player. Its best modifier is Godly. The Seeking Scorcher was implemented jokingly based on a community suggestion made by kerfpos on the mod's Discord server.

name: Abyss Shocker
description: The Abyss Shocker is a Pre-Hardmode magic gun dropped by Box Jellyfish and Mirage Jellies after Skeletron has been defeated. It fires an erratic lightning bolt that travels very quickly on a semi-randomized path, leaving an aesthetic lingering trail. The lightning homes in on enemies and bounces to another nearby enemy on contact, hitting enemies a maximum of 6 times, though each bolt is unable to bounce to an enemy it has already hit. name: Hypothermia
description: The Hypothermia is a craftable post-Moon Lord rogue weapon. It fires a constant barrage of black ice shards that ricochet off of tiles and inflict Frostburn. Performing a stealth strike with the Hypothermia causes it to fire a black ice chunk that shatters into additional ice shards. Its best modifier is Flawless. description: The Night's Gaze is a craftable post-Moon Lord javelin. It throws a rapid stratus spear that breaks upon hitting a tile and explodes upon striking an enemy, releasing 4 stratus stars that inflict Nightwither. These stars can pierce for a short amount of time and the explosion from the spear will not be triggered if the spear doesn't strike an enemy. Performing a stealth strike with the Night's Gaze will summon stars that travel along parallel to the trajectory of the spear and will home in if an

name: Triboluminescent Etomer
description: The Triboluminescent Etomer is a craftable Pre-Hardmode pet summoning item that summons an electric troublemaker to follow the player. The pet can change forms depending on the biome the player is in or any ongoing events. description: The Ice Barrage is a craftable post-Moon Lord wand that consumes Blood Runes as ammunition. After that, it creates four large blocks of ice which fire snowflakes at enemies, eventually shattering. The center of the spell attaches to nearby enemies that enter the field. description: Sirius is a craftable post-Moon Lord summon weapon and the upgrade to the Sun God Staff. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions

description: The Endogenesis is a craftable post-Moon Lord developer summon weapon. It summons an ascended ice construct that has four different modes: Endo Cooper will fire five to seven lasers that will infinitely pierce in the direction of nearby enemies. Endo Cooper will launch out several homing icicle shards. Endo Cooper will aggressively ram back and forth into enemies. Endo Cooper will fire endothermic flamethrowers in all directions. Each mode is toggled by resummoning the Endo Cooper. All attacks e

name: Magnomaly Cannon
description: The Magnomaly Cannon is a craftable post-Moon Lord launcher. When used, it fires a single exo rocket that homes in on enemies and has an invisible damaging aura surrounding it. Upon impact with enemies, it creates a large explosion and splits into 8 exo beams which travel in every direction. Both the exo beams and rockets can go through tiles, and inflict the following debuffs: Exo Freeze (0.5 seconds) Elemental Mix (2 seconds) Cursed Inferno (2 seconds) Frostburn (2 seconds) On Fire! (2 seconds

The second, third, fourth, and fifth sound waves deal additional damage and all sound waves deal increased damage the more they pierce. They also echo when hitting enemies, creating four extra sound waves around the enemy. After hitting an enemy they slow down and fade. The sound waves ignore NPC immunity frames,

name: Stratus Sphere
description: The Stratus Sphere is a craftable post-Moon Lord magic weapon. When used, it fires a massive planetary stratus orb that can pass through tiles. The orb eventually slows down to a stop, then begins releasing sets of 6 crescent blades from itself that function similarly to boomerangs. The orb releases 5 sets of blades before fading away. Up to 6 stratus orbs can be active at a time. Its best modifier is Mythical. The name is a pun on the word "stratosphere", a major layer of the Earth's atmosphere

name: Guidelight of Oblivion
description: The Guidelight of Oblivion is a post-Moon Lord sentry dropped by Signus, Envoy of the Devourer in Malice Mode. It summons a soul lantern that floats up and down near the location it was summoned. The lantern summons red flames around it which home in on enemies, travel through tiles, and explode upon contact, inflicting the Brimstone Flames debuff for three seconds. name: Primrose Keepsake
description: The Primrose Keepsake is a craftable pet summoning item combining Bear's Eye and the Romajeda Orchid, allowing both pets to be summoned at once. It summons a guardian angel cat named Bear, and a dog named Kendra to follow the player. If the player is moving too fast, Bear will use blue angel wings to fly towards the player, and Kendra will use black dragon wings to fly towards them. This item originated due to people in the community having difficulties deciding whether they would use Bear or Ke

name: Burning Strife
description: The Burning Strife is a Hardmode non-consumable rogue spiky ball that is dropped by Goblin Summoners. It throws a gravity-affected shadowflame spiky ball that bounces off of solid blocks. Upon contact with an enemy, the spiky ball will explode and inflict the Shadowflame debuff to all nearby enemies, as well as dealing 33% damage to them. name: Recitation of the Beast
description: The Recitation of the Beast is a craftable post-Moon Lord spell tome that is a direct upgrade to the Demon Scythe. It causes a ring of six homing Beast Scythes to appear around the player that then fly off in the direction of the player's cursor. Beast Scythes inflict several debuffs: On Fire! (3 seconds) Shadowflame (33.33% chance for 5 seconds) Brimstone Flames (33.33% chance for 5 seconds) Frostburn (33.33% chance for 5 seconds) Exactly one of Shadowflame, Brimstone Flames or Frostburn will b

name: Tesla Potion
description: The Tesla Potion is a craftable Pre-Hardmode buff potion. Upon consumption, it grants the player the Tesla's Electricity buff which spawns an electric aura around the player, dealing 15 typeless damage, inflicting the Electrified debuff as well as the Galvanic Corrosion debuff which freezes enemies, with a lesser effect on bosses. Critters and other passive NPCs are unaffected. This is a list of NPCs immune to the Galvanic Corrosion debuff. Just like the Inferno Potion, the Tesla Potion's aura i

name: Gravistar Sabaton
description: The Gravistar Sabaton is an Expert Mode-exclusive Hardmode accessory dropped by Astrum Aureus. If equipped, when the ▼ Down key is pressed while in mid-air, it increases the player's fall speed for 5 seconds, allowing them to create an astral explosion upon hitting the ground, dealing 50 rogue damage to nearby enemies and inflicting the Astral Infection debuff. This effect has an 8 second cooldown. The explosion is very good at mapping out uncharted underground areas. A sabaton, historically, wa

name: Alpha Virus
description: The Alpha Virus is a craftable post-Moon Lord rogue weapon. It fires a large plague cell that has a lethal aura, dealing damage to every enemy that enters its radius. It slowly fades as it flies and splits into six plague seekers on contact with tiles. Performing a stealth strike with the Alpha Virus will result in the projectile moving more slowly and allowing plague seekers to accumulate around it as it flies. Its best modifier is Flawless. This weapon does not benefit from the effects of the

name: Plague Reaper armor
description: Not to be confused with Plaguebringer armor, a Hardmode armor set based on the summoner class. Plague Reaper armor is a Hardmode armor set that is an upgrade to the Necro armor. It requires an entire Necro armor set along with 65 Plague Cell Canisters and 47 Nanites to craft the entire set. The armor mainly grants bonuses to the ranged class. If the entire set is visible (regardless of whether it is equipped or in social slots), the wearer will have a faint pulsing aura. It consists of a Plague

name: Blood Rune
description: Not to be confused with Blood Relic, the summoning item for the Blood Moon. Blood Runes are post-Moon Lord ammunition that can be bought from the Archmage for 1 while the Ice Barrage is in the player's inventory. They are consumed by the Ice Barrage as ammunition. Blood Runes are a reference to Runescape.

name: Sulphurous armor
description: Sulphurous armor is a craftable Pre-Hardmode armor set. It requires 95 Urchin Stingers and 45 Acidwood, 45 Sulphuric Scales, and 45 Sulphurous Sand to craft the entire set. The armor mainly grants bonuses to the Rogue class. It consists of a Sulphurous Helmet, Sulphurous Breastplate, and Sulphurous Leggings. The full set grants the following stats and bonuses (this includes the set bonus): 16 defense 12% increased rogue damage 7% increased rogue critical strike chance Underwater breathing identi

name: Squirrel Squire Staff
description: The Squirrel Squire Staff is a craftable Pre-Hardmode summon weapon that is also obtainable from the Starter Bag. When used, it summons a squirrel minion. The squirrel walks along the ground nearby the player and attack enemies by throwing acorns that pierce once. The squirrel will accelerate towards the player with a propeller when it is far away from the player, allowing it to fly at very high speeds but stopping its attacks. Its best modifier is Mythical. While Ruthless may seem to provide a

name: Deific Thunderbolt
description: The Deific Thunderbolt is a craftable post-Moon Lord dagger that is an upgrade to the Stormfront Razor. It automatically throws a gravity-defying lightning bolt that does not pierce and travels faster while raining. When it hits an enemy, lightning strikes vertically from the sky which pierces indefinitely. Performing a stealth strike with the Deific Thunderbolt will cause the next lightning bolt thrown to summon five strikes of lightning, in addition to the main bolt travelling much faster. Its

name: Brimstone Jewel
description: The Brimstone Jewel is a pet summoning item dropped by Supreme Calamitas in Expert Mode. It summons a miniature Supreme Calamitas to follow the player. The pet's design is based on the eye-like appearance that Supreme Calamitas used in previous versions of the mod.

name: Prideful Hunter's Planar Ripper
description: The Prideful Hunter's Planar Ripper is a craftable post-Moon Lord gun. It automatically rapidly fires bullets. Musket balls turn into fast lightning bolts which do not pierce enemies or tiles, inflict the Electrified debuff, and explode when enemies are killed. Every fourth lightning bolt deals 35% more damage and in addition, critical strikes from the lightning bolts will grant a minor boost to movement speed and acceleration up to a maximum of 20%. The movement speed boost is reset if the play

name: Abandoned Slime Staff
description: The Abandoned Slime Staff is a Hardmode summon weapon that is dropped by Astral Slimes after Astrum Aureus is defeated. When used, it summons a rocky Astral Jelly slime minion, which bounces near the player and fires lasers at nearby enemies. If the player strays too far away from the slime, it will equip an armored jetpack and fly to catch up with them. When the slime is summoned, it will immediately occupy all of the player's remaining minion slots. For each minion slot it occupies, its damage

name: Ancient God Slayer armor
description: Ancient God Slayer armor is a post-Moon Lord vanity set which consists of the Ancient God Slayer Helm, Ancient God Slayer Chestplate and Ancient God Slayer Leggings. The set is collectively dropped from the Sentinels of the Devourer at a 5% chance. Unlike the other similar Ancient armor sets from vanilla Terraria, this armor set gives no benefits and is intended purely for vanity. The Ancient God Slayer vanity set is based off of an older sprite for the God Slayer armor set.

name: Sulphurous Sand Wall
description: Sulphurous Sand Walls are background walls crafted from Sulphurous Sand.

name: Sulphurous Sandstone
description: Sulphurous Sandstone is a Pre-Hardmode block that can be found in the Sulphurous Sea biome, which spawns upon world generation. It composes most of the lower portion of the biome. It also can be obtained by opening Abyssal Crates.

name: Sulphurous Sandstone Wall
description: Sulphurous Sandstone Walls are background walls crafted from Sulphurous Sandstone.

name: Belladonna Spirit Staff
description: The Belladonna Spirit Staff is a craftable Pre-Hardmode summon weapon. When used, it summons a flying forest spirit minion. The spirit can pass through walls to reach its target, and rapidly throws a tight spread of three gravity-affected petals towards its targets, inflicting the Poisoned debuff. Every ninth attack, it additionally fires a large and even spread of five petals into the air. Its best modifier is Mythical. While Ruthless may seem to provide a bigger damage by percentages, rounding

name: Stormjaw Staff
description: The Stormjaw Staff is a Pre-Hardmode summon weapon that drops from Stormlions. When used, it summons a miniature Stormlion minion. It runs on the ground and aggressively rams enemies back and forth, does not deal contact damage but creates damaging sparks in contact with enemies. Sparks linger for 2 seconds and partially ignore immunity frames, in a similar manner to the Amidias' Spark. Its best modifier is Mythical. While Ruthless may seem to provide a bigger damage by percentages, rounding rev

name: Frost Blossom Staff
description: The Frost Blossom Staff is a craftable Pre-Hardmode summon weapon. When used, it summons a frozen flower minion above the player’s head which shoots frost beams towards a nearby enemy. The beam creates a small explosion in the shape of a flower with three, four, or five leaves in a randomized manner, all of which deals one-third of the weapon’s damage. Unlike most minions, only one Frost Blossom can be summoned. Its best modifier is Mythical. While Ruthless may seem to provide a bigger damage by

name: Snow Ruffian armor
description: Snow Ruffian armor is a craftable Pre-Hardmode rogue armor set. It requires 60 Snow Blocks, 30 Ice Blocks, and 90 Boreal Wood to craft the entire set. It consists of a Snow Ruffian Mask, Snow Ruffian Chestplate, and Snow Ruffian Greaves. The full set grants the following stats and bonuses (this includes the set bonus): 4 defense 7% increased rogue damage 3% increased rogue critical strike chance 5% increased movement speed The player can glide by holding the ↷ Jump key, which negates fall damage

name: Scuttler's Jewel
description: The Scuttler's Jewel is a Pre-Hardmode accessory that drops from Gemstone Crawlers. While equipped, rogue javelin projectiles have a 33.33% chance to break into stationary floating jewel spikes that deal 15 rogue damage.

name: Sulphuric Scale
description: Sulphuric Scales are Pre-Hardmode crafting materials that drop from various enemies in the Acid Rain event after the Eye of Cthulhu has been defeated. They are used to craft several weapons themed around the Acid Rain, as well as the Sulphurous armor. 1-3 Sulphuric Scales can additionally be obtained from Abyssal Crates at a 10% drop chance after completing Tier 1 Acid Rain.

name: Pristine Fury
description: The Pristine Fury is a post-Moon Lord Legendary flamethrower that drops from Providence, the Profaned Goddess in Malice Mode. When used with its primary fire (left-click), it will rapidly fire a string of five flame helices that do not pierce but will create a small explosion and form a visual pillar of flame dust. When used with its secondary fire (right-click), it will rapidly fire a set of four fiery dust clouds that decelerate to a complete stop and linger for a short while before dissipatin

name: Starbuster Core
description: The Starbuster Core is a Hardmode accessory dropped by Stellar Culex once Astrum Aureus has been defeated. While equipped the player gains +1 minion slots and all minion attacks spawn a small astral explosion on enemy hits with a one-second cooldown, dealing 40 summon damage. This accessory can also be obtained from the Astral Crate after Astrum Aureus has been defeated. The explosion effect is identical to that of the Star-Tainted Generator, will be overridden by the Nucleogenesis's sparks, and

name: Basher
description: The Basher is a craftable Pre-Hardmode true melee broadsword with autoswing. On hit, it inflicts the Irradiated debuff onto enemies. Its best modifier is Legendary.

name: Toxibow
description: The Toxibow is a craftable Pre-Hardmode bow. When Wooden Arrows are used as ammo, it fires toxic arrows that emit a tiny explosion upon contact with tiles or enemies, dealing an additional 50% of the weapon’s damage and has a small chance to inflict the Sulphuric Poisoning debuff. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Acid Gun
description: The Acid Gun is a craftable Pre-Hardmode magic gun. It fires an even spread of three acid streams which dissipate upon contact with tiles or after piercing three enemies. Its best modifier is Mythical. The Acid Gun is extremely effective on clusters of enemies and on worm-type enemies that have lots of segments like the Eater of Worlds.

name: Caustic Croaker Staff
description: Not to be confused with Caustic Staff, a Hardmode minion-summoning weapon. The Caustic Croaker Staff is a craftable Pre-Hardmode sentry. It summons a miniature white Nuclear Toad sentry that stays on the ground. It attacks enemies by exploding itself into nine damaging chunks. Its best modifier is Demonic, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers that affect it. The Nuclear Toad sentry is named 'A not frog of the explosive variety'. In the mod's source files, the sentry is

name: Contaminated Bile
description: The Contaminated Bile is a craftable Pre-Hardmode bomb. It fires small toxic flasks that explode on contact with tiles or enemies, dealing 75% of the weapon’s damage and lingering for a short time. Performing a stealth strike with the Contaminated Bile will cause the resulting flask to form a larger and longer-lasting explosion. Its best modifier is Flawless. Bile is a bitter greenish-brown alkaline fluid produced by the liver that aids in digestion.

name: Nuclear Rod
description: The Nuclear Rod is a Hardmode accessory that drops from the Cragmaw Mire mini boss. While equipped, minions spawn shortly-lingering irradiated dust clouds on enemy hits with a one-second cooldown, dealing 20 summon damage, and inflicting the Irradiated debuff. It also grants one additional minion slot. The aura effect will override the spawn of Jelly-Charged Battery's orbs, and will be overridden by Starbuster Core's explosion and Nucleogenesis's sparks. This accessory can also be obtained from

name: Star-Tainted Generator
description: The Star-Tainted Generator is a craftable Hardmode accessory that functions as a direct upgrade to the Jelly-Charged Battery, Nuclear Rod, and the Starbuster Core. While equipped the player gains +2 minion slots, which doesn't stack with downgrades, and 7% increased minion damage. In addition to this, all minion attacks spawn a small astral explosion on enemy hits with a one-second cooldown, dealing 40 summon damage, and all minions will inflict the Electrified, Astral Infection, and Irradiated

name: Nucleogenesis
description: Nucleogenesis is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory that is the direct upgrade to the Star-Tainted Generator and Statis' Curse. While equipped, the player gains +4 minion slots, which doesn't stack with downgrades, 15% increased minion damage, and all minion knockback is increased by 4. All minion attacks spawn a damaging spark on enemy hits with a cooldown of 1.67 seconds, dealing 60 summon damage. While equipped, all minions will inflict the following debuffs: Electrified for 1 second. Tempo

name: Vile Feeder
description: The Vile Feeder is a craftable Pre-Hardmode summon weapon. When used, it summons a tiny Eater of Souls minion, which flies around and latches onto nearby enemies. When latched, it does not deal contact damage to enemies but releases several homing tiny eaters similar to the Scourge of the Corruptor. It is the Corruption counterpart to the Scab Ripper. Its best modifier is Mythical. While Ruthless may seem to provide a bigger damage by percentages, rounding reveals that Mythical and Ruthless boos

name: Scab Ripper
description: The Scab Ripper is a craftable Pre-Hardmode summon weapon. When used, it summons a tiny Blood Crawler minion, which flies around and latches onto nearby enemies. When latched, it deals contact damage in addition to causing damaging blood particles to rain from the sky. It is the Crimson counterpart to the Vile Feeder. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Addi

name: Cinder Blossom Staff
description: The Cinder Blossom Staff is a craftable Pre-Hardmode summon weapon. When used, it summons a fiery flower minion above the player’s head which shoots a volley of three flaming cinders above a nearby enemy. The cinders are able to linger on the ground for a short time. Unlike most minions, only one Cinder Blossom can be summoned. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting mi

name: Staff of Necrosteocytes
description: The Staff of Necrosteocytes is a Pre-Hardmode summon weapon that drops from Dark Casters. When used, it summons a small skeleton minion which runs along the ground to target nearby enemies. While it is moving, lingering bone cells are occasionally dropped from the skeleton. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits.

name: Haunted Scroll
description: The Haunted Scroll is a craftable Hardmode summon weapon. When used, it summons a stack of three haunted dishes which runs along the ground. It does not deal contact damage, but rapidly throws high velocity dishes at nearby enemies. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Haun

name: Enchanted Butterfly
description: The Enchanted Butterfly is a craftable Hardmode light pet summoning item. It summons a tiny dragonfly pet to follow the player and provide a small amount of light. It will actively fly towards butterflies to consume them. It additionally will fly towards nearby items, which will be placed in the player's inventory. When the player is below 75 percent health, the dragonfly turns blue, and when the player is below 50 percent health, the dragonfly turns green. The pet itself is based on a character

name: Cold Divinity
description: The Cold Divinity is a Hardmode Legendary summon weapon that drops from Cryogen in Malice Mode. When used with its primary fire (left-click), it will first encase the player with an icy shield that provides heat and cold immunity in Death Mode, with subsequent uses adding one shield spike around it at the cost of a single minion slot. It does not cost minion slots to summon the first time, but the ice shield will not be summoned if all your minion slots are occupied. Each summoned shield spike w

name: Dormant Brimseeker
description: The Dormant Brimseeker is a Hardmode summon weapon that has a 25% chance (33.33% in Expert Mode) to drop from the Brimstone Elemental. When used, it summons a Brimseeker that charges towards enemies in a straight line, dealing damage and inflicting the Brimstone Flames debuff to hit enemies. When used while all minion slots are exhausted, it instead launches a Dormant Brimseeker towards the cursor that emits a large aura of brimstone after stopping. This aura emits swirling brimstone fireballs t

name: Caustic Tear
description: Not to be confused with Torrential Tear, which is used to toggle the Rain event. The Caustic Tear is a Pre-Hardmode item used to summon the Acid Rain event. A non-consumable version can also be crafted. Using this non-consumable variant while the Acid Rain is currently active will prematurely end the event. The consumable variant can also be purchased from the Sea King for 3 after any tier of the Acid Rain has been defeated.

name: Corroded Fossil
description: Corroded Fossils are Hardmode crafting materials that drop from various enemies in the Acid Rain event after the Aquatic Scourge has been defeated, as well as some post-Aquatic Scourge Sulphurous Sea enemies. They are used to craft several weapons themed around the Acid Rain. 1-3 Corroded Fossils can additionally be obtained from Abyssal Crates at a 10% drop chance after completing Tier 2 Acid Rain.

name: Bonebreaker
description: The Bonebreaker is a craftable Hardmode melee weapon that is an upgrade to Bone Javelins. It fires javelins that stick to enemies for a long time, then bursting into damaging rocky shrapnels. Up to six javelin projectiles can be stuck on an enemy at once, totalling 120 damage per second from the Venom and Penetrated debuffs. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size.

name: Miasma
description: The Miasma is a craftable Hardmode wand. It fires a random spread of three to five fast gas cloud projectiles that slows down every time they hit an enemy, until it reaches a stop. After being stationary for a short time, the clouds decay into dust and disappear. Clouds can pierce up to nine enemies and also inflict the Irradiated debuff. Its best modifier is Mythical. A miasma is a highly unpleasant or unhealthy smell or vapor.

name: Acidic Rain Barrel
description: The Acidic Rain Barrel is a craftable Hardmode bomb that is an upgrade to the Blast Barrel. It throws a barrel that rolls across the ground that pierces through all enemies it comes into contact with until it either despawns or hits a wall. Hitting a wall causes the barrel to erupt into shrapnel and acidic raindrops. Performing a stealth strike with the Acidic Rain Barrel causes the resulting barrel to be able to bounce off walls up to a total of three times, and also causes more shrapnels and r

name: Bloodworm
description: The Bloodworm is a critter found in the Sulphurous Sea. They can be caught with a Bug Net or Golden Bug Net. Bloodworms act identically to Truffle Worms, slowly crawling along the floor and burrowing away from the player when they get too close to it. Also like Truffle Worms, Bloodworms cannot be used in normal fishing; instead, they are used to summon The Old Duke while fishing in the Sulphurous Sea. Bloodworms can also be purchased from the Sea King for 2 after The Old Duke has been defeated.

name: Corrosive Spine
description: The Corrosive Spine is a Hardmode accessory that drops from the Aquatic Scourge. It increases defense by 4 and movement speed by 10%. It additionally causes all rogue weapons to inflict the Venom debuff and occasionally release green toxic clouds in random directions. For stealth strikes, this effect only triggers for the first five enemies hit. The clouds are also released from the player while their immunity frames are active.

name: Flak Toxicannon
description: The Flak Toxicannon is a Hardmode ranged weapon that drops from Flak Crabs. When used, it fires sulphur cross blasts that explode after traveling a short distance or after contacting a block or enemy. When a sulphur cross explodes, it releases up to three acid rain droplets that damage enemies. Attempting to fire this weapon to the side or below will cause the Flak Toxicannon to not fire at all. Unlike most ranged weapons, the Flak Toxicannon does not require ammo to fire. Its best modifier is U

name: Baby Flak Crab
description: The Baby Flak Crab is a Hardmode critter found within the Sulphurous Sea biome after the Aquatic Scourge has been defeated. Similarly to its adult counterpart, it disguises itself as a geyser. If the player gets too close to one, it will reveal itself and run away until they are far enough from the player. Baby Flak Crabs can be caught with a Bug Net or Golden Bug Net, and will rarely drop the Geyser Shell when captured. The Baby Flak Crab along with the pet version are both inspired by a submis

name: Cosmic Viper Engine
description: The Cosmic Viper Engine is a craftable post-Moon Lord summon weapon that is an upgrade to the Tactical Plague Engine. It summons a Cosmic Gunship that fires the following projectiles: Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Cosmic Viper Engine has over a Ruthless one is knockb

name: Belching Saxophone
description: The Belching Saxophone is a Hardmode magic weapon that drops from Belching Corals. When used, it fires two volleys of projectiles, including a dirty reed and one of two possible additional projectiles with varying effects. Its best modifier is Mythical. This weapon can also be obtained from the Abyssal Crate after completing Tier 2 Acid Rain. The Belching Saxophone originated from a joke about one of Belching Coral's gores resembling a Saxophone. "Doot" commonly refers to the sound that brass in

name: Slithering Eels
description: The Slithering Eels is a Hardmode spell tome that drops from Acid Eels after defeating the Aquatic Scourge. It fires magical Acid Eels that roughly follow the cursor around, trailing acid droplets up to five times before it disappears. The eels can also freely move through blocks and pierce infinitely, with each enemy hit reducing the lifespan of the eel. Its best modifier is Mythical. This weapon can also be obtained from the Abyssal Crate after completing Tier 2 Acid Rain.

name: Orthocera Shell
description: The Orthocera Shell is a Hardmode sentry that drops from Orthoceras. It summons a stationary flying Orthocera sentry that shoots streams of acid at nearby enemies. The acid streams pierce up to two enemies along with inflicting the Venom debuff. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a

name: Skyfin Bombers
description: The Skyfin Bombers is a Hardmode bomb that drops from Skyfins after defeating the Aquatic Scourge. It throws Skyfin bombs that only seek towards enemies that are below them, erupting into three sulphuric clouds on impact. Performing a stealth strike with the Skyfin Bombers causes three nukes to be thrown instead of one. The nukes will home regardless of position and will cause a massive irradiated aura on hits. Its best modifier is Flawless. This weapon can also be obtained from the Abyssal Crat

name: Spent Fuel Container
description: The Spent Fuel Container is a Hardmode bomb that drops from the Cragmaw Mire mini boss. When used, a gravity-affected flask is thrown, which erupts into a nuclear explosion on impact and inflicting the Irradiated debuff. The explosion does not occur if no tiles are below it. Performing a stealth strike with the Spent Fuel Container causes the resulting flask to erupt into a lingering Irradiated explosion that persists after the nuclear explosion disappears and rapidly hits enemies. Its best modi

name: Geyser Shell
description: The Geyser Shell is a Hardmode pet summoning item that has a chance to drop from Baby Flak Crabs when hit with a Bug Net or Golden Bug Net. It summons a pet Flak Hermit that is undisguised and runs along the ground, but will disguise itself once the player idles for too long. If the player moves too fast, it will curl up around itself to fly towards the player.

name: Hallowed Rune
description: The Hallowed Rune is a craftable Hardmode accessory and the upgrade of the Spirit Glyph. While equipped, whenever a minion hits an enemy, the player will gain one of the following buffs: Hallowed Power, which increases minion damage by 10%. Additionally, while this buff is active, a hallowed star rains from the sky on hit which deals 30 summon damage. This effect has a 3-second cooldown. Hallowed Defense, which increases defense by 8 and damage reduction by 4%. Hallowed Regen, which grants +3 li

name: Fathom Swarmer armor
description: Fathom Swarmer armor is a Hardmode armor set that is an upgrade to the Spider armor. It requires an entire Spider armor set, 26 Victide Bars, 24 Planty Mush, 44 Abyss Gravel, and 12 Depth Cells to craft the entire set. The armor mainly grants bonuses to the summoner class. It consists of a Fathom Swarmer Visage, Fathom Swarmer Breastplate, and Fathom Swarmer Greaves. The full set grants the following stats and bonuses (this includes the set bonus): 47 defense 12% increased damage reduction 25% i

name: Igneous Exaltation
description: The Igneous Exaltation is a craftable Hardmode summon weapon. When used with left-click, it summons an Igneous blade that orbits around the player, damaging enemies that come to contact with it. Pressing right-click will force all blades orbiting the player to charge towards the position of the cursor and piercing up to three enemies in its path, causing three smaller blades to rain down per hit. The Igneous blades will not re-orbit after being launched and will despawn shortly after. Unlike mos

name: Brimflame armor
description: Brimflame armor is a Hardmode armor set. It requires 45 Ashes of Calamity, 9 Unholy Cores, and an Obsidian Rose to craft the entire set. The armor mainly grants bonuses to the mage class. If the full set is visible (whether equipped or in social slots), the player will have a tiny pulsating aura around them. It consists of a Brimflame Cowl, Brimflame Robes, and Brimflame Boots. The full set grants the following stats and bonuses (this includes the set bonus): 41 defense 30% increased magic damag

name: Infected Remote
description: The Infected Remote is a Hardmode summon weapon that drops from The Plaguebringer Goliath. It summons Virili, the Plague Princess, who floats by the player and attacks enemies with various attacks set in the following pattern: Distances herself away from an enemy and launches up to six plague nukes that create a small explosion on enemy hits. Summons several miniature Plaguebringers and tiny plagued bees around her. Plagued bees home in towards the enemy similarly to normal friendly bees, while

name: Tactical Plague Engine
description: The Tactical Plague Engine is a craftable post-Moon Lord summon weapon. When used, it summons a Plague Jet minion that fires and consumes bullets. It will attempt to fire from above, and will occasionally fire homing missiles instead of bullets, which inflict the Plague debuff and deal 150% of the weapon's base damage. Additionally, it will always align itself horizontally when idle. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primari

name: Fuel Cell Bundle
description: The Fuel Cell Bundle is a Hardmode summon weapon that drops from The Plaguebringer Goliath. When used, it throws a small gravity-affected flask that deals no contact damage, but summons a small and armed miniature Plaguebringer minion upon tile contact. Plaguebringer minions stay at a certain distance from enemies to rapidly fires explosive missiles that inflict the Plague debuff. Occasionally, a homing variant of the explosive plague missile is fired. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical

name: Dazzling Stabber Staff
description: The Dazzling Stabber Staff is a post-Moon Lord summon weapon that drops from Providence, the Profaned Goddess. It summons Holy Blade minions that rally in a cone-formation above the player’s head. When enemies are nearby, the blades will dash into enemies and move in an ellipse between hits while leaving behind a purely visual glowing trail. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than th

name: Blood Boiler
description: The Blood Boiler is a craftable post-Moon Lord flamethrower. It fires a long and continuous stream of three bloodfire. Each use has a 25% chance to subtract 1 health from the player. The fire returns to the player after 2.67 seconds and has a 33.33% chance to heal them for 1 health each. If the flame hits an enemy, the player has a 50% chance to gain 1-3 health. Its best modifier is Unreal. If the player is killed by the Blood Boiler's self-damage, the death messages "<PlayerName> suffered from

name: Dragonblood Disgorger
description: The Dragonblood Disgorger is a craftable post-Moon Lord summon weapon. It summons a large dragon minion accompanied by her two children. The main dragon wanders around and breathes bloodfire at nearby enemies, while the children spit healing blood shots and charge violently. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits.

name: Endo Hydra Staff
description: The Endo Hydra Staff is a craftable post-Moon Lord summon weapon that is an upgrade to the Staff of the Frost Hydra. It summons a single-headed Endo Hydra at the back of the player, with each resummon consuming one additional minion slot for an extra head. The Endo Hydra itself stays at the back of the player, while the heads fire beams at nearby enemies. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon

name: Corvid Harbinger Staff
description: The Corvid Harbinger Staff is a craftable post-Moon Lord summon weapon that is an upgrade to the Raven Staff. It summons a dark raven minion that flies around and rapidly charges towards enemies, occasionally teleporting near them and leaving a ring of dust before continuing its charge. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal cr

name: Cadaverous Carrion
description: The Cadaverous Carrion is a post-Moon Lord sentry that drops from The Old Duke. It summons a grounded Old Duke head sentry, the sentry rapidly fires homing Sulphurous Sharknadoes at nearby enemies. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only lasting advantage a Mythical Cadaverous Carrion has over a Ruthless

name: Anthozoan Crab
description: The Anthozoan Crab is a Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Sulphurous Sea after the Aquatic Scourge has been defeated. It attacks by quickly running at the player and occasionally stopping to throw rocks at the player. It will leap backwards when the player gets too close to it. It is one of the only sources of Corroded Fossils outside of the Acid Rain Event. Anthozoa refers to a class of marine invertebrates (animals without backbones) that includes sea anemones and corals.

name: Belching Coral
description: The Belching Coral is a Hardmode enemy that spawns in the Sulphurous Sea after the Aquatic Scourge has been defeated. It is stationary, and will fire Sulphurous Spikes toward the player if they are nearby. It is one of the only sources of Corroded Fossils outside of the Acid Rain Event.

name: Hadal Mantle
description: The Hadal Mantle is a Hardmode wing-type accessory that allows the player to fly and glide. If these wings are worn along with Hydrothermic armor with any Hydrothermic headpiece, the player's damage is increased by 5%. The Hadal Mantle was previously known as the "Discordian Wings".

name: Old Duke's Scales
description: The Old Duke’s Scales are a post-Moon Lord accessory that drop from The Old Duke. While equipped the player gains immunity to the Poisoned, Venom, and Sulphuric Poisoning debuffs. Additionally, the player gains 10% increased damage and 5% increased critical strike chance while under the effects of a damaging debuff. If the player has lost 25% of their health, they will gain 6% increased damage and 3% increased critical strike chance. This effect can occur three times, maxing out at 18% increased

name: Skyfin
description: The Skyfin is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns during the Acid Rain event. They commonly form schools when underwater, and can leap out of the water to attack the player, flopping around when on land. After being on land for long enough or having leaped out of the water enough times, they will also begin flying to attack the player, passing through tiles.

name: Nuclear Terror
description: The Nuclear Terror is a post-Moon Lord, post-Polterghast mini boss that spawns during Acid Rain during Tier 3. It has 3 special attacks and 2 other attacks which it uses when not using the special attacks. The three special attacks are as follows: Fires 3-shot bursts of small nuclear bullets at the player, which will return to their firing position shortly after being fired. Fires a barrage of larger nuclear bullets at the player. Fires two converging streams of large nuclear bullets to trap the

name: The Old Duke
description: "The mutant terror of the seas was not alone..." The Old Duke is a post-Moon Lord boss that can be fought in the Sulphurous Sea biome at any point in the game, but is intended to be fought after defeating Polterghast. The Old Duke can be spawned by finishing the Acid Rain event after Polterghast is defeated, appearing from a giant sulphurous tornado. It can also be summoned by fishing in the Sulphurous Sea with a Bloodworm. The Old Duke behaves similarly to Duke Fishron at its core, though most

name: Cragmaw Mire
description: The Cragmaw Mire is a Hardmode, post-Aquatic Scourge mini boss that spawns during the Acid Rain event. They spawn on the Sulphurous Sea floor and cannot move. The Cragmaw Mire is gravity-affected and completely stationary enemy. It randomly spawns enemies around nearby liquid and cycles between two attacks every 7 seconds. For 4 seconds, it fires acid bubbles consistently which float upwards, splitting into four crosses after 2-3 seconds or upon tile collision once fully materialized. Crosses ex

name: Gamma Slime
description: The Gamma Slime is a post-Moon Lord slime that spawns during tier 3 of the Acid Rain event. It behaves like a normal slime but will shoot 5 Gamma Acids out in a star pattern while it is jumping. Occasionally, it will stop jumping and charge up a laser and fire it upwards. It replaces the Irradiated Slime once Polterghast is defeated. Uniquely among slimes, they do not float in water, and instead sink to the bottom.

name: Orthocera
description: The Orthocera is a Hardmode aquatic enemy that spawns during tiers 2 and 3 of the Acid Rain event. It floats through water, charging at the player when possible, flops on the surface and fires streams of acid. Orthoceras is an extinct genus of nautiloid cephalopods that lived during the Middle Ordovician period.

name: Silva Wings
description: Silva Wings are a post-Moon Lord wing-type accessory that allow the player to fly and glide. If these wings are worn along with Silva armor with any Silva headpiece, the player will be healed to 50% of their max life when the Silva revive procs.

name: Fetid Emesis
description: The Fetid Emesis is a post-Moon Lord gun that is dropped by The Old Duke. It rapidly fires bullets and has a small chance of firing a slow-moving rotten chunk that sticks to enemies, damaging them and inflicting the Sulphuric Poisoning debuff. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Temporal Umbrella
description: The Temporal Umbrella is a craftable Post-Moon Lord summon weapon that is the direct upgrade of Saros Possession and the final upgrade to the Sun Spirit Staff. It summons up to only one Magic Hat minion which summons elemental sniper rifles, axes, bats, hammers, umbrellas, and birds to attack nearby enemies. It requires 5 minion slots to use. The Temporal Umbrella's various projectiles can inflict a variety of debuffs. They are listed below: Elemental Axes inflict Elemental Mix for 2 seconds. Bu

name: Vitriolic Viper
description: The Vitriolic Viper is a post-Moon Lord wand that drops from The Old Duke. It rapidly fires a tight spread of nine venomous spits followed by five venomous fangs. The spits move faster but do not pierce, while the fangs move slower and pierce up to three enemies. Both projectiles are capable of inflicting the Sulphuric Poisoning debuff. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Toxicant Twister
description: The Toxicant Twister is a post-Moon Lord boomerang that drops from The Old Duke. It throws a fast boomerang that homes in after a short time, piercing all tiles and enemies. It only deals one-third damage before it begins homing. Performing a stealth strike with the Toxicant Twister causes the resulting boomerang to release dust blasts in their path. Its best modifier is Flawless.

name: Mutated Truffle
description: Not to be confused with Shrimpy Truffle, a vanilla mount-summoning item. The Mutated Truffle is an Expert Mode-exclusive, post-Moon Lord accessory dropped by The Old Duke. It summons a miniature Old Duke minion to attack nearby enemies by ramming into them, dealing 1200 base summon damage. The mini Old Duke will enrage when the player is below 50% of their health, moving and ramming at a much higher speed, also indicated by the mini Old Duke's eyes turning yellow. The miniature Old Duke minion i

name: Midnight Sun Beacon
description: The Midnight Sun Beacon is a craftable post-Moon Lord summon weapon that is the direct upgrade to the Xeno Staff and the Lunar Portal Staff. When used it throws out a Midnight Sun Beacon that summons a Midnight Sun UFO after a few seconds. The Midnight Sun UFO will track an enemy and fire small lasers towards them. After a few seconds of consecutively firing, it will circle above an enemy and fire a concentrated laser beam thats length is determined by the size of the enemy it's targeting. After

name: Saros Possession
description: Saros Possession is a craftable post-Moon Lord summon weapon and the direct upgrade to Sirius. It summons a spinning radiant aura around the player that fires two homing flares towards enemies. Homing radiant orbs will occasionally be summoned from a random position near the aura, alongside a wave of three flares. Summoning the Saros Possession will consume all remaining minion slots, with the number of slots consumed increasing the damage of both the flares and the radiant orbs. Its best modifi

name: Profaned Soul Crystal
description: "The Profaned Goddess has recognised your devotion to purity!" The Profaned Soul Crystal is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory that is also dropped by Providence, the Profaned Goddess if the player defeats her in Expert Mode using only the Profaned Soul Artifact and optionally Golden Gun. The Profaned Soul Crystal has two distinct states dependent on whether or not the Exo Mechs and Supreme Calamitas have been defeated in the world. Before defeating them, the accessory is entirely vanity. Afte

name: Sulphurous Grabber
description: The Sulphurous Grabber is a Hardmode yoyo that drops from Sulphurous Skaters. While it is thrown, the yoyo will occasionally release seven damaging bubbles that can be either green or purple. The bubbles deal 25% of the yoyo's damage. If the yoyo touches a green bubble, it will power up, gaining increased damage and releasing bubbles more often. Only the yoyo can inflict the Irradiated debuff. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. This weapon can also be obtained

name: Nuclear Toad
description: The Nuclear Toad is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns during the Acid Rain event. They are stationary, and when near the player will explode into goo. The explosion radius depends on what tier of the Acid Rain event the player is currently on. The radius is roughly 12 blocks for Tier 1, 18.5 blocks for Tier 2 and 29 blocks for Tier 3. The Nuclear Toad's throat glows a bright lime-green color during the Acid Rain event.

name: Acid Eel
description: The Acid Eel is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns during the Acid Rain event. They patrol the sea’s shallow waters and charge horizontally into the player in high speeds, however they are stationary on land.

name: Trilobite
description: The Trilobite is a Hardmode enemy that spawns during tiers 2 and 3 of the Acid Rain event. They are a shelled creature, rolling itself while submerged and flops on the surface. When hit by a projectile, they release a spike that deals damage. Trilobites are based off real-world Trilobites.

name: Acidwood
description: Acidwood is a Pre-Hardmode crafting material obtained by cutting down Acidwood Trees in the Sulphurous Sea biome. It is used to craft several weapons themed around the Acid Rain, as well as the Sulphurous armor. Acidwood can also be found in Abyssal Crates obtained by fishing in Sulphurous Sea biome. The Acidwood is considered to be a part of the Any Wood recipe group, and therefore can also be used in recipes requiring wood.

name: Water Leech
description: The Water Leech is a Pre-Hardmode enemy that spawns during the Acid Rain event. It is fairly common and accelerates toward the player while they are submerged and sticking on them. It does not deal contact damage but it will constantly inflict the Bleeding debuff along with the Heavy Bleeding debuff, which reduces player's health by 3 per second in Tier 1, 6 per second in Tier 2, and 12 per second in Tier 3. If the player is not submerged, Water Leeches become invincible and immobile.

name: Flak Crab
description: The Flak Crab is a Hardmode enemy that spawns during tiers 2 and 3 of the Acid Rain event. They disguise themselves as a geyser and will move around after taking damage. When disguised, it will shoot Flak Shots, which will inflict the Irradiated debuff. The enemy itself does not have any contact damage, only the Flak Shot damages the player. This enemy is a reference to the Hermit Crab enemy from Risk of Rain 2. The way Flak Crabs attack is a reference to the Aeroflak Cannon from Robocraft. The

name: Eternity
description: Eternity is a craftable post-Moon Lord developer spell tome. When used, it will create a large circle, which inside will have five crystals, a beam, and a group of projectiles that create a flower shape while traveling, all of which will be centered around a nearby enemy. The beam will travel in an infinity shape. The crystals will circle the targeted enemy. The flower-shaped projectiles will also harm nearby enemies. If the attack button is held, the beam's path will slowly grow in size as the

name: Sulphurous Skater
description: The Sulphurous Skater is a Hardmode enemy that spawns during tiers 2 and 3 of the Acid Rain event. They move slowly on land and will jump around often. Sulphurous skaters will target Sulphurous Sea bubbles and upon latching onto them, they will gain the ability to fly around and chase the player. If the bubble is popped by the player, it will return to jumping around. The Sulphurous Skater was taken from a submission for a sulphurous sea design contest that was held on the Calamity art server. H

name: Pulse Rifle
description: The Pulse Rifle is a craftable post-Moon Lord ranged weapon. When fired, a large purple beam is fired that creates a small dust explosion when contacting a block or enemy. The beam will arc towards other nearby enemies once contacting an enemy. Additionally, if the target is Inorganic, 1/250 of the target's max health will be added to its damage. The weapon consumes 0.24 units of charge per use and has a maximum charge of 250. Its best modifier is Unreal. But the weapon's knockback will not be a

name: Heavy Laser Rifle
description: The Heavy Laser Rifle is a craftable post-Moon Lord ranged weapon. When used, two small orange beams are fired that each create a small dust explosion when contacting a block or enemy. The beam is incredibly accurate, although 20% of the target's defense is subtracted from its damage. The weapon consumes 0.125 units of charge per use and has a maximum charge of 190. Its best modifier is Unreal. The Heavy Laser Rifle cannot be crafted until the Encrypted Schematic from the Underworld Bio-center L

name: Gatling Laser
description: The Gatling Laser is a craftable Hardmode magic gun. When used, the gun has a short load period before a barrage of fast but inaccurate red lasers are fired at a massively rapid rate. The laser creates a tiny explosion on hit, inflicts the On Fire! debuff, but its damage is reduced by 20% of the target's defense. The weapon consumes 0.0075 units of charge for each frame the weapon is held (totaling 0.015 units of charge per use) and has a maximum charge of 135. Its best modifier is Mythical. But

name: Plasma Caster
description: The Plasma Caster is a craftable post-Moon Lord magic gun. When used with the primary fire (left-click), it slowly fires a plasma bolt that does not pierce and create a large explosion on hit. When used with the secondary fire (right-click), the bolts are fired three times faster, deal one third of the damage, cost one third as much mana, and have lower accuracy. Bolts are able to inflict the On Fire! and Cursed Inferno debuffs, and have their damage increased by one-third of an enemy's defense.

name: Tesla Cannon
description: The Tesla Cannon is a magic gun. When fired, a large light-blue beam is fired that creates a large dust explosion when contacting a block or enemy. The beam will arc towards other nearby enemies once contacting an enemy. Additionally, if the target is Organic, 1/250 (0.4%) of the target's max HP will be added to the damage of the beam. The weapon consumes 0.9 units of charge per use and has a maximum charge of 250. Its best modifier is Mythical. The Tesla Cannon cannot be crafted until the Encry

name: Rusty Chest
description: Rusty Chests are chests found only in the Sulphurous Sea that contains rare and unique items. Each Rusty Chest will contain one unique item along with other standard loot. The Rusty Chest always contains one primary item and a few common items. In previous versions of the mod, Rusty Chests were initially locked and required Rusty Lockpicks to unlock.

name: Rusty Beacon Prototype
description: The Rusty Beacon Prototype is a craftable Pre-Hardmode summon weapon that can also be found in Rusty Chests. When used, it summons a Rusty drone that follows the player and locks on to enemies with a visible green target. Once locked on, it will explode into four rust shards that deal 16 summon damage each and inflict the Irradiated debuff. Left-clicking an enemy with the weapon in-hand will poke enemies, dealing one damage and forces them to chase the player. The Rusty Beacon Prototype cannot b

name: Draconic Swarmer
