description: The Draconic Swarmer is a post-Moon Lord enemy that rarely spawns in the Surface Jungle, and Underground Jungle at an even rarer chance. It attacks by accelerating towards the player for a short time, pauses, and repeats. It is summoned by The Dragonfolly and is more aggressive during the fight. Draconic Swarmers spawned by The Dragonfolly will not drop any Effulgent Feathers. The Effulgent Feathers dropped by these enemies allow the player to craft the Jungle Dragon Egg used to summon Yharon, w

name: Effigy of Decay
description: The Effigy of Decay is a craftable Pre-Hardmode effigy that can also be found in Rusty Chests. When placed down, all nearby players are granted water-breathing outside of the Abyss, along with immunity to the Sulphuric Poisoning debuff.

name: Rusty Medallion
description: The Rusty Medallion is a craftable Pre-Hardmode accessory that can also be found in Rusty Chests. While equipped, ranged weapons have a 20% chance to release 3 acidic droplets from the sky. The droplets deal 30% of the weapon's base damage and behave identically to the droplets from Flak Toxicannon. The droplets are softcapped at 30 damage, with any further damage increases being 90% less effective.

name: Broken Water Filter
description: The Broken Water Filter is a craftable Pre-Hardmode spawn-blocking tool that can also be found in Rusty Chests. While the item is favorited in the player's inventory, natural Acid Rain spawns are disabled.

name: Rusty Lockpick
description: The Rusty Lockpick was a craftable item which allowed the player to access locked Rusty Chests while in the player's inventory. A Rusty Lockpick was consumed upon use, so unlocking each Rusty Chest would require an additional key. Additionally, it could also craft items that would otherwise be found in Rusty Chests.

name: Sulphurskin Potion
description: The Sulphurskin Potion is a craftable Pre-Hardmode buff potion. Upon consumption it grants the Sulphurskin buff, which reduces the damage over time dealt by the water in the Sulphurous Sea. The Sulphurskin's effect of reducing severity of the water in the Sulphurous Sea stacks with the Sulphurous armor's set bonus in the following manner: While the buff is active without the set bonus, the amount of minimum life regen lost is 2 instead of 8, and further reduced by 1 every 5.83 seconds instead of

name: Corroded Caustibow
description: The Corroded Caustibow is a craftable Hardmode bow. When Wooden Arrows are used as ammo, It fires slow gravity-affected toxic shells that emit a wet aura along its path which deals 15% of the weapon's damage and inflicts the Irradiated debuff. The toxic shell itself pierces five enemies and breaks upon contact with tiles, inflicting both Irradiated and Sulphuric Poisoning onto enemies. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Gamma Heart
description: The Gamma Heart is a post-Moon Lord summon weapon that drops from Nuclear Terrors. It summons a Gamma Hydra that is attached to the player; summoning the item again will add a head in exchange for taking up another minion slot. The heads fire Gamma Canisters in an arc at nearby enemies which inflict the Sulphuric Poisoning debuff. Each canister splits into 6 Gamma Bullets upon contacting an enemy or tile, each of which deals half the original weapon's damage and will home into enemies after exac

name: Hardened Sulphurous Sandstone
description: Hardened Sulphurous Sandstone is a Pre-Hardmode block that can be found in the Sulphurous Sea biome, which spawns upon world generation. It is commonly found on the outlines of caves and the sea floor.

name: Hardened Sulphurous Sandstone Wall
description: Hardened Sulphurous Sandstone Wall is a background walls crafted from Hardened Sulphurous Sandstone.

name: Star Struck Water
description: The Star Struck Water is a craftable Hardmode consumable classless weapon that acts as the Astral Infection variant of the Thrown Water. When thrown, it converts a small, square-shaped area with a radius of five blocks from the center into the Astral Infection. Directly striking an enemy also deals a small amount of typeless damage. The Star Struck Water cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers.

name: Plague Caller
description: The Plague Caller is a pet summoning item that drops from The Plaguebringer Goliath. It summons a miniature Plaguebringer that is similar to the ones spawned by the Infected Remote to follow the player. The miniature Plaguebringer sprite is taken from an unused asset in the code for a scrapped summoner weapon of the same name and with a similar appearance. The Plague Caller summon weapon eventually got redesigned into the Fuel Cell Bundle. The miniature Plaguebringer is also used for one of the

name: Relic of Convergence
description: The Relic of Convergence is a post-Moon Lord usable tool that is dropped by the Crystal Profaned Guardian. When held out, it slows the player's movement speed by 50% and charges up over the course of four seconds, creating an aura around the player. When fully charged, the aura will converge on to the player, healing them for 70 HP. Unlike most healing items, this item can be used as many times as the player wants with no cooldown. This can be useful for class playthroughs, as items such as the

name: Relic of Resilience
description: The Relic of Resilience is a post-Moon Lord tool that is dropped by the Rock Profaned Guardian. When used, it summons a spinning circular Artifact of Resilience at the mouse cursor. After taking enough damage, it will break apart into eight intangible shards that orbit around the breaking area, then slowly converge and reform back into the Artifact over the course of five seconds. Enemies near the shards will be inflicted with Profaned Weakness, which reduces their next attack's damage by 45%. A

name: Critter Cages
description: Critter Cages are placeable decorative furniture items that display animated critters. A critter caught with the Bug Net or Golden Bug Net is combined with a Terrarium to craft a cage. All Critter Cages cannot be opened, broken, or crafted back into their ingredients, so once a critter is crafted into a cage, that particular critter can no longer be released. Each Critter Cage type has its own dimensions and requirements to be placed: Cages are 3 tiles wide and 2 tiles high. Jars are 2 tiles wid

name: Living Fire Blocks
description: Living Fire Blocks are craftable Hardmode furniture blocks that, when placed, resemble small animated flames and emit a faint light. They deal no damage on contact, and can be broken with any pickaxe. The Calamity Mod currently adds three types of Living Fire Blocks to the game, each corresponding to the types of fire found in the mod. Similarly to all other Living Fire Blocks, they can be placed in a manner similar to traditional blocks, but as furniture items rather than foreground blocks. The

name: Effigies
description: Effigies are furniture items which give all players within their radius a unique buff. The Calamity Mod currently adds three types of effigies to the game, which can all be found in certain chests spawned naturally.

name: Water Fountains
description: Water Fountains are furniture items that change the color of all nearby water. They can be activated via right-click or wiring. The Calamity Mod currently adds four different fountains to the game, all of which are purchased from the Witch Doctor for 4 . Abyss and Astral Water Fountains are only available in Hardmode. Unlike vanilla Water Fountains, these are automatically activated when placed. The effects of the Fountains are purely cosmetic. They have no effect on Fishing, etc. Water Fountain

name: Relic of Deliverance
description: The Relic of Deliverance is a post-Moon Lord classless weapon that drops from the Profaned Guardians. When initially used, a spear is summoned at the player, spawning dust and increasing its potential lunge speed up to a maximum of 153 mph. When used again, the spear launches the player towards the direction of the cursor until the player collides with a wall or shortly after the player redirects for a total of three times. The player is able to redirect the spear by using the item again, which

name: Valkyrie Ray
description: The Valkyrie Ray is a craftable Hardmode wand. When used, it charges for half a second, then releases a straight magenta laser beam that fades out very shortly after. The beam pierces infinitely, cannot pass through tiles, and cannot be aimed after its release. The beam also partially ignores enemy immunity frames, and will strike enemies 6 times per shot if the beam remains in contact with them. Its best modifier is Mythical. The Valkyrie Ray's knockback always launches foes to the right. Combi

name: Tundra Flame Blossoms Staff
description: The Tundra Flame Blossoms Staff is a craftable Hardmode summon weapon. When used, it summons up to three pink flowers that orbit around the player, and passively fire three Blossom Orbs which inflicts the Frostburn debuff. If a target is nearby, the flower fires 3.1x faster and the projectiles are sped up by 2.33x. Unlike most minions, only one set of Tundra Flame Blossoms can be summoned. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these p

name: Lion Heart
description: The Lion Heart is a post-Moon Lord true melee broadsword that is sold by the Cyborg NPC for 1 40 after Polterghast has been defeated. When swung, an energy explosion is created on every enemy hit, dealing an additional 100% of the weapon's damage and inflicting the Electrified debuff. When used with the right-click, an energy shell is created around the player that halves all damage for 5 seconds while the weapon is held, with a 45-second cooldown after the shield runs out. Its best modifier is

name: Joyful Heart
description: The Joyful Heart is a pet summoning item that drops from Sharks. It summons a white shark pet to fly around the player, occasionally spinning around itself. It has a 1 in 10000 chance every frame to squeak and causes all players, enemies, critters, and Town NPCs within a 15-block radius to emit heart particles similarly to a Love Potion. If the player is named "Aleksh" or "Shark Lad", the player can obtain the Joyful Heart from the Starter Bag. Lad Shark behaves the same way as the Baby Skeletro

name: Forbidden Circlet
description: The Forbidden Circlet is a Hardmode helmet armor piece and variant of the Forbidden armor. It grants 1 defense, 10% increased summon damage, and 15% increased rogue velocity. When equipped with the Forbidden Robes and Forbidden Treads, the full set grants the following stats and bonuses (this includes the set bonus): 21 defense 10% increased summon damage 15% increased rogue velocity +80 max mana +2 max minions Gives a max stealth of 40. Stealth strikes summon 6 homing Forbidden Eaters that each

name: Devourer Spawn
description: The Devourer Spawn was a post-Moon Lord boss servant enemy that was spawned during the fight with The Devourer of Gods. It behaved almost identically to Wyverns and spawned periodically as the Devourer of Gods was damaged, in a similar manner to the Probes in the Destroyer fight. The Devourer Spawn shared its sprite with a previous version of the Staff of the Mechworm's Mechworm. The Devourer Spawn was a reference to the Mechanical Digger from the Avalon Mod.

name: Energy Orb
description: Not to be confused with Energy Core, a crafting material for Wulfrum armor. Energy Orbs were Hardmode crafting materials dropped by Golem. They were solely used to make Uelibloom Bars and Tarragon Wings. The item was a recolor of the Shadow Orb.

name: Diamond Dust
description: Diamond Dust was a Pre-Hardmode crafting material made using Obsidian. It was solely used to make the Blizzard in a Bottle, Cloud in a Bottle, and Sandstorm in a Bottle. The item was a recolor of Gold Dust.

name: Ancient Feather
description: Ancient Feathers were a Hardmode crafting material crafted using Wyvern Feathers and Living Dew Droplets. They were solely used to make Perennial Bars.

name: Living Dew Droplet
description: Not to be confused with Living Dew, an accessory. Living Dew Droplets were a Hardmode crafting material dropped by certain Jungle enemies. They were solely used to make Everglade Spray and Ancient Feathers.

name: Twisted Tendril
description: Twisted Tendrils were Hardmode crafting materials dropped by the Wall of Flesh and certain Underworld enemies. They were solely used to make Chaos Serpent Shards.

name: Chaos Serpent Shard
description: Chaos Serpent Shards were Hardmode crafting materials crafted using Twisted Tendrils and Living Shards. They were solely used to make Scoria Bars, then called Cruptix Bars.

name: Crystallite
description: Not to be confused with Crystalline, a rogue weapon. Crystallite was a Hardmode crafting material crafted using Stardusts and Crystal Shards. It was solely used to make Cryonic Bars and Devastation.

name: Particle Accelerator
description: The Particle Accelerator was a hardmode crafting station used to craft "advanced" items. It counted as a Hardmode Forge and a Hardmode Anvil. The Particle Accelerator's item sprite was reused for lul's first sprite. Draedon's Forge can be seen as a replacement for the Particle Accelerator.

name: Calamity Spawner
description: The Calamity Spawner was a Hardmode item used to generate the Calamity Biome and all of the mod's ores into the world. In the mod's source files, the item was referred to as 'TestItemKYS'. It was known by the name 'Calamity Biome Spawner' prior to it gaining the ability to generate ores.

name: Gauss Dagger
description: The Gauss Dagger is a craftable Pre-Hardmode broadsword. When used, the player swings a short-ranged dagger that spawns an energy flux on top of enemies when they are struck two times. The flux repeatedly damages enemies that come into contact with it for 3 seconds. The weapon consumes 0.05 units of charge per use and has a maximum charge of 50. Its best modifier is Legendary. The Gauss Dagger cannot be crafted until the Schematic from the Sunken Sea Bio-center Lab is found. If the requirement h

name: Aurora Blazer
description: The Aurora Blazer is a Hardmode flamethrower that drops from Astrum Aureus. It fires an erratic astral flame that travels quickly in a star shaped pattern that changes direction after travelling for 70 frames, or 32.8125 tiles, damaging enemies and inflicting the Astral Infection debuff. Once completing its path, it will return to the player. There is no limit to how many astral flames can be active at once. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Taser
description: The Taser is a craftable Pre-Hardmode ranged weapon. When used, a slow hook is fired from the edge of the weapon, attempting to attach to the first enemy it hits and inflicting the Electrified debuff. After a short time has passed, the hook returns to the player, hitting any targets it contacts without sticking to them. The weapon consumes 0.05 units of charge per use and has a maximum charge of 50. Its best modifier is Demonic, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers tha

name: Pulse Pistol
description: The Pulse Pistol is a craftable Pre-Hardmode magic gun. When used, it fires a pink gravity-defying pulse that disappears on tile impact. If the pulse hits a target, it is able to redirect to another target, and pierce up to two enemies before disappearing on the third. Additionally if the target is inorganic, 1/300 of the target's max health will be added to its damage. Unlike other magic guns, this weapon does not consume mana. The weapon consumes 0.1 units of charge per use and has a maximum c

name: Wulfrum Rover
description: The Wulfrum Rover is a Pre-Hardmode enemy found on the Surface during daytime. It is initially stationary, but when it detects a player, it attacks by sliding towards them in order to deal contact damage. It is incapable of moving up non-slope blocks. It can be supercharged by the Wulfrum Pylon enemy, causing its lights to turn from green to blue and gaining a temporary energy shield which increases its defense. The name of the enemy, as well as the accessory it drops, are partially in reference

name: Auroradical Throw
description: The Auroradical Throw is a Hardmode rogue weapon that drops from Astrum Aureus. When used, it throws out an astral star that splits into five stars after traveling for a short distance. The split stars will deal 87% of the base damage and travel away from where the main star split for two seconds before homing in on nearby enemies. All stars inflict the Astral Infection debuff and can travel through blocks. Performing a stealth strike with the Auroradical Throw causes the main star to deal 120%

name: Alula Australis
description: The Alula Australis is a Hardmode wand that drops from Astrum Aureus. It fires an aurora beam that travels in a cosine pattern. As the beam travels, Astral stars trail the beam and rain down from the sky. Astral stars' damage and knockback are randomized from 25% to 75% of their base values. Both the aurora beam and the astral stars inflict the Astral Infection debuff. Its best modifier is Mythical. Alula Australis is an alternate name given to the star system "Xi Ursae Majoris", which was the f

name: Leonid Progenitor
description: The Leonid Progenitor is a Hardmode Legendary rogue weapon that drops from Astrum Aureus in Malice Mode. When used with its primary fire (left-click), gravity-affected bombshells are thrown which will explode on enemies and tiles, causing a large explosive meteor to rain down which deals half damage. When used with its secondary fire (right-click), six gravity-affected small comets are thrown out which each explodes into a stationary star which deals one-third damage. Stars may deal damage to an

name: Rover Drive
description: The Rover Drive is a Pre-Hardmode accessory dropped by Wulfrum Rovers. While equipped, it periodically generates a spherical energy shield around the player, which grants 10 defense while it is active. The shield lasts for 10 seconds before disappearing, and then after 20 seconds it will automatically reappear. It is later used as an ingredient for The Absorber. The name of the accessory is a reference to mod developer and wiki editor RoverdriveX.

name: Desert Prowler armor
description: Desert Prowler armor is a craftable Pre-Hardmode ranged armor set. It requires 6 Desert Feathers and 23 Silk to craft the entire set. It consists of a Desert Prowler Hat, Desert Prowler Shirt, and Desert Prowler Pants. The full set grants the following stats and bonuses (this includes the set bonus): 6 defense Increased ranged damage by 1 9% increased ranged critical strike chance 20% chance to not consume ammunition 10% increased movement speed Grants immunity to the Mighty Wind debuff Ranged c

name: Titan Heart armor
description: Titan Heart armor is a craftable Hardmode rogue armor set crafted from several materials from the Astral Infection biome. It requires 3 Titan Hearts and 44 Astral Monoliths to craft the entire set. It consists of a Titan Heart Mask, Titan Heart Mantle, and Titan Heart Boots. The full set grants the following stats and bonuses (this includes the set bonus): 43 defense 24% increased rogue damage 10% increased rogue velocity 35% increased rogue knockback 15% decreased rogue firing rate 45% increase

name: Titan Heart
description: The Titan Heart is a Hardmode crafting material that drops from Atlases. It is used to craft Titan Heart armor and summon the Astrum Deus boss when interacting (right-click) with the Astral Beacon.

name: Monstrous Knives
description: The Monstrous Knives is a craftable Pre-Hardmode melee weapon that acts similarly to the Vampire Knives. When used, the player throws a spread of 3-6 gravity-affected knives that have a 33.33% chance to heal the player for 7.5% to 90% of the damage dealt. The knives fade away after a short amount of time, losing 10% of its damage and knockback every 0.5 seconds, then disappear into cosmetic red dust when fully transparent. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size.

name: Parasitic Scepter
description: The Parasitic Scepter is a Pre-Hardmode wand that drops from Water Leeches during tier 1 of the Acid Rain event. On use, it fires two to four leeches which latch onto enemies on contact. They inflict the Irradiated debuff, which stacks up to three times depending on how many leeches are currently latched onto an enemy. Its best modifier is Mythical.

name: Tyranny's End
description: The Tyranny’s End is a craftable post-Moon Lord gun that is the upgrade of the Anti-materiel Rifle and the final upgrade of the Sniper Rifle. It always fires a high-damage High Velocity Bullet regardless of the bullet used. If the initial shot critically strikes, a swarm of ten bullets arrive from the left and right of the enemy, enclosing on the enemy’s position. Holding right-click will use its zoom ability, which scrolls the viewing area of the screen in the direction of the cursor in a simil

name: Prismatic Breaker
description: The Prismatic Breaker is a craftable post-Moon Lord broadsword and ranged weapon. When used with its primary fire (left-click), the player will hold the sword similarly to a staff, dealing no contact damage. After charging for roughly 1.67 seconds, an infinite-piercing laser is summoned as long as the item is held, with the laser itself being disrupted by tile contact. When used with its secondary fire (right-click), the sword is swung normally and a rainbow wave is fired, piercing tiles and up

name: Rubico Prime
description: The Rubico Prime is a craftable post-Moon Lord gun that is the direct upgrade to the Pestilent Defiler. When used, a high-velocity round is fired every half-second for a total of 10 times. The bullets pierce all tiles and enemies, dealing 25% more damage during a critical strike. Additionally, damage increases by 10% on inorganic targets, stacking with the critical strike effect for a total of 35% damage boost. Its best modifier is Unreal. The weapon itself is a reference to the Rubico Prime fro

name: Infected Armor Plating
description: Infected Armor Plating is a Hardmode crafting material that drops from The Plaguebringer Goliath. Similarly to Plague Cell Canisters, they are used to craft Plague-themed items such as Plague Keeper, Tactical Plague Engine, and Plaguebringer armor. However, it is also used for other items, such as the True Forbidden Oathblade and the third tier of weapons from Draedon's Arsenal.

name: Plaguebringer armor
description: Not to be confused with Plague Reaper armor, a Hardmode armor set based on the ranged class. Plaguebringer armor is a craftable Hardmode armor set that is an upgrade to the Bee armor. It requires an entire Bee armor set, along with 2 Alchemical Flasks, a Flower Boots, 16 Plague Cell Canisters and 16 Infected Armor Platings to craft the entire set. While wearing the Plaguebringer Carapace, the wearer has a tank equipped behind them. While wearing all three set pieces, a motion blur afterimage is

name: Howl's Heart
description: Howl's Heart is a Hardmode accessory that is purchased from the Wizard NPC for 12 . While equipped, three pets assist the player: Howl fires blue flames towards enemies that have a base damage of 42. Calcifer provides light around the player. Turnip-Head follows the player around. Howl, Calcifer, and Turnip-Head are all references to the characters of the same name from the Howl's Moving Castle book series. The designs of the characters summoned are based on their appearances in the 2004 film Ho

name: Prismatic armor
description: Prismatic armor is a craftable post-Moon Lord armor set. It requires 9 Armored Shells, 15 Exodium Clusters, 18 Divine Geodes, and 900 Nanites to craft the entire set. If the entire set is visible (regardless of whether it is equipped or in social slots), the wearer will have a faint pulsing aura. It consists of a Prismatic Helmet, Prismatic Regalia, and Prismatic Greaves. The full set grants the following stats and bonuses (this includes the set bonus): 72 defense 60% decreased non-magic damage

name: Evasion Scarf
description: The Evasion Scarf is a craftable Hardmode accessory that is an indirect upgrade to the Counter Scarf. Wearing the scarf grants the player the ability to dash a base distance of 17 blocks left or right by double tapping the ◀ Left or ▶ Right key. While dashing, the player will dodge attacks and is granted the Evasion Scarf Cooldown debuff. This debuff will temporarily prevent the user from dodging any more attacks, though they are still able to dash. The scarf also increases damage of true melee

name: Sealed Singularity
description: The Sealed Singularity is a craftable post-Moon Lord bomb that hurls a circular, void-containing flask. The flask stops moving after a short time, shattering if enough time has passed or upon any collision with solid tiles or enemies. Once shattered, a black hole is formed at the center of the impact, along with 3 gravity-affected shards which each deal 25% damage. The black hole lasts 5 seconds and pulls in nearby enemies, gaining more strength the more black holes are present at a time. Perfor

name: Yanmei's Knife
description: Yanmei's Knife is a craftable Hardmode classless weapon. When swung, a short-ranged green slash appears in front of the player towards the mouse cursor. After the swing, the player is temporarily unable to use the item for three seconds. Striking a boss or its servants causes the user to gain the Kami Injection buff while the target is inflicted with the Kami Flu debuff. Kami Injection grants the player 15% movement speed and damage, while Kami Flu reduces the enemy’s damage reduction by 20% and

name: Blunder Booster
description: The Blunder Booster is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory that is the direct upgrade to the Plagued Fuel Pack. While equipped, rogue damage is increased by 12%, projectile velocity is increased by 15% and stealth generates 10% faster. Additionally, a red aura is summoned around the player that damages enemies and inflicts the Electrified debuff. Pressing the Booster Dash key causes the player to dash diagonally upwards in the player's direction at the cost of 25% of the player's stealth, leavi

name: Ultima
description: Ultima is a craftable post-Moon Lord bow. Upon firing initially, it fires rainbow bolts which bounce off surfaces and do not pierce, firing in a manner parallel from the bow to the cursor with a random offset around the bow's sprite position. After 2.45 seconds, the chance of a bolt being replaced with a solid beam of light linearly increases until it reaches 100% chance at 7 seconds. The beams pierce all tiles and targets and deal 50% more damage than the bolts. After 4.9 seconds, there is a 16

name: Folly Feed
description: The Folly Feed is a post-Moon Lord Mount summoning item that drops from The Dragonfolly. When used, it summons a rideable Bumbledoge mount which has a very high running speed. The Bumbledoge mount has a top running speed of 72 mph, vertical speed of 31 mph, and overall speed of 78 mph. The Bumbledoge itself does not deal any contact damage, but will fire homing mini-swarmers that deal 180 damage. The mount is capable of 10 seconds of flight with a low vertical acceleration before gliding down. S

name: Marksman Bow
description: The Marksman Bow is a craftable Hardmode bow. When fired, it semi-inaccurately fires three arrows at a time, each with a varying velocity. It additionally converts normal Wooden Arrows into Jester’s Arrows. Fired Jester’s Arrows use local npc immunity frames. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Caustic Staff
description: Not to be confused with Caustic Croaker Staff, a Pre-Hardmode sentry-summoning weapon. The Caustic Staff is a craftable Hardmode summon weapon. When used, it summons a black Caustic Dragon minion that flies behind the player and attacks nearby enemies by firing gravity-affected thorns that pierce through tiles and up to two enemies. While the player is holding a summon weapon or tool, the thorns will cycle through and inflict one of the following debuffs for 1-3 seconds in this repeating order:

name: Apoctolith
description: The Apoctolith is a craftable Hardmode rogue weapon that throws a gravity-affected abyssal brick that inflicts the Crush Depth debuff. Whenever the brick critically hits an enemy, the struck target loses 15 defense, which cannot stack with itself. Performing a stealth strike with the Apoctolith will cause the next brick to stun enemies with the Eutrophication debuff. The brick will also deal 125% damage and shatter on impact, creating 5 shards that deal 62.5% damage each. Its best modifier is Fl

name: Gastric Belcher Staff
description: The Gastric Belcher Staff is a Hardmode summon weapon that drops from Leviathan and Anahita. When used, it summons a miniature variant of the Aquatic Aberration that floats by the player and attacks nearby enemies by firing gravity-affected vomit towards its targets. Every third attack, it instead fires a random spread of five bubbles with varying size. The bubbles stay still and linger after a short time if they haven't hit a target, and the vomit pierces up to two enemies. Its best modifier is

name: Toilets
description: Toilets are pieces of furniture. The Calamity Mod currently adds one new toilet. The Auric Toilet uses the tooltip "This was used by the gods".

name: Wulfrum Hovercraft
description: The Wulfrum Hovercraft is a Pre-Hardmode enemy found on the Surface during daytime. It is initially stationary when it first spawns, moving to attack only when the player is considerably close and has direct line of sight. It attacks by hovering above the ground and diving downward before charging the player. It will stop attacking if the line of sight is broken. If enough time has passed without the hovercraft detecting a player, it will fly straight up, passing through tiles, and despawn. It c

name: Tenebreus Tides
description: The Tenebreus Tides is a craftable Hardmode spear. When swung, it launches a water spear that deals 65% of the spear’s damage. When an enemy is struck with the spear or its main projectile, three swords or spears appear around the struck target. The secondary wave of swords and spears deal half the damage of the projectile that spawned them, and will disappear and return to attack an enemy up to two more times before disappearing, similarly to the Influx Waver. Its best modifier is Godly. It can

name: Energy Core
description: Energy Cores are Pre-Hardmode crafting materials dropped by Wulfrum Drones, Gyrators, Hovercrafts, Pylons and Rovers when they are supercharged. They are used to craft Wulfrum armor.

name: Wulfrum Pylon
description: For the vanilla furniture items, see Pylons. The Wulfrum Pylon is a Pre-Hardmode enemy found on the Surface during daytime. It is completely stationary, and emits a field around it that will supercharge nearby Wulfrum Robots and increase their spawn rates by 5.5x. If a player enters this field, it spawns 1 / 2 wulfrum enemies. It spawns more frequently at the outer two-thirds of the world.

name: Wulfrum Gyrator
description: The Wulfrum Gyrator is a Pre-Hardmode enemy found on the Surface during daytime. Initially, it remains in one place, jumping periodically. When it detects a player, it attacks by rolling quickly and jumping towards them. It can be supercharged by the Wulfrum Pylon enemy, causing its lights to turn from green to blue and increasing their speed and jump height.

name: Astral Beacon
description: The Astral Beacon is a Hardmode furniture item that can be crafted or found naturally on a pillar of Astral Monolith after the Astral Infection has generated. When right-clicked during the night, it is used to summon Astrum Deus while a Titan Heart or Starcore is in the player's inventory. Upon successfully summoning the boss, one Titan Heart is removed from the player's inventory if the player does not have a Starcore, and two stars rise up from the beacon, summoning Astrum Deus shortly after.

name: Gauss Rifle
description: The Gauss Rifle is a craftable Hardmode ranged weapon. When used, it fires a high velocity stream of blue particles, exploding on impact with an enemy or blocks. It consumes charge on use. The weapon consumes 0.1125 units of charge per use and has a maximum charge of 135. Its best modifier is Unreal. The Gauss Rifle cannot be crafted until the Encrypted Schematic from the Jungle Bio-center Lab is decrypted. If the requirement has not been met, two lines of tooltip are added at the bottom of the

name: Hydraulic Volt Crasher
description: The Hydraulic Volt Crasher is a craftable Hardmode hammer. When an enemy is struck, a stream of electricity is released, striking all enemies within a short range. Enemies that are struck by electricity take continuous damage from the shock, equivalent to 80% of the weapon's damage and reduces by 25% every hit until it hits the target 5 times. If the target is repeatedly hit, an explosion will occur, dealing more damage and inflicting the Electrified debuff. It consumes charge on use. The weapon

name: Snake Eyes
description: The Snake Eyes is a craftable post-Moon Lord summon weapon. It summons an orb that chases nearby enemies at high speed, moving in a square pattern around all the targets it can detect, and shooting at the nearest one with a laser beam. It will travel through blocks to reach its target and will change its formation if the minion is targeted at a specific enemy. When idle, it floats up and down above the player's head. The weapon consumes 1 unit of charge per use and has a maximum charge of 190. I

name: Pulse Turret Remote
description: The Pulse Turret Remote is a craftable Hardmode sentry. It summons a stationary turret sentry that fires a purple homing pulse blast towards nearby enemies. Every third shot, a spread of three blasts is fired. The blast deals 0.2% bonus health to inorganic targets. The weapon consumes charge on use and has a maximum charge of 135. Its best modifier is Demonic, as it does not have any knockback and thus cannot get modifiers that affect it. The Pulse Turret Remote cannot be crafted until the Encry

name: Pole Warper
description: The Pole Warper is a craftable post-Moon Lord summon weapon. It summons a pair of Warper Magnet minions that orbit around the player. When an enemy is found, the magnets disperse, pause for a brief moment, then charge at the target. Whilst using the item itself, the magnets independently circle around themselves and will not charge if enemies are nearby. The weapon consumes 1.25 units of charge per use and has a maximum charge of 250. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides

name: Star Swallower Containment Unit
description: The Star Swallower Containment Unit is a craftable Pre-Hardmode summon weapon. It summons a grounded bio-mechanical frog minion that jumps around the player. When an enemy is nearby, it fires gravity-affected acid droplets which have their damage boosted by half of the target's defense, and inflict the Irradiated debuff. It does not directly deal contact damage. The weapon consumes 0.08 units of charge per use and has a maximum charge of 50. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier p

name: Mounted Scanner
description: The Mounted Scanner is a craftable Hardmode summon weapon. It summons a floating machine that surrounds the player. When an enemy is nearby, the machine fires red laser beams at them. The beam's damage is reduced by 40% every hit, and reduced again by 1/7 of the enemy's defense. The weapon consumes 0.85 units of charge per use and has a maximum charge of 85. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summ

name: Charger Test Item
description: The Charger Test Item was an unobtainable tool that filled the charge of all items in the player's inventory when used.

name: Chaosplate
description: Chaosplate is a craftable Pre-Hardmode block that can also be found in the core of the Underworld Bio-center Lab of a world. It can be used as a building material, and is also required to craft the Profaned Soul Artifact.

name: Elumplate
description: Elumplate is a craftable Pre-Hardmode block that can also be found in the core of the Ice Bio-center Lab of a world. It can be used as a building material, and is also required to craft the Dimensional Soul Artifact.

name: Plagueplate
description: Not to be confused with Plagued Containment Brick, a similarly-themed Hardmode metallic block. Plagueplate is a craftable Pre-Hardmode block that can also be found in the core of the Jungle Bio-center Lab of a world. It can be used as a building material, and is also required to craft the Godly Soul Artifact.

name: Navyplate
description: Navyplate is a craftable Pre-Hardmode block that can also be found in the core of the Sunken Sea Bio-center Lab of a world. It can be used as a building material, and is also required to craft the Eldritch Soul Artifact.

name: Chaosplate Wall
description: Chaosplate Wall is a background wall crafted with Chaosplate.

name: Plagueplate Wall
description: Plagueplate Walls are background walls crafted with Plagueplate.

name: Navyplate Wall
description: Navyplate Walls is a background wall crafted with Navyplate.

name: Elumplate Wall
description: Elumplate Walls is a background wall crafted with Elumplate.

name: Hazard Chevron Wall
description: Hazard Chevron Wall is a background wall crafted with Hazard Chevron Panels.

name: Laboratory Panel Wall
description: Laboratory Panel Wall is a background wall crafted with Laboratory Panels.

name: Laboratory Plate Beam
description: Laboratory Plate Beam is a background wall crafted with Laboratory Plating. Despite being called a beam, it does not function like regular beams, instead being a wall.

name: Rusted Plate Beam
description: Rusted Plate Beams are background walls crafted with Rusted Plating. Despite being called a beam, it does not function like regular beams, instead being a wall.

name: Laboratory Plate Pillar
description: Laboratory Plate Pillar is a background wall crafted with Laboratory Plating.

name: Rusted Plate Pillar
description: Rusted Plate Pillars are background walls crafted with Rusted Plating.

name: Laboratory Plating Wall
description: Laboratory Plating Wall is a background wall crafted with Laboratory Plating.

name: Rusted Plating Wall
description: Rusted Plating Walls are background walls crafted with Rusted Plating.

name: Anahita's Arpeggio
description: The Anahita's Arpeggio is a Hardmode magic weapon that is dropped by the Leviathan and Anahita and is the indirect upgrade to the Magical Harp. It fires treble clefs in random directions within about 30 degrees of the cursor. The clefs will ricochet off of blocks and pierce through all enemies while traveling, inflicting the Confused debuff. Its best modifier is Mythical. An arpeggio is a musical technique in which the notes of a chord are played in succession in a rising or falling order. This

name: Tracking Disk
description: The Tracking Disk is a craftable Pre-Hardmode rogue boomerang. When thrown, the disk detects its nearest enemy and fires lasers towards it continuously. Lasers deal 25% of the disk's damage and have a small area of effect. Damage from both the disk and laser is reduced by 25% of the target's defense. Performing a stealth strike with the Tracking Disk causes the resulting disk to be able to track and target four enemies at once. Lasers fired from stealth strikes are also 60% larger. The weapon co

name: Frequency Manipulator
description: The Frequency Manipulator is a craftable Hardmode javelin. When used, the player winds up a javelin around them before throwing, spawning four homing energy outwards from each enemy that is hit and pierces up to three times. Colliding with tiles will break the javelin but also release the homing energy before it is killed. Performing a stealth strike with the Frequency Manipulator causes the resulting javelin to deal 90% damage and massively increase its area of effect. The weapon consumes 0.004

name: Pots
description: Pots are common items generated at world creation in random areas. When broken with any weapon or tool, they will drop coins and/or random common items. Pots cannot be picked up, never respawn, and cannot be crafted. The Calamity Mod adds two new pots that spawn in the Abyss and the Sulphurous Sea. Pots in the Abyss can only drop Abyssal Treasure while pots in the Sulphurous Sea can only drop Sulphuric Treasure.

name: Abyssal Treasure
description: Abyssal Treasure is a Grab bag obtained from breaking Abyssal Pots. It contains several items that typically drop from pots, along with Hadal Stew and Anechoic Coating.

name: Sulphuric Treasure
description: Sulphuric Treasure is a Grab bag obtained from breaking Sulphurous Pots. It contains several items that typically drop from pots, along with Anechoic Coating and Triumph Potions.

name: System Bane
description: The System Bane is a craftable Hardmode spiky ball. When used, the player throws a gravity-affected electric machine that continuously deals damage to targets that come into contact with it. Occasionally if there's a target nearby, the device releases lightning to triple-strike it. Up to 5 machines can be out at a time. Performing a stealth strike with the System Bane causes the resulting machine to emit a large pulsating electric field that releases lightning into enemies within it. The weapon

name: Wave Pounder
description: The Wave Pounder is a craftable post-Moon Lord bomb. When used, a gravity-affected bomb is thrown, which is able to stick onto a solid floor for 3 seconds or until a target is struck before it explodes. When exploded, a large shockwave is formed along with cosmetic cloud particles, continuously dealing damage for a short time. Performing a stealth strike with the Wave Pounder causes the resulting explosion to dramatically increase in size, allowing it to shake the screen. The weapon consumes 0.5

name: Fleshy Geode
description: Fleshy Geode is a Grab bag that drops from Ravager before Providence, the Profaned Goddess has been defeated. It contains several Hardmode crafting materials. After Providence has been defeated, Ravager instead drops Necromantic Geodes.

name: Plasma Grenade
description: Plasma Grenades are craftable post-Moon Lord bombs. When used, the bomb is affected by gravity after a short time. When it collides with a surface or enemy, it explodes, dealing damage within the area. All projectile damage from the weapon is boosted by 25% of the target's defense. Performing a stealth strike with the Plasma Grenade causes the resulting explosion to be larger and strike twice. The Plasma Grenade cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers. Plasma Grenades cannot be c

name: Necromantic Geode
description: The Necromatic Geode is a Grab bag that drops from Ravager that replaces Fleshy Geodes once Providence, the Profaned Goddess has been defeated. It contains several late-Hardmode crafting materials and a large supply of Bloodstone.

name: Gauss Pistol
description: The Gauss Pistol is a craftable Hardmode magic gun. When used, it fires a sharpened green blast that is initially immobilized. After half a second, the blast travels towards the direction of the cursor when the item is used. The weapon consumes 0.05 units of charge per use and has a maximum charge of 85. Its best modifier is Mythical. The Gauss Pistol cannot be crafted until the Encrypted Schematic from the Space Bio-center Lab is decrypted. If the requirement has not been met, two lines of tool

name: Matter Modulator
description: The Matter Modulator is a craftable Hardmode ranged weapon. When used, it fires a spread of three to five unstable matter. Before bouncing, the matter will do 67% less damage to enemies but will infinitely pierce targets. After the projectile bounces off a solid block once, it speeds up and turns to a nearby target. The matter can not bounce more than once nor can it infinitely pierce after bouncing, but its damage is boosted by one-third of the target's defense. The weapon consumes 0.075 units

name: Galvanizing Glaive
description: The Galvanizing Glaive is a craftable Hardmode spear. When used, the player swings a spear around similarly to the Ghastly Glaive, and releases five gauss energy projectiles, each dealing 40% of the weapon's damage. If the target is struck by the spear itself, there is a 1/12 chance per hit for an energy flux to spawn on the enemy which inflicts continuous damage. The weapon consumes 0.075 units of charge per use and has a maximum charge of 135. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifier

name: Bleached Angling Kit
description: The Bleached Angling Kit is a Grab bag that drops from the Aquatic Scourge. It contains several Fishing equipment and potions. Sandy Angling Kit

name: Sandy Angling Kit
description: The Sandy Angling Kit is a Grab bag that drops from the Desert Scourge. It contains several Fishing equipment and potions. Bleached Angling Kit

name: Draedon's Logs
description: Draedon's Logs are five miscellaneous items that hold lore based around the location their Arsenal Labs reside in. When used, each log item brings up a custom menu that the player can click through and read. Almost every page has an accompanying illustration.

name: Pulse Dragon
description: The Pulse Dragon is a craftable post-Moon Lord flail. When used, the player swings two glowing electric dragon heads which moves in a whip-like manner. As they converge, up to eight short-lasting electrosphere projectiles are spawned per each flail. The whip then returns after converging or upon tile contact. Additionally if the target is inorganic, 1/300 of the target's max health will be added to the flail's damage. The weapon consumes 0.32 units of charge per use and has a maximum charge of 1

name: Phaseslayer
description: Not to be confused with Phasesabers, similarly-named vanilla broadswords. The Phaseslayer is a craftable unique post-Moon Lord melee weapon. When used, a long red laser blade is created that deals continuous contact damage to enemies. The blade always points towards the player's cursor and deals increased damage the faster and farther the blade is swung, encouraging the player to manually swing the blade. Swinging the blade fast enough will cause additional homing sword beams to fire, which deal

name: Dubious Plating
description: Dubious Platings are crafting materials found in guarded structures in the Cavern layer. They can also be obtained by using a Draedon Power Cell on a Extractinator with a 2.5% chance, or breaking Lab Turrets. They are used to craft various weapons and furniture alongside Mysterious Circuitry. Crafting all of the weapons that require Dubious Plating (in other words, Draedon's Arsenal weapons) costs 296 Platings; additionally, crafting every decoration that requires Dubious Plating requires an add

name: Mysterious Circuitry
description: Mysterious Circuitry are crafting materials found in guarded structures in the Cavern layer. They can also be obtained by using a Draedon Power Cell on a Extractinator with a 2.5% chance, or breaking Lab Turrets. They are used to craft various weapons alongside Dubious Plating. Crafting all weapons from Draedon's Arsenal would cost 310 Circuitry, Crafting the single decoration would bring that to 314.

name: Security Chest
description: Security Chests are chests found only in the Arsenal Labs that contain rare and unique items. Each Security Chest will contain two or more unique items depending on the type of lab, along with other standard loot. The following set of loot can be found in all Abandoned Workshops and Bio-center Labs. Primary items can only be found in one chest per Bio-center Lab, despite each labs containing two chests. If the Thorium Mod is enabled, Marine Kelp Planter Boxes can also be found alongside other Pl

name: The Final Dawn
description: The Final Dawn is a post-Moon Lord rogue weapon that drops from the Jungle Dragon, Yharon. When used it charges up and swings a large scythe that damages enemies and replenishes 40% of the player's maximum rogue stealth. Holding ▲ Up while charging up the scythe will cause it to be thrown out akin to a Boomerang. Both methods of attack inflict the Holy Flames debuff onto enemies. Performing a stealth strike with The Final Dawn will cause the player to spin around and create a horizontal fire aur

name: Laboratory Furniture
description: Laboratory Furniture are unique pieces of furniture that are found in Arsenal Labs. They can be crafted using Dubious Plating and Any Iron Bars. There are two variants of the following furniture pieces, listed with their respective dimensions: Consoles (2 wide × 3 high) Containment Boxes (3 wide × 2 high) Displays (4 wide × 3 high) Electric Panels (2 wide × 2 high) Reinforced Crates (2 wide × 2 high) Screens (3 wide × 2 high) Servers (2 wide × 4 high) Terminals (4 wide × 3 high) Electric Panels

name: Chromatic Orb
description: The Chromatic Orb is a light pet summoning item that drops from Astrum Deus. It summons an ancient dragon to follow the player. The player can control the location of the pet by using the movement keys. While the pet is active, the player gains the Hunter and Dangersense effects. Its name is a reference to a spell of the same name from Dungeons & Dragons. The buff tooltip is supposed to sound like the phrase 'He believes in you', as the dedicatee pronounces 'Xi' as 'kee'.

name: Charging Station
description: Charging Station is a furniture item used to charge certain weapons. It uses Draedon Power Cells as fuel to grant weapons charge. To charge an item, right-click the station, put the arsenal weapon at the top, and the power cell at the bottom. It can be found inside Arsenal Labs in the Cavern layer. The charging process can be stopped mid charge and keeps all previous progress.

name: Draedon Power Cell
description: Draedon Power Cells are consumable items that are generated by the Power Cell Factory. When used and correctly input at the Charging Station, it is able to add 1 unit of charge to chargeable weapons per power cell. It can also be used at an Extractinator to obtain a renewable supply of Dubious Plating and Mysterious Circuitry. Additionally, Draedon Power Cells are used to decrypt Schematics at the Codebreaker. The charging process can be stopped mid charge and keeps all previous progress. Draedo

name: Lab Hologram Projector
description: The Lab Hologram Projector is a unique piece of furniture found in the Arsenal Lab. When the player is within 35-blocks radius around the box, the hologram will be active. When interacted (right-click), the following dialogues may pop up: "To any personnel engaged in the laboratories. Please wear your steel engraved ID badge at all times. It is the easiest method to discern your body if any accidents do occur." "To experiment is to fail. To fail is to learn. To learn is to advance." "Apparent da

name: Power Cell Factory
description: Power Cell Factory is a unique piece of furniture found in Arsenal Labs. They are naturally found inactive, but can be broken and replaced by the player to make them functional. Every 15 seconds the Power Cell Factory generates a Draedon Power Cell, which can be retrieved by right-clicking the factory. These Power Cells can be used to charge certain weapons. Each Fuel Factory can hold up to 9999 Power Cells, which is equivalent to roughly 41.66 real time hours of generation.

name: Shadow Potion
description: The Shadow Potion is a craftable Pre-Hardmode buff potion that is a direct upgrade to the Invisibility Potion. Upon consumption it grants the Shadow buff, which turns the player invisible and reduces aggro while not attacking, and boosts stealth regeneration by 10% at all times. The player will also become immune to the Invisibility buff. When holding and using a certain type of rogue weapon, the player will gain certain buffs and spawn certain projectiles. The effects are listed below: For stea

name: Hazard Chevron Panels
description: Hazard Chevron Panels is a craftable Pre-Hardmode block that can be found in Arsenal Labs. Chevron refers to an alternating zigzag pattern often used in interior design for tiles and fabric.

name: Laboratory Panels
description: Laboratory Panels is a craftable Pre-Hardmode block that can be found in Arsenal Labs. It can be used to craft Hazard Chevron Panels.

name: Laboratory Pipe Plating
description: Laboratory Pipe Plating is a craftable Pre-Hardmode block that can be found in Arsenal Labs.

name: Rusted Pipes
description: Rusted Pipes are craftable Pre-Hardmode blocks that can be found in Arsenal Labs. They can be used to make Laboratory Pipe Platings.

name: Laboratory Plating
description: Laboratory Plating is a craftable Pre-Hardmode block that can be found in Arsenal Labs.

name: Rusted Plating
description: Rusted Plating is a craftable Pre-Hardmode block that can be found in Arsenal Labs.

name: Flamsteed Ring
description: The Flamsteed Ring is a craftable post-Moon Lord developer summon weapon. When used, the player is turned into a giant controllable robot. While mounted, most of their weapons are transformed into attacks. The attack type is determined by the top button on the interface, which is summoned by right-clicking while the item is held; the crescent symbol spawns a massive slash from the bot towards the cursor which rapidly hits all targets within the area for 5200 damage, and the cross-hair symbol fir

name: Field Generator
description: Field Generators were tiles found in Arsenal Labs which fired symmetrical 8 way patterned lasers in addition to singular lasers periodically at players who entered a 60 tile radius around them. The lasers dealt 54 / 108 damage. They could be mined using a Deathbringer Pickaxe, Nightmare Pickaxe, or higher.

name: Ascendant Spirit Essence
description: Ascendant Spirit Essence is a post-Moon Lord crafting material that is a combination of Phantoplasm, Nightmare Fuel, Endothermic Energy, and Darksun Fragments. It is used to craft several powerful post-Devourer of Gods items. A total of 83 Ascendant Spirit Essences are required to craft one of every item requiring it (including only 1 Auric Bar craft, only 1 God's Paranoia, and only 1 helmet of the God Slayer and Silva armor sets), which comes out to a total of 415 Phantoplasm, Nightmare Fuel, a

name: Aero Dynamite
description: Aero Dynamite is a craftable Pre-Hardmode consumable explosive. When thrown, it explodes following a 5-second delay, breaking most nearby blocks, similarly to its predecessor Dynamite. Unlike other dynamites, the Aero Dynamite is not affected by gravity and smoothly bounces off surfaces. The explosion will also not harm the player. The Aero Dynamite cannot be reforged, and therefore cannot have modifiers.

name: Steam Geyser
description: Steam Geysers are tiles found at the Sulphurous Sea which shoot steam upwards when directly below a player. The steam inflicts Poisoned and will launch the player upwards. They can be broken using any pickaxe and will not drop anything.

name: Ball and Chain
description: The Ball and Chain is a unique tool that works in the player's inventory. If the item is favorited, all dashes that are activated by double tapping ◀ Left and ▶ Right keys (such as the Shield of Cthulhu, Tabi, or Asgard's Valor) are disabled. This item is useful when trying to achieve precise movement while not accidentally shooting off in a direction undesirably, such as when building or during bullet hell fights like Supreme Calamitas. In previous versions of the mod, the ability to dash with

name: God Slayer Slug
description: God Slayer Slugs are post-Moon Lord bullets crafted from Cosmilite Bars. They initially behave similarly to Luminite Bullets, piercing infinitely and moving at a high velocity. Upon contact with an enemy, their lifespan will be limited and they will gain the ability to warp after despawning. Warping causes the bullets to appear behind the player, turn blue, aiming semi-accurately at the cursor, and cause a small explosion on contact for 28% of the original damage.

name: Bloodfire Bullet
description: Bloodfire Bullets are post-Moon Lord bullets made from Bloodstone Cores. Upon contact with an enemy, they accelerate the regeneration rate of the player. Additionally, their base damage is increased by the player's life regeneration, which calculates when the enemy has been hit. Bloodfire Bullets increase the player's lifeRegenTime variable by 2 frames per enemy hit. The variable represents the number of frames since the last time the player has been hit, with a maximum of 3600 frames, or 60 sec

name: Auralis
description: The Auralis is a craftable post-Moon Lord gun that is the direct upgrade to the Sniper Rifle. When used, a high-velocity blue-green dust round is fired. The bullet pierces up to four targets and inflicts Cursed Inferno, Ichor, and Marked. It has a 50% chance to not consume ammo when fired. The player builds up damage when they are standing still, up to a maximum of 25% increase to damage after 5 seconds. If the player uses a scope effect whilst having the maximum damage boost, they will form a b

name: Lab Turret
description: Lab Turrets are tiles found in Arsenal Labs which fire lasers at players who enter a 37.5 tile radius around them. While turrets can target players through solid tiles, the lasers can not pass through them. When broken, they will drop 8 Dubious Plating and Mysterious Circuitry. Lab Turrets cannot be destroyed by explosives.

name: Mossy Gravel Wall
description: Mossy Gravel Wall was an unobtainable backing wall. It was completely indestructible, unable to be broken with any hammer or destroyed with any explosives.

name: Calamity
description: If you were looking for something other than the accessory, see Calamity (disambiguation). Calamity is an Expert Mode-exclusive, post-Moon Lord accessory that drops from Supreme Calamitas. While equipped, a flaming aura spawns at the user's cursor. While an enemy is within range, the aura glows and continuously deals 212 typeless damage at a rate of 12 hits per second, inflicting the Vulnerability Hex debuff. Additionally, the cursor alternates between red and orange colors, regardless if the ac

name: Altar of the Accursed
description: The Altar of the Accursed is a craftable post-Moon Lord furniture item. When right-clicked, it is used to summon Supreme Calamitas while Ashes of Calamity or Ceremonial Urn is in the player's inventory. Upon successfully summoning the boss, one Ashes of Calamity is removed from the player's inventory if the player does not have a Ceremonial Urn, and the sky darkens, summoning Supreme Calamitas shortly after. The Altar of the Accursed cannot be destroyed by explosives. The Altar of the Accursed c

name: Angelic Alliance
description: The Angelic Alliance is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory. While equipped, the player is granted +2 max minions, +15% increased summon damage and +8% increased damage to all non-summoner classes. In addition, the player is granted +4 life regen while jumping or flying. Pressing the Angelic Alliance Blessing key will grant the Divine Bless buff for 15 seconds. While under the effects of Divine Bless, the player gains +5% increased damage and 2.5x health regen, along with a flat health regen bo

name: Phantomic Artifact
description: The Phantomic Artifact is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory and the final upgrade of the Spirit Glyph. While equipped, whenever a minion hits an enemy, the player will gain one of the following buffs: Phantomic Empowerment, which increases minion damage by 10%. Additionally, while this buff is active, there is a 10% chance for a phantomic dagger to spawn. The dagger has 75 base summon damage and there can be a maximum of three knives active at once. Phantomic Shield, which increases defense b

name: Rotten Dogtooth
description: The Rotten Dogtooth is a Pre-Hardmode accessory that drops from Pitbulls. While equipped, stealth strikes inflict the Armor Crunch debuff, deal 10% more damage, and cost 1 less unit of stealth.

name: Sand Shark Tooth Necklace
description: The Sand Shark Tooth Necklace is a craftable Hardmode accessory that is an upgrade to both the Shark Tooth Necklace and the Avenger Emblem. While equipped, the player's armor penetration is increased by 10 and all damage is increased by 6%.

name: Shattered Community
description: The Shattered Community is a post-Moon Lord accessory. It is the exhumed form of The Community. While equipped, the player’s Rage Meter no longer depletes when out of combat. The player will also passively gain rage over time, as well as when taking damage. While the Rage Mode buff is active, the maximum amount of rage increases to 200 units, or 200%. Additionally, the player is provided with various boosts including 5% critical strike chance, 10% damage, 5% damage reduction, 10 defense, 15% fli

name: Hallowed Ore
description: "The hallow has been blessed with consecrated stone!" Hallowed Ore is a Hardmode ore which generates in Pearlstone Blocks, Hardened Pearlsand Blocks, Pearlsandstone Blocks, and Pink Ice Blocks after all three Mechanical Bosses have been defeated. As such, it predominantly generates in the Underground Hallow biome. It is used to craft Hallowed Bars at an Adamantite Forge or Titanium Forge. It requires at least an Adamantite Pickaxe or Titanium Pickaxe to mine. Hallowed Ore cannot be destroyed by

name: Thaumatic Chair
description: The Thaumatic Chair is a craftable post-Moon Lord chair. "Thauma" is a word used to describe things relating to miracles.

name: Brimstone Witch
description: The Brimstone Witch is a post-Moon Lord NPC vendor that will spawn once the following conditions have been met: There is an empty house. Supreme Calamitas has been defeated. When threatened by enemies, she will defend herself with Brimstone Hellblasts. The Brimstone Witch will always be named Calamitas. For a full explanation on this mechanic, see Enchantment. For an expensive price, the Brimstone Witch is capable of enchanting the player's items, granting them new power with some drawback. She

name: Repair Unit
description: The Repair Unit is a critter found in all five Bio-center Labs. It passively walks back and forth, jumping over gaps and solid blocks in its path. Every 5 seconds, it will latch onto a nearby wall if available for up to 10.33 seconds or until it leaves a wall. Unlike other critters, the Repair Unit is not able to be caught with a Bug Net. Also unlike most critters, they are cannot take damage from the player, but can still take damage from hostile creatures. Repair Units were inspired by Alien R

name: Little Light
description: The Little Light is a light pet summoning item that drops from Storm Weaver. It summons a light construct to follow behind the player. While summoned, the construct provides a large amount of light to the player's surroundings. Its name, appearance, and tooltip are references to the Ghost from Destiny.

name: Pineapple
description: For the vanilla food item, see here. The Pineapple is a pet summoning item that drops from Goldfish at a very rare chance. It summons a spinning pineapple that hovers over the player. The buff tooltip is a reference to a popular debate on whether or not pineapple is suitable topping for pizza. The pineapple is a tropical fruit native to South America. Pineapple plants in real life do not grow as trees, but instead as small shrubs.

name: Rotting Eyeball
description: The Rotting Eyeball is a pet summoning item that drops from The Hive Mind. It summons a miniature Hive Mind that follows the player.

name: The Atom Splitter
description: The Atom Splitter is a post-Moon Lord javelin that drops from the Exo Mechs after XS-01 Artemis and XS-03 Apollo have been defeated last. It throws out a gravity-defying javelin that travels through tiles and emits light. Upon contact with an enemy, 15 rainbow javelins randomly appear from all sides of the target, each dealing 70% damage and pierces twice but have a very short lifespan. Performing a stealth strike with The Atom Splitter will cause the resulting javelin to spawn 100 rainbow javel

name: Bullet-Filled Shotgun
description: The Bullet-Filled Shotgun is a craftable Pre-Hardmode gun. When used, it fires from 25 to 34 bullets per shot at an extremely large spread and varying velocity, consuming five bullets. All bullets are converted into bouncy explosive bullets, which can emit a small light and explode on hit or after three seconds have passed. These bullets can bounce once which will halve their damage, and the second bounce will cause them to explode. Its best modifier is Agile due to its unusually low base damage

name: Cinders of Lament
description: The Cinders of Lament is a post-Moon Lord summon weapon. It is the exhumed form of the Entropy's Vigil. When used, a full-sized husk of Supreme Cataclysm or Supreme Catastrophe appears at the player's cursor. After 0.67 seconds, its damage increases by 45% and charges at the player. The brothers pierce infinitely, travel through solid tiles, and are capable of damaging players or Town NPCs along with enemies. Players and Town NPCs take 140 / 280 damage regardless of the player's damage boosts. I

name: Condemnation
description: Condemnation is a post-Moon Lord repeater that drops from Supreme Calamitas. When used with its primary fire (left-click), the player holds the crossbow and charges up, increasing the number of arrows which is also indicated by a ring of dust. The player can load up to a maximum of 8 arrows and stop holding to release arrows with a 50% velocity boost. Each arrow spawns two smaller homing arrows every 0.75 seconds for a total of 3 times. Homing arrows deal half as much damage and cannot travel th

name: Daedalus Golem Staff
description: The Daedalus Golem Staff is a craftable Hardmode summon weapon. When used, it summons a grounded golem that follows the player. When an enemy is nearby, the golem alternates between attacking with purple-blue pellets and firing red lightning bolts that pierce once. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, minions cannot deal critical hits. The only

name: Deathstare Rod
description: Not to be confused with Eye of Night, a craftable Corruption-themed summon weapon. The Deathstare Rod is a Pre-Hardmode summon weapon that drops from the Eye of Cthulhu. It summons a tiny floating eyeball above the player's head that fires lasers towards nearby targets. The eye is able to target and fire through tiles. On hit, the laser deals damage in a tiny area of effect. Unlike most minions, only one Miniature Eye of Cthulhu can be summoned. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifi

name: Eye of Night
description: Not to be confused with Deathstare Rod, a summon weapon that drops from the Eye of Cthulhu. The Eye of Night is a craftable Pre-Hardmode summon weapon. It is the Corruption counterpart of the Flesh of Infidelity. It summons a tiny floating eyeball that follows slightly above the player. When an enemy is nearby, the eye orbits around it and fires cells which stick to enemies to damage enemies up to two times, inflicting the Cursed Inferno debuff. Up to 4 cells can be stuck to an enemy at once. It

name: Flesh of Infidelity
description: The Flesh of Infidelity is a craftable Pre-Hardmode summon weapon. It is the Crimson counterpart of the Eye of Night. It summons a flesh ball that jumps around erratically near the player. When an enemy is nearby, it jumps around near that enemy and fires a burst of 2 blood particles upwards every 3 jumps, which homes into enemies but does not pierce nor travel through tiles. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affec

name: Flowers of Mortality
description: The Flowers of Mortality is a craftable post-Moon Lord summon weapon and the final upgrade to the Frost Blossom Staff. When used, it summons up to five rainbow flowers that orbit around the player, and fire homing bolts at nearby targets. The bolt does not pierce nor travel through solid tiles, but bursts into a tile-ignoring shrapnel. Both bolts and shrapnels inflict the Elemental Mix debuff. Each flower consumes half a minion slot. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides

name: Gruesome Eminence
description: The Gruesome Eminence is a post-Moon Lord magic weapon. It is the exhumed form of the Ghastly Visage. It fires a spirit monster that poorly follows the cursor and occasionally moves around randomly on its own. As time passes, it spawns small spirits which deal 140 / 280 to player and Town NPCs. After 14 seconds, it grows to full size and becomes fully controllable by the player, but also stop releasing spirits. The damage of the spirit gradually builds up from 1x to 3.3x as it builds up to full

name: Heresy
description: Heresy is a post-Moon Lord magic weapon that drops from Supreme Calamitas. It fires flame particles and souls upwards, which can travel through solid tiles but only home into enemies when solid tiles are not present. The time taken to fire varies from 0.33-0.47 seconds initially, but linearly speeds up to 0.07-0.2 seconds after 2 seconds of holding the book. Its best modifier is Mythical. But the weapon's knockback will not be affected due to already being 0. Heresy is an act or belief that conf

name: The Jailor
description: The Jailor is a post-Moon Lord gun that drops from the Exo Mechs after XF-09 Ares has been defeated last. It fires an infinitely piercing electric mine that decelerates to a stop after as it travels. The mine detects other mines in a 75-tile radius and forms a damaging electric chain between them. On hit, the damage of all mines and electric chains that are connected are exponentially decreased, to a lower bound of 42.5% of its original damage. Its best modifier is Unreal.

name: Perdition
description: Perdition is a post-Moon Lord sentry that drops from Supreme Calamitas. When used, a floating beacon sentry follows the player around. When an enemy is targeted via right-clicking with most summon weapons, a cross appears on the marked target, a large area lights up with fire dust, and various types of homing souls appear from below. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the result

name: Phosphorescent Gauntlet
description: The Phosphorescent Gauntlet is a post-Moon Lord melee weapon that drops from Nuclear Terrors. When used, the player lunges slightly towards the direction of the cursor and performs a close-ranged punch. Upon punching a target or a solid tile, the player recoils in the opposite direction and nearby blocks will emit particles as if they are broken. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size. Despite not behaving like standard swords or spears, it can deal true melee damag

name: Photon Ripper
description: The Photon Ripper is a post-Moon Lord chainsaw that drops from the Exo Mechs after XF-09 Ares has been defeated last. It rapidly fires out rainbow teeth which circle back after passing through the cursor or past a set distance. The maximum set distance along with tooth damage increases as the weapon is used up to 3 seconds where it is fully charged. The tooth deals 6% damage initially and scales up to 16.67%, while the chainsaw itself deals full contact damage. Additionally, teeth projectiles wi

name: Polyp Launcher
description: Polyp Launcher is a Pre-Hardmode sentry that is purchased from the Sea King at any time. When used, it summons a grounded polyp sentry which inaccurately fires gravity-affected balls of coral at nearby enemies. On hit, the coral chunk bursts into 1-4 fragments which deals half as much damage and knockback. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primarily affect the initial summon rather than the resulting minion. Additionally, mi

name: Rainbow Party Cannon
description: The Rainbow Party Cannon is a craftable post-Moon Lord developer magic gun. When used, a cannon is locked in place at the player and firing at the direction of the cursor, unable to change angles until released, similarly to Charged Blaster Cannon. After one second of firing non-damaging confetti, the cannon starts firing comets at the rate of its use time. Comets have exceptional vertical acceleration and explode upon collision with tiles or targets, bursting into 18 infinitely-piercing deceler

name: Rancor
description: Rancor is a post-Moon Lord magic weapon. It is the exhumed form of the Burning Sea. It creates a magic circle a set distance away from the player. After 4 seconds, the magic circle fires a large laser beam that pierces infinitely. Upon contact with solid tiles, the laser spawns dust, fog, and lava at the impact location. Additionally, damaging arms emerge out which deal 66.67% of the laser's damage, along with large cinders which fly out and deal 33.33% of the laser's damage. Both arms and cinde

name: Refraction Rotor
description: The Refraction Rotor is a post-Moon Lord rogue weapon that drops from the Exo Mechs after XM-05 Thanatos has been defeated last. It throws out a gravity-defying disk that travels through solid tiles and pierces up to nine times. When destroyed, the disk shatters into 6 homing rockets which each deal 49.5% damage, along with 6 gravity-affected metallic gore chunks which do not deal damage. Performing a stealth strike with the Refraction Rotor will cause the resulting disk to burst into more rocke

name: Rem's Revenge
description: "Wither" redirects here. For the Withered enchantment and its associated debuff, see here. The Rem's Revenge is a craftable post-Moon Lord flail. It throws out a gravity-defying spike ball that travels through solid tiles. Upon travelling over 53.125 tiles or on contact with 4 targets, the flail returns to the player. The flail returns at doubled speed if it is over 62.5 tiles from the player, and despawn if over 93.75 tiles away. On hit, the flail inflicts the Wither debuff which reduces enemy

name: Sacrifice
description: Sacrifice is a post-Moon Lord dagger that drops from Supreme Calamitas. When used with the left-click, it rapidly throws daggers that stick to enemies and constantly deal damage for 0.83 seconds. Up to a maximum of 15 daggers can be stuck at a time. When used with the right-click, daggers that are stuck on an enemy will return to the player and heal for 4 health per dagger. Performing a stealth strike with the Sacrifice will cause the resulting dagger to heal for 50 health when returning to the

name: Slime Puppet Staff
description: The Slime Puppet Staff is a Pre-Hardmode summon weapon that drops from The Slime God. It summons a floating slime ball that does not take up minion slots and follows slightly above the player. It attacks by charging at enemies within a 50-tile radius and then exploding upon impact, despawning immediately after. If the slime ball persists for five seconds without hitting any target, it will explode on its own. Its best modifier is Mythical, due to its unique nature of not requiring minion slots t

name: Spine of Thanatos
description: The Spine of Thanatos is a post-Moon Lord flail that drops from the Exo Mechs after XM-05 Thanatos has been defeated last. It launches one flail forward towards the cursor with two flails swiping from the sides. The three flails collide and return to the player, spawning an explosion and 12 rainbow rays when the flails collide. Rainbow rays deal 75% damage, can home into nearby targets including ones behind solid tiles, and explode on hit. The explosion persists for 0.75 seconds and deals consta

name: Surge Driver
description: The Surge Driver is a post-Moon Lord gun that drops from the Exo Mechs after XS-01 Artemis and XS-03 Apollo have been defeated last. When used with its primary fire (left-click), a laser beam is fired which creates a large glowing explosion on impact with tiles or enemies. The laser beam deals 666% damage while the large explosion deals 333% damage. When used with its secondary fire (right-click), two tile-passing energy bullets are inaccurately fired which splits into three comets on enemy hits

name: Vigilance
description: Vigilance is a post-Moon Lord summon weapon that drops from Supreme Calamitas. It summons a soul seeker which flies in place at a set distance from the player, forming a ring around the player if multiple seekers are present. When enemies are nearby, the seekers will rapidly fire Brimstone Darts similar to those fired by Supreme Calamitas, then charge back and forth at great speeds. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the widest array of stat bonuses, but these primaril

name: Violence
description: Violence is a post-Moon Lord melee weapon that drops from Supreme Calamitas. The player throws out a rapidly spinning spear which follows the cursor and rapidly deals contact damage. The spear is followed by an orange-red trail as it travels. Its best modifier is Godly. It cannot get modifiers that affect size.

name: Viral Sprout
description: The Viral Sprout is a craftable Hardmode summon weapon. When used, it summons a flower-shaped spirit that floats around the player and attacks nearby enemies by firing gravity-affected needles. When moving or attacking, the spirits will move in a group with individual circular motions, and launch an even spread of three needles upwards. Needles inflict the Sage Poison debuff which deals a constant 45 damage per second, with higher damage per tick the more spirits are present. Its best modifier i

name: Virid Vanguard
description: The Virid Vanguard is a craftable post-Moon Lord summon weapon that is a direct upgrade to the Igneous Exaltation. When used with left-click, it summons two blades that orbit around the player in two ovals offset slightly above and below the player, damaging enemies that come into contact with it. Each blade consumes 1.5 minion slots, the bottom ring will be prioritized if the player does not have enough slots to summon both blades at once. When right-click is used, all blades travel outward at

name: Wither Blossoms Staff
description: The Wither Blossoms Staff is a craftable Hardmode summon weapon that is an upgrade to the Tundra Flame Blossoms Staff. When used, it summons up to four dark-colored flowers that orbit around the player, and fire homing bolts at nearby targets. The bolts pierce once and travel through terrain, splitting into two plague seekers when destroyed. Both bolts and seekers inflict the Plague debuff. Each flower consumes half a minion slot. Its best modifier is Ruthless. The Mythical modifier provides the

name: The Cart of Gods
description: The Cart of Gods is a craftable post-Moon Lord Mount summoning item. When used on Minecart Tracks, it summons a rideable cart with a trail of 17 body segments and 1 tail segment. The Devourer Cart has a top running speed of 112 mph with an acceleration of 36 tiles/second2 (49 mph/second). Similar to other minecarts, the Devourer Cart is able to jump with a similar height and acceleration.

name: Martian Distress Beacon
