description: The Martian Distress Beacon is a Hardmode consumable item that summons the Martian Madness event upon use. It is sold by the Cyborg for 50 after Golem has been defeated.

name: Malice
description: For the difficulty activated by this item, see here. Malice is an item placed in a newly spawned player's inventory. Upon being used it activates or disables Malice Mode. Attempting to use it during a boss fight will have no effects. It can be crafted at an Altar and does not have any ingredients. This item's tooltip, which explains many of Malice Mode's effects, is the longest of any item in the game. This item's appearance was inspired by certain promotional artwork for the game The Evil Withi

name: Brimstone Locus
description: The Brimstone Locus is an item placed in a player's inventory when they open the enchanting interface after talking to the Brimstone Witch for the first time. While it is in the inventory, this item causes items that can be exhumed to be marked with a special effect, appearing as a white aura gathering purple energy. This effect is accompanied by a pulse of the item's sprite once per second. The following items will be marked by the Locus. Burning Sea The Community Entropy's Vigil Ghastly Visage

name: Metastasis
description: The Metastasis is a post-Moon Lord summon weapon. It is the exhumed form of the Staff of the Mechworm. It summons a full-sized Sepulcher which follows the player. Sepulcher takes four minion slots and attacks by alternating between firing Brimstone Darts from its segments and rapidly charging the target back and forth. Every seven seconds, an Exhumed Brimstone Heart spawns which orbits around the player. If there are over two hearts present, each additional heart will increase the chance for Sep

name: Cosmic Anvil
description: Cosmic Anvil is a post-Moon Lord crafting station that is an upgrade to the Hardmode Anvil. It is used to craft most post-The Devourer of Gods items. Prior to the 1.5.0.001 update, Draedon's Forge served as both the post-Devourer of Gods crafting station and the endgame crafting station.

name: Calamitous set
description: Calamitous set is a post-Moon Lord vanity set which consists of the Calamitous Hood, Calamitous Robes and Calamitous Boots. The set is collectively dropped from Supreme Calamitas at a 14.29% chance along with the Ashen Horns.

name: Ashen Horns
description: Ashen Horn is a post-Moon Lord vanity item which is worn in the head slot. It drops from Supreme Calamitas at a 14.29% chance along with the Calamitous set.

name: Exo Prism
description: Exo Prisms are post-Moon Lord crafting materials that drop from the Exo Mechs. Their main use is to craft Miracle Matters and to craft the Draedon's Forge. When dropped, the item will pulse, glow, and emit bright yellow dust.

name: Miracle Matter
description: Miracle Matter is a post-Moon Lord crafting material. It is used to craft various endgame weapons. When dropped or in the inventory, the item will pulse and glow. The item will also emit bright yellow dust when dropped. For a full crafting tree, see here. This item's name is a reference to a boss from the game Kirby 64: The Crystal Shards.

name: Daawnlight Spirit Origin
description: The Daawnlight Spirit Origin is a craftable post-Moon Lord accessory. When equipped, the player's ranged critical strike chance is reset to 4%. Enemies and bosses will be marked with a bullseye at a random location. When the center of the bullseye is struck with a smaller ranged projectile, the critical strike damage increases from 2x to 3.5x, increasing further if the weapon is slower and even further if the player has boosts to ranged critical strike chance. The bullseye disappears when struck

name: Exo Mechs
description: If you were looking for something other than the boss, see Draedon (disambiguation). "The fruits of masterful craftsmanship and optimization, created only with the objective to destroy." The Exo Mechs are a group of post-Moon Lord bosses that can be fought simultaneously after defeating Jungle Dragon, Yharon, and intended to be fought around the same time as Supreme Calamitas. name: Universe Splitter
description: The Universe Splitter is a craftable post-Moon Lord developer summon weapon. When used, a field appears at the player's cursor, and inflicts the player with the Universe Splitter Cooldown debuff. After two seconds, a red laser sweeps down from the sky towards the field every second for six seconds, slightly randomized in the angle shot. name: Void Concentration Staff
description: The Void Concentration Staff is a post-Moon Lord summon weapon that drops from Ceaseless Void. When used with its primary fire (left-click), it will engulf the player with a void aura which uses up three minion slots and increases the player's summon damage by 5%. When enemies are nearby, homing void orbs are rapidly fired out of the player, dealing 75% of the weapon's damage. If the aura is active, the player can use their secondary fire (right-click) to remove it and launch a black hole. The b

name: Mysterious Mechanism
description: The Mysterious Mechanism is a craftable Pre-Hardmode crafting material. It is solely used to craft Lab Seeking Mechanisms.

name: Lab Seeking Mechanisms
description: Lab Seeking Mechanisms are craftable Pre-Hardmode items. They are used to locate different kinds of Bio-center Labs, with each color corresponding to a specific lab type. When used, it flies into the air for a brief moment then accelerate towards the lab, trailing dusts of matching color. These items have 100 max charge and consume 15 charge per use. Lab Seeking Mechanisms do not work in worlds created before the 1.5.0.001 update.

name: Exo Box
description: The Exo Box is a post-Moon Lord Mount summoning item that drops from the Exo Mechs. When used, it summons a flying chair mount that behaves similar to the UFO mount summoned by the Cosmic Car Key. It has a high overall movement speed and takes very little time to accelerate to its maximum speed. Draedon's Gamer Chair has a top speed of 61 mph both vertically and horizontally, for an overall max speed of 87 mph. name: Anti-Cyst Ointment
description: The Anti-Cyst Ointment is a craftable Pre-Hardmode spawn-blocking tool. While the item is favorited in the player's inventory, Perforator Cyst spawns are disabled.

name: Anti-Tumor Ointment
description: The Anti-Tumor Ointment is a craftable Pre-Hardmode spawn-blocking tool. While the item is favorited in the player's inventory, Hive Cyst spawns are disabled.

name: Bleach Ball
description: The Bleach Ball is a craftable Pre-Hardmode spawn-blocking tool. While the item is favorited in the player's inventory, Aquatic Scourge spawns are disabled.

name: Sirenproof Earmuffs
description: The Sirenproof Earmuffs is a craftable Hardmode spawn-blocking tool. While the item is favorited in the player's inventory, ??? spawns are disabled.

name: Voodoo Demon Voodoo Doll
description: The Voodoo Demon Voodoo Doll is a craftable Pre-Hardmode spawn-blocking tool. While the item is favorited in the player's inventory, Voodoo Demon spawns are disabled.

name: Spawn blockers
description: Spawn blockers are unique tools. Their sole purpose is to prevent certain bosses, boss-spawning enemies, or events from spawning naturally. These items will only work when favorited.

name: The Codebreaker
description: The Codebreaker is a piece of constructible furniture that consists of six different components scattered throughout progression: Codebreaker Base, Decryption Computer, Long Ranged Sensor Array, Advanced Display, Voltage Regulation System, and Auric Quantum Cooling Cell. It is used to decrypt schematics to unlock various items, and also used to initiate the Exo Mechs boss. Most components of The Codebreaker are required to be unlocked through decryption.
